 17235                                  ; 17/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 17236                                  
 17237                                  ; DOSCODE:6065h (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
 17238                                  
 17239                                  ;BREAK <$ChDir -- Change current directory on a drive>
 17240                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 17241                                  ;
 17242                                  ; $ChDir - Top-level change directory system call.  This call is responsible
 17243                                  ; for setting up the CDS for the specified drive appropriately.  There are
 17244                                  ; several cases to consider:
 17245                                  ;
 17246                                  ;   o	Local, simple CDS.  In this case, we take the input path and convert
 17247                                  ;	it into a WFP.	We verify the existance of this directory and then
 17248                                  ;	copy the WFP into the CDS and set up the ID field to point to the
 17249                                  ;	directory cluster.
 17250                                  ;   o	Net CDS.  We form the path from the root (including network prefix)
 17251                                  ;	and verify its existance (via DOS_Chdir).  If successful, we copy the
 17252                                  ;	WFP back into the CDS.
 17253                                  ;   o	SUBST'ed CDS.  This is no different than the local, simple CDS.
 17254                                  ;   o	JOIN'ed CDS.  This is trouble as there are two CDS's at work.  If we
 17255                                  ;	call TransPath, we will get the PHYSICAL CDS that the path refers to
 17256                                  ;	and the PHYSICAL WFP that the input path refers to.  This is perfectly
 17257                                  ;	good for the validation but not for currency.  We call TransPathNoSet
 17258                                  ;	to process the path but to return the logical CDS and the logical
 17259                                  ;	path.  We then copy the logical path into the logical CDS.
 17260                                  ;
 17261                                  ; Inputs:
 17262                                  ;	DS:DX Points to asciz name
 17263                                  ; Returns:
 17264                                  ;	STD XENIX Return
 17265                                  ;	AX = chdir_path_not_found if error
 17266                                  ;
 17267                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 17268                                  	
 17269                                  	; 25/01/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 17270                                  	
 17271                                  _$CHDIR:
 17272                                  	; 25/01/2024
 17273                                  	;;;
 17274 0000279C 36C606[7B12]43          	mov	byte [ss:PATHNAMELEN],67 ; Retro DOS v5.0
 17275                                  	;mov	word [ss:PATHNAMELEN],67 ; DIRSTRLEN = 67
 17276                                  	;;;
 17277 000027A2 BF[BE03]                	MOV	DI,OPENBUF		; spot for translated name
 17278 000027A5 89D6                    	MOV	SI,DX			; get source
 17279 000027A7 E8D14D                  	call	TransPath		; go munge the path and get real CDS
 17280 000027AA 7304                    	JNC	short ChDirCrack	; no errors, try path
 17281                                  ChDirErrP:
 17282                                  	;mov	al,3
 17283 000027AC B003                    	MOV	AL,error_path_not_found
 17284                                  ChDirErr:
 17285                                  	;jmp	SYS_RET_ERR 	; oops!
 17286                                  	; 10/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS compatibility)
 17287 000027AE EBB1                    	jmp	short chdir_errj
 17288

 17291 000027B5 75F5                    	JNZ	short ChDirErrP

 17294                                  ; found.

 17307                                  ; Get back CDS to see if a join as seen. Set the currency pointer (only if
 17308                                  ; not network). If one was seen, all we need to do is copy in the text
 17309                                  ;
 17310                                  	; 25/01/2024 - Retro DOS V5.0
 17311 000027C5 FF36[E30A]              	push	word [DIRSTART_HW] ; *
 17312                                  
 17313 000027C9 C43E[A205]              	LES	DI,[THISCDS]
 17314                                  	;test	word [es:di+43h],2000h

 17318                                  
 17319                                  	; 25/01/2024 (PCDOS 7.1)
 17320                                  	;mov	dx,[DIRSTART_HW]
 17321                                  
 17322 000027D2 742B                    	JZ	short GotCDS
 17323                                  
 17324                                  ; The CDS was joined. Let's go back and grab the logical CDS.
 17325

 17331

 17334                                  	;mov	ds,[si+0Eh]
 17335 000027DD 8E5C0E                  	MOV	DS,[SI+user_env.user_DS]
 17336                                  	
 17337 000027E0 BE[BE03]                	MOV	SI,OPENBUF		; spot for translated name
 17338 000027E3 87F7                    	XCHG	SI,DI
 17339 000027E5 30C0                    	XOR	AL,AL			; do no splicing
 17340 000027E7 57                      	push	di
 17341 000027E8 E89C4D                  	call	TransPathNoSet		; Munge path
 17342 000027EB 5E                      	pop	si

 17345

 17365

 17531                                  ;============================================================================
 17532                                  ; IOCTL.ASM, MSDOS 6.0, 1991
 17533                                  ;============================================================================
 17534                                  ; 07/08/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 17535                                  ; 17/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 17536                                  
 17537                                  ;**	IOCTL system call.
 17538                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 17539                                  ;	$IOCTL
 17540                                  ;
 17541                                  ;	  Revision history:
 17542                                  ;
 17543                                  ;		Created: ARR 4 April 1983
 17544                                  ;
 17545                                  ;		GenericIOCTL added:		KGS	22 April 1985
 17546                                  ;
 17547                                  ;		A000	version 4.00	Jan. 1988
 17548                                  ;
 17549                                  ;		Used jump table to dispatch IOCTL functions. HKN 3/12/90
 17550                                  ;
 17551                                  
 17552                                  ;BREAK <IOCTL - munge on a handle to do device specific stuff>
 17553                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 17554                                  ;
 17555                                  ;   Assembler usage:
 17556                                  ;	    MOV     BX, Handle
 17557                                  ;	    MOV     DX, Data
 17558                                  ;
 17559                                  ;	(or LDS     DX,BUF
 17560                                  ;	    MOV     CX,COUNT)
 17561                                  ;
 17562                                  ;	    MOV     AH, Ioctl
 17563                                  ;	    MOV     AL, Request
 17564                                  ;	    INT     21h
 17565                                  ;
 17566                                  ;   AH = 0  Return a combination of low byte of sf_flags and device driver
 17567                                  ;	    attribute word in DX, handle in BX:
 17568                                  ;	    DH = high word of device driver attributes
 17569                                  ;	    DL = low byte of sf_flags
 17570                                  ;	 1  Set the bits contained in DX to sf_flags.  DH MUST be 0.  Handle
 17571                                  ;	    in BX.
 17572                                  ;	 2  Read CX bytes from the device control channel for handle in BX
 17573                                  ;	    into DS:DX.  Return number read in AX.
 17574                                  ;	 3  Write CX bytes to the device control channel for handle in BX from
 17575                                  ;	    DS:DX.  Return bytes written in AX.
 17576                                  ;	 4  Read CX bytes from the device control channel for drive in BX
 17577                                  ;	    into DS:DX.  Return number read in AX.
 17578                                  ;	 5  Write CX bytes to the device control channel for drive in BX from
 17579                                  ;	    DS:DX.  Return bytes written in AX.
 17580                                  ;	 6  Return input status of handle in BX. If a read will go to the
 17581                                  ;	    device, AL = 0FFh, otherwise 0.
 17582                                  ;	 7  Return output status of handle in BX. If a write will go to the
 17583                                  ;	    device, AL = 0FFh, otherwise 0.
 17584                                  ;	 8  Given a drive in BX, return 1 if the device contains non-
 17585                                  ;	    removable media, 0 otherwise.
 17586                                  ;	 9  Return the contents of the device attribute word in DX for the
 17587                                  ;	    drive in BX.  0200h is the bit for shared.	1000h is the bit for
 17588                                  ;	    network. 8000h is the bit for local use.
 17589                                  ;	 A  Return 8000h if the handle in BX is for the network or not.
 17590                                  ;	 B  Change the retry delay and the retry count for the system. BX is
 17591                                  ;	    the count and CX is the delay.
 17592                                  ;
 17593                                  ;   Error returns:
 17594                                  ;	    AX = error_invalid_handle
 17595                                  ;	       = error_invalid_function
 17596                                  ;	       = error_invalid_data
 17597                                  ;
 17598                                  ;-------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 17599                                  ;
 17600                                  ;   This is the documentation copied from DOS 4.0 it is much better
 17601                                  ;   than the above
 17602                                  ;
 17603                                  ;	There are several basic forms of IOCTL calls:
 17604                                  ;
 17605                                  ;
 17606                                  ;	** Get/Set device information:	**
 17607                                  ;
 17608                                  ;	ENTRY	(AL) = function code
 17609                                  ;		  0 - Get device information
 17610                                  ;		  1 - Set device information
 17611                                  ;		(BX) = file handle
 17612                                  ;		(DX) = info for "Set Device Information"
 17613                                  ;	EXIT	'C' set if error
 17614                                  ;		  (AX) = error code
 17615                                  ;		'C' clear if OK
 17616                                  ;		  (DX) = info for "Get Device Information"
 17617                                  ;	USES	ALL
 17618                                  ;
 17619                                  ;
 17620                                  ;	**  Read/Write Control Data From/To Handle  **
 17621                                  ;
 17622                                  ;	ENTRY	(AL) = function code
 17623                                  ;		  2 - Read device control info
 17624                                  ;		  3 - Write device control info
 17625                                  ;		(BX) = file handle
 17626                                  ;		(CX) = transfer count
 17627                                  ;		(DS:DX) = address for data
 17628                                  ;	EXIT	'C' set if error
 17629                                  ;		  (AX) = error code
 17630                                  ;		'C' clear if OK
 17631                                  ;		  (AX) = count of bytes transfered
 17632                                  ;	USES	ALL
 17633                                  ;
 17634                                  ;
 17635                                  ;	**  Read/Write Control Data From/To Block Device  **
 17636                                  ;
 17637                                  ;	ENTRY	(AL) = function code
 17638                                  ;		  4 - Read device control info
 17639                                  ;		  5 - Write device control info
 17640                                  ;		(BL) = Drive number (0=default, 1='A', 2='B', etc)
 17641                                  ;		(CX) = transfer count
 17642                                  ;		(DS:DX) = address for data
 17643                                  ;	EXIT	'C' set if error
 17644                                  ;		  (AX) = error code
 17645                                  ;		'C' clear if OK
 17646                                  ;		  (AX) = count of bytes transfered
 17647                                  ;	USES	ALL
 17648                                  ;
 17649                                  ;
 17650                                  ;	**  Get Input/Output Status  **
 17651                                  ;
 17652                                  ;	ENTRY	(AL) = function code
 17653                                  ;		  6 - Get Input status
 17654                                  ;		  7 - Get Output Status
 17655                                  ;		(BX) = file handle
 17656                                  ;	EXIT	'C' set if error
 17657                                  ;		  (AX) = error code
 17658                                  ;		'C' clear if OK
 17659                                  ;		  (AL) = 00 if not ready
 17660                                  ;		  (AL) = FF if ready
 17661                                  ;	USES	ALL
 17662                                  ;
 17663                                  ;
 17664                                  ;	**  Get Drive Information  **
 17665                                  ;
 17666                                  ;	ENTRY	(AL) = function code
 17667                                  ;		  8 - Check for removable media
 17668                                  ;		  9 - Get device attributes
 17669                                  ;		(BL) = Drive number (0=default, 1='A', 2='B', etc)
 17670                                  ;	EXIT	'C' set if error
 17671                                  ;		  (AX) = error code
 17672                                  ;		'C' clear if OK
 17673                                  ;		  (AX) = 0/1 media is removable/fixed (func. 8)
 17674                                  ;		  (DX) = device attribute word (func. 9)
 17675                                  ;	USES	ALL
 17676                                  ;
 17677                                  ;
 17678                                  ;	**  Get Redirected bit	**
 17679                                  ;
 17680                                  ;	ENTRY	(AL) = function code
 17681                                  ;		  0Ah - Network stuff
 17682                                  ;		(BX) = file handle
 17683                                  ;	EXIT	'C' set if error
 17684                                  ;		  (AX) = error code
 17685                                  ;		'C' clear if OK
 17686                                  ;		  (DX) = SFT flags word, 8000h set if network file
 17687                                  ;	USES	ALL
 17688                                  ;
 17689                                  ;
 17690                                  ;	**  Change sharer retry parameters  **
 17691                                  ;
 17692                                  ;	ENTRY	(AL) = function code
 17693                                  ;		  0Bh - Set retry parameters
 17694                                  ;		(CX) = retry loop count
 17695                                  ;		(DX) = number of retries
 17696                                  ;	EXIT	'C' set if error
 17697                                  ;		  (AX) = error code
 17698                                  ;		'C' clear if OK
 17699                                  ;	USES	ALL
 17700                                  ;
 17701                                  ;
 17702                                  ;   =================================================================
 17703                                  ;
 17704                                  ;	**  New Standard Control  **
 17705                                  ;
 17706                                  ;	ALL NEW IOCTL FACILITIES SHOULD USE THIS FORM.	THE OTHER
 17707                                  ;	FORMS ARE OBSOLETE.
 17708                                  ;
 17709                                  ;   =================================================================
 17710                                  ;
 17711                                  ;	ENTRY	(AL) = function code
 17712                                  ;		  0Ch - Control Function subcode
 17713                                  ;		(BX) = File Handle
 17714                                  ;		(CH) = Category Indicator
 17715                                  ;		(CL) = Function within category
 17716                                  ;		(DS:DX) = address for data, if any
 17717                                  ;		(SI) = Passed to device as argument, use depends upon function
 17718                                  ;		(DI) = Passed to device as argument, use depends upon function
 17719                                  ;	EXIT	'C' set if error
 17720                                  ;		  (AX) = error code
 17721                                  ;		'C' clear if OK
 17722                                  ;		  (SI) = Return value, meaning is function dependent
 17723                                  ;		  (DI) = Return value, meaning is function dependent
 17724                                  ;		  (DS:DX) = Return address, use is function dependent
 17725                                  ;	USES	ALL
 17726                                  ;
 17727                                  ;    ============== Generic IOCTL Definitions for DOS 3.2 ============
 17728                                  ;     (See inc\ioctl.inc for more info)
 17729                                  ;
 17730                                  ;	ENTRY	(AL) = function code
 17731                                  ;		  0Dh - Control Function subcode
 17732                                  ;		(BL) = Drive Number (0 = Default, 1= 'A')
 17733                                  ;		(CH) = Category Indicator
 17734                                  ;		(CL) = Function within category
 17735                                  ;		(DS:DX) = address for data, if any
 17736                                  ;		(SI) = Passed to device as argument, use depends upon function
 17737                                  ;		(DI) = Passed to device as argument, use depends upon function
 17738                                  ;
 17739                                  ;	EXIT	'C' set if error
 17740                                  ;		  (AX) = error code
 17741                                  ;		'C' clear if OK
 17742                                  ;		  (DS:DX) = Return address, use is function dependent
 17743                                  ;	USES	ALL
 17744                                  ;
 17745                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 17746                                  	
 17747                                  	; 17/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 17748                                  	; DOSCODE:611Eh (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
 17749                                  
 17750                                  	; 11/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 17751                                  	; DOSCODE:610Ah (MSDOS 5.0, MSDOS.SYS)
 17752                                  
 17753                                  	; 14/01/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 (Modified PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 17754                                  	; DOSCODE:67F7h (PCDOS 7.1, IBMDOS.COM)
 17755                                  
 17756                                  IOCTLJMPTABLE:	;label	word
 17757                                  	; MSDOS 3.3 (& MSDOS 6.0)
 17758 00002870 [AC28]                  	dw	ioctl_getset_data	; 0
 17759 00002872 [AC28]                  	dw	ioctl_getset_data   	; 1
 17760 00002874 [F628]                  	dw	ioctl_control_string	; 2
 17761 00002876 [F628]                  	dw	ioctl_control_string	; 3
 17762 00002878 [892A]                  	dw	ioctl_get_dev		; 4
 17763 0000287A [892A]                  	dw	ioctl_get_dev		; 5
 17764 0000287C [0E29]                  	dw	ioctl_status		; 6
 17765 0000287E [0E29]                  	dw	ioctl_status		; 7
 17766 00002880 [E829]                  	dw	ioctl_rem_media		; 8
 17767 00002882 [312A]                  	dw	ioctl_drive_attr	; 9
 17768 00002884 [7B2A]                  	dw	ioctl_handle_redir	; A
 17769 00002886 [232A]                  	dw	Set_Retry_Parameters	; B
 17770 00002888 [2A29]                  	dw	GENERICIOCTLHANDLE	; C
 17771 0000288A [4429]                  	dw	GENERICIOCTL		; D
 17772                                  	; MSDOS 6.0 (& MSDOS 3.3)
 17773 0000288C [2A2B]                  	dw	ioctl_drive_owner	; E
 17774 0000288E [2A2B]                  	dw	ioctl_drive_owner	; F
 17775                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 17776 00002890 [2A29]                  	dw	query_handle_support	; 10h
 17777 00002892 [4429]                  	dw	query_device_support	; 11h
 17778                                  
 17779                                  	; 11/11/2022
 17780                                  _$IOCTL:
 17781 00002894 8CDE                    	MOV	SI,DS			; Stash DS for calls 2,3,4 and 5
 17782 00002896 16                      	push	ss
 17783 00002897 1F                      	pop	ds			;hkn; SS is DOSDATA
 17784                                  
 17785                                  	; MSDOS 3.3
 17786                                  	;cmp	al,0Fh 
 17787                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 17788 00002898 3C11                    	cmp	al,11h			; al must be between 0 & 11h
 17789 0000289A 770D                    	ja	short ioctl_bad_funj2	; if not bad function #
 17790                                  
 17791                                  	; 14/01/2024
 17792                                  	; 28/05/2019
 17793                                  	;push	AX	; 14/01/2024	; Need to save AL for generic IOCTL
 17794 0000289C 89C7                    	mov	di,ax			; di NOT a PARM
 17795 0000289E 81E7FF00                	and	di,0FFh			; di = al
 17796 000028A2 D1E7                    	shl	di,1			; di = index into jmp table
 17797                                  	;pop	AX			; Restore AL for generic IOCTL
 17798                                  
 17799                                  
 17800 000028A4 2EFFA5[7028]            	jmp	word [CS:DI+IOCTLJMPTABLE]
 17801                                  
 17802                                  ioctl_bad_funj2:
 17803 000028A9 E90401                  	JMP	ioctl_bad_fun  ; 10/08/2018
 17804                                  
 17805                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 17806                                  ;
 17807                                  ; IOCTL: AL = 0,1
 17808                                  ;
 17809                                  ; ENTRY: DS = DOSDATA
 17810                                  ;
 17811                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 17812                                  
 17813                                  	; 29/01/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0
 17814                                  ioctl_getset_data:
 17815                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 17816 000028AC E8D147                  	call	SFFromHandle		; ES:DI -> SFT
 17817 000028AF 7305                    	JNC	short ioctl_check_permissions ; have valid handle
 17818                                  ioctl_bad_handle:
 17819                                  	;mov	al,6
 17820 000028B1 B006                    	mov	al,error_invalid_handle
 17821                                  ioctl_error:
 17822 000028B3 E9C4DD                  	jmp	SYS_RET_ERR
 17823                                  
 17824                                  ioctl_check_permissions:
 17825 000028B6 3C00                    	CMP	AL,0
 17826                                  	;mov	al,[es:di+5]
 17827 000028B8 268A4505                	MOV	AL,[ES:DI+SF_ENTRY.sf_flags]; Get low byte of flags
 17828 000028BC 7419                    	JZ	short ioctl_read	; read the byte
 17829                                  
 17830 000028BE 08F6                    	or	dh,dh
 17831 000028C0 7404                    	JZ	short ioctl_check_device ; can I set with this data?
 17832                                  	;mov	al,0Dh
 17833 000028C2 B00D                    	mov	al,error_invalid_data	; no DH <> 0
 17834                                  	;jmp	SYS_RET_ERR
 17835 000028C4 EBED                    	jmp	short ioctl_error
 17836                                  
 17837                                  ioctl_check_device:
 17838 000028C6 A880                    	test	AL,devid_device  ; 80h	; can I set this handle?
 17839 000028C8 74DF                    	jz	short ioctl_bad_funj2
 17840 000028CA 80CA80                  	OR	DL,devid_device 	; Make sure user doesn't turn off the
 17841                                  					;   device bit!! He can muck with the
 17842                                  					;   others at will.
 17843                                  	;MOV	byte [EXTERR_LOCUS],errLOC_SerDev ; 4
 17844                                  	; 29/01/2024
 17845                                  	;;;
 17846 000028CD E819EA                  	call	set_exerr_locus_ser ; (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 17847                                  	;;;
 17848 000028D0 26885505                	MOV	BYTE [ES:DI+SF_ENTRY.sf_flags],DL  ;AC000;MS.; Set flags
 17849                                  ioctl_ok:
 17850 000028D4 E999DD                  	jmp	SYS_RET_OK
 17851                                  
 17852                                  ioctl_read:
 17853                                  	;MOV	byte [EXTERR_LOCUS],errLOC_Disk  ; 2
 17854                                  	; 29/01/2024
 17855                                  	;;;
 17856 000028D7 E80AEA                  	call	set_exerr_locus_disk ; (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 17857                                  	;;;
 17858 000028DA 30E4                    	XOR	AH,AH
 17859 000028DC A880                    	test	AL,devid_device 	; Should I set high byte
 17860 000028DE 740B                    	JZ	short ioctl_no_high	; no
 17861                                  	;MOV	byte [EXTERR_LOCUS],errLOC_SerDev ; 4
 17862                                  	; 29/01/2024
 17863                                  	;;;
 17864 000028E0 E806EA                  	call	set_exerr_locus_ser ; (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 17865                                  	;;;
 17866                                  	;les	di,[es:di+7]
 17867 000028E3 26C47D07                	LES	DI,[ES:DI+SF_ENTRY.sf_devptr] ; Get device pointer
 17868                                  	;mov	ah,[es:di+5]
 17869 000028E7 268A6505                	MOV	AH,[ES:DI+SYSDEV.ATT+1] ; Get high byte
 17870                                  ioctl_no_high:
 17871 000028EB 89C2                    	MOV	DX,AX
 17872                                  ioctl_set_dx:	; 16/12/2022
 17873 000028ED E887DB                  	call	Get_User_Stack
 17874                                  	;mov	[si+6],dx
 17875 000028F0 895406                  	MOV	[SI+user_env.user_DX],DX
 17876                                  	;;jmp	SYS_RET_OK
 17877                                  	; 11/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS compatibility)
 17878                                  ioctl_ok_j:
 17879                                  	; 16/12/2022
 17880 000028F3 E97DDD                  	jmp	SYS_RET_OK_clc	 ; (after 'Get_User_Stack') 
 17881                                  	;jmp	short ioctl_ok
 17882                                  	; 26/07/2019
 17883                                  	;jmp	SYS_RET_OK_clc
 17884                                  
 17885                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 17886                                  ;
 17887                                  ; IOCTL: AL = 2,3
 17888                                  ;
 17889                                  ; ENTRY: DS = DOSDATA
 17890                                  ;	 SI = user's DS
 17891                                  ;
 17892                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 17893                                  
 17894                                  	; 07/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 17895                                  ioctl_control_string:
 17896 000028F6 E88747                  	call	SFFromHandle		; ES:DI -> SFT
 17897 000028F9 72B6                    	JC	short ioctl_bad_handle	; invalid handle
 17898                                  	; 07/12/2022
 17899                                  	;TEST	word [ES:DI+SF_ENTRY.sf_flags],devid_device ; can I?
 17900                                  	;jz	short ioctl_bad_funj2			; No it is a file
 17901                                  	; MSDOS 5.0 & MSDOS 6.0
 17902 000028FB 26F6450580              	test	byte [ES:DI+SF_ENTRY.sf_flags],devid_device ; can I?
 17903 00002900 74A7                    	jz	short ioctl_bad_funj2			; No it is a file
 17904                                  	;MOV	byte [EXTERR_LOCUS],errLOC_SerDev ; 4
 17905                                  	; 29/01/2024
 17906                                  	;;;
 17907 00002902 E8E4E9                  	call	set_exerr_locus_ser ; (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 17908                                  	;;;
 17909 00002905 26C47D07                	LES	DI,[ES:DI+SF_ENTRY.sf_devptr] ; Get device pointer
 17910 00002909 30DB                    	XOR	BL,BL			; Unit number of char dev = 0
 17911 0000290B E98301                  	JMP	ioctl_do_string
 17912                                  
 17913                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 17914                                  ;
 17915                                  ; IOCTL: AL = 6,7
 17916                                  ;
 17917                                  ; ENTRY: DS = DOSDATA
 17918                                  ;
 17919                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 17920                                  
 17921                                  ioctl_status:
 17922 0000290E B401                    	MOV	AH,1
 17923 00002910 2C06                    	SUB	AL,6			; 6=0,7=1
 17924 00002912 7402                    	JZ	short ioctl_get_status
 17925 00002914 B403                    	MOV	AH,3
 17926                                  ioctl_get_status:
 17927 00002916 50                      	PUSH	AX
 17928 00002917 E8BF15                  	call	GET_IO_SFT
 17929 0000291A 58                      	POP	AX
 17930                                  	;JNC	short DO_IOFUNC
 17931                                  	;JMP	short ioctl_bad_handle	; invalid SFT
 17932                                  	; 16/12/2022
 17933 0000291B 7294                    	jc	short ioctl_bad_handle
 17934                                  DO_IOFUNC:
 17935 0000291D E84125                  	call	IOFUNC
 17936 00002920 88C4                    	MOV	AH,AL
 17937 00002922 B0FF                    	MOV	AL,0FFH
 17938                                  	;JNZ	short ioctl_status_ret
 17939                                  	; 29/01/2024
 17940 00002924 75AE                    	jnz	short ioctl_ok
 17941 00002926 FEC0                    	INC	AL
 17942                                  ioctl_status_ret:
 17943                                  	;jmp	SYS_RET_OK
 17944                                  	; 11/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS compatibility)
 17945                                  	;jmp	short ioctl_ok_j
 17946                                  	; 16/12/2022
 17947 00002928 EBAA                    	jmp	short ioctl_ok
 17948                                  
 17949                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 17950                                  ;
 17951                                  ; Generic IOCTL entry point. AL = C, D, 10h, 11h
 17952                                  ;
 17953                                  ;	here we invoke the Generic IOCTL using the IOCTL_Req structure.
 17954                                  ;	SI:DX -> Users Device Parameter Table
 17955                                  ;	IOCALL -> IOCTL_Req structure
 17956                                  ;
 17957                                  ; 	If on entry AL >= IOCTL_QUERY_HANDLE the function is a
 17958                                  ;	QueryIOCtlSupport call ELSE it's a standard generic IOCtl
 17959                                  ;	call.
 17960                                  ;
 17961                                  ; BUGBUG: Don't push anything on the stack between GENERIOCTL: and 
 17962                                  ;         the call to Check_If_Net because Check_If_Net gets our
 17963                                  ;         return address off the stack if the drive is invalid.
 17964                                  ;
 17965                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 17966                                  
 17967                                  	; 29/01/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0
 17968                                  
 17969                                  query_handle_support:	; Entry point for handles
 17970                                  GENERICIOCTLHANDLE:
 17971 0000292A E85347                  	call	SFFromHandle		; Get SFT for device.
 17972 0000292D 727E                    	jc	short ioctl_bad_handlej
 17973                                  
 17974                                  	;test	word [es:di+5],8000h
 17975                                  	;TEST	word [ES:DI+SF_ENTRY.sf_flags],sf_isnet	; M031;
 17976                                  	;test	byte [es:di+6],80h
 17977 0000292F 26F6450680              	test	byte [ES:DI+SF_ENTRY.sf_flags+1],(sf_isnet>>8)
 17978 00002934 757A                    	jnz	short ioctl_bad_fun	; Cannot do this over net.
 17979                                  
 17980                                  	;mov	byte [EXTERR_LOCUS],errLOC_SerDev ; 4
 17981                                  	; 29/01/2024
 17982                                  	;;;
 17983 00002936 E8B0E9                  	call	set_exerr_locus_ser ; (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 17984                                  	;;;
 17985                                  
 17986                                  	;les	di,[es:di+7]
 17987 00002939 26C47D07                	les	di,[es:di+SF_ENTRY.sf_devptr]	; Get pointer to device.
 17988                                  	;;;
 17989                                  	; 29/01/2024 - PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM
 17990 0000293D C606[B103]FF            	mov	byte [IOCTL_drvnum],0FFh	; invalidate drive number
 17991                                  					; (for extended -lock/unlock- functions)
 17992                                  	;;;
 17993 00002942 EB16                    	jmp	short Do_GenIOCTL
 17994                                  
 17995                                  	; 29/01/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0
 17996                                  	; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM - DOSCODE:68DAh
 17997                                  	; (WINME IO.SYS - BIOSCODE:6612h)
 17998                                  
 17999                                  query_device_support:	; Entry point for devices:
 18000                                  GENERICIOCTL:
 18001                                  	;mov	byte [EXTERR_LOCUS],errLOC_Disk ; 2
 18002                                  	; 29/01/2024
 18003                                  	;;;
 18004 00002944 E89DE9                  	call	set_exerr_locus_disk
 18005 00002947 80FD48                  	cmp	ch,48h			; category (extended, disk lock/unlock)
 18006 0000294A 7405                    	je      short GenIOCTL_chk_net	; extended (MSDOS/PCDOS 7)
 18007                                  	;;;
 18008                                  
 18009 0000294C 80FD08                  	cmp	ch,IOC_DC ; 8		; Only disk devices are allowed to use
 18010 0000294F 755F                    	jne	short ioctl_bad_fun	; no handles with Generic IOCTL.
 18011                                  
 18012                                  	; 29/01/2024 
 18013                                  	;;;
 18014                                  GenIOCTL_chk_net:
 18015 00002951 881E[B103]              	mov	[IOCTL_drvnum],bl	; drive number
 18016                                  	;;;
 18017                                  
 18018 00002955 E8C301                  	CALL	Check_If_Net		; ES:DI := Get_hdr_block of device in BL
 18019 00002958 7556                    	JNZ	short ioctl_bad_fun	; There are no "net devices", and they
 18020                                  
 18021                                  Do_GenIOCTL:
 18022                                  	; 29/01/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 
 18023                                  	;;;
 18024 0000295A 80FD48                  	cmp	ch,48h			; category code 48h for FAT32
 18025 0000295D 7456                    	je	short GenIOCTL_extended ; MSDOS/PCDOS 7 functions (lock/unlock)
 18026                                  	;cmp	ch,8
 18027 0000295F 80FD08                  	cmp	ch,IOC_DC ; 8          	; disk control
 18028 00002962 7451                    	je	short GenIOCTL_extended
 18029                                  GenIOCTL_normal:			; MSDOS 5-6.22 functions
 18030                                  	;;;
 18031                                  
 18032                                  	;TEST	word [ES:DI+SYSDEV.ATT],DEV320 
 18033                                  					; Can device handle Generic IOCTL funcs
 18034                                  	; 09/09/2018
 18035                                  	;test	byte [es:di+4],40h
 18036 00002964 26F6450440              	TEST	byte [ES:DI+SYSDEV.ATT],DEV320 ; 0040h
 18037 00002969 7445                    	jz	short ioctl_bad_fun
 18038                                  
 18039                                  	; 17/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 18040                                  
 18041                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 18042                                  	;mov	byte [IOCALL_REQFUNC],19 ; 13h
 18043 0000296B C606[7E03]13            	mov	byte [IOCALL_REQFUNC],GENIOCTL ; Assume real Request
 18044                                  	;cmp	al,10h
 18045 00002970 3C10                    	cmp	AL,IOCTL_QUERY_HANDLE	; See if this is just a query
 18046 00002972 7C0C                    	jl	short SetIOCtlBlock
 18047                                  	
 18048                                  	;TEST	word [ES:DI+SYSDEV.ATT],IOQUERY ; See if device supports a query
 18049                                  	;test	byte [es:di+4],80h 
 18050 00002974 26F6450480              	TEST	byte [ES:DI+SYSDEV.ATT],IOQUERY ; See if device supports a query
 18051 00002979 7435                    	jz	short ioctl_bad_fun	; No support for query 
 18052                                  	;
 18053                                  	;mov	byte [IOCALL_REQFUNC],19h	
 18054 0000297B C606[7E03]19            	mov	byte [IOCALL_REQFUNC],IOCTL_QUERY ; Just a query (5.00)
 18055                                  
 18056                                  SetIOCtlBlock:
 18057 00002980 06                      	PUSH	ES			; DEVIOCALL2 expects Device header block
 18058 00002981 57                      	PUSH	DI			; in DS:SI
 18059                                  					; Setup Generic IOCTL Request Block
 18060                                  	;mov	byte [IOCALL_REQLEN],23
 18061 00002982 C606[7C03]17            	mov	byte [IOCALL_REQLEN],IOCTL_REQ.size
 18062                                  	; 07/09/2018 (MSDOS 3.3)
 18063                                  	;;mov	byte [IOCALL_REQFUNC],19
 18064                                  	;mov	byte [IOCALL_REQFUNC],GENIOCTL ; 07/09/2018
 18065                                  	;
 18066 00002987 881E[7D03]              	MOV	[IOCALL_REQUNIT],BL
 18067 0000298B 882E[8903]              	MOV	[IOCALL+IOCTL_REQ.MAJORFUNCTION],CH
 18068 0000298F 880E[8A03]              	MOV	[IOCALL+IOCTL_REQ.MINORFUNCTION],CL
 18069 00002993 8936[8B03]              	MOV	[IOCALL+IOCTL_REQ.REG_SI],SI
 18070 00002997 893E[8D03]              	MOV	[IOCALL+IOCTL_REQ.REG_DI],DI
 18071 0000299B 8916[8F03]              	MOV	[IOCALL+IOCTL_REQ.GENERICIOCTL_PACKET],DX
 18072 0000299F 8936[9103]              	MOV	[IOCALL+IOCTL_REQ.GENERICIOCTL_PACKET+2],SI
 18073                                  
 18074                                  ;hkn; IOCALL is in DOSDATA
 18075 000029A3 BB[7C03]                	MOV	BX,IOCALL
 18076                                  
 18077 000029A6 16                      	PUSH	SS
 18078 000029A7 07                      	POP	ES
 18079                                  					; DS:SI -> Device header.
 18080 000029A8 5E                      	POP	SI
 18081 000029A9 1F                      	POP	DS
 18082                                  	; 10/08/2018
 18083 000029AA E91D01                  	jmp	ioctl_do_IO		; Perform Call to device driver
 18084                                  	
 18085                                  ioctl_bad_handlej:
 18086 000029AD E901FF                  	jmp	ioctl_bad_handle
 18087                                  
 18088                                  	; 29/01/2024
 18089                                  ioctl_bad_fun:
 18090 000029B0 B001                    	mov	al, error_invalid_function  ; 1
 18091 000029B2 E9C5DC                  	jmp	SYS_RET_ERR	
 18092                                  
 18093                                  	; 29/01/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 (Modified PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 18094                                  GenIOCTL_extended:
 18095 000029B5 80F96A                  	cmp	cl,6Ah			; UNLOCK LOGICAL VOLUME
 18096                                  	;je	short GenIOCTL_chk_lock
 18097 000029B8 740E                    	je	short GenIOCTL_lock_unlock
 18098 000029BA 80F94A                  	cmp	cl,4Ah			; LOCK LOGICAL VOLUME
 18099 000029BD 75A5                    	jne	short GenIOCTL_normal
 18100                                  ;GenIOCTL_chk_lock:
 18101                                  	;cmp	cl,4Ah			; LOCK LOGICAL VOLUME
 18102                                  	;jne	short GenIOCTL_lock_unlock
 18103 000029BF 80FF04                  	cmp	bh,4			; lock level (0-4)
 18104 000029C2 7404                    	je	short GenIOCTL_lock_unlock
 18105 000029C4 08FF                    	or	bh,bh
 18106 000029C6 75E8                    	jnz	short ioctl_bad_fun
 18107                                  GenIOCTL_lock_unlock:
 18108 000029C8 8A1E[B103]              	mov	bl,[IOCTL_drvnum]	; drive number (1=A:, 2=B: ..)
 18109 000029CC 30FF                    	xor	bh,bh
 18110 000029CE 4B                      	dec	bx
 18111 000029CF 80FB1A                  	cmp	bl,26			; logical disk number limit
 18112 000029D2 73DC                    	jnb	short ioctl_bad_fun
 18113 000029D4 80F96A                  	cmp	cl,6Ah			; UNLOCK LOGICAL VOLUME
 18114 000029D7 7507                    	jne	short GenIOCTL_lock
 18115 000029D9 80A7[2F14]7F            	and	byte [bx+drive_flags],7Fh ; UNLOCK
 18116 000029DE EB05                    	jmp	short GenIOCTL_OK
 18117                                  GenIOCTL_lock:
 18118 000029E0 808F[2F14]80            	or	byte [bx+drive_flags],80h ; LOCK
 18119                                  GenIOCTL_OK:
 18120 000029E5 E988DC                  	jmp	SYS_RET_OK
 18121

 18129                                  ;         the call to Check_If_Net because Check_If_Net gets our
 18130                                  ;         return address off the stack if the drive is invalid.

 18132                                  ;-------------------------------------------------------------------------
 18133                                  
 18134                                  	; 30/01/2024
 18135                                  ioctl_rem_media:
 18136                                  	; MSDOS 3.3 (& MSDOS 6.0)
 18137 000029E8 E83001                  	CALL	Check_If_Net
 18138 000029EB 75C3                    	JNZ	short ioctl_bad_fun	; There are no "net devices", and they
 18139                                  					;   certainly don't know how to do this
 18140                                  					;   call.
 18141                                  	;test	word [es:di+4],800h

 18501                                  ;-------------------------------------------------------------------------
 18502                                  ; Proc Name : Check_If_Net:
 18503                                  ;
 18504                                  ;
 18505                                  ; Checks if the device is over the net or not. Returns result in ZERO flag.
 18506                                  ; If no device is found, the return address is popped off the stack, and a
 18507                                  ; jump is made to ioctl_drv_err.
 18508                                  ;
 18509                                  ; On Entry:
 18510                                  ; Registers same as those for Get_Driver_BL
 18511                                  ;
 18512                                  ; On Exit:
 18513                                  ; ZERO flag	- set if not a net device
 18514                                  ;		- reset if net device
 18515                                  ; ES:DI -> the device
 18516                                  ;
 18517                                  ;
 18518                                  ; BUGBUG: This function assumes the following stack setup on entry
 18519                                  ;
 18520                                  ;	  SP+2 -> Error return address
 18521                                  ;	  SP   -> Normal return address
 18522                                  ;
 18523                                  ;-------------------------------------------------------------------------
 18524                                  
 18525                                  	; 30/01/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0
 18526                                  	; MSDOS 6.22 MSDOS.SYS - DOSCODE:639Ch
 18527                                  	; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM - DOSCODE:6A91h
 18528                                  	; Windows ME IO.SYS - BIOSCODE:68E1h
 18529                                  
 18530                                  Check_If_Net:
 18531                                  	; MSDOS 3.3 (& MSDOS 6.0)
 18532 00002B1B E8D2FF                  	CALL	Get_Driver_BL
 18533 00002B1E 7201                    	JC	short ioctl_drv_err_pop	; invalid drive letter
 18534                                  
 18535                                  ; 30/01/2024 ('Get_Driver_BL' returns with
 18536                                  ;	      'curdir_isnet' condition/ZF, no need to a second test)
 18537                                  %if 0
 18538                                  	;;;
 18539                                  	; (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM, Windows ME IO.SYS)
 18540                                  	PUSH	ES
 18541                                  	PUSH	DI
 18542                                  	LES	DI,[THISCDS]
 18543                                  	;test	word [es:di+43h],8000h
 18544                                  	;TEST	word [ES:DI+curdir.flags],curdir_isnet
 18545                                  	;test	byte [es:di+44h],80h
 18546                                  	TEST	byte [ES:DI+curdir.flags+1],(curdir_isnet>>8)
 18547                                  	POP	DI
 18548                                  	POP	ES
 18549                                  	;;;
 18550                                  %endif
 18551 00002B20 C3                      	retn
 18552                                  
 18553                                  ioctl_drv_err_pop:
 18554 00002B21 58                      	pop	ax			; pop off return address
 18555 00002B22 E951FF                  	jmp	ioctl_drv_err
 18556                                  
 18557                                  ioctl_bad_funj3:
 18558 00002B25 E988FE                  	jmp	ioctl_bad_fun
 18559                                  
 18560                                  ioctl_string_errj:
 18561 00002B28 EBB2                    	jmp	short ioctl_string_err  ; 25/05/2019
 18562

 18572                                  ;         return address off the stack if the drive is invalid.

 18588 00002B36 C606[7E03]17            	mov	byte [IOCALL_REQFUNC],DEVGETOWN	; default to get owner
 18589 00002B3B 3C0E                    	cmp	al,0Eh			; Get Owner ?

 18591                                  SetOwner:
 18592 00002B3F C606[7E03]18            	MOV	byte [IOCALL_REQFUNC],DEVSETOWN ; 24
 18593                                  GetOwner:
 18594 00002B44 B00D                    	MOV	AL,OWNHL ; 13
 18595 00002B46 88DC                    	MOV	AH,BL			; Unit number

 18600 00002B51 1F                      	POP	DS
 18601 00002B52 89FE                    	MOV	SI,DI			; DS:SI -> driver
 18602 00002B54 16                      	PUSH	SS
 18603 00002B55 07                      	POP	ES
 18604 00002B56 BB[7C03]                	MOV	BX,IOCALL		; ES:BX -> Call header
 18605 00002B59 1E                      	push	ds
 18606 00002B5A 56                      	push	si
 18607 00002B5B E8D824                  	call	DEVIOCALL2
 18608 00002B5E 5E                      	pop	si
 18609 00002B5F 1F                      	pop	ds
 18610                                  ;hkn; SS override
 18611                                  	;TEST	word [SS:IOCALL_REQSTAT],STERR ;Error?
 18612                                  	;test	byte [SS:IOCALL_REQSTAT+1],80h
 18613 00002B60 36F606[8003]80          	TEST	byte [SS:IOCALL_REQSTAT+1],(STERR>>8)
 18614 00002B66 75C0                    	jnz	short ioctl_string_errj
 18615 00002B68 36A0[7D03]              	MOV	AL,[SS:IOCALL_REQUNIT]	; Get owner returned by device
 18616                                  					; owner returned is 1-based.
 18617 00002B6C E901DB                  	jmp	SYS_RET_OK
