 20787                                  ;============================================================================
 20788                                  ; 08/08/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 20789                                  ; 18/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 20790                                  
 20791                                  ;	TITLE	DOS_OPEN - Internal OPEN call for MS-DOS
 20792                                  ;	NAME	DOS_OPEN
 20793                                  
 20794                                  ;**	OPEN.ASM - File Open
 20795                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 20796                                  ;	Low level routines for openning a file from a file spec.
 20797                                  ;	Also misc routines for sharing errors
 20798                                  ;
 20799                                  ;	DOS_Open
 20800                                  ;	Check_Access_AX
 20801                                  ;	SHARE_ERROR
 20802                                  ;	SET_SFT_MODE
 20803                                  ;	Code_Page_Mismatched_Error		   ; DOS 4.00
 20804                                  ;
 20805                                  ;	Revision history:
 20806                                  ;
 20807                                  ;	    Created: ARR 30 March 1983
 20808                                  ;	    A000	version 4.00   Jan. 1988
 20809                                  ;
 20810                                  ;	M034 - The value in save_bx must be pushed on to the stack for
 20811                                  ; 	       remote extended opens and not save_cx.
 20812                                  ;
 20813                                  ;	M035 - if open made from exec then we must set the appropriate bits
 20814                                  ;	       on the stack before calling off to the redir.
 20815                                  ;	M042 - Bit 11 of DOS34_FLAG set indicates that the redir knows how 
 20816                                  ;	       to handle open from exec. In this case set the appropriate bit
 20817                                  ;	       else do not.
 20818                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------	
 20819                                  
 20820                                  ;Installed = TRUE
 20821                                  
 20822                                  ;	i_need	NoSetDir,BYTE
 20823                                  ;	i_need	THISSFT,DWORD
 20824                                  ;	i_need	THISCDS,DWORD
 20825                                  ;	i_need	CURBUF,DWORD
 20826                                  ;	i_need	CurrentPDB,WORD
 20827                                  ;	i_need	CURR_DIR_END,WORD
 20828                                  ;	I_need	RetryCount,WORD
 20829                                  ;	I_need	Open_Access,BYTE
 20830                                  ;	I_need	fSharing,BYTE
 20831                                  ;	i_need	JShare,DWORD
 20832                                  ;	I_need	FastOpenFlg,byte
 20833                                  ;	I_need	EXTOPEN_ON,BYTE 		  ;AN000;; DOS 4.00
 20834                                  ;	I_need	ALLOWED,BYTE			  ;AN000;; DOS 4.00
 20835                                  ;	I_need	EXTERR,WORD			  ;AN000;; DOS 4.00
 20836                                  ;	I_need	EXTERR_LOCUS,BYTE		  ;AN000;; DOS 4.00
 20837                                  ;	I_need	EXTERR_ACTION,BYTE		  ;AN000;; DOS 4.00
 20838                                  ;	I_need	EXTERR_CLASS,BYTE		  ;AN000;; DOS 4.00
 20839                                  ;	I_need	CPSWFLAG,BYTE			  ;AN000;; DOS 4.00
 20840                                  ;	I_need	EXITHOLD,DWORD			  ;AN000;; DOS 4.00
 20841                                  ;	I_need	THISDPB,DWORD			  ;AN000;; DOS 4.00
 20842                                  ;	I_need	SAVE_CX,WORD			  ;AN000;; DOS 4.00
 20843                                  ;	I_need	SAVE_BX,WORD			  ;M034
 20844                                  ;
 20845                                  ;	I_need	DOS_FLAG,BYTE
 20846                                  ;	I_need	DOS34_FLAG,WORD			  ;M042
 20847                                  
 20848                                  ;Break	<DOS_Open - internal file access>
 20849                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 20850                                  ; Procedure Name : DOS_Open
 20851                                  ;
 20852                                  ; Inputs:
 20853                                  ;	[WFP_START] Points to WFP string ("d:/" must be first 3 chars, NUL
 20854                                  ;		terminated)
 20855                                  ;	[CURR_DIR_END] Points to end of Current dir part of string
 20856                                  ;		( = -1 if current dir not involved, else
 20857                                  ;		 Points to first char after last "/" of current dir part)
 20858                                  ;	[THISCDS] Points to CDS being used
 20859                                  ;		(Low word = -1 if NUL CDS (Net direct request))
 20860                                  ;	[THISSFT] Points to SFT to fill in if file found
 20861                                  ;		(sf_mode field set so that FCB may be detected)
 20862                                  ;	[SATTRIB] Is attribute of search, determines what files can be found
 20863                                  ;	AX is Access and Sharing mode
 20864                                  ;	  High NIBBLE of AL (Sharing Mode)
 20865                                  ;		sharing_compat	   file is opened in compatibility mode
 20866                                  ;		sharing_deny_none  file is opened Multi reader, Multi writer
 20867                                  ;		sharing_deny_read  file is opened Only reader, Multi writer
 20868                                  ;		sharing_deny_write file is opened Multi reader, Only writer
 20869                                  ;		sharing_deny_both  file is opened Only reader, Only writer
 20870                                  ;	  Low NIBBLE of AL (Access Mode)
 20871                                  ;		open_for_read	file is opened for reading
 20872                                  ;		open_for_write	file is opened for writing
 20873                                  ;		open_for_both	file is opened for both reading and writing.
 20874                                  ;
 20875                                  ;	  For FCB SFTs AL should = sharing_compat + open_for_both
 20876                                  ;		(not checked)
 20877                                  ; Function:
 20878                                  ;	Try to open the specified file
 20879                                  ; Outputs:
 20880                                  ;	sf_ref_count is NOT altered
 20881                                  ;	CARRY CLEAR
 20882                                  ;	    THISSFT filled in.
 20883                                  ;	CARRY SET
 20884                                  ;	    AX is error code
 20885                                  ;		error_file_not_found
 20886                                  ;			Last element of path not found
 20887                                  ;		error_path_not_found
 20888                                  ;			Bad path (not in curr dir part if present)
 20889                                  ;		error_bad_curr_dir
 20890                                  ;			Bad path in current directory part of path
 20891                                  ;		error_invalid_access
 20892                                  ;			Bad sharing mode or bad access mode or bad combination
 20893                                  ;		error_access_denied
 20894                                  ;			Attempt to open read only file for writting, or
 20895                                  ;			open a directory
 20896                                  ;		error_sharing_violation
 20897                                  ;			The sharing mode was correct but not allowed
 20898                                  ;			generates an INT 24 on compatibility mode SFTs
 20899                                  ; DS preserved, others destroyed
 20900                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 20901                                  
 20902                                  ; 18/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 20903                                  ; DOSCODE:6A60h (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
 20904                                  ; 14/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 20905                                  ; DOSCODE:6A4Ch (MSDOS 5.0, MSDOS.SYS)
 20906                                  
 20907                                  ; 01/02/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 (Modified PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 20908                                  ; DOSCODE:71BBh (PCDOS 7.1, IBMDOS.COM)
 20909                                  
 20910                                  DOS_OPEN:
 20911                                  	; DS has been set up to DOSDATA in file.asm and fcbio2.asm.

 21071 000032A3 742E                    	JZ	short open_ok

 21073                                  ; The file is marked READ-ONLY. We verify that the open mode allows access to
 21074                                  ; the read-only file. Unfortunately, with FCB's and net-FCB's we cannot
 21075                                  ; determine at the OPEN time if such access is allowed. Thus, we defer such
 21076                                  ; processing until the actual write operation:
 21077                                  ;
 21078                                  ; If FCB, then we change the mode to be read_only.
 21079                                  ; If net_FCB, then we change the mode to be read_only.
 21080                                  ; If not open for read then error.
 21081

 21092 000032B3 88CA                    	MOV	DL,CL

 21094 000032B8 80FA70                  	CMP	DL,SHARING_NET_FCB ; 70h ; is it net FCB?

 21096                                  ResetAccess:
 21097                                  	; 14/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS compatibility)	
 21098                                  	;AND	CX,~access_mask	; 0FFF0h ; clear access
 21099                                  	; 16/12/2022
 21100                                  	;and	cl,0F0h ; 18/05/2019
 21101                                  	;;;
 21102                                  	; 01/02/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0
 21103                                  	; (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 21104                                  	;and	cx,0FFFCh
 21105 000032BD 80E1FC                  	and	cl,0FCh ; ~3 ; ~open_mode_mask ; clear access
 21106                                  	;;;
 21107                                  ;	OR	CX,open_for_read ; 0	; stick in open_for_read
 21108 000032C0 894C02                  	MOV	[SI+SF_ENTRY.sf_mode],CX
 21109 000032C3 EB0C                    	JMP	SHORT FillSFT
 21110                                  
 21111                                  ; The SFT is normal. See if the requested access is open_for_read
 21112

 21120                                  				; this may be open_mode_mask

 21225                                  ; Called on sharing violations. ES:DI points to SFT. AX has error code

 21227                                  ; Returns carry set AX=error_sharing_violation if user says ignore (can't
 21228                                  ; really ignore). Carry clear if user wants a retry. ES, DI, DS preserved

 21235                                  	;TEST	word [ES:DI+SF_ENTRY.sf_mode],sf_isFCB ; 8000h
 21236 0000330D 7509                    	JNZ	short _HARD_ERR

 21253                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 21254                                  ; Procedure Name : DO_SHARE_CHECK
 21255                                  ;
 21256                                  ; Input: THISDPB, WFP_Start, THISSFT set
 21257                                  ; Functions: check file sharing mode is valid
 21258                                  ; Output: carry set, error
 21259                                  ;	  carry clear, share ok
 21260                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 21261                                  
 21262                                  	; 18/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 21263                                  DO_SHARE_CHECK:
 21264 00003322 E8C4E5                  	call	ECritDisk		; enter critical section
 21265                                  OPN_RETRY:
 21266 00003325 8B0E[1A00]              	MOV	CX,[RetryCount]		; Get # tries to do
 21267                                  OpenShareRetry:
 21268 00003329 51                      	push	cx			; Save number left to do
 21269 0000332A E8254A                  	call	SHARE_CHECK		; Final Check
 21270 0000332D 59                      	pop	cx			; CX = # left
 21271 0000332E 730E                    	JNC	short Share_Ok2		; No problem with access
 21272 00003330 E8AFE4                  	call	Idle
 21273 00003333 E2F4                    	LOOP	OpenShareRetry		; One more retry used up
 21274                                  OpenShareFail:
 21275 00003335 C43E[9E05]              	LES	DI,[THISSFT]
 21276 00003339 E8CCFF                  	call	SHARE_ERROR
 21277 0000333C 73E7                    	JNC	short OPN_RETRY		; User wants more retry
 21278                                  Share_Ok2:
 21279                                  	;call	LCritDisk		; leave critical section
 21280                                  	;retn
 21281                                  	; 18/12/2022
 21282 0000333E E9D5E5                  	jmp	LCritDisk
 21283                                  
 21284                                  ;-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 21285                                  ; Procedure Name : Check_Access
 21286                                  ;
 21287                                  ; Inputs:
 21288                                  ;	AX is mode
 21289                                  ;	  High NIBBLE of AL (Sharing Mode)
 21290                                  ;		sharing_compat	   file is opened in compatibility mode
 21291                                  ;		sharing_deny_none  file is opened Multi reader, Multi writer
 21292                                  ;		sharing_deny_read  file is opened Only reader, Multi writer
 21293                                  ;		sharing_deny_write file is opened Multi reader, Only writer
 21294                                  ;		sharing_deny_both  file is opened Only reader, Only writer
 21295                                  ;	  Low NIBBLE of AL (Access Mode)
 21296                                  ;		open_for_read	file is opened for reading
 21297                                  ;		open_for_write	file is opened for writing
 21298                                  ;		open_for_both	file is opened for both reading and writing.
 21299                                  ; Function:
 21300                                  ;	Check this access mode for correctness
 21301                                  ; Outputs:
 21302                                  ;	[open_access] = AL input
 21303                                  ;	Carry Clear
 21304                                  ;		Mode is correct
 21305                                  ;		AX unchanged
 21306                                  ;	Carry Set
 21307                                  ;		Mode is bad
 21308                                  ;		AX = error_invalid_access
 21309                                  ; No other registers effected
 21310                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 21311                                  
 21312                                  	; 23/01/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0
 21313                                  Check_Access_AX:
 21314 00003341 A2[6E05]                	MOV	[OPEN_ACCESS],AL
 21315 00003344 53                      	PUSH	BX
 21316                                  
 21317                                  ;	If sharing, then test for special sharing mode for FCBs
 21318                                  
 21319 00003345 88C3                    	MOV	BL,AL
 21320 00003347 80E3F0                  	AND	BL,SHARING_MASK ; 0F0h
 21321                                  
 21322                                  	;CMP	byte [FSHARING],-1
 21323                                  	;JNZ	short CheckShareMode	; not through server call, must be ok
 21324                                  	; 23/01/2024
 21325                                  	; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM
 21326 0000334A 803E[7205]00            	cmp	byte [FSHARING],0
 21327 0000334F 7405                    	jz	short CheckShareMode	; not through server call, must be ok
 21328                                  
 21329 00003351 80FB70                  	CMP	BL,SHARING_NET_FCB ; 70h
 21330 00003354 7405                    	JZ	short CheckAccessMode	; yes, we have an FCB
 21331                                  CheckShareMode:
 21332 00003356 80FB40                  	CMP	BL,40h			; is this a good sharing mode?
 21333 00003359 770D                    	JA	short Make_Bad_Access
 21334                                  CheckAccessMode:
 21335 0000335B 88C3                    	MOV	BL,AL
 21336                                  	; 23/01/2024
 21337 0000335D 80E303                  	and	bl,3 ; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM	
 21338                                  	;AND	BL,access_mask ; 0Fh
 21339 00003360 80FB02                  	CMP	BL,2
 21340 00003363 7703                    	JA	short Make_Bad_Access
 21341 00003365 5B                      	POP	BX
 21342 00003366 F8                      	CLC
 21343 00003367 C3                      	retn
 21344                                  
 21345                                  Make_Bad_Access:
 21346 00003368 B80C00                  	MOV	AX,error_invalid_access ; 0Ch
 21347 0000336B 5B                      	POP	BX
 21348 0000336C F9                      	STC
 21349 0000336D C3                      	retn
 21350                                  
 21351                                  ;============================================================================
 21352                                  ; DINFO.ASM, MSDOS 6.0, 1991
 21353                                  ;============================================================================
 21354                                  ; 08/08/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 21355                                  ; 18/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 21356                                  ; 02/02/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0
 21357                                  
 21358                                  ;**	Low level routine for returning disk drive information from a local
 21359                                  ;	  or NET device
 21360                                  ;
 21361                                  ;	DISK_INFO
 21362                                  ;
 21363                                  ;	  Modification history:
 21364                                  ;
 21365                                  ;		Created: ARR 30 March 1983
 21366                                  
 21367                                  ;	Break	<DISK_INFO -- Get Disk Drive Information>
 21368                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 21369                                  ; Procedure Name : DISK_INFO
 21370                                  ;
 21371                                  ; Inputs:
 21372                                  ;	[THISCDS] Points to the Macro List Structure of interest
 21373                                  ;		(It MAY NOT be NUL, error not detected)
 21374                                  ; Function:
 21375                                  ;	Get Interesting Drive Information
 21376                                  ; Returns:
 21377                                  ;	DX = Number of free allocation units
 21378                                  ;	BX = Total Number of allocation units on disk
 21379                                  ;	CX = Sector size
 21380                                  ;	AL = Sectors per allocation unit
 21381                                  ;	AH = FAT ID BYTE
 21382                                  ;	Carry set if error (currently user FAILed to I 24)
 21383                                  ; Segs except ES preserved, others destroyed
 21384                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 21385                                  
 21386                                  ;hkn; called from getset.asm and misc.asm. DS has already been set up to
 21387                                  ;hkn; DOSDATA. 
 21388

 21463 000033AD 16                      	push	ss
 21464 000033AE 1F                      	pop	ds
 21465                                  
 21466                                  ; 02/02/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0
 21467                                  %if 0
 21468                                  	;mov	cx,[es:bp+0Dh]
 21469                                  	MOV	CX,[ES:BP+DPB.MAX_CLUSTER]
 21470                                  
 21471                                  ; Examine the current free count. If it indicates that we have an invalid
 21472                                  ; count, do the expensive calculation.
 21473                                  
 21474                                  	;mov	dx,[es:bp+1Fh]
 21475                                  	MOV	DX,[ES:BP+DPB.FREE_CNT] ; get free count
 21476                                  	CMP	DX,-1			; is it valid?
 21477                                  	JZ	short DoScan
 21478                                  
 21479                                  ; Check to see if it is in a reasonable range. If so, trust it and return.
 21480                                  ; Otherwise, we need to blast out an internal error message and then recompute
 21481                                  ; the count.
 21482                                  
 21483                                  	CMP	DX,CX			; is it in a reasonable range?
 21484                                  	JB	short GotVal		; yes, trust it.
 21485                                  DoScan:
 21486                                  	XOR	DX,DX
 21487                                  	DEC	CX
 21488                                  SCANFREE:
 21489                                  	call	UNPACK
 21490                                  	JC	short CRIT_LEAVE
 21491                                  	JNZ	short NOTFREECLUS
 21492                                  	INC	DX			; A free one
 21493                                  NOTFREECLUS:
 21494                                  	INC	BX			; Next cluster
 21495                                  	LOOP	SCANFREE
 21496                                  	DEC	BX			; BX was next cluster. Convert to
 21497                                  ReturnVals:
 21498                                  	DEC	BX			; count
 21499                                  	;mov	al,[es:bp+4]
 21500                                  	MOV	AL,[ES:BP+DPB.CLUSTER_MASK]
 21501                                  	INC	AL			; Sectors/cluster
 21502                                  	;mov	cx,[es:bp+2]
 21503                                  	MOV	CX,[ES:BP+DPB.SECTOR_SIZE] ; Bytes/sector
 21504                                  	;mov	[es:bp+1Fh],dx
 21505                                  	MOV	[ES:BP+DPB.FREE_CNT],DX
 21506                                  	CLC
 21507                                  CRIT_LEAVE:
 21508                                  	;call	LCritDisk
 21509                                  	;retn
 21510                                  	; 17/12/2022
 21511                                  	jmp	LCritDisk
 21512                                  
 21513                                  ; We have correctly computed everything previously. Load up registers for
 21514                                  ; return.
 21515                                  
 21516                                  GotVal: 
 21517                                  	MOV	BX,CX			; get cluster count
 21518                                  	JMP	short ReturnVals
 21519                                  
 21520                                  %else
 21521                                  	; 02/02/2024 (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 21522 000033AF 31F6                    	xor	si,si	; 0
 21523 000033B1 89F7                    	mov	di,si	; 0
 21524                                  	;mov	dx,[es:bp+1Fh]

 21526                                  	;cmp	[es:bp+0Fh],si
 21527 000033B7 2639760F                	cmp	[es:bp+DPB.FAT_SIZE],si ; FAT32 (16 bit FAT size = 0) ?

 21529                                  	;mov	cx,[es:bp+0Dh]

 21531 000033C1 EB18                    	jmp	short dsk_info_5 ; zf=0, si=di=0
 21532                                  
 21533                                  dsk_info_4:
 21534                                  	;mov	di,[es:bp+2Fh]
 21535 000033C3 268B7E2F                	mov	di,[es:bp+DPB.LAST_CLUSTER+2]
 21536                                  	;mov	cx,[es:bp+2Dh]
 21537 000033C7 268B4E2D                	mov	cx,[es:bp+DPB.LAST_CLUSTER]
 21538                                  	;mov	si,[es:bp+21h]
 21539 000033CB 268B7621                	mov	si,[es:bp+DPB.FREE_CNT_HW] ; hw of free cluster count
 21540 000033CF 39F2                    	cmp	dx,si			; same (zero) ?
 21541                                  ;dsk_info_5:
 21542 000033D1 7504                    	jnz	short dsk_info_6	; not same (not zero)
 21543 000033D3 42                      	inc	dx
 21544 000033D4 740B                    	jz	short dsk_info_8	; 0FFFFh -> 0 (free count is invalid/initial)
 21545                                  					; free count calculation is needed
 21546 000033D6 4A                      	dec	dx
 21547                                  dsk_info_6:
 21548 000033D7 39FE                    	cmp	si,di			; same hw ?
 21549 000033D9 7502                    	jne	short dsk_info_7	; no
 21550                                  dsk_info_5:	; 02/02/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 
 21551 000033DB 39CA                    	cmp	dx,cx			; same lw ?
 21552                                  dsk_info_7:
 21553 000033DD 7268                    	jb	short GotVal		; free cluster count < last cluster number
 21554 000033DF 31D2                    	xor	dx,dx	; 0
 21555                                  dsk_info_8:
 21556 000033E1 31F6                    	xor	si,si	; 0
 21557 000033E3 83E901                  	sub	cx,1			; last cluster number - 1 = number of clusters
 21558 000033E6 19F7                    	sbb	di,si
 21559                                  	;or	byte [es:bp+18h],1
 21560 000033E8 26804E1801              	or	byte [es:bp+DPB.FIRST_ACCESS],1 ; set first access bit 0
 21561                                  					; (Update flag for FSINFO sector)
 21562                                  SCANFREE:
 21563 000033ED 56                      	push	si
 21564 000033EE FF36[F30A]              	push	word [CCONTENT_HW]
 21565 000033F2 57                      	push	di
 21566 000033F3 E81B2B                  	call	UNPACK
 21567 000033F6 5F                      	pop	di
 21568 000033F7 8F06[F30A]              	pop	word [CCONTENT_HW]
 21569 000033FB 5E                      	pop	si
 21570 000033FC 7246                    	jc	short CRIT_LEAVE
 21571 000033FE 7504                    	jnz	short NOTFREECLUS
 21572 00003400 42                      	inc	dx			; a free one
 21573 00003401 7501                    	jnz	short NOTFREECLUS
 21574 00003403 46                      	inc	si			; increase hw of free cluster count
 21575                                  
 21576                                  NOTFREECLUS:
 21577 00003404 43                      	inc	bx			; next cluster
 21578 00003405 7504                    	jnz	short NOTFREECLUS2
 21579 00003407 FF06[EF0A]              	inc	word [CLUSTNUM_HW]	; increase hw of (next) cluster number
 21580                                  
 21581                                  NOTFREECLUS2:
 21582 0000340B 83E901                  	sub	cx,1			; decrease remain cluster count for calculation
 21583 0000340E 83DF00                  	sbb	di,0
 21584 00003411 75DA                    	jnz	short SCANFREE
 21585 00003413 E302                    	jcxz	NOTFREECLUS3		; calculation completed
 21586 00003415 EBD6                    	jmp	short SCANFREE
 21587                                  
 21588                                  NOTFREECLUS3:
 21589 00003417 8B3E[EF0A]              	mov	di,[CLUSTNUM_HW]
 21590 0000341B 83EB01                  	sub	bx,1
 21591 0000341E 83DF00                  	sbb	di,0			; di:bx = last cluster number
 21592                                  
 21593                                  ReturnVals:
 21594 00003421 31C9                    	xor	cx,cx
 21595 00003423 83EB01                  	sub	bx,1
 21596 00003426 19CF                    	sbb	di,cx			; di:bx = number of clusters
 21597                                  	;mov	al,[es:bp+4]
 21598 00003428 268A4604                	mov	al,[es:bp+DPB.CLUSTER_MASK] ; spc - 1

 21602                                  	;cmp	[es:bp+0Fh],cx ; 0

 21605                                  	;mov	[es:bp+21h],si

 21609

 21612 0000343F 268B4E02                	mov	cx,[es:bp+DPB.SECTOR_SIZE] ; bytes per sector
 21613 00003443 F8                      	clc
 21614                                  
 21615                                  CRIT_LEAVE:
 21616                                  	;call	LCritDisk
 21617                                  	;retn
 21618 00003444 E9CFE4                  	jmp	LCritDisk
 21619                                  
 21620                                  GotVal:

 21622 00003449 EBD6                    	jmp	short ReturnVals

 21626                                  ; =============== S U B R O U T I N E =======================================
 21627                                  
 21628                                  ; 03/02/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0
 21629                                  
 21630                                  modify_spc:
 21631 0000344B 50                      	push	ax			; ax = sectors per cluster
 21632 0000344C 52                      	push	dx
 21633 0000344D F7E1                    	mul	cx			; bytes per sector
 21634                                  	;cmp	dx,0
 21635 0000344F 21D2                    	and	dx,dx
 21636 00003451 7503                    	jnz	short mspc_1
 21637 00003453 3D0040                  	cmp	ax,16384		; 16 kilobytes (per cluster)
 21638                                  					; ***
 21639                                  					; actual disk size limit
 21640                                  					; without invalidating cluster counts is
 21641                                  					; 2 GB (512K clusters * 8 sectors per cluster)
 21642                                  					;      (128K clusters * 32 sectors per cluster)
 21643                                  mspc_1:
 21644 00003456 5A                      	pop	dx
 21645 00003457 58                      	pop	ax
 21646 00003458 760E                    	jbe	short mspc_3		; bytes per cluster <= 16 KB
 21647                                                                          ; ***
 21648                                                                          ; bytes per cluster > 16 KB
 21649 0000345A 31FF                    	xor	di,di			; 0
 21650 0000345C BBFEFF                  	mov	bx,0FFFEh		; (invalidated)
 21651 0000345F 09F6                    	or	si,si			; hw of free cluster count
 21652 00003461 7404                    	jz	short mspc_2		; si = 0
 21653 00003463 89FE                    	mov	si,di			; si = 0
 21654 00003465 89DA                    	mov	dx,bx			; dx = bx = 0FFFEh (invalidated)
 21655                                  mspc_2:
 21656 00003467 C3                      	retn
 21657                                  
 21658                                  mspc_3:
 21659 00003468 D1E0                    	shl	ax,1			; sectors per clust = sectors per clust * 2
 21660                                  					; (ax <= 32768) -modified spc limit-
 21661 0000346A D1EF                    	shr	di,1			; cluster count = cluster count /2
 21662                                  					; di:bx = modified value of total clusters
 21663                                  mspc_4:
 21664 0000346C D1DB                    	rcr	bx,1
 21665 0000346E D1EE                    	shr	si,1			; free clusters = free clusters / 2
 21666 00003470 D1DA                    	rcr	dx,1			; si:dx = modified value of free clusters
 21667

 21673                                  modify_cluster_count:
 21674 00003472 09FF                    	or	di,di			; hw of cluster count

 21678                                  ; =============== S U B R O U T I N E =======================================
 21679                                  
 21680                                  ; write FSINFO sector onto disk
 21681                                  
 21682                                  ; 03/02/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0
 21683                                  ; --------------------------------
 21684                                  ; FAT32 FSInfo Sector Structure
 21685                                  ; --------------------------------
 21686                                  ; ref: Microsoft FAT32 File System Specification (2000)
 21687                                  
 21688                                  struc FSINFO		; Offset ;
 21689 00000000 ????????                .LeadSig:	resb 4	  ; 0		; Value 0x41615252. Lead Signature.
 21690 00000004 <res 1E0h>              .Reserved1:	resb 480  ; 4		; Reserved. Must be 0. Never be used.
 21691 000001E4 ????????                .StrucSig:	resb 4	  ; 484		; Value 0x61417272. Fields Signature.
 21692 000001E8 ????????                .Free_Count:	resb 4	  ; 488		; Last known free cluster count. (*) 
 21693 000001EC ????????                .Nxt_Free:	resb 4	  ; 492		; Start clus for free clus srch. (**)
 21694 000001F0 <res Ch>                .Reserved2:	resb 12	  ; 496		; Reserved. Must be 0. Never be used.
 21695 000001FC ????????                .TrailSig:	resb 4	  ; 508		; Value 0xAA550000. Trail Signature.
 21696                                  .size:
 21697                                  endstruc
 21698                                  
 21699                                  ; (*) If the value is 0xFFFFFFFF, then the free count is unknown
 21700                                  ;     and must be computed.
 21701                                  ; (**) If the value is 0xFFFFFFFF, then free cluster search must be started
 21702                                  ;     from cluster 2.
 21703                                  ; Lead Signature, Fields (Structure) Signature and Trail Signature
 21704                                  ; are used to validate FSInfo sector.
 21705                                  
 21706                                  ; --------------------------------
 21707                                  
 21708                                  	; 03/02/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0
 21709                                  	; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM - DOSCODE:7436h
 21710                                  	; (Windows ME IO.SYS - BIOSCODE:7227h)
 21711                                  
 21712                                  update_fat32_fsinfo:
 21713 00003477 51                      	push	cx
 21714 00003478 52                      	push	dx
 21715 00003479 31C9                    	xor	cx,cx
 21716                                  	;mov	dx,[es:bp+25h]
 21717 0000347B 268B5625                	mov	dx,[es:bp+DPB.FSINFO_SECTOR]
 21718                                  	;cmp	[es:bp+0Fh],cx
 21719 0000347F 26394E0F                	cmp	[es:bp+DPB.FAT_SIZE],cx ; 0
 21720                                  				; (16bit FAT size field = 0 for FAT32 fs)
 21721 00003483 7505                    	jne	short u_fat32_inf_1
 21722 00003485 83FAFF                  	cmp	dx,0FFFFh ; -1
 21723 00003488 7508                    	jne	short u_fat32_inf_2
 21724                                  
 21725                                  u_fat32_inf_1:
 21726 0000348A 5A                      	pop	dx
 21727 0000348B 59                      	pop	cx
 21728                                  	;and	byte [es:bp+18h],0F4h
 21729 0000348C 26806618F4              	and	byte [es:bp+DPB.FIRST_ACCESS],0F4h ; clear bit 0,1 and 3
 21730                                  					; bit 0 - FSINFO update (dirty) bit
 21731                                  					; bit 1 - BPB_RootClus update bit
 21732                                  					; bit 3 - BPB_ExtFlags update bit
 21733 00003491 C3                      	retn
 21734                                  
 21735                                  u_fat32_inf_2:
 21736 00003492 50                      	push	ax
 21737 00003493 53                      	push	bx
 21738 00003494 57                      	push	di
 21739 00003495 56                      	push	si
 21740 00003496 1E                      	push	ds
 21741 00003497 36803E[7900]00          	cmp	byte [ss:BuffInHMA],0	; is buffers in HMA?
 21742 0000349D 740A                    	jz	short u_fat32_inf_3	; no
 21743 0000349F 36C53E[7A00]            	lds	di,[ss:LoMemBuff]	; read it into scratch buffer
 21744                                  	;sub	di,24
 21745 000034A4 83EF18                  	sub	di,BUFINSIZ		; space for buffer header
 21746                                  					; (buffer header size = 24)
 21747                                  	;clc
 21748 000034A7 EB0E                    	jmp	short u_fat32_inf_4
 21749                                  
 21750                                  u_fat32_inf_3:
 21751 000034A9 06                      	push	es
 21752 000034AA 55                      	push	bp
 21753 000034AB E82A2E                  	call	GETCURHEAD		; ds:di = first buffer in queue
 21754 000034AE 52                      	push	dx
 21755 000034AF E80430                  	call	BUFWRITE		; BufWrite writes a buffer to the disk,
 21756                                  					;  if it's dirty.
 21757 000034B2 5A                      	pop	dx
 21758 000034B3 5D                      	pop	bp
 21759 000034B4 07                      	pop	es
 21760                                  ;u_fat32_inf_4:
 21761 000034B5 726A                    	jc	short u_fat32_inf_5
 21762                                  u_fat32_inf_4:
 21763 000034B7 31C9                    	xor	cx,cx
 21764                                  	;lea	bx,[di+24]
 21765 000034B9 8D5D18                  	lea	bx,[di+BUFINSIZ]	; buffer data address
 21766                                  	;mov	byte [ss:ALLOWED],18h
 21767 000034BC 36C606[4B03]18          	mov	byte [ss:ALLOWED],Allowed_FAIL+Allowed_RETRY
 21768 000034C2 36890E[0706]            	mov	[ss:HIGH_SECTOR],cx ; 0
 21769 000034C7 41                      	inc	cx			; cx = sector count = 1
 21770                                  					; es:bp = DPB
 21771 000034C8 53                      	push	bx			; ds:bx = buffer (data) address
 21772 000034C9 52                      	push	dx			; HIGH_SECTOR:dx = disk sector address
 21773 000034CA E8C40A                  	call	DREAD		 	; read fs info sector
 21774 000034CD 5A                      	pop	dx
 21775 000034CE 5B                      	pop	bx
 21776 000034CF 7250                    	jc	short u_fat32_inf_5
 21777                                  
 21778                                  	;cmp	word [bx+FSINFO.LeadSig],5252h	
 21779 000034D1 813F5252                	cmp	word [bx],5252h		; 'RR'
 21780 000034D5 754A                    	jne	short u_fat32_inf_5
 21781                                  	;cmp	word [bx+2],4161h	; 'aA' ; (NASM syntax)
 21782 000034D7 817F026141              	cmp	word [bx+FSINFO.LeadSig+2],4161h
 21783 000034DC 7543                    	jne	short u_fat32_inf_5
 21784                                  	
 21785                                  	;cmp	word [bx+1E4h],7272h	; 'rr' at offset 484
 21786 000034DE 81BFE4017272            	cmp	word [bx+FSINFO.StrucSig],7272h
 21787 000034E4 753B                    	jne	short u_fat32_inf_5
 21788                                  
 21789                                  	;cmp	word [bx+1E6h],6141h	; 'Aa' at offset 486
 21790 000034E6 81BFE6014161            	cmp	word [bx+FSINFO.StrucSig+2],6141h
 21791 000034EC 7533                    	jne	short u_fat32_inf_5
 21792                                  
 21793                                  	;cmp	word [bx+1FEh],0AA55h	; boot signature at offset 510
 21794 000034EE 81BFFE0155AA            	cmp	word [bx+FSINFO.TrailSig+2],0AA55h
 21795 000034F4 752B                    	jne	short u_fat32_inf_5
 21796                                  	
 21797                                  	;mov	ax,[es:bp+1Fh]
 21798 000034F6 268B461F                	mov	ax,[es:bp+DPB.FREE_CNT]
 21799                                  	;mov	[bx+1E8h],ax 
 21800 000034FA 8987E801                	mov	[bx+FSINFO.Free_Count],ax ; at offset 488
 21801                                  	;mov	ax,[es:bp+21h]
 21802 000034FE 268B4621                	mov	ax,[es:bp+DPB.FREE_CNT+2]
 21803                                  	;mov	[bx+1EAh],ax
 21804 00003502 8987EA01                	mov	[bx+FSINFO.Free_Count+2],ax
 21805                                  
 21806                                  	;mov	ax,[es:bp+39h]
 21807 00003506 268B4639                	mov	ax,[es:bp+DPB.FAT32_NXTFREE]
 21808                                  	;mov	[bx+1ECh],ax
 21809 0000350A 8987EC01                	mov	[bx+FSINFO.Nxt_Free],ax	; at offset 492
 21810                                  	;mov	ax,[es:bp+3Bh]
 21811 0000350E 268B463B                	mov	ax,[es:bp+DPB.FAT32_NXTFREE+2]
 21812                                  	;mov	[bx+1EEh],ax
 21813 00003512 8987EE01                	mov	[bx+FSINFO.Nxt_Free+2],ax
 21814                                  
 21815 00003516 31C9                    	xor	cx,cx
 21816 00003518 36890E[0706]            	mov	[ss:HIGH_SECTOR],cx ; 0
 21817 0000351D 41                      	inc	cx	; 1
 21818 0000351E E8D00A                  	call	DWRITE
 21819                                  
 21820                                  u_fat32_inf_5:
 21821 00003521 1F                      	pop	ds
 21822 00003522 5E                      	pop	si
 21823 00003523 5F                      	pop	di
 21824 00003524 5B                      	pop	bx
 21825 00003525 58                      	pop	ax
 21826 00003526 E961FF                  	jmp	u_fat32_inf_1

 21829                                  ; ISEARCH.ASM, MSDOS 6.0, 1991
 21830                                  ;============================================================================
 21831                                  ; 22/07/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 21832                                  
 21833                                  ;	TITLE	DOS_SEARCH - Internal SEARCH calls for MS-DOS
 21834                                  ;	NAME	DOS_SEARCH
 21835                                  
 21836                                  ;**	Low level routines for doing local and NET directory searches
 21837                                  ;
 21838                                  ;	DOS_SEARCH_FIRST
 21839                                  ;	DOS_SEARCH_NEXT
 21840                                  ;	RENAME_NEXT
 21841                                  ;
 21842                                  ;	Revision history:
 21843                                  ;
 21844                                  ;	    Created: ARR 30 March 1983
 21845                                  ;	    A000	version 4.00  Jan. 1988
 21846                                  ;	    A001	PTM 3564 -- search for fastopen
 21847                                  
 21848                                  ;Installed = TRUE
 21849                                  
 21850                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 21851                                  ;
 21852                                  ; Procedure Name : DOS_SEARCH_FIRST
 21853                                  ;
 21854                                  ; Inputs:
 21855                                  ;	[WFP_START] Points to WFP string ("d:/" must be first 3 chars, NUL
 21856                                  ;		terminated)
 21857                                  ;	[CURR_DIR_END] Points to end of Current dir part of string
 21858                                  ;		( = -1 if current dir not involved, else
 21859                                  ;		 Points to first char after last "/" of current dir part)
 21860                                  ;	[THISCDS] Points to CDS being used
 21861                                  ;		(Low word = -1 if NUL CDS (Net direct request))
 21862                                  ;	[SATTRIB] Is attribute of search, determines what files can be found
 21863                                  ;	[DMAADD] Points to 53 byte buffer
 21864                                  ; Function:
 21865                                  ;	Initiate a search for the given file spec
 21866                                  ; Outputs:
 21867                                  ;	CARRY CLEAR
 21868                                  ;	    The 53 bytes ot DMAADD are filled in as follows:
 21869                                  ;
 21870                                  ;	LOCAL
 21871                                  ;	    Drive Byte (A=1, B=2, ...) High bit clear
 21872                                  ;		NEVER STORE DRIVE BYTE AFTER  found_it
 21873                                  ;	    11 byte search name with Meta chars in it
 21874                                  ;	    Search Attribute Byte, attribute of search
 21875                                  ;	    WORD LastEnt value
 21876                                  ;	    WORD DirStart
 21877                                  ;	    4 byte pad
 21878                                  ;	    32 bytes of the directory entry found
 21879                                  ;	NET
 21880                                  ;	    21 bytes First byte has high bit set
 21881                                  ;	    32 bytes of the directory entry found
 21882                                  ;
 21883                                  ;	CARRY SET
 21884                                  ;	    AX = error code
 21885                                  ;		error_no_more_files
 21886                                  ;			No match for this file
 21887                                  ;		error_path_not_found
 21888                                  ;			Bad path (not in curr dir part if present)
 21889                                  ;		error_bad_curr_dir
 21890                                  ;			Bad path in current directory part of path
 21891                                  ; DS preserved, others destroyed
 21892                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 21893                                  
 21894                                  ; 24/01/2024
 21895                                  %if 1
 21896                                  	; 17/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 21897                                  GET_FAST_SEARCH:
 21898                                  	; 22/07/2018
 21899                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 21900                                  	; 17/12/2022
 21901 00003529 36800E[1206]04          	OR	byte [ss:DOS34_FLAG+1],(SEARCH_FASTOPEN>>8)  ; 04h
 21902                                  	;OR	word [ss:DOS34_FLAG],SEARCH_FASTOPEN  ; 400h
 21903                                  					;FO.trigger fastopen ;AN000;
 21904                                  	;call	DOS_SEARCH_FIRST
 21905                                  	;retn
 21906                                  	; 24/01/2024
 21907                                  	; 17/12/2022
 21908                                  	;jmp	DOS_SEARCH_FIRST
 21909                                  %endif

 22016                                  found_entry:

 22138                                  ;BREAK <DOS_SEARCH_NEXT - scan for subsequent matches>
 22139                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 22140                                  ;
 22141                                  ; Procedure Name : DOS_SEARCH_NEXT
 22142                                  ;
 22143                                  ; Inputs:
 22144                                  ;	[DMAADD] Points to 53 byte buffer returned by DOS_SEARCH_FIRST
 22145                                  ;	    (only first 21 bytes must have valid information)
 22146                                  ; Function:
 22147                                  ;	Look for subsequent matches
 22148                                  ; Outputs:
 22149                                  ;	CARRY CLEAR
 22150                                  ;	    The 53 bytes at DMAADD are updated for next call
 22151                                  ;		(see DOS_SEARCH_FIRST)
 22152                                  ;	CARRY SET
 22153                                  ;	    AX = error code
 22154                                  ;		error_no_more_files
 22155                                  ;			No more files to find
 22156                                  ; DS preserved, others destroyed
 22157                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 22158                                  
 22159                                  ;hkn; called from search.asm. DS already set up at this point.
 22160                                  
 22161                                  	; 03/02/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0
 22162                                  	; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM - DOSCODE:75ECh
 22163                                  
 22164                                  DOS_SEARCH_NEXT:
 22165 00003629 C43E[2C03]              	LES	DI,[DMAADD]	; 24/01/2024 (Retro DOS v5-v4)
 22166 0000362D 268A05                  	MOV	AL,[ES:DI]
 22167 00003630 A880                    	TEST	AL,80H			; Test for NET
 22168 00003632 7406                    	JZ	short LOCAL_SEARCH_NEXT
 22169                                  ;IF NOT Installed
 22170                                  ;	transfer NET_SEARCH_NEXT
 22171                                  ;ELSE
 22172                                  	;mov	ax,111Ch
 22173 00003634 B81C11                  	MOV	AX,(MultNET<<8)|28
 22174 00003637 CD2F                    	INT	2FH  ; Multiplex - NETWORK REDIRECTOR - FINDNEXT
 22175                                  		     ; SS = DS = DOS CS, [DTA] = 21-byte findfirst search data
 22176                                  		     ; Return: CF set on error, AX = DOS error code
 22177                                  		     ; CF clear if successful
 22178 00003639 C3                      	retn
 22179                                  ;ENDIF
 22180                                  
 22181                                  LOCAL_SEARCH_NEXT:
 22182                                  	;AL is drive A=1
 22183                                  	;mov	byte [EXTERR_LOCUS],2
 22184 0000363A C606[2303]02            	MOV	byte [EXTERR_LOCUS],errLOC_Disk
 22185 0000363F E8A7E2                  	call	ECritDisk
 22186

 22188 00003642 C706[A205][F304]        	MOV     word [THISCDS],DUMMYCDS

 22213 00003674 AC                      	LODSB				; Drive Byte

 22216                                  RENAME_NEXT:
 22217                                  	;context ES
 22218 00003675 16                      	push	ss
 22219 00003676 07                      	pop	es			; THIS BLOWS ES:BP POINTER TO DPB
 22220

 22222 00003677 BF[4B05]                	MOV	DI,NAME1
 22223                                  
 22224 0000367A B90B00                  	MOV	CX,11

 22240 0000368A AD                      	LODSW				; DirStart
 22241 0000368B 89C3                    	MOV	BX,AX
 22242

 22252 0000368F 1F                      	pop	ds

 22254

 22288                                  ;
 22289                                  ; Procedure Name : CHECK_QUESTION
 22290                                  ;
 22291                                  ; Input: [WFP_START]= pointer to final path
 22292                                  ; Function: check '?' char
 22293                                  ; Output: carry clear, if no '?'
 22294                                  ;	 carry set, if '?' exists
 22295                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 22296                                  
 22297                                  ; 03/02/2024
 22298                                  %if 0
 22299                                  	; 07/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 22300                                  CHECK_QUESTION:
 22301                                  ;hkn;	wfp_start is in DOSDATA;hkn;	MOV	WORD PTR ThisCDS+2,CS
 22302                                  ;hkn;	PUSH	CS			;AN000;;FO.
 22303                                  	push	ss
 22304                                  	POP	DS			;AN000;;FO. ds:si -> final path
 22305                                  	; 16/12/2022
 22306                                  	; 07/12/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS compatibility)
 22307                                  	MOV	SI,[WFP_START]		;AN000;;FO.
 22308                                  	;mov	si,[ss:WFP_START]
 22309                                  getnext:				;AN000;
 22310                                  	LODSB				;AN000;;FO. get char
 22311                                  	OR	AL,AL			;AN000;;FO. is it null
 22312                                  	JZ	short NO_Question	;AN000;;FO. yes
 22313                                  	CMP	AL,'?'                  ;AN000;;FO. is '?'
 22314                                  	JNZ	short getnext 		;AN000;;FO. no
 22315                                  	STC				;AN000;;FO.
 22316                                  NO_Question:				;AN000;
 22317                                  	retn				;AN000;;FO.
 22318                                  %endif
 22319                                  
 22320                                  ;============================================================================
 22321                                  ; ABORT.ASM, MSDOS 6.0, 1991
 22322                                  ;============================================================================
 22323                                  ; 23/07/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 22324                                  ; 18/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 22325                                  
 22326                                  ;**
 22327                                  ;
 22328                                  ; Internal Abort call closes all handles and FCBs associated with a process.
 22329                                  ;  If process has NET resources a close all is sent out over the net.
 22330                                  ;
 22331                                  ;   DOS_ABORT
 22332                                  ;
 22333                                  ;   Modification history:
 22334                                  ;
 22335                                  ;       Created: ARR 30 March 1983
 22336                                  ;
 22337                                  ;	M038	SR	10/16/90	Free SFT with the PSP of the process
 22338                                  ;				being terminated only if it is busy.
 22339                                  ;
 22340                                  
 22341                                  ;Break   <DOS_ABORT -- CLOSE all files for process>
 22342                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 22343                                  ;
 22344                                  ; Procedure Name : DOS_ABORT
 22345                                  ;
 22346                                  ; Inputs:
 22347                                  ;       [CurrentPDB] set to PID of process aborting
 22348                                  ; Function:
 22349                                  ;       Close all files and free all SFTs for this PID
 22350                                  ; Returns:
 22351                                  ;       None
 22352                                  ; All destroyed except stack
 22353                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 22354                                  
 22355                                  	; 03/02/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0
 22356                                  	; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM - DOSCODE:7685h
 22357                                  	; (Win ME IO.SYS - BIOSCODE:74F4h) 
 22358                                  
 22359                                  DOS_ABORT:
 22360 000036BC 368E06[3003]            	MOV     ES,[SS:CurrentPDB]	; SS override
 22361 000036C1 268B0E3200              	MOV     CX,[ES:PDB.JFN_Length]  ; Number of JFNs
 22362                                  reset_free_jfn:
 22363 000036C6 89CB                    	MOV     BX,CX
 22364 000036C8 51                      	PUSH    CX
 22365 000036C9 4B                      	DEC     BX                      ; get jfn (start with last one)
 22366                                  
 22367 000036CA E84E3A                  	CALL	_$CLOSE
 22368 000036CD 59                      	POP     CX
 22369 000036CE E2F6                    	LOOP    reset_free_jfn          ; and do 'em all
 22370                                  
 22371                                  ; Note: We do need to explicitly close FCBs. Reasons are as follows: If we
 22372                                  ; are running in the no-sharing no-network environment, we are simulating the
 22373                                  ; 2.0 world and thus if the user doesn't close the file, that is his problem
 22374                                  ; BUT... the cache remains in a state with garbage that may be reused by the
 22375                                  ; next process. We scan the set and blast the ref counts of the FCBs we own.
 22376                                  ;
 22377                                  ; If sharing is loaded, then the following call to close process will
 22378                                  ; correctly close all FCBs. We will then need to walk the list AFTER here.
 22379                                  ;
 22380                                  ; Finally, the following call to NET_Abort will cause an EOP to be sent to all
 22381                                  ; known network resources. These resources are then responsible for cleaning
 22382                                  ; up after this process.
 22383                                  ;
 22384                                  ; Sleazy, eh?
 22385                                  
 22386                                  	;context DS			; SS is DOSDATA
 22387 000036D0 16                      	push	ss
 22388 000036D1 1F                      	pop	ds  ; 09/09/2018
 22389                                  
 22390                                  	;CallInstall Net_Abort, MultNET, 29
 22391 000036D2 B81D11                  	mov	ax,111Dh
 22392 000036D5 CD2F                    	int     2Fh 	; Multiplex - NETWORK REDIRECTOR 
 22393                                  			;	    - CLOSE ALL REMOTE FILES FOR PROCESS
 22394                                  			; DS???, SS = DOS CS
 22395                                  ;if installed
 22396 000036D7 FF1E[A000]              	call	far [JShare+(4*4)]	; 4 = MFTCloseP
 22397                                  ;else
 22398                                  ;	call 	MFTCloseP
 22399                                  ;endif
 22400                                  
 22401                                  ; Scan the FCB cache for guys that belong to this process and zap their ref
 22402                                  ; counts.
 22403                                  					; SS override
 22404 000036DB 36C43E[4000]            	les     di,[ss:SFTFCB]		; grab the pointer to the table
 22405                                  
 22406                                  	;;;
 22407                                  	; 03/02/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0
 22408                                  	; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM
 22409                                  SFTFCB_check:
 22410 000036E0 8CC1                    	mov	cx,es
 22411 000036E2 09F9                    	or	cx,di
 22412 000036E4 E31C                    	jcxz	FCBScanDone
 22413 000036E6 57                      	push	di
 22414                                  SFTFCB_OK:
 22415                                  	;;;
 22416                                  	;mov	cx,[es:di+4]
 22417 000036E7 268B4D04                	mov     cx,[es:di+SFT.SFCount]
 22418 000036EB E315                    	jcxz    FCBScanDone
 22419                                  	;lea	di,[di+6]
 22420 000036ED 8D7D06                  	LEA     DI,[DI+SFT.SFTable]	; point at table
 22421 000036F0 36A1[3C03]              	mov     ax,[SS:PROC_ID]		; SS override
 22422                                  FCBTest:
 22423                                  	;cmp	[es:di+31h],ax
 22424 000036F4 26394531                	cmp	[es:di+SF_ENTRY.sf_PID],ax ; is this one of ours
 22425 000036F8 7503                    	jnz	short FCBNext		; no, skip it
 22426                                  
 22427                                  ; 03/02/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0
 22428                                  %if 0
 22429                                  	mov	word [es:di],0
 22430                                  	;mov	word [es:di+SF_ENTRY.sf_ref_count],0 ; yes, blast ref count
 22431                                  %else
 22432                                  	; 03/02/2024
 22433                                  	; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM
 22434 000036FA E8E711                  	call    SFT_FREE
 22435                                  %endif
 22436                                  
 22437                                  FCBNext:
 22438 000036FD 83C73B                  	add     di,SF_ENTRY.size ; 59 (for MSDOS 6.0)
 22439 00003700 E2F2                    	loop    FCBTest
 22440                                  FCBScanDone:
 22441                                  
 22442                                  ; Walk the SFT to eliminate all busy SFT's for this process.
 22443                                  
 22444 00003702 31DB                    	XOR     BX,BX
 22445                                  Scan:
 22446 00003704 53                      	push    bx
 22447 00003705 E88E39                  	call	SFFromSFN
 22448 00003708 5B                      	pop     bx
 22449                                  	;jnc	short Scan1
 22450                                  	;retn
 22451                                  
 22452                                  	; 18/12/2022
 22453                                  	;jc	short NO_Question ; retn
 22454                                  	; 03/02/2024
 22455 00003709 7232                    	jc	short RET2
 22456                                  
 22457                                  ;M038
 22458                                  ; Do what the comment above says, check for busy state
 22459                                  
 22460                                  Scan1:
 22461                                  	;cmp	word [es:di],0
 22462                                  	;jz	short scan_next  ; MSDOS 3.3
 22463                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 22464 0000370B 26833DFF                	cmp	word [es:di],sf_busy ; -1
 22465                                  	;cmp	word [es:di+SF_ENTRY.sf_ref_count],sf_busy
 22466                                  				; Is Sft busy? ;M038
 22467 0000370F 7517                    	jnz	short scan_next ; no
 22468                                  ;
 22469                                  ; we have a SFT that is busy. See if it is for the current process
 22470                                  ;
 22471 00003711 36A1[3C03]              	mov     ax,[SS:PROC_ID]		; SS override
 22472                                  	;cmp	[es:di+31h],ax
 22473 00003715 26394531                	cmp	[es:di+SF_ENTRY.sf_PID],ax
 22474 00003719 750D                    	jnz	short scan_next
 22475 0000371B 36A1[3E03]              	mov     ax,[SS:USER_ID]		; SS override
 22476                                  	;sub	ax,[es:di+2Fh] ; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM ; 03/02/2024
 22477                                  	;cmp	[es:di+2Fh],ax
 22478 0000371F 2639452F                	cmp	[es:di+SF_ENTRY.sf_UID],ax
 22479 00003723 7503                    	jnz	short scan_next
 22480                                  
 22481                                  ; This SFT is labelled as ours.
 22482                                  
 22483                                  ; 03/02/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0
 22484                                  %if 0
 22485                                  	mov	word [es:di],0
 22486                                  	;mov	word [es:di+SF_ENTRY.sf_ref_count],0
 22487                                  %else
 22488                                  	; 03/02/2024
 22489                                  	; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM
 22490 00003725 E8BC11                  	call    SFT_FREE
 22491                                  %endif
 22492                                  
 22493                                  scan_next:
 22494 00003728 43                      	inc     bx
 22495 00003729 EBD9                    	jmp     short Scan
 22496                                  
 22497                                  ;============================================================================
 22498                                  ; CLOSE.ASM, MSDOS 6.0, 1991
 22499                                  ;============================================================================
 22500                                  ; 23/07/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 22501                                  ; 18/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 22502                                  
 22503                                  ;**	Internal Close and Commit calls to close a local or NET SFT.
 22504                                  ;
 22505                                  ;	DOS_CLOSE
 22506                                  ;	DOS_COMMIT
 22507                                  ;	FREE_SFT
 22508                                  ;	SetSFTTimes
 22509                                  ;
 22510                                  ;	Revision history:
 22511                                  ;
 22512                                  ;	   AN000  version 4.00	Jan. 1988
 22513                                  ;	   A005   PTM 3718 --- lost clusters when fastopen installed
 22514                                  ;	   A011   PTM 4766 --- C2 fastopen problem
 22515                                  
 22516                                  ;Installed = TRUE
 22517                                  
 22518                                  ;Break <DOS_CLOSE -- CLOSE FILE from SFT>
 22519                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 22520                                  ;
 22521                                  ; Procedure Name : DOS_CLOSE
 22522                                  ;
 22523                                  ; Inputs:
 22524                                  ;	[THISSFT] set to the SFT for the file being used
 22525                                  ; Function:
 22526                                  ;	Close the indicated file via the SFT
 22527                                  ; Returns:
 22528                                  ;	sf_ref_count decremented otherwise
 22529                                  ;	ES:DI point to SFT
 22530                                  ;	Carry set if error
 22531                                  ;	    AX has error code
 22532                                  ; DS preserved, others destroyed
 22533                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 22534                                  
 22535                                  ;hkn; DOS_CLOSE called from fcbio.asm and handle.asm. DS alreday set up.
 22536                                  
 22537                                  ; 18/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 22538                                  ; DOSCODE:6E2Eh (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
 22539                                  
 22540                                  ; 14/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 22541                                  ; DOSCODE:6E1Ah (MSDOS 5.0, MSDOS.SYS)
 22542                                  
 22543                                  ; 23/07/2018 - IBMDOS.COM (MSDOS 3.3), 1987 - Offset 39D0h
 22544                                  
 22545                                  	; 03/02/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0
 22546                                  	; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM - DOSCODE:76FEh
 22547                                  	; (Win ME IO.SYS - BIOSCODE:7579h) 
 22548                                  
 22549                                  DOS_CLOSE:
 22550 0000372B C43E[9E05]              	LES	DI,[THISSFT]
 22551                                  	;mov	bx,[ES:DI+5]
 22552 0000372F 268B5D05                	MOV	BX,[ES:DI+SF_ENTRY.sf_flags]
 22553                                  
 22554                                  ; Network closes are handled entirely by the net code.
 22555                                  
 22556                                  	;;test	bx,8000h
 22557                                  	;TEST	BX,sf_isnet
 22558                                  	; 17/12/2022
 22559                                  	;test	bh,80h
 22560 00003733 F6C780                  	test	bh,(sf_isnet>>8)
 22561 00003736 7406                    	JZ	short LocalClose
 22562                                  
 22563                                  	;CallInstall Net_Close,MultNET,6
 22564 00003738 B80611                  	mov     ax,1106h
 22565 0000373B CD2F                    	int     2Fh	; Multiplex - NETWORK REDIRECTOR - CLOSE REMOTE FILE
 22566                                  			; ES:DI -> SFT
 22567                                  			; SFT DPB field -> DPB of drive containing file
 22568                                  			; Return: CF set on error, AX = DOS error code
 22569                                  			; CF clear if successful
 22570                                  RET2:		; 03/02/2024
 22571 0000373D C3                      	retn
 22572                                  
 22573                                  ; All closes release the sharing information.
 22574                                  ; No commit releases sharing information
 22575                                  ;
 22576                                  ; All closes decrement the ref count.
 22577                                  ; No commit decrements the ref count.
 22578                                  
 22579                                  LocalClose:
 22580 0000373E E8A8E1                  	call	ECritDisk
 22581 00003741 E8C901                  	CALL	SetSFTTimes
 22582 00003744 E84C01                  	CALL	FREE_SFT		; dec ref count or mark as busy
 22583                                  
 22584                                  ;hkn; SS is DOSDATA
 22585                                  	;Context DS
 22586 00003747 16                      	push	ss
 22587 00003748 1F                      	pop	ds
 22588                                  
 22589 00003749 50                      	push	ax
 22590 0000374A 53                      	push	bx
 22591 0000374B E82F46                  	call	ShareEnd
 22592 0000374E 5B                      	pop	bx
 22593 0000374F 58                      	pop	ax
 22594                                  
 22595                                  ; Commit enters here. AX from commit MUST be <> 1, BX is flags word
 22596                                  
 22597                                  CloseEntry:
 22598 00003750 50                      	PUSH	AX
 22599                                  
 22600                                  ; File clean or device does not get stamped nor disk looked at.
 22601                                  
 22602                                  	;test	bx,0C0h
 22603                                  	; 17/12/2022
 22604 00003751 F6C3C0                  	test	bl,devid_file_clean+devid_device
 22605                                  	;TEST	BX,devid_file_clean+devid_device
 22606 00003754 7403                    	JZ	short rdir
 22607                                  	; 14/11/2022
 22608 00003756 E90101                  	JMP	FREE_SFT_OK		; either clean or device
 22609                                  	;jnz	short FREE_SFT_OK ; 24/07/2019	
 22610                                  
 22611                                  ; Retrieve the directory entry for the file
 22612                                  
 22613                                  rdir:
 22614 00003759 E84401                  	CALL	DirFromSFT
 22615                                  	;mov	al,5
 22616 0000375C B005                    	MOV	AL,error_access_denied
 22617                                  	
 22618                                  	; 03/02/2024
 22619                                  	;JNC	short clook
 22620                                  	;; 14/11/2022
 22621                                  	;JMP	CloseFinish		; pretend the close worked.
 22622                                  	;;jc	short CloseFinish ; 24/07/2019
 22623                                  	
 22624                                  	;;;
 22625                                  	; 03/02/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0
 22626                                  	; (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 22627 0000375E 7240                    	jc	short jmp_to_CloseFinish ; pretend the close worked.
 22628                                  rdir2:
 22629                                  	;test	word [si+2],4
 22630 00003760 F6440204                	test	byte [si+SF_ENTRY.sf_mode],4 ; devid_device_null
 22631                                  					; bit 2 - null device
 22632 00003764 751F                    	jnz	short clook
 22633                                  
 22634 00003766 1E                      	push	ds
 22635 00003767 53                      	push	bx
 22636 00003768 C55C07                  	lds	bx,[si+7]
 22637 0000376B C55C07                  	lds	bx,[si+SF_ENTRY.sf_devptr] ; pointer to DPB
 22638                                  
 22639 0000376E 8A1F                    	mov	bl,[bx]			; DPB.DRIVE
 22640 00003770 30FF                    	xor	bh,bh  ; 0
 22641 00003772 36F687[2F14]04          	test	byte [ss:bx+drive_flags],4
 22642                                  					; bit 2 - last access date/time flag?
 22643                                  					; or disk accessed flag !?
 22644 00003778 5B                       	pop	bx
 22645 00003779 7409                    	jz	short skip_upd_laccdt	; no support for last access date&time
 22646 0000377B 1F                      	pop	ds
 22647 0000377C 1E                      	push	ds
 22648 0000377D E8E2D3                  	call	DATE16
 22649                                  	;mov	[es:di+12h],ax
 22650 00003780 26894512                	mov	[es:di+dir_entry.dir_lstaccdate],ax
 22651                                  skip_upd_laccdt:
 22652 00003784 1F                      	pop	ds
 22653                                  	;;;
 22654                                  
 22655                                  clook:
 22656                                  
 22657                                  ; ES:DI points to entry
 22658                                  ; DS:SI points to SFT
 22659                                  ; ES:BX points to buffer header
 22660                                  
 22661 00003785 57                      	push	di
 22662 00003786 56                      	push	si
 22663                                  	;lea	si,[si+20h]
 22664 00003787 8D7420                  	LEA	SI,[SI+SF_ENTRY.sf_name]
 22665                                  
 22666                                  ; ES:DI point to directory entry
 22667                                  ; DS:SI point to unpacked name
 22668                                  
 22669 0000378A E84EE0                  	call	XCHGP
 22670

 22672                                  ; DS:SI point to directory entry
 22673                                  
 22674 0000378D E81D0F                  	call	MetaCompare
 22675 00003790 E848E0                  	call	XCHGP
 22676 00003793 5E                      	pop	si
 22677 00003794 5F                      	pop	di
 22678 00003795 740C                    	JZ	short CLOSE_GO		; Name OK
 22679                                  Bye:	
 22680 00003797 89F7                    	MOV	DI,SI
 22681 00003799 1E                      	PUSH	DS
 22682 0000379A 07                      	POP	ES			; ES:DI points to SFT
 22683 0000379B 16                      	PUSH	SS
 22684 0000379C 1F                      	POP	DS
 22685 0000379D F9                      	STC
 22686                                  	;mov	al,2
 22687 0000379E B002                    	MOV	AL,error_file_not_found
 22688                                  	
 22689                                  jmp_to_CloseFinish: ; 03/02/2024
 22690                                  	;JMP	CloseFinish ; 24/07/2019
 22691                                  	; 03/02/2024

 22693 000037A0 E9DF00                  	jmp	CloseFinish2
 22694

 22696                                  CLOSE_GO:
 22697                                  	; 03/02/2024
