 31973                                  ; 20/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 31974                                  ; DOSCODE:8DC2h (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
 31975                                  
 31976                                  ; 30/07/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 31977                                  ; IBMDOS.COM (MSDOS 3.3, 1987) - Offset 
 31978                                  
 31979                                  ;Break   <ALLOCATE -- Assign disk space>
 31980                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31981                                  ;
 31982                                  ; Procedure Name : ALLOCATE - Allocate Disk Space
 31983                                  ;
 31984                                  ;   ALLOCATE is called to allocate disk clusters. The new clusters are
 31985                                  ;   FAT-chained onto the end of the existing file.
 31986                                  ;
 31987                                  ;   The DPB contains the cluster # of the last free cluster allocated
 31988                                  ;   (dpb_next_free). We start at this cluster and scan towards higher
 31989                                  ;   numbered clusters, looking for the necessary free blocks.
 31990                                  ;
 31991                                  ;   Once again, fancy terminology gets in the way of correct coding. When
 31992                                  ;   using next_free, start scanning AT THAT POINT and not the one following it.
 31993                                  ;   This fixes the boundary condition bug when only free = next_free = 2.
 31994                                  ;
 31995                                  ;       If we get to the end of the disk without satisfaction:
 31996                                  ;
 31997                                  ;           if (dpb_next_free == 2) then we've scanned the whole disk.
 31998                                  ;               return (insufficient_disk_space)
 31999                                  ;           ELSE
 32000                                  ;               dpb_next_free = 2; start scan over from the beginning.
 32001                                  ;
 32002                                  ;   Note that there is no multitasking interlock. There is no race when
 32003                                  ;   examining the entrys in an in-core FAT block since there will be no
 32004                                  ;   context switch. When UNPACK context switches while waiting for a FAT read
 32005                                  ;   we are done with any in-core FAT blocks, so again there is no race. The
 32006                                  ;   only special concern is that V2 and V3 MSDOS left the last allocated
 32007                                  ;   cluster as "00"; marking it EOF only when the entire alloc request was
 32008                                  ;   satisfied. We can't allow another activation to think this cluster is
 32009                                  ;   free, so we give it a special temporary mark to show that it is, indeed,
 32010                                  ;   allocated.
 32011                                  ;
 32012                                  ;   Note that when we run out of space this algorithem will scan from
 32013                                  ;   dpb_next_free to the end, then scan from cluster 2 through the end,
 32014                                  ;   redundantly scanning the later part of the disk. This only happens when
 32015                                  ;   we run out of space, so sue me.
 32016                                  ;
 32017                                  ;----+----+----+----+----+----+----+----+----+----+----+----+----+----+----;
 32018                                  ;            C  A  V  E  A  T     P  A  T  T  E  R  S  O  N                ;
 32019                                  ;                                                                          ;
 32020                                  ;   The use of FATBYT and RESTFATBYT is somewhat mysterious. Here is the
 32021                                  ;   explanation:
 32022                                  ;
 32023                                  ;   In the NUL file case (sf_firclus currently 0) ALLOCATE is called with
 32024                                  ;   entry BX = 0. What needs to be done in this case is to stuff the cluster
 32025                                  ;   number of the first cluster allocated in sf_firclus when the ALLOCATE is
 32026                                  ;   complete. THIS VALUE IS SAVED TEMPORARILY IN CLUSTER 0, HENCE THE CURRENT
 32027                                  ;   VALUE IN CLUSTER 0 MUST BE SAVED AND RESTORED. This is a side effect of
 32028                                  ;   the fact that PACK and UNPACK don't treat requests for clusters 0 and 1 as
 32029                                  ;   errors. This "stuff" is done by the call to PACK which is right before
 32030                                  ;   the
 32031                                  ;           LOOP   findfre         ; alloc more if needed
 32032                                  ;   instruction when the first cluster is allocated to the nul file. The
 32033                                  ;   value is recalled from cluster 0 and stored at sf_firclus at ads4:
 32034                                  ;
 32035                                  ;   This method is obviously useless (because it is non-reentrant) for
 32036                                  ;   multitasking, and will have to be changed. Storing the required value on
 32037                                  ;   the stack is recommended. Setting sf_firclus at the PACK of cluster 0
 32038                                  ;   (instead of actually doing the PACK) is BAD because it doesn't handle
 32039                                  ;   problems with INT 24 well.
 32040                                  ;
 32041                                  ;            C  A  V  E  A  T     P  A  T  T  E  R  S  O  N                ;
 32042                                  ;----+----+----+----+----+----+----+----+----+----+----+----+----+----+----;
 32043                                  ;                                                                          ;
 32044                                  ;       ENTRY   BX = Last cluster of file (0 if null file)
 32045                                  ;               CX = No. of clusters to allocate
 32046                                  ;               ES:BP = Base of drive parameters
 32047                                  ;               [THISSFT] = Points to SFT
 32048                                  ;
 32049                                  ;       EXIT    'C' set if insufficient space
 32050                                  ;                 [FAILERR] can be tested to see the reason for failure
 32051                                  ;                 CX = max. no. of clusters that could be added to file
 32052                                  ;               'C' clear if space allocated
 32053                                  ;                 BX = First cluster allocated
 32054                                  ;                 FAT is fully updated
 32055                                  ;                 sf_FIRCLUS field of SFT set if file was null
 32056                                  ;
 32057                                  ;       USES    ALL but SI, BP
 32058                                  
 32059                                  ;callmagic  proc near
 32060                                  ;       push    ds                             ;push segment of routine 
 32061                                  ;       push    Offset MagicPatch              ;push offset for routine
 32062                                  ;       retf                                   ;simulate jmp far
 32063                                  ;                                              ;far return address is on
 32064                                  ;                                              ;stack, so far return from
 32065                                  ;                                              ;call will return this routine
 32066                                  ;callmagic  endp
 32067                                  
 32068                                  
 32069                                  ; 25/09/2023
 32070                                  %if 0
 32071                                  callmagic:
 32072                                  	push	ds
 32073                                  	push	MagicPatch
 32074                                  	retf	
 32075                                  %endif
 32076                                  
 32077                                  ALLOCATE:
 32078                                  	; 10/09/2018
 32079                                  ;BEGIN MAGICDRV MODIFICATIONS
 32080                                  ;
 32081                                  ;7/5/92 scottq
 32082                                  ;
 32083                                  ;This is the disk compression patch location which allows
 32084                                  ;the disk compression software to fail allocations if the
 32085                                  ;FAT would allows allocation, but the free space for compressed
 32086                                  ;data would not.
 32087                                  ;        
 32088                                  ;;;	call    far ptr MAGICPATCH
 32089                                  ;;; We cannot do a far call since we cannot have fix-ups[romdos,hidos],
 32090                                  ;;; but we do know the segment and offset of the routine
 32091                                  ;;; so simulate a far call to dosdata:magicpatch
 32092                                  ;;; note dosassume above, so DS -> dosdata
 32093                                  
 32094                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 32095                                          ;clc				;clear carry so we fall through
 32096                                  	;				;if no patch is present
 32097                                  	;push	cs			;push segment for far return
 32098                                          ;call	callmagic		;this is a near call
 32099                                          ;jnc	short Regular_Allocate_Path
 32100                                  	;jmp	Disk_Full_Return
 32101                                  
 32102                                  ; 25/09/2023
 32103                                  %if 0
 32104                                  	clc
 32105                                  	push	cs
 32106                                  	call	callmagic
 32107                                  	jnc	short Regular_Allocate_Path
 32108                                  	jmp	Disk_Full_Return
 32109                                  Regular_Allocate_Path:
 32110                                  %endif
 32111                                  
 32112                                  	; 20/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 32113                                  ;END MAGICDRV MODIFICATIONS
 32114                                  
 32115                                  	; 25/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 32116                                  	; DOSCODE:8D87h (MSDOS 5.0, MSDOS.SYS)
 32117                                  
 32118 000057E7 53                              PUSH    BX                      ; save (bx)
 32119 000057E8 31DB                            XOR     BX,BX
 32120 000057EA E82407                  	call	UNPACK
 32121 000057ED 893E[9605]                      MOV     [FATBYT],DI             ; save correct cluster 0 value
 32122 000057F1 5B                              POP     BX
 32123 000057F2 72F2                            jc	short figrec_retn	; abort if error   [INTERR?]
 32124                                  
 32125 000057F4 51                              PUSH    CX
 32126 000057F5 53                              PUSH    BX
 32127                                  
 32128 000057F6 89DA                            MOV     DX,BX
 32129                                  	;;mov	bx,[es:bp+1Ch]  ; MSDOS 3.3
 32130                                  	;mov	bx,[es:bp+1Dh]	; MSDOS 6.0
 32131 000057F8 268B5E1D                        mov     bx,[ES:BP+DPB.NEXT_FREE]
 32132 000057FC 83FB02                          cmp     bx,2
 32133 000057FF 7709                            ja	short FINDFRE
 32134                                  
 32135                                  ;   couldn't find enough free space beyond dpb_next_free, or dpb_next_free is
 32136                                  ;   <2 or >dpb_max_clus. Reset it and restart the scan
 32137                                  
 32138                                  ads1:
 32139                                  	;;mov	word [es:bp+1Ch],2 ; MSDOS 3.3
 32140                                  	;mov	word [es:bp+1Dh],2 ; MSDOS 6.0
 32141 00005801 26C7461D0200                    mov     word [ES:BP+DPB.NEXT_FREE],2
 32142 00005807 BB0100                          mov     bx,1                    ; Counter next instruction so first
 32143                                                                          ;       cluster examined is 2
 32144                                  
 32145                                  ;   Scanning both forwards and backwards for a free cluster
 32146                                  ;
 32147                                  ;       (BX) = forwards scan pointer
 32148                                  ;       (CX) = clusters remaining to be allocated
 32149                                  ;       (DX) = current last cluster in file
 32150                                  ;       (TOS) = last cluster of file
 32151                                  
 32152                                  FINDFRE:
 32153 0000580A 43                              INC     BX
 32154                                  	;cmp	bx,[es:bp+0Dh]
 32155 0000580B 263B5E0D                        CMP	BX,[ES:BP+DPB.MAX_CLUSTER]
 32156 0000580F 7757                    	ja	short ads7	; at end of disk
 32157 00005811 E8FD06                          call	UNPACK          ; check out this cluster
 32158 00005814 722F                            jc	short ads4	; FAT error             [INTERR?]
 32159 00005816 75F2                            jnz	short FINDFRE	; not free, keep on truckin
 32160                                  
 32161                                  ;   Have found a free cluster. Chain it to the file
 32162                                  ;
 32163                                  ;       (BX) = found free cluster #
 32164                                  ;       (DX) = current last cluster in file
 32165                                  
 32166                                  	;;mov	[es:bp+1Ch],bx
 32167                                  	;mov	[es:bp+1Dh],bx ; MSDOS 6.0
 32168 00005818 26895E1D                        mov	[ES:BP+DPB.NEXT_FREE],bx ; next time start search here
 32169 0000581C 92                              xchg    ax,dx           ; save (dx) in ax
 32170 0000581D BA0100                          mov     dx,1            ; mark this free guy as "1"
 32171 00005820 E84207                  	call	PACK            ; set special "temporary" mark
 32172 00005823 7220                            jc	short ads4	; FAT error             [INTERR?]
 32173                                  	;;cmp	word [es:bp+1Eh],-1
 32174                                          ;cmp	word [es:bp+1Fh],-1 ; MSDOS 6.0
 32175 00005825 26837E1FFF              	CMP	word [ES:BP+DPB.FREE_CNT],-1 ; Free count valid?
 32176 0000582A 7404                            JZ	short NO_ALLOC	; No
 32177                                  	;;dec	word [es:bp+1Eh]
 32178                                          ;dec	word [es:bp+1Fh] ; MSDOS 6.0
 32179 0000582C 26FF4E1F                        DEC     word [ES:BP+DPB.FREE_CNT] ; Reduce free count by 1
 32180                                  NO_ALLOC:
 32181 00005830 92                              xchg    ax,dx           ; (dx) = current last cluster in file
 32182 00005831 87DA                            XCHG    BX,DX
 32183 00005833 89D0                            MOV     AX,DX
 32184 00005835 E82D07                  	call	PACK            ; link free cluster onto file
 32185                                                                  ;  CAVEAT.. On Nul file, first pass stuffs
 32186                                                                  ;    cluster 0 with FIRCLUS value.
 32187 00005838 720B                            jc	short ads4	; FAT error [INTERR?]
 32188 0000583A 93                              xchg    BX,AX           ; (BX) = last one we looked at
 32189 0000583B 89DA                            mov     dx,bx           ; (dx) = current end of file
 32190 0000583D E2CB                            LOOP    FINDFRE         ; alloc more if needed
 32191                                  
 32192                                  ;   We've successfully extended the file. Clean up and exit
 32193                                  ;
 32194                                  ;       (BX) = last cluster in file
 32195                                  
 32196 0000583F BAFFFF                          MOV     DX,0FFFFH
 32197 00005842 E82007                  	call	PACK            ; mark last cluster EOF
 32198                                  
 32199                                  ;   Note that FAT errors jump here to clean the stack and exit. This saves us
 32200                                  ;   2 whole bytes. Hope its worth it...
 32201                                  ;
 32202                                  ;       'C' set if error
 32203                                  ;       calling (BX) and (CX) pushed on stack
 32204                                  
 32205                                  ads4:   
 32206 00005845 5B                      	POP     BX
 32207 00005846 59                              POP     CX              ; Don't need this stuff since we're successful
 32208 00005847 729D                            jc	short figrec_retn
 32209 00005849 E8C506                          call	UNPACK          ; Get first cluster allocated for return
 32210                                                                  ; CAVEAT... In nul file case, UNPACKs cluster 0.
 32211 0000584C 7298                            jc	short figrec_retn
 32212 0000584E E83200                  	call	RESTFATBYT      ; Restore correct cluster 0 value
 32213 00005851 7293                            jc	short figrec_retn
 32214 00005853 87DF                            XCHG    BX,DI           ; (DI) = last cluster in file upon our entry
 32215 00005855 09FF                            OR      DI,DI           ; clear 'C'
 32216 00005857 758D                    	jnz	short figrec_retn ; we were extending an existing file
 32217                                  
 32218                                  ;   We were doing the first allocation for a new file. Update the SFT cluster
 32219                                  ;   info
 32220                                  dofastk:
 32221                                  	; 20/05/2019
 32222                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 32223                                  	;push	dx ; * MSDOS 6.0
 32224                                  	;;mov	dl,[es:bp+0]
 32225                                  	;;MOV	DL,[ES:BP+DPB.DRIVE]	; get drive #
 32226                                  	;mov	dl,[es:bp]
 32227                                  
 32228                                  	; 25/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS compatibility)
 32229                                  	; DOSCODE:8DF9h (MSDOS 5.0, MSDOS.SYS)
 32230                                  	
 32231                                  	; 16/12/2022
 32232                                  	;push	dx ; *
 32233                                  	;mov	dl,[ES:BP+DPB.DRIVE] 
 32234                                  	; 15/12/2022
 32235                                  	;mov	dl,[es:bp]
 32236                                  	
 32237                                  	; MSDOS 3.3 & MSDOS 6.0
 32238 00005859 06                      	PUSH	ES
 32239 0000585A C43E[9E05]              	LES     DI,[THISSFT]
 32240                                  	;mov	[es:di+0Bh],bx
 32241 0000585E 26895D0B                	MOV     [ES:DI+SF_ENTRY.sf_firclus],BX
 32242                                  	;;mov	[es:di+1Bh],bx ; MSDOS 3.3
 32243                                  	;mov	[es:di+35h],bx ; MSDOS 6.0
 32244 00005862 26895D35                	MOV     [ES:DI+SF_ENTRY.sf_lstclus],BX
 32245 00005866 07                      	POP	ES
 32246                                  	;retn
 32247                                  
 32248                                  	;pop	dx ; * MSDOS 6.0
 32249                                  
 32250                                  	; 16/12/2022
 32251                                  	; 25/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS compatibility)
 32252                                  	;pop	dx ; *
 32253                                  
 32254 00005867 C3                      	retn	
 32255                                  
 32256                                  ;** we're at the end of the disk, and not satisfied. See if we've scanned ALL
 32257                                  ;   of the disk...
 32258                                  
 32259                                  ads7:   
 32260 00005868 26837E1D02              	cmp	word [ES:BP+DPB.NEXT_FREE],2
 32261 0000586D 7592                    	jnz	short ads1	; start scan from front of disk
 32262                                  
 32263                                  ;   Sorry, we've gone over the whole disk, with insufficient luck. Lets give
 32264                                  ;   the space back to the free list and tell the caller how much he could have
 32265                                  ;   had.  We have to make sure we remove the "special mark" we put on the last
 32266                                  ;   cluster we were able to allocate, so it doesn't become orphaned.
 32267                                  ;
 32268                                  ;       (CX) = clusters remaining to be allocated
 32269                                  ;       (TOS) = last cluster of file (before call to ALLOCATE)
 32270                                  ;       (TOS+1) = # of clusters wanted to allocate
 32271                                  
 32272 0000586F 5B                              POP     BX              ; (BX) = last cluster of file
 32273 00005870 BAFFFF                          MOV     DX,0FFFFH
 32274 00005873 E81F00                  	call	RELBLKS         ; give back any clusters just alloced
 32275 00005876 58                              POP     AX              ; No. of clusters requested
 32276                                                                  ; Don't "retc". We are setting Carry anyway,
 32277                                                                  ;   Alloc failed, so proceed with return CX
 32278                                                                  ;   setup.
 32279 00005877 29C8                            SUB     AX,CX           ; AX=No. of clusters allocated
 32280 00005879 E80700                  	call	RESTFATBYT      ; Don't "retc". We are setting Carry anyway,
 32281                                                                  ;   Alloc failed.
 32282                                  Disk_Full_Return:               ;label added for magic patch 8-6-92 scottq
 32283                                          ; MSDOS 6.0
 32284 0000587C C606[0B06]01            	MOV	byte [DISK_FULL],1 ;MS. indicating disk full
 32285 00005881 F9                              STC
 32286 00005882 C3                              retn
 32287                                  
 32288                                  ;-----------------------------------------------------------------------
 32289                                  ;
 32290                                  ; Procedure Name : RESTFATBYT
 32291                                  ;
 32292                                  ; SEE ALLOCATE CAVEAT
 32293                                  ;       Carry set if error (currently user FAILed to I 24)
 32294                                  ;-----------------------------------------------------------------------
 32295                                  
 32296                                  RESTFATBYT:
 32297 00005883 53                              PUSH    BX
 32298 00005884 52                              PUSH    DX
 32299 00005885 57                              PUSH    DI
 32300 00005886 31DB                            XOR     BX,BX
 32301 00005888 8B16[9605]                      MOV     DX,[FATBYT]
 32302 0000588C E8D606                  	call	PACK
 32303 0000588F 5F                              POP     DI
 32304 00005890 5A                              POP     DX
 32305 00005891 5B                              POP     BX
 32306                                  ; 16/12/2022
 32307                                  ; 25/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS compatibility)
 32308                                  ;RELEASE_flush:
 32309 00005892 C3                      	retn
 32310                                  
 32311                                  ;Break	<RELEASE -- DEASSIGN DISK SPACE>
 32312                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 32313                                  ;
 32314                                  ; Procedure Name : RELEASE
 32315                                  ;
 32316                                  ; Inputs:
 32317                                  ;       BX = Cluster in file
 32318                                  ;       ES:BP = Base of drive parameters
 32319                                  ; Function:
 32320                                  ;       Frees cluster chain starting with [BX]
 32321                                  ;       Carry set if error (currently user FAILed to I 24)
 32322                                  ; AX,BX,DX,DI all destroyed. Other registers unchanged.
 32323                                  ;
 32324                                  ;-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 32325                                  
 32326                                  	; 25/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 32327                                  	; 20/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 32328                                  RELEASE:
 32329 00005893 31D2                            XOR     DX,DX
 32330                                  
 32331                                  	;entry	RELBLKS
 32332                                  RELBLKS:
 32333                                  
 32334                                  ;   Enter here with DX=0FFFFH to put an end-of-file mark in the first cluster
 32335                                  ;   and free the rest in the chain.
 32336                                  
 32337 00005895 E87906                  	call	UNPACK
 32338 00005898 7224                    	jc	short RELEASE_flush
 32339 0000589A 7422                    	jz	short RELEASE_flush
 32340 0000589C 89F8                            MOV     AX,DI
 32341 0000589E 52                              PUSH    DX
 32342 0000589F E8C306                  	call	PACK
 32343 000058A2 5A                              POP     DX
 32344 000058A3 7219                    	jc	short RELEASE_flush
 32345 000058A5 09D2                            OR      DX,DX
 32346 000058A7 750B                            JNZ	short NO_DEALLOC	; Was putting EOF mark
 32347                                  	;;cmp	word [es:bp+1Eh],-1 ; MSDOS 3.3
 32348                                  	;cmp	word [es:bp+1Fh],-1 ; MSDOS 6.0
 32349 000058A9 26837E1FFF              	CMP     word [ES:BP+DPB.FREE_CNT],-1 ; Free count valid?
 32350 000058AE 7404                            JZ	short NO_DEALLOC	; No
 32351 000058B0 26FF461F                        INC	word [ES:BP+DPB.FREE_CNT] ; Increase free count by 1
 32352                                  NO_DEALLOC:
 32353 000058B4 89C3                            MOV     BX,AX
 32354 000058B6 48                              dec     ax              ; check for "1"
 32355 000058B7 7405                    	jz	short RELEASE_flush	; is last cluster of incomplete chain
 32356 000058B9 E83E06                  	call	IsEOF
 32357 000058BC 72D5                            JB	short RELEASE	; Carry clear if JMP not taken
 32358                                  
 32359                                  	; 16/12/2022
 32360                                  ; 25/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS compatibility)
 32361                                  ;%if 0
 32362                                  RELEASE_flush:
 32363                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 32364 000058BE 268A4600                	mov	al,[es:bp]
 32365                                  	;MOV	AL,[ES:BP+DPB.DRIVE]
 32366 000058C2 56                      	push	si		; FLUSHBUF may trash these and we guarantee
 32367 000058C3 51                      	push	cx		;  them to be preserved.
 32368 000058C4 06                      	push	es
 32369 000058C5 55                      	push	bp
 32370 000058C6 E8850B                  	call	FLUSHBUF	; commit buffers for this drive
 32371 000058C9 5D                      	pop	bp
 32372 000058CA 07                      	pop	es
 32373 000058CB 59                      	pop	cx
 32374 000058CC 5E                      	pop	si
 32375                                  ;%endif
 32376                                  RET12:
 32377 000058CD C3                      	retn
 32378                                  
 32379                                  ;Break	<GETEOF -- Find the end of a file>
 32380                                  ;------------------------------------------------------------------------
 32381                                  ;
 32382                                  ; Procedure Name : GETEOF
 32383                                  ;
 32384                                  ; Inputs:
 32385                                  ;       ES:BP Points to DPB
 32386                                  ;       BX = Cluster in a file
 32387                                  ;       DS = CS
 32388                                  ; Outputs:
 32389                                  ;       BX = Last cluster in the file
 32390                                  ;       Carry set if error (currently user FAILed to I 24)
 32391                                  ; DI destroyed. No other registers affected.
 32392                                  ;
 32393                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 32394                                  
 32395                                  GETEOF:
 32396 000058CE E84006                  	call	UNPACK
 32397 000058D1 72FA                            jc	short RET12
 32398 000058D3 53                              PUSH    BX
 32399 000058D4 89FB                            MOV     BX,DI
 32400 000058D6 E82106                  	call	IsEOF
 32401 000058D9 5B                              POP     BX
 32402 000058DA 73F1                            JAE     short RET12
 32403 000058DC 89FB                            MOV     BX,DI
 32404 000058DE EBEE                            JMP     short GETEOF
 32405

 32412                                  ;	TITLE	FCB - FCB parse calls for MSDOS
 32413                                  ;	NAME	FCB
 32414                                  
 32415                                  ;**	FCB.ASM - Low level routines for parsing names into FCBs and analyzing
 32416                                  ;		  filename characters
 32417                                  ;
 32418                                  ;	MakeFcb
 32419                                  ;	NameTrans
 32420                                  ;	PATHCHRCMP
 32421                                  ;	GetLet
 32422                                  ;	UCase
 32423                                  ;	GetLet3
 32424                                  ;	GetCharType
 32425                                  ;	TESTKANJ
 32426                                  ;	NORMSCAN
 32427                                  ;	DELIM
 32428                                  ;
 32429                                  ;	Revision history:
 32430                                  ;
 32431                                  ;		A000  version 4.00  Jan. 1988
 32432                                  ;	
 32433                                  ;	M048 - access FILE_UCASE_TAB using DS rather than SS.
 32434                                  
 32435                                  TableLook	EQU	-1
 32436                                  
 32437                                  SCANSEPARATOR	EQU	1
 32438                                  DRVBIT		EQU	2
 32439                                  NAMBIT		EQU	4
 32440                                  EXTBIT		EQU	8
 32441                                  
 32442                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 32443                                  ;
 32444                                  ; Procedure : MakeFcb
 32445                                  ;
 32446                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 32447                                  
 32448                                  	; 25/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 32449                                  	; DOSCODE:8E77h (MSDOS 5.0, MSDOS.SYS)
 32450                                  MAKEFCB:
 32451                                  ;hkn; SS override
 32452 000058E0 36C606[4E03]00          	MOV	BYTE [SS:SpaceFlag],0
 32453 000058E6 30D2                    	XOR	DL,DL		; Flag--not ambiguous file name
 32454                                  	;test	al,2
 32455 000058E8 A802                    	test	AL,DRVBIT	; Use current drive field if default?
 32456 000058EA 7504                    	JNZ	short DEFDRV
 32457 000058EC 26C60500                	MOV	BYTE [ES:DI],0	; No - use default drive
 32458                                  DEFDRV:
 32459 000058F0 47                      	INC	DI
 32460 000058F1 B90800                  	MOV	CX,8
 32461                                  	;test	al,4
 32462 000058F4 A804                    	test	AL,NAMBIT	; Use current name fields as default?
 32463 000058F6 93                      	XCHG	AX,BX		; Save bits in BX
 32464 000058F7 B020                    	MOV	AL," "
 32465 000058F9 7404                    	JZ	short FILLB	; If not, go fill with blanks
 32466 000058FB 01CF                    	ADD	DI,CX
 32467 000058FD 31C9                    	XOR	CX,CX		; Don't fill any
 32468                                  FILLB:
 32469 000058FF F3AA                    	REP	STOSB
 32470 00005901 B103                    	MOV	CL,3
 32471 00005903 F6C308                  	test	BL,EXTBIT	; Use current extension as default
 32472 00005906 7404                    	JZ	short FILLB2
 32473 00005908 01CF                    	ADD	DI,CX
 32474 0000590A 31C9                    	XOR	CX,CX
 32475                                  FILLB2:
 32476 0000590C F3AA                    	REP	STOSB
 32477 0000590E 91                      	XCHG	AX,CX		; Put zero in AX
 32478 0000590F AB                      	STOSW
 32479 00005910 AB                      	STOSW			; Initialize two words after to zero
 32480 00005911 83EF10                  	SUB	DI,16		; Point back at start
 32481                                  	;test	bl,1
 32482 00005914 F6C301                  	test	BL,SCANSEPARATOR; Scan off separators if not zero
 32483 00005917 7409                    	JZ	short SKPSPC
 32484 00005919 E88800                  	CALL	SCANB		; Peel off blanks and tabs
 32485 0000591C E82201                  	CALL	DELIM		; Is it a one-time-only delimiter?
 32486 0000591F 7504                    	JNZ	short NOSCAN
 32487 00005921 46                      	INC	SI		; Skip over the delimiter
 32488                                  SKPSPC:
 32489 00005922 E87F00                  	CALL	SCANB		; Always kill preceding blanks and tabs
 32490                                  NOSCAN:
 32491 00005925 E8F000                  	CALL	GETLET
 32492 00005928 761E                    	JBE	short NODRV	; Quit if termination character
 32493 0000592A 803C3A                  	CMP	BYTE [SI],":"	; Check for potential drive specifier
 32494 0000592D 7519                    	JNZ	short NODRV
 32495 0000592F 46                      	INC	SI		; Skip over colon
 32496 00005930 2C40                    	SUB	AL,"@"          ; Convert drive letter to drive number (A=1)
 32497 00005932 760F                    	JBE	short BADDRV	; Drive letter out of range
 32498                                  
 32499 00005934 50                      	PUSH	AX
 32500 00005935 E8501B                  	call	GetVisDrv
 32501 00005938 58                      	POP	AX
 32502 00005939 730A                    	JNC	short HAVDRV
 32503                                  
 32504                                  	; 20/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 32505                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 32506                                  ;hkn; SS override
 32507 0000593B 36803E[1006]1A          	CMP	byte [SS:DrvErr],error_not_DOS_disk ; 1Ah
 32508                                  					; if not FAT drive ;AN000;
 32509 00005941 7402                    	JZ	short HAVDRV		; assume ok	   ;AN000;
 32510                                  BADDRV:
 32511 00005943 B2FF                    	MOV	DL,-1
 32512                                  HAVDRV:
 32513 00005945 AA                      	STOSB			; Put drive specifier in first byte
 32514 00005946 46                      	INC	SI
 32515 00005947 4F                      	DEC	DI		; Counteract next two instructions
 32516                                  NODRV:
 32517 00005948 4E                      	DEC	SI		; Back up
 32518 00005949 47                      	INC	DI		; Skip drive byte
 32519                                  
 32520                                  	;entry	NORMSCAN
 32521                                  NORMSCAN:
 32522 0000594A B90800                  	MOV	CX,8
 32523 0000594D E82200                  	CALL	GETWORD 	; Get 8-letter file name
 32524 00005950 803C2E                  	CMP	BYTE [SI],"."
 32525 00005953 7510                    	JNZ	short NODOT
 32526 00005955 46                      	INC	SI		; Skip over dot if present
 32527                                  
 32528                                  	; 24/09/2023
 32529                                  	;mov	cx,3
 32530 00005956 B103                    	mov	cl,3	; ch=0
 32531                                  
 32532                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 32533                                  ;hkn; SS override
 32534                                  	;TEST	word [SS:DOS34_FLAG],DBCS_VOLID2 ; 100h ;AN000;
 32535                                  	; 10/06/2019
 32536 00005958 36F606[1206]01          	test	byte [SS:DOS34_FLAG+1],(DBCS_VOLID2>>8) ; 1
 32537 0000595E 7402                    	JZ	short VOLOK				;AN000;
 32538 00005960 A4                      	MOVSB			; 2nd byte of DBCS	;AN000;
 32539                                  	; 24/09/2023
 32540                                  	;MOV	CX,2					;AN000;
 32541 00005961 49                      	dec	cx  ; cx=2
 32542                                  	;JMP	SHORT contvol				;AN000;
 32543                                  VOLOK:
 32544                                  	;MOV	CX,3		; Get 3-letter extension
 32545                                  contvol:
 32546 00005962 E81300                  	CALL	MUSTGETWORD
 32547                                  NODOT:
 32548 00005965 88D0                    	MOV	AL,DL
 32549                                  
 32550                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 32551                                  	;and	word [ss:DOS34_FLAG],0FEFFh
 32552                                  	; 18/12/2022
 32553 00005967 368026[1206]FE          	and	byte [ss:DOS34_FLAG+1],0FEh ; (~DBCS_VOLID2)>>8
 32554                                  	;and	word [ss:DOS34_FLAG],~DBCS_VOLID2 ; ### BUG FIX ###
 32555                                  
 32556 0000596D C3                      	retn
 32557                                  
 32558                                  NONAM:
 32559 0000596E 01CF                    	ADD	DI,CX
 32560 00005970 4E                      	DEC	SI
 32561 00005971 C3                      	retn
 32562                                  
 32563                                  GETWORD:
 32564 00005972 E8A300                  	CALL	GETLET		
 32565 00005975 76F7                    	JBE	short NONAM	; Exit if invalid character
 32566 00005977 4E                      	DEC	SI
 32567                                  
 32568                                  ;	UGH!!! Horrible bug here that should be fixed at some point:
 32569                                  ;	If the name we are scanning is longer than CX, we keep on reading!
 32570                                  
 32571                                  MUSTGETWORD:
 32572 00005978 E89D00                  	CALL	GETLET
 32573                                  
 32574                                  ;	If spaceFlag is set then we allow spaces in a pathname
 32575                                  
 32576                                  ;IF NOT TABLELOOK
 32577                                  ;	JB	short FILLNAM  ; MSDOS 3.3
 32578                                  ;ENDIF
 32579 0000597B 750C                    	JNZ	short MustCheckCX
 32580                                  
 32581                                  ;hkn; SS override
 32582 0000597D 36F606[4E03]FF          	test	BYTE [SS:SpaceFlag],0FFh
 32583 00005983 7419                    	JZ	short FILLNAM
 32584 00005985 3C20                    	CMP	AL," "
 32585 00005987 7515                    	JNZ	short FILLNAM
 32586                                  
 32587                                  MustCheckCX:
 32588 00005989 E3ED                    	JCXZ	MUSTGETWORD
 32589 0000598B 49                      	DEC	CX
 32590 0000598C 3C2A                    	CMP	AL,"*"          ; Check for ambiguous file specifier
 32591 0000598E 7504                    	JNZ	short NOSTAR
 32592 00005990 B03F                    	MOV	AL,"?"
 32593 00005992 F3AA                    	REP	STOSB
 32594                                  NOSTAR:
 32595 00005994 AA                      	STOSB
 32596 00005995 3C3F                    	CMP	AL,"?"
 32597 00005997 75DF                    	JNZ	short MUSTGETWORD
 32598 00005999 80CA01                  	OR	DL,1		; Flag ambiguous file name
 32599 0000599C EBDA                    	JMP	short MUSTGETWORD
 32600                                  FILLNAM:
 32601 0000599E B020                    	MOV	AL," "
 32602 000059A0 F3AA                    	REP	STOSB
 32603 000059A2 4E                      	DEC	SI
 32604 000059A3 C3                      	retn
 32605                                  
 32606                                  SCANB:
 32607 000059A4 AC                      	LODSB
 32608 000059A5 E8A100                  	CALL	SPCHK
 32609 000059A8 74FA                    	JZ	short SCANB
 32610 000059AA 4E                      	DEC	SI
 32611                                  scanb_retn:
 32612 000059AB C3                      	retn
 32613                                  
 32614                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 32615                                  ;
 32616                                  ; Procedure Name : NameTrans
 32617                                  ;
 32618                                  ; NameTrans is used by FindPath to scan off an element of a path. We must
 32619                                  ; allow spaces in pathnames
 32620                                  ;
 32621                                  ;   Inputs:	DS:SI points to start of path element
 32622                                  ;   Outputs:	Name1 has unpacked name, uppercased
 32623                                  ;		ES = DOSGroup
 32624                                  ;		DS:SI advanced after name
 32625                                  ;   Registers modified: DI,AX,DX,CX
 32626                                  ;
 32627                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 32628                                  
 32629                                  	; 25/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 32630                                  	; 20/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 32631                                  NameTrans:
 32632                                  ;hkn; SS override
 32633 000059AC 36C606[4E03]01          	MOV	BYTE [SS:SpaceFlag],1
 32634 000059B2 16                      	push	ss
 32635 000059B3 07                      	pop	es
 32636                                  
 32637                                  ;hkn; NAME1 is in DOSDATA
 32638 000059B4 BF[4B05]                	MOV	DI,NAME1
 32639 000059B7 57                      	PUSH	DI
 32640 000059B8 B82020                  	MOV	AX,'  '
 32641 000059BB B90500                  	MOV	CX,5
 32642 000059BE AA                      	STOSB
 32643 000059BF F3AB                    	REP	STOSW		; Fill "FCB" at NAME1 with spaces
 32644 000059C1 30C0                    	XOR	AL,AL		; Set stuff for NORMSCAN
 32645 000059C3 88C2                    	MOV	DL,AL
 32646 000059C5 AA                      	STOSB
 32647 000059C6 5F                      	POP	DI
 32648                                  
 32649 000059C7 E880FF                  	CALL	NORMSCAN
 32650                                  
 32651                                  ;hkn; SS override for NAME1
 32652 000059CA 36803E[4B05]E5          	CMP	byte [SS:NAME1],0E5H
 32653 000059D0 75D9                    	jnz	short scanb_retn
 32654 000059D2 36C606[4B05]05          	MOV	byte [SS:NAME1],5 ; Magic name translation
 32655 000059D8 C3                      	retn
 32656                                  
 32657                                  ;Break	<GETLET, DELIM -- CHECK CHARACTERS AND CONVERT>
 32658                                  ;============================================================================
 32659                                  
 32660                                  ; 20/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 32661                                  ; DOSCODE:8FD2h (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
 32662                                  
 32663                                  ;If TableLook
 32664                                  
 32665                                  ;hkn; Table	SEGMENT
 32666                                  ;	PUBLIC	CharType
 32667                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 32668                                  
 32669                                  ; Character type table for file name scanning
 32670                                  ; Table provides a mapping of characters to validity bits.
 32671                                  ; Four bits are provided for each character. Values 7Dh and above
 32672                                  ; have all bits set, so that part of the table is chopped off, and
 32673                                  ; the translation routine is responsible for screening these values.
 32674                                  ; The bit values are defined in DOSSYM.INC
 32675                                  
 32676                                  ;	      ; ^A and NUL
 32677                                  ;CharType:
 32678                                  ;	 db   LOW ((NOT FFCB+FCHK) SHL 4) OR LOW (NOT FFCB+FCHK) AND 0Fh
 32679                                  ;	      ; ^C and ^B
 32680                                  ;	 db   LOW ((NOT FFCB+FCHK) SHL 4) OR LOW (NOT FFCB+FCHK) AND 0Fh
 32681                                  ;	      ; ^E and ^D
 32682                                  ;	 db   LOW ((NOT FFCB+FCHK) SHL 4) OR LOW (NOT FFCB+FCHK) AND 0Fh
 32683                                  ;	      ; ^G and ^F
 32684                                  ;	 db   LOW ((NOT FFCB+FCHK) SHL 4) OR LOW (NOT FFCB+FCHK) AND 0Fh
 32685                                  ;	      ; TAB and BS
 32686                                  ;	 db   LOW ((NOT FFCB+FCHK+FDELIM+FSPCHK) SHL 4) OR LOW (NOT FFCB+FCHK) AND 0Fh
 32687                                  ;	      ; ^K and ^J
 32688                                  ;	 db   LOW ((NOT FFCB+FCHK) SHL 4) OR LOW (NOT FFCB+FCHK) AND 0Fh
 32689                                  ;	      ; ^M and ^L
 32690                                  ;	 db   LOW ((NOT FFCB+FCHK) SHL 4) OR LOW (NOT FFCB+FCHK) AND 0Fh
 32691                                  ;	      ; ^O and ^N
 32692                                  ;	 db   LOW ((NOT FFCB+FCHK) SHL 4) OR LOW (NOT FFCB+FCHK) AND 0Fh
 32693                                  ;	      ; ^Q and ^P
 32694                                  ;	 db   LOW ((NOT FFCB+FCHK) SHL 4) OR LOW (NOT FFCB+FCHK) AND 0Fh
 32695                                  ;	      ; ^S and ^R
 32696                                  ;	 db   LOW ((NOT FFCB+FCHK) SHL 4) OR LOW (NOT FFCB+FCHK) AND 0Fh
 32697                                  ;	      ; ^U and ^T
 32698                                  ;	 db   LOW ((NOT FFCB+FCHK) SHL 4) OR LOW (NOT FFCB+FCHK) AND 0Fh
 32699                                  ;	      ; ^W and ^V
 32700                                  ;	 db   LOW ((NOT FFCB+FCHK) SHL 4) OR LOW (NOT FFCB+FCHK) AND 0Fh
 32701                                  ;	      ; ^Y and ^X
 32702                                  ;	 db   LOW ((NOT FFCB+FCHK) SHL 4) OR LOW (NOT FFCB+FCHK) AND 0Fh
 32703                                  ;	      ; ESC and ^Z
 32704                                  ;	 db   LOW ((NOT FFCB+FCHK) SHL 4) OR LOW (NOT FFCB+FCHK) AND 0Fh
 32705                                  ;	      ; ^] and ^;	 db   LOW ((NOT FFCB+FCHK) SHL 4) OR LOW (NOT FFCB+FCHK) AND 0Fh
 32707                                  ;	      ; ^_ and ^^
 32708                                  ;	 db   LOW ((NOT FFCB+FCHK) SHL 4) OR LOW (NOT FFCB+FCHK) AND 0Fh
 32709                                  ;	      ; ! and SPACE
 32710                                  ;	 db   LOW (NOT FCHK+FDELIM+FSPCHK)
 32711                                  ;	      ; # and "
 32712                                  ;	 db   LOW (NOT FFCB+FCHK)
 32713                                  ;	      ; $ - )
 32714                                  ;	 db   3 dup (0FFh)
 32715                                  ;	      ; + and *
 32716                                  ;	 db   LOW ((NOT FFCB+FCHK+FDELIM) SHL 4) OR 0Fh
 32717                                  ;	      ; - and '
 32718                                  ;	 db   NOT (FFCB+FCHK+FDELIM)
 32719                                  ;	      ; / and .
 32720                                  ;	 db   LOW ((NOT FFCB+FCHK) SHL 4) OR LOW (NOT FCHK) AND 0Fh
 32721                                  ;	      ; 0 - 9
 32722                                  ;	 db   5 dup (0FFh)
 32723                                  ;	      ; ; and :
 32724                                  ;	 db   LOW ((NOT FFCB+FCHK+FDELIM) SHL 4) OR LOW (NOT FFCB+FCHK+FDELIM) AND 0Fh
 32725                                  ;	      ; = and <
 32726                                  ;	 db   LOW ((NOT FFCB+FCHK+FDELIM) SHL 4) OR LOW (NOT FFCB+FCHK+FDELIM) AND 0Fh
 32727                                  ;	      ; ? and >
 32728                                  ;	 db   NOT FFCB+FCHK+FDELIM
 32729                                  ;	      ; A - Z
 32730                                  ;	 db   13 dup (0FFh)
 32731                                  ;	      ; \ and [
 32732                                  ;	 db   LOW ((NOT FFCB+FCHK) SHL 4) OR 0Fh
 32733                                  ;	      ; ^ and ]
 32734                                  ;	 db   LOW ((NOT FFCB+FCHK) SHL 4) OR LOW (NOT FFCB+FCHK) AND 0Fh
 32735                                  ;	      ; _ - {
 32736                                  ;	 db   15 dup (0FFh)
 32737                                  ;	      ; } and |
 32738                                  ;	 db   NOT FFCB+FCHK+FDELIM
 32739                                  
 32740                                  ;CharType_last equ ($ - CharType) * 2	; This is the value of the last
 32741                                  ;					; character in the table
 32742                                  
 32743                                  ;FCHK	equ 1		; normal name char, no chks needed
 32744                                  ;FDELIM	equ 2		; is a delimiter
 32745                                  ;FSPCHK	equ 4		; set if character is not a space or equivalent
 32746                                  ;FFCB	equ 8		; is valid in an FCB
 32747                                  
 32748                                  ; DOSCODE:8FD2h (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
 32749                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------

 32751                                  
 32752                                  CharType: ; 63 bytes
 32753 000059D9 6666666606666666                db  66h, 66h, 66h, 66h, 06h, 66h, 66h, 66h ; 0-7
 32754 000059E1 6666666666666666        	db  66h, 66h, 66h, 66h, 66h, 66h, 66h, 66h ; 8-15
 32755 000059E9 F8F6FFFFFF4FF46E        	db 0F8h,0F6h,0FFh,0FFh,0FFh, 4Fh,0F4h, 6Eh ; 16-23
 32756 000059F1 FFFFFFFFFF4444F4        	db 0FFh,0FFh,0FFh,0FFh,0FFh, 44h, 44h,0F4h ; 24-31
 32757 000059F9 FFFFFFFFFFFFFFFF        	db 0FFh,0FFh,0FFh,0FFh,0FFh,0FFh,0FFh,0FFh ; 32-39
 32758 00005A01 FFFFFFFFFF6F66FF        	db 0FFh,0FFh,0FFh,0FFh,0FFh, 6Fh, 66h,0FFh ; 40-47
 32759 00005A09 FFFFFFFFFFFFFFFF        	db 0FFh,0FFh,0FFh,0FFh,0FFh,0FFh,0FFh,0FFh ; 48-55
 32760 00005A11 FFFFFFFFFFFFF4          	db 0FFh,0FFh,0FFh,0FFh,0FFh,0FFh,0F4h	   ; 56-62

 32804                                  ; 20/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 32805                                  ; DOSCODE:9011h (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
 32806                                  
 32807                                  ; 25/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 32808                                  ; DOSCODE:8FB5h (MSDOS 5.0, MSDOS.SYS)
 32809                                  
 32810                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 32811                                  ;
 32812                                  ; Procedure Names : GetLet, UCase, GetLet3
 32813                                  ;
 32814                                  ; These routines take a character, convert it to upper case, and check
 32815                                  ; for delimiters.  Three different entry points:
 32816                                  ;	GetLet -  DS:[SI] = character to convert
 32817                                  ;	UCase  -  AL = character to convert
 32818                                  ;	GetLet3 - AL = character
 32819                                  ;		  [BX] = translation table to use
 32820                                  ;
 32821                                  ;	Exit (in all cases) : AL = upper case character
 32822                                  ;			      CY set if char is control char other than TAB
 32823                                  ;			      ZF set if char is a delimiter
 32824                                  ;	Uses : AX, flags
 32825                                  ;
 32826                                  ; NOTE: This routine exists in a fast table lookup version, and a slow
 32827                                  ; inline version.  Return with carry set is only possible in the inline
 32828                                  ; version. The table lookup version is the one in use.
 32829                                  ;
 32830                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 32831                                  
 32832                                  ; This entry point has character at [SI]
 32833                                  
 32834                                  	; IBMDOS.COM (MSDOS 3.3, 1987) - Offset 5517h
 32835                                  GETLET:	
 32836 00005A18 AC                      	LODSB
 32837                                  
 32838                                  ; This entry point has character in AL
 32839                                  
 32840                                  	;entry	UCase
 32841                                  UCase:	
 32842                                  	; 09/08/2018
 32843                                  	; IBMDOS.COM (MSDOS 3.3, 1987) - Offset 5518h
 32844                                  _UCase:
 32845 00005A19 53                      	PUSH	BX
 32846 00005A1A BB[850B]                	MOV	BX,FILE_UCASE_TAB+2
 32847                                  
 32848                                  ; Convert the character in AL to upper case
 32849                                  
 32850                                  gl_0:
 32851 00005A1D 3C61                    	CMP	AL,"a"
 32852 00005A1F 7214                    	JB	short gl_2	; Already upper case, go check type
 32853 00005A21 3C7A                    	CMP	AL,"z"
 32854 00005A23 7702                    	JA	short gl_1
 32855 00005A25 2C20                    	SUB	AL,20H		; Convert to upper case
 32856                                  
 32857                                  ; Map European character to upper case
 32858                                  
 32859                                  gl_1:
 32860 00005A27 3C80                    	CMP	AL,80H
 32861 00005A29 720A                    	JB	short gl_2	; Not EuroChar, go check type
 32862 00005A2B 2C80                    	SUB	AL,80H		; translate to upper case with this index
 32863                                  
 32864                                  	; M048 - Start 
 32865                                  	; Lantastic call Ucase thru int 2f without setting SS to DOSDATA.
 32866                                  	; So we shall set up DS and to access FILE_UCASE_TAB in BX and also 
 32867                                  	; preserve it.
 32868                                  
 32869                                  	; 09/08/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 32870                                  	; MSDOS 3.3
 32871                                  	;;XLAT	BYTE [CS:BX]	; ds as file_ucase_tab is in DOSDATA
 32872                                  	;CS	XLAT
 32873                                  
 32874                                  	; 20/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 32875                                  
 32876                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 32877 00005A2D 1E                      	push	ds
 32878                                  	;getdseg <ds>
 32879 00005A2E 2E8E1E[0700]            	mov	ds,[cs:DosDSeg]
 32880 00005A33 D7                      	XLAT			; ds as file_ucase_tab is in DOSDATA
 32881 00005A34 1F                      	pop	ds
 32882                                  
 32883                                  	; M048 - End
 32884                                  
 32885                                  ; Now check the type
 32886                                  
 32887                                  ;If TableLook
 32888                                  gl_2:
 32889                                  	; 20/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 32890 00005A35 50                      	PUSH	AX
 32891                                  
 32892                                  	; MSDOS 3.3
 32893                                  	;mov	bx,CharType
 32894                                  	;; 09/08/2018
 32895                                  	;;xlat	byte [cs:bx]
 32896                                  	;cs	xlat	
 32897                                  	
 32898                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 32899 00005A36 E81800                  	CALL	GetCharType	; returns type flags in AL
 32900                                  	
 32901                                  	;test	al,1	
 32902 00005A39 A801                    	TEST	AL,FCHK 	; test for normal character
 32903 00005A3B 58                      	POP	AX
 32904                                  
 32905 00005A3C 5B                      	POP	BX
 32906 00005A3D C3                      	RETN
 32907                                  
 32908                                  ; This entry has character in AL and lookup table in BX
 32909                                  
 32910                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 32911                                  ;	;entry GetLet3
 32912                                  GETLET3: ; 10/08/2018
 32913 00005A3E 53                      	PUSH	BX
 32914 00005A3F EBDC                    	JMP	short gl_0
 32915                                  ;ELSE
 32916                                  ;
 32917                                  ;gl_2:
 32918                                  ;	POP	BX
 32919                                  ;	CMP	AL,"."
 32920                                  ;	retz
 32921                                  ;	CMP	AL,'"'
 32922                                  ;	retz
 32923                                  ;	CALL	PATHCHRCMP
 32924                                  ;	retz
 32925                                  ;	CMP	AL,"["
 32926                                  ;	retz
 32927                                  ;	CMP	AL,"]"
 32928                                  ;	retz
 32929                                  ;ENDIF
 32930                                  
 32931                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------
 32932                                  ;
 32933                                  ; DELIM - check if character is a delimiter
 32934                                  ;	Entry : AX = character to check
 32935                                  ;	Exit  : ZF set if character is not a delimiter
 32936                                  ;	Uses  : Flags
 32937                                  ;
 32938                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------
 32939                                  
 32940                                  	;entry	DELIM
 32941                                  DELIM:
 32942                                  ;IF TableLook
 32943                                  	; 20/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 32944 00005A41 50                      	PUSH	AX
 32945                                  
 32946                                  	; MSDOS 3.3
 32947                                  	;push	bx
 32948                                  	;mov	bx,CharType
 32949                                  	;;09/08/2018
 32950                                  	;;xlat	byte [cs:bx]
 32951                                  	;cs	xlat
 32952                                  	;pop	bx
 32953                                  
 32954                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 32955 00005A42 E80C00                  	CALL	GetCharType
 32956                                  	
 32957                                  	;test	al,2
 32958 00005A45 A802                    	TEST	AL,FDELIM
 32959 00005A47 58                      	POP	AX
 32960 00005A48 C3                      	RETN
 32961                                  ;ELSE
 32962                                  ;	CMP	AL,":"
 32963                                  ;	retz
 32964                                  ;
 32965                                  ;	CMP	AL,"<"
 32966                                  ;	retz
 32967                                  ;	CMP	AL,"|"
 32968                                  ;	retz
 32969                                  ;	CMP	AL,">"
 32970                                  ;	retz
 32971                                  ;
 32972                                  ;	CMP	AL,"+"
 32973                                  ;	retz
 32974                                  ;	CMP	AL,"="
 32975                                  ;	retz
 32976                                  ;	CMP	AL,";"
 32977                                  ;	retz
 32978                                  ;	CMP	AL,","
 32979                                  ;	retz
 32980                                  ;ENDIF
 32981                                  
 32982                                  ;-------------------------------------------------------------------------
 32983                                  ;
 32984                                  ;  SPCHK - checks to see if a character is a space or equivalent
 32985                                  ;	Entry : AL = character to check
 32986                                  ;	Exit  : ZF set if character is a space
 32987                                  ;	Uses  : flags
 32988                                  ;
 32989                                  ;-------------------------------------------------------------------------
 32990                                  
 32991                                  	;entry SPCHK
 32992                                  SPCHK:
 32993                                  ;IF TableLook
 32994                                  	; 20/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 32995 00005A49 50                      	PUSH	AX
 32996                                  
 32997                                  	; MSDOS 3.3
 32998                                  	;push	bx
 32999                                  	;mov	bx,CharType
 33000                                  	;; 09/08/2018
 33001                                  	;;xlat	byte [cs:bx]
 33002                                  	;cs	xlat
 33003                                  	;pop	bx
 33004                                  
 33005                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 33006 00005A4A E80400                  	CALL	GetCharType
 33007                                  	
 33008                                  	;test	al,4
 33009 00005A4D A804                    	TEST	AL,FSPCHK
 33010 00005A4F 58                      	POP	AX
 33011 00005A50 C3                      	RETN
 33012                                  ;ELSE
 33013                                  ;	CMP	AL,9		; Filter out tabs too
 33014                                  ;	retz
 33015                                  ;; WARNING! " " MUST be the last compare
 33016                                  ;	CMP	AL," "
 33017                                  ;	return
 33018                                  ;ENDIF
 33019                                  
 33020                                  ;-------------------------------------------------------------------------
 33021                                  ;
 33022                                  ;  GetCharType - return flag bits indicating character type
 33023                                  ;	Bits are defined in DOSSYM.INC. Uses lookup table
 33024                                  ;	defined above at label CharType.
 33025                                  ;
 33026                                  ;	Entry : AL = character to return type flags for
 33027                                  ;	Exit  : AL = type flags
 33028                                  ;	Uses  : AL, flags
 33029                                  ;
 33030                                  ;-------------------------------------------------------------------------
 33031                                  
 33032                                  	; 25/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 33033                                  
 33034                                  	; 20/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 33035                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 33036                                  GetCharType:
 33037                                  	;cmp	al,7Eh
 33038 00005A51 3C7E                    	cmp	al,CharType_last 	; beyond end of table?
 33039 00005A53 7316                    	jae	short gct_90		; return standard value
 33040                                  
 33041 00005A55 53                      	push	bx
 33042 00005A56 BB[D959]                	mov	bx,CharType		; load lookup table
 33043 00005A59 D0E8                    	shr	al,1			; adjust for half-byte table entry size
 33044                                  	;xlat	cs:[bx] 		; get flags
 33045 00005A5B 2ED7                    	cs	xlat	
 33046 00005A5D 5B                      	pop	bx
 33047                                  
 33048                                  ; carry clear from previous shift means we want the low nibble.  Otherwise
 33049                                  ; we have to shift the flags down to the low nibble
 33050                                  
 33051 00005A5E 7308                    	jnc	short gct_80		; carry clear, no shift needed
 33052                                  
 33053 00005A60 D0E8                    	shr	al,1			; we want high nibble, shift it down
 33054 00005A62 D0E8                    	shr	al,1
 33055 00005A64 D0E8                    	shr	al,1
 33056 00005A66 D0E8                    	shr	al,1
 33057                                  gct_80:
 33058 00005A68 240F                    	and	al,0Fh			; clear the unused nibble
 33059 00005A6A C3                      	retn
 33060                                  gct_90:
 33061 00005A6B B00F                    	mov	al,0Fh			; set all flags
 33062 00005A6D C3                      	retn
 33063                                  
 33064                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 33065                                  ;
 33066                                  ; Procedure : PATHCHRCMP
 33067                                  ;
 33068                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 33069                                  
 33070                                  PATHCHRCMP:
 33071 00005A6E 3C2F                    	CMP	AL,'/'
 33072 00005A70 7606                    	JBE	short PathRet
 33073 00005A72 3C5C                    	CMP	AL,'\'
 33074 00005A74 C3                      	retn
 33075                                  GotFor:
 33076 00005A75 B05C                    	MOV	AL,'\'
 33077 00005A77 C3                      	retn
 33078                                  PathRet:
 33079 00005A78 74FB                    	JZ	short GotFor
 33080 00005A7A C3                      	retn

 33087                                  
 33088                                  ; 15/03/2018 - Retro DOS v2.0 (MSDOS 2.11, CTRLC.ASM, 1983)
 33089                                  
 33090                                  ;**	MSCTRLC.ASM - ^C and error handler for MSDOS
 33091                                  
 33092                                  ;	TITLE	Control C detection, Hard error and EXIT routines
 33093                                  ;	NAME	IBMCTRLC
 33094                                  
 33095                                  ;**	Low level routines for detecting special characters on CON input,
 33096                                  ;	the ^C exit/int code, the Hard error INT 24 code, the
 33097                                  ;	process termination code, and the INT 0 divide overflow handler.
 33098                                  ;
 33099                                  ;	FATAL
 33100                                  ;	FATAL1
 33101                                  ;	reset_environment
 33102                                  ;	DSKSTATCHK
 33103                                  ;	SPOOLINT
 33104                                  ;	STATCHK
 33105                                  ;	CNTCHAND
 33106                                  ;	DIVOV
 33107                                  ;	CHARHARD
 33108                                  ;	HardErr
 33109                                  ;
 33110                                  ;	Revision history:
 33111                                  ;
 33112                                  ;	    AN000	version 4.0   Jan 1988
 33113                                  ;	    A002	PTM    -- dir >lpt3 hangs
 33114                                  ;	    A003	PTM 3957- fake version for IBMCAHE.COM
 33115                                  ;
 33116                                  ; 	M011: NEC's 8086 clone chip uses Intel's undocumented bit number in
 33117                                  ;	      flags register. In order to return to user normally DOS used to
 33118                                  ;	      move F202 into flags, which sets bit number 1 in flags uncondit-
 33119                                  ;	      ionally. Now it is modified to maintain the state of bit 1.
 33120                                  ;
 33121                                  ; 	M024: suppressed fail and ignore options if not in the middle of int 
 33122                                  ;	      24 and if Ctrl P or ctrl printscrn is pressed in routine 
 33123                                  ;	      charhard.
 33124                                  
 33125                                  ; 29/04/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 33126                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 33127                                  ;		public	LowInt23Addr		
 33128                                  LowInt23Addr: ;	LABEL	DWORD
 33129 00005A7B [3111]0000              	DW	LowInt23, 0
 33130                                  
 33131                                  ;		public	LowInt24Addr
 33132                                  LowInt24Addr: ;	LABEL	DWORD
 33133 00005A7F [4511]0000              	DW	LowInt24, 0
 33134
