 33467                                  
 33468                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 33469                                  ;
 33470                                  ; Procedure Name : CNTHAND ( CTRLC_C HANDLER )
 33471                                  ;
 33472                                  ; "^C" and CR/LF is printed. Then the user registers are restored and the
 33473                                  ; user CTRL-C handler is executed. At this point the top of the stack has 1)
 33474                                  ; the interrupt return address should the user CTRL-C handler wish to allow
 33475                                  ; processing to continue; 2) the original interrupt return address to the code
 33476                                  ; that performed the function call in the first place. If the user CTRL-C
 33477                                  ; handler wishes to continue, it must leave all registers unchanged and RET
 33478                                  ; (not IRET) with carry CLEAR. If carry is SET then an terminate system call
 33479                                  ; is simulated.
 33480                                  ;
 33481                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 33482                                  
 33483                                  CNTCHAND:
 33484                                  	; MSDOS 6.0			; SS override
 33485                                  					; AN002; from RAWOUT
 33486                                  	;TEST	word [SS:DOS34_FLAG],CTRL_BREAK_FLAG  
 33487                                  	;JNZ	short around_deadlock 	; AN002;
 33488                                  
 33489                                  	; 05/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 33490                                  	; (MSDOS 6.21 MSDOS.SYS DOSCODE:91C4h, 29/12/2022)
 33491 00005BC5 36F606[1206]02          	TEST	byte [SS:DOS34_FLAG+1],(CTRL_BREAK_FLAG>>8)  ; 2 
 33492 00005BCB 7508                    	JNZ	short around_deadlock 	; AN002;
 33493                                  
 33494 00005BCD B003                            MOV     AL,3			; Display "^C"
 33495 00005BCF E8F5C0                          CALL	BUFOUT
 33496 00005BD2 E890BF                          CALL	CRLF
 33497                                  around_deadlock:
 33498 00005BD5 16                              PUSH    SS
 33499 00005BD6 1F                              POP     DS
 33500 00005BD7 803E[5703]00                    CMP     BYTE [CONSWAP],0
 33501 00005BDC 7403                            JZ      SHORT NOSWAP
 33502 00005BDE E88ADF                          CALL	SWAPBACK
 33503                                  NOSWAP:
 33504 00005BE1 FA                      	CLI				; Prepare to play with stack
 33505 00005BE2 8E16[8605]              	MOV	SS,[USER_SS]		; User stack now restored
 33506 00005BE6 8B26[8405]              	MOV	SP,[USER_SP]
 33507 00005BEA E854A8                          CALL	restore_world       ; User registers now restored
 33508                                  
 33509                                  	; 30/07/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0 
 33510                                  	; MSDOS 3.3 (IBMDOS.COM - Offset 56ACh)
 33511                                          ; 14/03/2018 - Retro DOS v2.0
 33512                                  	;MOV	BYTE [CS:INDOS],0	
 33513                                          ;MOV	BYTE [CS:ERRORMODE],0
 33514                                          ;MOV	[CS:ConC_Spsave],SP
 33515                                  	;clc	;30/07/2018
 33516                                          ;INT	int_ctrl_c ; 23h    ; Execute user Ctrl-C handler
 33517                                  	;;int	23h	; DOS - CONTROL "C" EXIT ADDRESS
 33518                                  			; Return: return via RETF 2 with CF set
 33519                                  			; DOS will abort program with errorlevel 0
 33520                                  			; else
 33521                                  			; interrupted DOS call continues
 33522                                  
 33523                                  	; 05/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 33524                                  	; MSDOS 6.0 (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS,91ECh) 
 33525                                  
 33526                                  	; CS was used to address these variables. We have to use DOSDATA
 33527                                  	
 33528 00005BED 07                      	pop	es ; *	; MSDOS 6.21 (MSDOS.SYS, DOSCODE:91ECh)
 33529                                  			; (pop es, after 'call restore_world')	
 33530 00005BEE 1E                      	push	ds
 33531                                  	;getdseg <ds>			; ds -> dosdata
 33532 00005BEF 2E8E1E[0700]            	mov	ds,[cs:DosDSeg]
 33533 00005BF4 C606[2103]00            	mov	byte [INDOS],0		; Go to known state
 33534 00005BF9 C606[2003]00            	mov	byte [ERRORMODE],0
 33535 00005BFE 8926[3203]              	mov	[ConC_Spsave],SP	; save his SP
 33536                                  	; User SP has changed because of push. Adjust for it
 33537 00005C02 8306[3203]02            	add	word [ConC_Spsave],2
 33538                                  
 33539 00005C07 803E[870D]00            	cmp	byte [DosHasHMA],0	; Q: is dos running in HMA (M021)
 33540 00005C0C 1F                       	pop	ds	; restore ds
 33541 00005C0D 7505                    	jne	short do_low_int23	; Y: the int must be done from low mem
 33542 00005C0F F8                      	CLC				
 33543 00005C10 CD23                    	INT	int_ctrl_c  ; int 23h	; N: Execute user Ctrl-C handler
 33544 00005C12 EB06                    	jmp	short ctrlc_ret_addr
 33545                                  
 33546                                  	; 05/05/2019
 33547                                  do_low_int23:
 33548 00005C14 F8                      	clc
 33549 00005C15 2EFF1E[7B5A]            	call	far [cs:LowInt23Addr]	
 33550                                  
 33551                                  	; 30/07/2018 
 33552                                  
 33553                                  	; MSDOS 3.3 (IBMDOS.COM - Offset 56C0h)
 33554                                  
 33555                                  ; The user has returned to us. The circumstances we allow are:
 33556                                  ;
 33557                                  ;   IRET	We retry the operation by redispatching the system call
 33558                                  ;   CLC/RETF	POP the stack and retry
 33559                                  ;   ... 	Exit the current process with ^C exit
 33560                                  ;
 33561                                  ; User's may RETURN to us and leave interrupts on. 
 33562                                  ; Turn 'em off just to be sure
 33563                                  
 33564                                  ctrlc_ret_addr: ; 05/05/2019
 33565                                  
 33566 00005C1A FA                      	CLI
 33567                                  
 33568                                  	; MSDOS 3.3 
 33569                                  	;MOV	[CS:USER_IN_AX],ax	; save the AX
 33570                                  	;PUSHF				; and the flags (maybe new call)
 33571                                  	;POP	AX
 33572                                  
 33573                                  	; 05/05/2019
 33574                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 33575                                  
 33576                                  	; We have to use DOSDATA for these variables. Previously CS was used 
 33577                                  
 33578 00005C1B 50                      	push	ax
 33579 00005C1C 8CD8                    	mov	ax,ds
 33580                                  	;getdseg <ds>			; ds -> dosdata
 33581 00005C1E 2E8E1E[0700]            	mov	ds,[cs:DosDSeg]
 33582 00005C23 A3[840D]                	mov	[TEMPSEG],ax
 33583 00005C26 58                      	pop	ax
 33584 00005C27 A3[3A03]                	MOV	[USER_IN_AX],ax		; save the AX
 33585 00005C2A 9C                      	pushf				; and the flags (maybe new call)
 33586 00005C2B 58                      	pop	ax
 33587                                  
 33588                                  ; See if the input stack is identical to the output stack
 33589                                  
 33590                                  	; MSDOS 3.3
 33591                                  	;CMP	SP,[CS:ConC_Spsave]
 33592                                  	;JNZ     SHORT ctrlc_try_new ; current SP not the same as saved SP
 33593                                  
 33594                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 33595 00005C2C 3B26[3203]              	CMP	SP,[ConC_Spsave]
 33596 00005C30 750A                    	JNZ     SHORT ctrlc_try_new ; current SP not the same as saved SP
 33597                                  
 33598                                  ; Repeat the operation by redispatching the system call.
 33599                                  
 33600                                  ctrlc_repeat:
 33601                                  	; MSDOS 3.3
 33602                                  	;MOV	AX,[CS:USER_IN_AX]
 33603                                  	; 05/05/2019
 33604                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 33605 00005C32 A1[3A03]                	mov	ax,[USER_IN_AX]
 33606 00005C35 8E1E[840D]              	mov	ds,[TEMPSEG]		; restore ds and original sp
 33607                                  	; MSDOS 3.3 & MSDOS 6.0

 33821                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 33822                                  ;
 33823                                  ; Procedure Name : HardErr
 33824                                  ;
 33825                                  ; Hard disk error handler. Entry conditions:
 33826                                  ;	DS:BX = Original disk transfer address
 33827                                  ;	DX = Original logical sector number
 33828                                  ;	CX = Number of sectors to go (first one gave the error)
 33829                                  ;	AX = Hardware error code
 33830                                  ;	DI = Original sector transfer count	
 33831                                  ;	ES:BP = Base of drive parameters
 33832                                  ;	[READOP] = 0 for read, 1 for write
 33833                                  ;	Allowed Set with allowed responses to this error (other bits MUST BE 0)
 33834                                  ; Output:
 33835                                  ;	[FAILERR] will be set if user responded FAIL
 33836                                  ;
 33837                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 33838                                  
 33839                                  	; 25/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 33840                                  HARDERR:
 33841                                  	; 05/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 33842                                  	; 30/07/2018
 33843                                  	; 08/07/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 33844 00005CD7 97                      	XCHG    AX,DI                   ; Error code in DI, count in AX
 33845                                          ;and	di,0FFh
 33846 00005CD8 81E7FF00                	AND     DI,STECODE              ; And off status bits
 33847                                          ;CMP	DI,WRECODE		; Write Protect Error?
 33848                                  	;cmp	di,0
 33849 00005CDC 83FF00                  	cmp	DI,error_I24_write_protect ; Write Protect Error?
 33850 00005CDF 750A                            JNZ     short NOSETWRPERR
 33851 00005CE1 50                              PUSH    AX
 33852                                  	; 25/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS compatibility)
 33853                                  	;MOV	AL,[ES:BP+DPB.DRIVE]
 33854                                          ;;MOV	AL,[ES:BP+0]

 33857                                          	; 15/03/2018

 33859 00005CEA 58                              POP     AX
 33860                                  NOSETWRPERR:

 33862 00005CED 01C2                            ADD     DX,AX                   ; First sector number to retry

 33889                                  ERRINT:

 33895 00005D20 360A26[4B03]            	OR	AH,[SS:ALLOWED]		; Set the allowed_ bits
 33896                                  
 33897                                          ;entry   FATAL
 33898                                  FATAL:
 33899                                  	; 25/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS compatibility)
 33900                                  	;MOV	AL,[ES:BP+DPB.DRIVE]

 33914                                  
 33915                                  	; DI has the INT-24-style extended error. We now map the error code 
 33916                                  	; for this into the normalized get extended error set by using the 
 33917                                  	; ErrMap24 table as a translate table. Note that we translate ONLY 
 33918                                  	; the device returned codes and leave all others beyond the look up 
 33919                                  	; table alone.

 33927 00005D41 BF0C00                  	MOV	DI,error_I24_gen_failure; mapped to gen_failure. Real codes
 33928                                  					;  Only come via GetExtendedError

 33931                                  ; Entry point used by REDIRector on Network I 24 errors.
 33932                                  ;
 33933                                  ;	ASSUME	DS:NOTHING,ES:NOTHING,SS:DOSDATA
 33934                                  ;

 33936                                  ;     EXITHOLD set for restore of ES:BP.

 33940                                  GOT_RIGHT_CODE:

 33944 00005D4E EB6C                    	JMP	short FailRet
 33945                                  NoSetFail:

 33947 00005D55 16                              PUSH	SS
 33948 00005D56 07                              POP	ES
 33949                                      
 33950                                  	; Wango!!! We may need to free some user state info... In 
 33951                                  	; particular, we may have locked down a JFN for a user and he may 
 33952                                  	; NEVER return to us. Thus,we need to free it here and then 
 33953                                  	; reallocate it when we come back.

 34014                                  
 34015                                  	; Triage the user's reply.
 34016                                  
 34017 00005DC1 3C01                    	CMP	AL,1
 34018 00005DC3 723D                    	JB	short CheckIgnore	; 0 => ignore

 34039                                  CleanUp:

 34047                                  CleanUp2:

 34058 00005E01 C3                      	retn
 34059                                  
 34060                                  	; The reply was IGNORE. See if we are allowed to ignore.
 34061                                  
 34062                                  CheckIgnore:
 34063                                  	;test	byte [ss:ALLOWED],20h
 34064 00005E02 36F606[4B03]20          	test	byte [ss:ALLOWED],Allowed_IGNORE ; Can we?
 34065 00005E08 74C9                    	jz	short DoFail			 ; No, do fail
 34066 00005E0A EBD6                    	jmp	short CleanUp
 34067                                  
 34068                                  	; The reply was RETRY. See if we are allowed to retry.
 34069                                  
 34070                                  CheckRetry:
 34071                                  	;test	byte [ss:ALLOWED],10h
 34072 00005E0C 36F606[4B03]10          	test	byte [ss:ALLOWED],Allowed_RETRY	; Can we?
 34073 00005E12 74BF                    	jz	short DoFail			; No, do fail
 34074 00005E14 EBCC                    	JMP	short CleanUp
 34075                                  
 34076                                  	; The reply was ABORT.
 34077                                  DoAbort:
 34078 00005E16 16                      	push	ss
 34079 00005E17 1F                      	pop	ds
 34080                                  
 34081 00005E18 803E[5703]00            	CMP	byte [CONSWAP],0
 34082 00005E1D 7403                    	JZ	short NOSWAP2
 34083 00005E1F E849DD                  	call	SWAPBACK
 34084                                  NOSWAP2:
 34085                                  	; See if we are to truly abort. If we are in the process of aborting, 
 34086                                  	; turn this abort into a fail.
 34087                                  
 34088                                  	;test	[fAborting],0FFh
 34089                                  	;jnz	short DoFail
 34090                                  
 34091 00005E22 803E[5903]00            	cmp	byte [fAborting],0
 34092 00005E27 75AA                    	JNZ	short DoFail
 34093                                  
 34094                                  	; Set return code
 34095                                  
 34096 00005E29 C606[7C05]02            	MOV	BYTE [EXIT_TYPE],EXIT_HARD_ERROR ; 2
 34097 00005E2E 30C0                    	XOR	AL,AL
 34098                                  
 34099                                  	; we are truly aborting the process. Go restore information from 
 34100                                  	; the PDB as necessary.
 34101                                  
 34102 00005E30 E9BF0D                  	jmp	exit_inner
 34103                                  
 34104                                  ;** --------------------------------------------------------------------------
 34105                                  ;
 34106                                  ; reset_environment checks the DS value against the CurrentPDB. If they are
 34107                                  ; different, then an old-style return is performed. If they are the same,
 34108                                  ; then we release jfns and restore to parent. We still use the PDB at DS:0 as
 34109                                  ; the source of the terminate addresses.
 34110                                  ;
 34111                                  ; Some subtlety: We are about to issue a bunch of calls that *may* generate
 34112                                  ; INT 24s. We *cannot* allow the user to restart the abort process; we may
 34113                                  ; end up aborting the wrong process or turn a terminate/stay/resident into a
 34114                                  ; normal abort and leave interrupt handlers around. What we do is to set a
 34115                                  ; flag that will indicate that if any abort code is seen, we just continue the
 34116                                  ; operation. In essence, we dis-allow the abort response.
 34117                                  ;
 34118                                  ; output:   none.
 34119                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 34120                                  
 34121                                  	;entry	reset_environment
 34122                                  	
 34123                                  reset_environment:
 34124                                  	; 30/07/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 34125                                  	; IBMDOS.COM (MSDOS 3.3) - Offset 588Ah 
 34126                                  
 34127                                  ;***	invoke	Reset_Version		; AN007 ;MS. reset version number
 34128                                  
 34129 00005E33 1E                      	PUSH	DS			; save PDB of process
 34130                                  
 34131                                  	; There are no critical sections in force. Although we may enter 
 34132                                  	; here with critical sections locked down, they are no longer 
 34133                                  	; relevant. We may safely free all allocated resources.
 34134                                  
 34135 00005E34 B482                    	MOV	AH,82h
 34136                                  		; Microsoft Networks - END DOS CRITICAL SECTIONS 0 THROUGH 7
 34137                                  	;int	2Ah 	
 34138 00005E36 CD2A                    	INT	int_IBM
 34139                                  
 34140                                  					; SS override
 34141 00005E38 36C606[5903]FF          	MOV	byte [SS:fAborting],-1	; signal abort in progress
 34142                                  
 34143                                  					; DOS 4.00 doesn't need it
 34144                                  	;CallInstall NetResetEnvironment, MultNET, 34  
 34145                                  					; Allow REDIR to clear some stuff
 34146                                  					; On process exit.
 34147 00005E3E B82211                  	mov     ax, 1122h
 34148 00005E41 CD2F                    	int     2Fh	; Multiplex - NETWORK REDIRECTOR - PROCESS TERMINATION HOOK
 34149                                  			; SS = DOS CS
 34150                                  	;mov	al,22h	
 34151 00005E43 B022                    	MOV	AL,int_terminate
 34152 00005E45 E81FB1                  	call	_$GET_INTERRUPT_VECTOR	; and who to go to
 34153                                  
 34154 00005E48 59                      	POP	CX			; get ThisPDB
 34155 00005E49 06                      	push	es
 34156 00005E4A 53                      	push	bx			; save return address
 34157                                  
 34158 00005E4B 368B1E[3003]            	MOV	BX,[SS:CurrentPDB] 	; get currentPDB
 34159 00005E50 8EDB                    	MOV	DS,BX
 34160 00005E52 A11600                  	MOV	AX,[PDB.PARENT_PID]	; get parentPDB
 34161                                  
 34162                                  	; AX = parentPDB, BX = CurrentPDB, CX = ThisPDB
 34163                                  	; Only free handles if AX <> BX and BX = CX and [exit_code].upper 
 34164                                  	; is not Exit_keep_process
 34165                                  	
 34166 00005E55 39D8                    	CMP	AX,BX
 34167 00005E57 7418                    	JZ	short reset_return	; parentPDB = CurrentPDB
 34168 00005E59 39CB                    	CMP	BX,CX
 34169 00005E5B 7514                    	JNZ	short reset_return	; CurrentPDB <> ThisPDB
 34170 00005E5D 50                      	PUSH	AX			; save parent
 34171                                  
 34172                                  					; SS override
 34173                                  	;cmp	byte [SS:EXIT_TYPE],3
 34174 00005E5E 36803E[7C05]03          	CMP	BYTE [SS:EXIT_TYPE],EXIT_KEEP_PROCESS ; 15/08/2018
 34175 00005E64 7406                    	JZ	short reset_to_parent 	; keeping this process
 34176                                  
 34177                                  	; We are truly removing a process. Free all allocation blocks 
 34178                                  	; belonging to this PDB
 34179                                  
 34180                                  	;invoke	arena_free_process
 34181 00005E66 E8C10D                  	call	arena_free_process
 34182                                  
 34183                                  	; Kill off remainder of this process. Close file handles and signal 
 34184                                  	; to relevant network folks that this process is dead. Remember that 
 34185                                  	; CurrentPDB is STILL the current process!
 34186                                  
 34187                                  	;invoke	DOS_ABORT
 34188 00005E69 E850D8                  	call	DOS_ABORT
 34189                                  
 34190                                  reset_to_parent:
 34191                                  					; SS override
 34192 00005E6C 368F06[3003]            	POP	word [SS:CurrentPDB]	; set up process as parent
 34193                                  
 34194                                  reset_return:				; come here for normal return
 34195                                  	;Context DS			; DS is used to refer to DOSDATA  
 34196 00005E71 16                      	push	ss
 34197 00005E72 1F                      	pop	ds	
 34198                                  
 34199 00005E73 B0FF                    	MOV	AL,-1
 34200                                  
 34201                                  	; make sure that everything is clean In this case ignore any errors, 
 34202                                  	; we cannot "FAIL" the abort, the program being aborted is dead.
 34203                                  
 34204                                  	;EnterCrit critDisk
 34205 00005E75 E871BA                  	call	ECritDisk
 34206                                  	;invoke	FLUSHBUF
 34207 00005E78 E8D305                  	call	FLUSHBUF
 34208                                  	;LeaveCrit critDisk
 34209 00005E7B E898BA                  	call	LCritDisk
 34210                                  
 34211                                  	; Decrement open ref. count if we had done a virtual open earlier.
 34212                                  
 34213 00005E7E E883F7                  	call	CHECK_VIRT_OPEN
 34214 00005E81 FA                      	CLI
 34215 00005E82 C606[2103]00            	MOV	BYTE [INDOS],0		; Go to known state
 34216 00005E87 C606[2203]FF            	MOV	BYTE [WPERR],-1		; Forget about WP error
 34217 00005E8C C606[5903]00            	MOV	byte [fAborting],0	; let aborts occur
 34218 00005E91 8F06[8005]              	POP	WORD [EXITHOLD]
 34219 00005E95 8F06[8205]              	POP	WORD [EXITHOLD+2]
 34220                                  
 34221                                  	; Snake into multitasking... Get stack from CurrentPDB person
 34222                                  
 34223 00005E99 8E1E[3003]              	MOV	DS,[CurrentPDB]
 34224 00005E9D 8E163000                	MOV	SS,[PDB.USER_STACK+2]
 34225 00005EA1 8B262E00                	MOV	SP,[PDB.USER_STACK]
 34226                                  
 34227 00005EA5 E899A5                  	call	restore_world
 34228                                  
 34229                                  	; 05/05/2019
 34230 00005EA8 07                      	pop	es ; * ; MSDOS 6.21 (DOSCODE:94A8h, MSDOS.SYS)
 34231                                  
 34232                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 34233 00005EA9 50                      	push	ax			; set up ds, but save ds in TEMPSEG 
 34234 00005EAA 8CD8                    	mov	ax,ds			; and not on stack.
 34235                                  	;getdseg <ds>			; ds -> dosdata
 34236 00005EAC 2E8E1E[0700]            	mov	ds,[cs:DosDSeg] 
 34237 00005EB1 A3[840D]                	mov	[TEMPSEG],ax
 34238 00005EB4 58                      	pop	ax
 34239                                  					; set up ds to DOSDATA
 34240                                  	;MOV	[CS:USER_SP],AX ; MSDOS 3.3
 34241 00005EB5 A3[8405]                	mov	[USER_SP],ax
 34242                                  
 34243 00005EB8 58                      	POP	AX			; suck off CS:IP of interrupt...
 34244 00005EB9 58                      	POP	AX
 34245 00005EBA 58                      	POP	AX
 34246                                  
 34247                                  ; M011 : BEGIN
 34248                                  
 34249                                  	; MSDOS 3.3
 34250                                  ;	MOV	AX,0F202h	; STI
 34251                                  
 34252                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 34253 00005EBB 9F                      	LAHF
 34254 00005EBC 86E0                    	XCHG	AH,AL
 34255 00005EBE 2402                    	AND	AL,2
 34256 00005EC0 B4F2                    	MOV	AH,0F2h
 34257                                  
 34258                                  ; M011 : END
 34259                                  
 34260                                  	; MSDOS 3.3 (& MSDOS 6.0)
 34261 00005EC2 50                      	PUSH	AX
 34262                                   
 34263                                  	;PUSH	word [CS:EXITHOLD+2]
 34264                                  	;PUSH	word [CS:EXITHOLD]
 34265                                  	
 34266                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 34267 00005EC3 FF36[8205]              	PUSH	word [EXITHOLD+2]
 34268 00005EC7 FF36[8005]              	PUSH	word [EXITHOLD]
 34269                                  
 34270                                  	;MOV	AX,[CS:USER_SP]
 34271                                  
 34272                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 34273 00005ECB A1[8405]                	MOV	AX,[USER_SP]
 34274 00005ECE 8E1E[840D]              	mov	ds,[TEMPSEG]	; restore ds
 34275                                  
 34276 00005ED2 CF                      	IRET			; Long return back to user terminate address
 34277                                  
 34278                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 34279                                  ;
 34280                                  ; Procedure Name : SET_I24_EXTENDED_ERROR
 34281                                  ;
 34282                                  ; This routine handles extended error codes.
 34283                                  ; Input : DI = error code from device
 34284                                  ; Output: All EXTERR fields are set
 34285                                  ;
 34286                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 34287                                  
 34288                                  SET_I24_EXTENDED_ERROR:
 34289 00005ED3 50                      	PUSH	AX
 34290                                  					; ErrMap24End is in DOSDATA
 34291 00005ED4 B8[020F]                	MOV	AX,ErrMap24End
 34292 00005ED7 2D[F20E]                	SUB	AX,ErrMap24
 34293                                  					; Change to dosdata to access 
 34294                                  					; ErrMap24 and EXTERR -SR
 34295                                  	; 05/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 34296                                  	
 34297                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 34298 00005EDA 1E                      	push	ds
 34299                                  	;getdseg <ds>			; ds ->dosdata
 34300 00005EDB 2E8E1E[0700]            	mov	ds,[cs:DosDSeg]
 34301                                  
 34302                                  	; AX is the index of the first unavailable error. Do not translate 
 34303                                  	; if greater or equal to AX.
 34304                                  
 34305 00005EE0 39C7                    	CMP	DI,AX
 34306 00005EE2 89F8                    	MOV	AX,DI
 34307 00005EE4 7306                    	JAE	short NoTrans
 34308                                  
 34309                                  	;MOV	AL,[CS:DI+ErrMap24]  ; MSDOS 3.3
 34310 00005EE6 8A85[F20E]              	mov	al,[ErrMap24+di] ; MSDOS 6.0
 34311 00005EEA 30E4                    	XOR	AH,AH
 34312                                  NoTrans:
 34313                                  	;MOV	[CS:EXTERR],AX
 34314 00005EEC A3[2403]                	mov	[EXTERR],AX
 34315 00005EEF 1F                      	pop	ds
 34316                                  	;assume	ds:nothing
 34317 00005EF0 58                      	POP	AX
 34318                                  
 34319                                  	; Now Extended error is set correctly. Translate it to get correct 
 34320                                  	; error locus class and recommended action.
 34321                                  
 34322 00005EF1 56                      	PUSH	SI
 34323                                  					; ERR_TABLE_24 is in DOSCODE 
 34324 00005EF2 BE[A20E]                	MOV	SI,ERR_TABLE_24
 34325 00005EF5 E8BBA7                  	call	CAL_LK			; Set other extended error fields
 34326 00005EF8 5E                      	POP	SI
 34327 00005EF9 C3                      	retn
 34328                                  
 34329                                  ;============================================================================
 34330                                  ; FAT.ASM, MSDOS 6.0, 1991
 34331                                  ;============================================================================
 34332                                  ; 30/07/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 34333                                  ; 20/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 34334                                  
 34335                                  ;	TITLE	FAT - FAT maintenance routines
 34336                                  ;	NAME	FAT
 34337                                  
 34338                                  ;**	FAT.ASM
 34339                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 34340                                  ;	Low level local device routines for performing disk change sequence,
 34341                                  ;	setting cluster validity, and manipulating the FAT
 34342                                  ;
 34343                                  ;	IsEof
 34344                                  ;	UNPACK
 34345                                  ;	PACK
 34346                                  ;	MAPCLUSTER
 34347                                  ;	FATREAD_SFT
 34348                                  ;	FATREAD_CDS
 34349                                  ;	FAT_operation
 34350                                  ;
 34351                                  ;	Revision history:
 34352                                  ;
 34353                                  ;	  AN000  version Jan. 1988
 34354                                  ;	   A001  PTM	      -- disk changed for look ahead buffers
 34355                                  ;
 34356                                  ;	M014 - if a request for pack\unpack cluster 0 is made we write\read
 34357                                  ;	       from CL0FATENTRY rather than disk.
 34358                                  
 34359                                  ; DOSCODE:94FAh (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
 34360                                  
 34361                                  ;Break <IsEOF - check the quantity in BX for EOF>
 34362                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 34363                                  ;
 34364                                  ; Procedure Name : IsEOF
 34365                                  ;
 34366                                  ; IsEOF - check the fat value in BX for eof.
 34367                                  ;
 34368                                  ;   Inputs:	ES:BP point to DPB
 34369                                  ;		BX has fat value
 34370                                  ;   Outputs:	JAE eof
 34371                                  ;   Registers modified: none
 34372                                  ;
 34373                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 34374                                  
 34375                                  IsEOF:
 34376                                  	;cmp	word [es:bp+0Dh],0FF6h
 34377 00005EFA 26817E0DF60F            	CMP	word [ES:BP+DPB.MAX_CLUSTER],4096-10 ; is this 16 bit fat?
 34378 00005F00 730B                    	JAE	short EOF16			; yes, check for eof there
 34379                                  
 34380                                  ;J.K. 8/27/86
 34381                                  ;Modified to accept 0FF0h as an eof. This is to handle the diskfull case
 34382                                  ;of any media that has "F0"(Other) as a MediaByte.
 34383                                  ;Hopely, this does not create any side effect for those who may use any value
 34384                                  ;other than "FF8-FFF" as an EOF for their own file.
 34385                                  
 34386 00005F02 81FBF00F                	cmp	bx,0FF0h
 34387 00005F06 7404                    	je	short IsEOF_other
 34388                                  
 34389 00005F08 81FBF80F                	CMP	BX,0FF8h		; do the 12 bit compare
 34390                                  IsEOF_other:
 34391 00005F0C C3                      	retn
 34392                                  EOF16:
 34393 00005F0D 83FBF8                  	CMP	BX,0FFF8h		; 16 bit compare
 34394 00005F10 C3                      	retn
 34395                                  
 34396                                  ; DOSCODE:9511h (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
 34397                                  
 34398                                  ;Break	<UNPACK -- UNPACK FAT ENTRIES>
 34399                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 34400                                  ;
 34401                                  ; Procedur Name : UNPACK
 34402                                  ;
 34403                                  ; Inputs:
 34404                                  ;	BX = Cluster number (may be full 16-bit quantity)
 34405                                  ;	ES:BP = Base of drive parameters
 34406                                  ; Outputs:
 34407                                  ;	DI = Contents of FAT for given cluster (may be full 16-bit quantity)
 34408                                  ;	Zero set means DI=0 (free cluster)
 34409                                  ;	Carry set means error (currently user FAILed to I 24)
 34410                                  ; SI Destroyed, No other registers affected. Fatal error if cluster too big.
 34411                                  ;
 34412                                  ; NOTE: if BX = 0 then DI = contents of CL0FATENTRY
 34413                                  ;
 34414                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 34415                                  	
 34416                                  	; 25/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 34417                                  	; DOSCODE:94B5h (MSDOS 5.0, MSDOS.SYS)
 34418                                  
 34419                                  	; 20/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 34420                                  UNPACK:
 34421                                  	; MSDOS 6.0			; M014 - Start
 34422 00005F11 09DB                    	or	bx, bx			; Q: are we unpacking cluster 0
 34423 00005F13 7507                    	jnz	short up_cont		; N: proceed with normal unpack
 34424 00005F15 8B3E[8100]              	mov	di,[CL0FATENTRY]	; Y: return value in CL0FATENTRY
 34425 00005F19 09FF                    	or	di,di 			; return z if di=0
 34426 00005F1B C3                      	retn				; done
 34427                                  up_cont:				; M014 - End
 34428                                  	; MSDOS 3.3 & MSDOS 6.0
 34429                                  	;cmp	bx,[es:bp+0Dh]
 34430 00005F1C 263B5E0D                	CMP	BX,[ES:BP+DPB.MAX_CLUSTER]
 34431 00005F20 7726                    	JA	short HURTFAT
 34432 00005F22 E8D600                  	CALL	MAPCLUSTER
 34433 00005F25 721E                    	jc	short _DoContext
 34434 00005F27 8B3D                    	MOV	DI,[DI]
 34435 00005F29 750E                    	JNZ	short High12		; MZ if high 12 bits, go get 'em
 34436 00005F2B 268B760D                	MOV	SI,[ES:BP+DPB.MAX_CLUSTER] ; MZ is this 16-bit fat?
 34437 00005F2F 81FEF60F                	CMP	SI,4096-10
 34438 00005F33 720C                    	JB	short Unpack12		; MZ No, go 'AND' off bits
 34439 00005F35 09FF                    	OR	DI,DI			; MZ set zero condition code, clears carry
 34440 00005F37 EB0C                    	JMP	SHORT _DoContext 	; MZ go do context
 34441                                  High12:
 34442 00005F39 D1EF                    	SHR	DI,1
 34443 00005F3B D1EF                    	SHR	DI,1
 34444 00005F3D D1EF                    	SHR	DI,1
 34445 00005F3F D1EF                    	SHR	DI,1
 34446                                  Unpack12:
 34447 00005F41 81E7FF0F                	AND	DI,0FFFh		; Clears carry
 34448                                  _DoContext:
 34449 00005F45 16                      	PUSH	SS
 34450 00005F46 1F                      	POP	DS
 34451 00005F47 C3                      	retn
 34452                                  HURTFAT:
 34453                                  	;;mov	word [es:bp+1Eh],0FFFFh
 34454                                  	;mov	word [es:bp+1Fh],0FFFFh  ; MSDOS 6.0
 34455 00005F48 26C7461FFFFF            	MOV	word [ES:BP+DPB.FREE_CNT],-1 ; Err in FAT must force recomp of freespace
 34456 00005F4E 50                      	PUSH	AX
 34457 00005F4F B488                    	MOV	AH,Allowed_FAIL+80h ; 88h
 34458                                  
 34459                                  ;hkn; SS override
 34460 00005F51 36C606[4B03]08          	MOV	byte [SS:ALLOWED],Allowed_FAIL ; 8
 34461                                  ;
 34462                                  ; Signal Bad FAT to INT int_fatal_abort handler. We have an invalid cluster.
 34463                                  ;
 34464 00005F57 BFFF0F                  	MOV	DI,0FFFh		; In case INT int_fatal_abort returns (it shouldn't)
 34465 00005F5A E8C8FD                  	call	FATAL
 34466 00005F5D 3C03                    	CMP	AL,3
 34467 00005F5F F8                      	CLC
 34468 00005F60 7501                    	JNZ	short OKU_RET 		; Try to ignore bad FAT
 34469 00005F62 F9                      	STC				; User said FAIL
 34470                                  OKU_RET:
 34471 00005F63 58                      	POP	AX
 34472                                  hurtfat_retn:
 34473 00005F64 C3                      	retn
 34474                                  
 34475                                  ; DOSCODE:9565h (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
 34476                                  
 34477                                  ;Break	<PACK -- PACK FAT ENTRIES>
 34478                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 34479                                  ;
 34480                                  ; Procedure Name : PACK
 34481                                  ;
 34482                                  ; Inputs:
 34483                                  ;	BX = Cluster number
 34484                                  ;	DX = Data
 34485                                  ;	ES:BP = Pointer to drive DPB
 34486                                  ; Outputs:
 34487                                  ;	The data is stored in the FAT at the given cluster.
 34488                                  ;	SI,DX,DI all destroyed
 34489                                  ;	Carry set means error (currently user FAILed to I 24)
 34490                                  ;	No other registers affected
 34491                                  ;
 34492                                  ; NOTE: if BX = 0 then data in DX is stored in CL0FATENTRY.
 34493                                  ;
 34494                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 34495                                  
 34496                                  	; 25/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 34497                                  	; 20/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 34498                                  PACK:
 34499                                  	; MSDOS 6.0			; M014 - start
 34500 00005F65 09DB                    	or	bx,bx			; Q: are we packing cluster 0
 34501 00005F67 7505                    	jnz	short p_cont		; N: proceed with normal pack
 34502 00005F69 8916[8100]              	mov	[CL0FATENTRY],dx	; Y: place value in CL0FATENTRY
 34503 00005F6D C3                      	retn				; done
 34504                                  p_cont:					; M014 - end
 34505                                  	; MSDOS 3.3 & MSDOS 6.0
 34506 00005F6E E88A00                  	CALL	MAPCLUSTER
 34507 00005F71 72D2                    	JC	short _DoContext
 34508 00005F73 8B35                    	MOV	SI,[DI]
 34509 00005F75 740B                    	JZ	short ALIGNED 		; byte (not nibble) aligned
 34510 00005F77 51                      	PUSH	CX			; move data to upper 12 bits
 34511 00005F78 B104                    	MOV	CL,4
 34512 00005F7A D3E2                    	SHL	DX,CL
 34513 00005F7C 59                      	POP	CX
 34514 00005F7D 83E60F                  	AND	SI,0FH			; leave in original low 4 bits
 34515 00005F80 EB14                    	JMP	SHORT PACKIN
 34516                                  ALIGNED:
 34517                                  	;cmp	word [es:bp+0Dh],0FF6h
 34518 00005F82 26817E0DF60F            	CMP	word [ES:BP+DPB.MAX_CLUSTER],4096-10 ; MZ 16 bit fats?
 34519 00005F88 730A                    	JAE	short Pack16		; MZ yes, go clobber original data
 34520 00005F8A 81E600F0                	AND	SI,0F000h		; MZ leave in upper 4 bits of original
 34521 00005F8E 81E2FF0F                	AND	DX,0FFFh		; MZ store only 12 bits
 34522 00005F92 EB02                    	JMP	SHORT PACKIN		; MZ go store
 34523                                  Pack16:
 34524 00005F94 31F6                    	XOR	SI,SI			; MZ no original data
 34525                                  PACKIN:
 34526 00005F96 09D6                    	OR	SI,DX
 34527 00005F98 8935                    	MOV	[DI],SI
 34528                                  
 34529                                  ;hkn; SS override
 34530 00005F9A 36C536[E205]            	LDS	SI,[SS:CURBUF]
 34531                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 34532 00005F9F F6440540                	TEST	byte [SI+BUFFINFO.buf_flags],buf_dirty
 34533                                  					;LB. if already dirty		  ;AN000;
 34534 00005FA3 7507                    	JNZ	short yesdirty11	;LB.  don't increment dirty count ;AN000;
 34535                                  	; 10/06/2019
 34536 00005FA5 E8B705                  	call	INC_DIRTY_COUNT		;LB.				  ;AN000;
 34537                                  	
 34538                                  	;or	byte [si+5],40h
 34539 00005FA8 804C0540                	OR	byte [SI+BUFFINFO.buf_flags],buf_dirty
 34540                                  yesdirty11:				;LB.				;AN000;
 34541                                  ;hkn; SS override
 34542 00005FAC 36803E[7805]00          	CMP	BYTE [SS:CLUSSPLIT],0	; 15/08/2018
 34543                                  ;hkn; SS is DOSDATA
 34544 00005FB2 16                      	push	ss
 34545 00005FB3 1F                      	pop	ds
 34546 00005FB4 74AE                    	jz	short hurtfat_retn	; Carry clear
 34547 00005FB6 50                      	PUSH	AX
 34548 00005FB7 53                      	PUSH	BX
 34549 00005FB8 51                      	PUSH	CX
 34550 00005FB9 A1[8E05]                	MOV	AX,[CLUSSAVE]
 34551 00005FBC 8E1E[E405]              	MOV	DS,[CURBUF+2]
 34552                                  	;;;add	si,16 ; MSDOS 3.3
 34553                                  	;;add	si,20 ; MSDOS 6.0
 34554                                  	; 02/01/2024
 34555                                  	;add	si,24 ; PCDOS 7.1 
 34556 00005FC0 83C618                  	ADD	SI,BUFINSIZ
 34557 00005FC3 8824                    	MOV	[SI],AH
 34558                                  ;hkn; SS is DOSDATA
 34559                                  	;Context DS
 34560 00005FC5 16                      	push	ss
 34561 00005FC6 1F                      	pop	ds
 34562                                  	
 34563 00005FC7 50                      	PUSH	AX
 34564                                  	
 34565                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 34566 00005FC8 8B16[9205]              	MOV	DX,[CLUSSEC+2]		;F.C. >32mb			;AN000;
 34567 00005FCC 8916[0706]              	MOV	[HIGH_SECTOR],DX	;F.C. >32mb			;AN000;
 34568

 34571                                  
 34572                                  	;MOV	SI,1	  ; *

 34577

 34579 00005FD8 721B                    	JC	short POPP_RET
 34580 00005FDA C53E[E205]              	LDS	DI,[CURBUF]
 34581

 34584                                  					;LB. if already dirty		  ;AN000;

 34586 00005FE4 E87805                  	call	INC_DIRTY_COUNT 	;LB.				  ;AN000;
 34587                                  	
 34588                                  	;or	byte [di+5],40h
 34589 00005FE7 804D0540                	OR	byte [DI+BUFFINFO.buf_flags],buf_dirty 
 34590                                  yesdirty12:
 34591                                  	;;;add	di,16
 34592                                  	;;add	di,20 ; MSDOS 6.0
 34593                                  	;ADD	DI,BUFINSIZ
 34594                                  	;DEC	DI

 34596                                  	;add	di,23 ; PCDOS 7.1
 34597 00005FEB 83C717                  	add	di,BUFINSIZ-1 ; 23 ; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM
 34598                                  	
 34599                                  	;add	di,[es:bp+2]
 34600 00005FEE 26037E02                	ADD	DI,[ES:BP+DPB.SECTOR_SIZE]
 34601 00005FF2 8805                    	MOV	[DI],AL
 34602 00005FF4 F8                      	CLC
 34603                                  POPP_RET:
 34604 00005FF5 16                      	PUSH	SS
 34605 00005FF6 1F                      	POP	DS

 34611                                  ; 31/07/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 34612                                  
 34613                                  ;Break	<MAPCLUSTER - BUFFER A FAT SECTOR>
 34614                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 34615                                  ;
 34616                                  ; Procedure Name : MAPCLUSTER
 34617                                  ;
 34618                                  ; Inputs:
 34619                                  ;	ES:BP Points to DPB
 34620                                  ;	BX Is cluster number
 34621                                  ; Function:
 34622                                  ;	Get a pointer to the cluster
 34623                                  ; Outputs:
 34624                                  ;	DS:DI Points to contents of FAT for given cluster
 34625                                  ;	DS:SI Points to start of buffer
 34626                                  ;	Zero Not set if cluster data is in high 12 bits of word
 34627                                  ;	Zero set if cluster data is in low 12 or 16 bits
 34628                                  ;	Carry set if failed.
 34629                                  ; SI is destroyed.
 34630                                  ;
 34631                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 34632                                  
 34633                                  	; 20/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 34634                                  	; DOSCODE:9601h (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
 34635                                  	; 27/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 34636                                  	; DOSCODE:95A5h (MSDOS 5.0, MSDOS.SYS)
 34637                                  
 34638                                  MAPCLUSTER:
 34639                                  	; IBMDOS.COM (MSDOS 3.3, 1987) - Offset 5A15h
 34640 00005FFB C606[7805]00            	MOV	BYTE [CLUSSPLIT],0
 34641                                  	;SAVE	<AX,BX,CX,DX>
 34642 00006000 50                      	push	ax
 34643 00006001 53                      	push	bx
 34644 00006002 51                      	push	cx
 34645 00006003 52                      	push	dx
 34646 00006004 89D8                    	MOV	AX,BX			; AX = BX
 34647 00006006 26817E0DF60F            	CMP	word [ES:BP+DPB.MAX_CLUSTER],4096-10  ; MZ 16 bit fat?
 34648 0000600C 7302                    	JAE	short Map16		; MZ yes, do 16 bit algorithm
 34649 0000600E D1E8                    	SHR	AX,1			; AX = BX/2
 34650                                  Map16:	
 34651                                  	; MSDOS 6.0			; MZ skip prev => AX=2*BX
 34652 00006010 31FF                    	XOR	DI,DI ; *		; >32mb fat ;AN000;
 34653                                  	; MSDOS 3.3 (& MSDOS 6.0)
 34654 00006012 01D8                    	ADD	AX,BX			; AX = 1.5*fat = byte offset in fat
 34655 00006014 11FF                    	ADC	DI,DI ; * MSDOS 6.0	; >32mb fat ;DI is zero before op;AN000;
 34656 00006016 268B4E02                	MOV	CX,[ES:BP+DPB.SECTOR_SIZE]
 34657                                  
 34658                                  ;IF FastDiv
 34659                                  ;
 34660                                  ; Gross hack: 99% of all disks have 512 bytes per sector. We test for this
 34661                                  ; case and apply a really fast algorithm to get the desired results
 34662                                  ;
 34663                                  ; Divide method takes 157+4*4=173 (MOV and DIV)
 34664                                  ; Fast method takes 39+20*4=119
 34665                                  ;
 34666                                  ; This saves a bunch.
 34667                                  
 34668 0000601A 81F90002                	CMP	CX,512			; 4  Is this 512 byte sector?
 34669 0000601E 7510                    	jne	short _DoDiv		; 4  for no jump
 34670 00006020 89C2                    	MOV	DX,AX			; 2  get set for remainder
 34671 00006022 81E2FF01                	AND	DX,512-1		; 4  Form remainder
 34672 00006026 88E0                    	MOV	AL,AH			; 2  Quotient in formation in AL
 34673                                  	; MDOS 3.3
 34674                                  	;shr	al,1	
 34675                                  	; MDOS 6.0
 34676 00006028 D1EF                    	shr	di,1			; 2
 34677 0000602A D0D8                    	rcr	al,1			; 2
 34678                                  	; MDOS 3.3 (& MSDOS 6.0)
 34679 0000602C 30E4                    	xor	ah,ah			; 3
 34680 0000602E EB04                    	jmp	short DivDone		; 16
 34681                                  _DoDiv:
 34682                                  ;ENDIF
 34683                                  	; MSDOS 3.3
 34684                                  	;xor	dx,dx
 34685                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 34686 00006030 89FA                    	mov	dx,di			; 2
 34687                                  	; MSDOS 3.3 (& MSDOS 6.0)	
 34688 00006032 F7F1                    	DIV	CX			; 155 AX is FAT sector # DX is sector index
 34689                                  ;IF FastDiv
 34690                                  DivDone:
 34691                                  ;ENDIF
 34692                                  	;add	ax,[es:bp+6]
 34693 00006034 26034606                	ADD	AX,[ES:BP+DPB.FIRST_FAT]
 34694 00006038 49                      	DEC	CX			; CX is sector size - 1
 34695                                  	;SAVE	<AX,DX,CX>
 34696 00006039 50                      	push	ax
 34697 0000603A 52                      	push	dx
 34698 0000603B 51                      	push	cx
 34699 0000603C 89C2                    	MOV	DX,AX
 34700                                  
 34701                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 34702                                  	; 22/09/2023
 34703                                  	;MOV	word [HIGH_SECTOR],0 ; *! ;F.C. >32mb  low sector #
 34704                                  	;
 34705                                  	; MDOS 3.3 (& MSDOS 6.0)
 34706                                  	;XOR	AL,AL	   ; *
 34707                                  	;MOV	SI,1	   ; *
 34708                                  	;;invoke GETBUFFRB ; *
 34709                                  	;call	GETBUFFRB  ; *
 34710                                  	; 22/09/2023
 34711 0000603E E8FC02                  	call	GETBUFFRC  ; *!
 34712                                  
 34713                                  	;RESTORE <CX,AX,DX>		; CX is sec siz-1, AX is offset in sec
 34714 00006041 59                      	pop	cx
 34715 00006042 58                      	pop	ax
 34716 00006043 5A                      	pop	dx
 34717 00006044 724C                    	JC	short MAP_POP
 34718                                  
 34719 00006046 C536[E205]              	LDS	SI,[CURBUF]
 34720                                  	;;lea	di,[si+16]
 34721                                  	;lea	di,[si+20] ; MSDOS 6.0
 34722 0000604A 8D7C18                  	LEA	DI,[SI+BUFINSIZ]
 34723 0000604D 01C7                    	ADD	DI,AX
 34724 0000604F 39C8                    	CMP	AX,CX
 34725 00006051 752C                    	JNZ	short MAPRET
 34726 00006053 8A05                    	MOV	AL,[DI]
 34727                                  	;Context DS		 	;hkn; SS is DOSDATA
 34728 00006055 16                      	push	ss
 34729 00006056 1F                      	pop	ds	
 34730 00006057 FE06[7805]              	INC	BYTE [CLUSSPLIT]
 34731 0000605B A2[8E05]                	MOV	[CLUSSAVE],AL
 34732 0000605E 8916[9005]              	MOV	[CLUSSEC],DX
 34733                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 34734 00006062 C706[9205]0000          	MOV	WORD [CLUSSEC+2],0      ;F.C. >32mb	;AN000;
 34735 00006068 42                      	INC	DX
 34736                                  
 34737                                  	; 22/09/2023
 34738                                  	;MOV	word [HIGH_SECTOR],0 ; *! ;F.C. >32mb FAT sector <32mb ;AN000;
 34739                                  	;
 34740                                  	; MDOS 3.3 (& MSDOS 6.0)
 34741                                  	;XOR	AL,AL	   ; *
 34742                                  	;MOV	SI,1	   ; *
 34743                                  	;;invoke GETBUFFRB ; *
 34744                                  	;call	GETBUFFRB  ; *
 34745                                  	; 22/09/2023
 34746 00006069 E8D102                  	call	GETBUFFRC  ; *!
 34747 0000606C 7224                    	JC	short MAP_POP
 34748                                  
 34749 0000606E C536[E205]              	LDS	SI,[CURBUF]
 34750 00006072 8D7C18                  	LEA	DI,[SI+BUFINSIZ]
 34751 00006075 8A05                    	MOV	AL,[DI]
 34752                                  	;Context DS			;hkn; SS is DOSDATA
 34753 00006077 16                      	push	ss
 34754 00006078 1F                      	pop	ds
 34755 00006079 A2[8F05]                	MOV	[CLUSSAVE+1],AL
 34756                                  
 34757                                  ;hkn; CLUSSAVE is in DOSDATA
 34758 0000607C BF[8E05]                	MOV	DI,CLUSSAVE
 34759                                  MAPRET:
 34760                                  	;RESTORE <DX,CX,BX>
 34761 0000607F 5A                      	pop	dx
 34762 00006080 59                      	pop	cx
 34763 00006081 5B                      	pop	bx
 34764 00006082 31C0                    	XOR	AX,AX			; MZ allow shift to clear carry
 34765 00006084 26817E0DF60F            	CMP	word [ES:BP+DPB.MAX_CLUSTER],4096-10 ; MZ is this 16-bit fat?
 34766 0000608A 7302                    	JAE	short MapSet		; MZ no, set flags
 34767 0000608C 89D8                    	MOV	AX,BX
 34768                                  MapSet:
 34769 0000608E A801                    	TEST	AL,1			; set zero flag if not on boundary
 34770                                  	;RESTORE <AX>
 34771 00006090 58                      	pop	ax
 34772 00006091 C3                      	retn
 34773                                  
 34774                                  MAP_POP:
 34775                                  	;RESTORE <DX,CX,BX,AX>
 34776 00006092 5A                      	pop	dx
 34777 00006093 59                      	pop	cx
 34778 00006094 5B                      	pop	bx
 34779 00006095 58                      	pop	ax
 34780                                  fatread_sft_retn: ; 17/12/2022
 34781 00006096 C3                      	retn
 34782                                  
 34783                                  ; 20/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 34784                                  ; DOSCODE:96B3h (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
 34785                                  ; 27/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 34786                                  ; DOSCODE:9657h (MSDOS 5.0, MSDOS.SYS)
 34787                                  
 34788                                  ;Break	<FATREAD_SFT/FATREAD_CDS -- CHECK DRIVE GET FAT>
 34789                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 34790                                  ;
 34791                                  ; Procedure Name : FATREAD_SFT
 34792                                  ;
 34793                                  ; Inputs:
 34794                                  ;	ES:DI points to an SFT for the drive of interest (local only,
 34795                                  ;		giving a NET SFT will produce system crashing results).
 34796                                  ;	DS DOSDATA
 34797                                  ; Function:
 34798                                  ;	Can be used by an SFT routine (like CLOSE) to invalidate buffers
 34799                                  ;	if disk changed.
 34800                                  ;	In other respects, same as FATREAD_CDS.
 34801                                  ;	(note ES:DI destroyed!)
 34802                                  ; Outputs:
 34803                                  ;	Carry set if error (currently user FAILed to I 24)
 34804                                  ; NOTE: This routine may cause FATREAD_CDS to "miss" a disk change
 34805                                  ;	as far as invalidating curdir_ID is concerned.
 34806                                  ;	Since getting a true disk changed on this call is a screw up
 34807                                  ;	anyway, that's the way it goes.
 34808                                  ;
 34809                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 34810                                  
 34811                                  FATREAD_SFT:
 34812 00006097 26C46D07                	LES	BP,[ES:DI+SF_ENTRY.sf_devptr]
 34813                                  	; 27/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS compatibility)
 34814                                  	;MOV	AL,[ES:BP+DPB.DRIVE] ; [es:bp+0]
 34815                                  	; 15/12/2022
 34816 0000609B 268A4600                	mov	AL,[ES:BP]
 34817 0000609F A2[7605]                	MOV	[THISDRV],AL
 34818 000060A2 E8C2A5                  	call	GOTDPB			; Set THISDPB
 34819                                  	;CALL	FAT_GOT_DPB
 34820                                  	; 17/12/2022
 34821 000060A5 E99F00                  	jmp	FAT_GOT_DPB
 34822                                  ;fatread_sft_retn:
 34823                                  	;retn
 34824                                  
 34825                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 34826                                  ;
 34827                                  ; Procedure Name : FATREAD_CDS
 34828                                  ;
 34829                                  ; Inputs:
 34830                                  ;	DS:DOSDATA
 34831                                  ;	ES:DI points to an CDS for the drive of interest (local only,
 34832                                  ;		giving a NET or NUL CDS will produce system crashing results).
 34833                                  ; Function:
 34834                                  ;	If disk may have been changed, media is determined and buffers are
 34835                                  ;	flagged invalid. If not, no action is taken.
 34836                                  ; Outputs:
 34837                                  ;	ES:BP = Drive parameter block
 34838                                  ;	THISDPB = ES:BP
 34839                                  ;	THISDRV set
 34840                                  ;	Carry set if error (currently user FAILed to I 24)
 34841                                  ; DS preserved , all other registers destroyed
 34842                                  ;
 34843                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 34844                                  
 34845                                  	; 20/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 34846                                  	; DOSCODE:96C5h (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
 34847                                  	; 27/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 34848                                  	; DOSCODE:9669h (MSDOS 5.0, MSDOS.SYS)
 34849                                  
 34850                                  FATREAD_CDS:
 34851 000060A8 06                      	PUSH	ES
 34852 000060A9 57                      	PUSH	DI
 34853                                  	;les	bp,[es:di+45h]
 34854 000060AA 26C46D45                	LES	BP,[ES:DI+curdir.devptr]
 34855                                  	; 27/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS compatibility)
 34856                                  	;MOV	AL,[ES:BP+DPB.DRIVE] ; [es:bp+0]
 34857                                  	; 15/12/2022
 34858 000060AE 268A4600                	mov	AL,[ES:BP]
 34859 000060B2 A2[7605]                	MOV	[THISDRV],AL
 34860 000060B5 E8AFA5                  	call	GOTDPB			;Set THISDPB
 34861 000060B8 E88C00                  	CALL	FAT_GOT_DPB
 34862 000060BB 5F                      	POP	DI			;Get back CDS pointer
 34863 000060BC 07                      	POP	ES
 34864 000060BD 72D7                    	jc	short fatread_sft_retn
 34865 000060BF 7538                    	JNZ	short NO_CHANGE		;Media NOT changed
 34866                                  
 34867                                  ;	Media changed. We now need to find all CDS structures which use this
 34868                                  ;	DPB and invalidate their ID pointers.
 34869                                  
 34870                                  MED_CHANGE:
 34871 000060C1 31C0                    	XOR	AX,AX
 34872 000060C3 48                      	DEC	AX			; AX = -1
 34873 000060C4 1E                      	PUSH	DS
 34874 000060C5 8A0E[4700]              	MOV	CL,[CDSCOUNT]
 34875 000060C9 30ED                    	XOR	CH,CH			; CX is number of structures
 34876                                  	;lds	si,[es:di+45h]
 34877 000060CB 26C57545                	LDS	SI,[ES:DI+curdir.devptr] ; Find all CDS with this devptr
 34878                                  
 34879                                  ;hkn; SS override
 34880                                  
 34881                                  ;	Find all CDSs with this DevPtr
 34882                                  ;
 34883                                  ;	(ax) = -1
 34884                                  ;	(ds:si) = DevPtr
 34885                                  
 34886 000060CF 36C43E[3C00]            	LES	DI,[SS:CDSADDR]		; (es:di) = CDS pointer
 34887                                  frcd20: 
 34888                                  	;;test	word [es:di+43h],8000h
 34889                                  	;TEST	word [ES:DI+curdir.flags],curdir_isnet
 34890 000060D4 26F6454480              	TEST	byte [ES:DI+curdir.flags+1],(curdir_isnet>>8)
 34891 000060D9 7518                    	JNZ	short frcd25		; Leave NET guys alone!!
 34892                                  
 34893                                  	; MSDOS 3.3
 34894                                  	;push	es
 34895                                  	;push	di
 34896                                  	;les	di,[es:di+45h]
 34897                                  	;;les	di,[ES:DI+curdir.devptr]
 34898                                  	;call	POINTCOMP
 34899                                  	;pop	di
 34900                                  	;pop	es
 34901                                  	;jnz	short frcd25
 34902                                  
 34903                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 34904 000060DB 263B7545                	cmp	si,[ES:DI+curdir.devptr]
 34905 000060DF 7512                    	jne	short frcd25		; no match
 34906 000060E1 8CDB                    	mov	bx,ds
 34907 000060E3 263B5D47                	cmp	bx,[ES:DI+curdir.devptr+2]
 34908 000060E7 750A                    	jne	short frcd25		; CDS not for this drive
 34909                                  
 34910                                  	; MSDOS 3.3 (& MSDOS 6.0)
 34911                                  	;test	[es:di+49h],ax
 34912 000060E9 26854549                	test	[ES:DI+curdir.ID],AX
 34913 000060ED 7404                    	JZ	short frcd25		; If root (0), leave root
 34914                                  	;mov	[es:di+49h],ax
 34915 000060EF 26894549                	MOV	[ES:DI+curdir.ID],AX	; else invalid
 34916                                  frcd25:	
 34917                                  	;;add	di,81  ; MSDOS 3.3
 34918                                  	;add	di,88  ; MSDOS 6.0	 
 34919 000060F3 83C758                  	ADD	DI,curdir.size		; Point to next CDS
 34920 000060F6 E2DC                    	LOOP	frcd20
 34921 000060F8 1F                      	POP	DS
 34922                                  NO_CHANGE:
 34923 000060F9 C42E[8A05]              	LES	BP,[THISDPB]
 34924 000060FD F8                      	CLC
 34925 000060FE C3                      	retn
 34926                                  
 34927                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 34928                                  ; 05/01/2024 - Retro DOS 5.0
 34929                                  ; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM - DOSCODE:0A7Fh
 34930                                  ;;;
 34931                                  chk_set_first_access:
 34932 000060FF 26837E0F00              	cmp	word [es:bp+0Fh],0	; DPB.FATSIZE
 34933 00006104 750D                    	jnz	short chk_set_fa_1	; FAT (FAT12 or FAT16)
 34934                                  					; FAT32
 34935 00006106 26837E21FF              	cmp	word [es:bp+21h],0FFFFh	; DPB.FREE_CNT_HW
 34936 0000610B 26C74621FFFF            	mov	word [es:bp+21h],0FFFFh	; High word of free cluster count
 34937 00006111 7505                    	jne	short chk_set_fa_2
 34938                                  chk_set_fa_1:
 34939 00006113 26837E1FFF              	cmp	word [es:bp+1Fh],0FFFFh	; DPB.FREE_CNT
 34940                                  chk_set_fa_2:
 34941 00006118 26C7461FFFFF            	mov	word [es:bp+1Fh],0FFFFh	; Count of free clusters, -1 if unknown
 34942 0000611E 7405                    	je	short chk_set_fa_3
 34943 00006120 26804E1801              	or	byte [es:bp+18h],1	; DPB.FIRST_ACCESS
 34944                                  chk_set_fa_3:
 34945 00006125 C3                      	retn
 34946                                  ;;;
 34947                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 34948                                  
 34949                                  
 34950                                  ;Break	<Fat_Operation - miscellaneous fat stuff>
 34951                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 34952                                  ;
 34953                                  ; Procedure Name : FAT_operation
 34954                                  ;
 34955                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 34956                                  
 34957                                  	; 27/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 34958                                  
 34959                                  FAT_operation:
 34960                                  	; 31/07/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 34961                                  FATERR:
 34962                                  	;mov	word [es:bp+1Eh],-1
 34963                                  	;mov	word [es:bp+1Fh],-1 ; MSDOS 6.0
 34964 00006126 26C7461FFFFF            	MOV	word [ES:BP+DPB.FREE_CNT],-1 
 34965                                  					; Err in FAT must force recomp of freespace
 34966                                  	;and	di,0FFh
 34967 0000612C 81E7FF00                	AND	DI,STECODE		; Put error code in DI
 34968                                  	;mov	byte [ALLOWED],18h
 34969 00006130 C606[4B03]18            	MOV	byte [ALLOWED],Allowed_FAIL+Allowed_RETRY
 34970                                  	;mov	ah,1Ah
 34971 00006135 B41A                    	MOV	AH,2+Allowed_FAIL+Allowed_RETRY ; While trying to read FAT
 34972 00006137 A0[7605]                	MOV	AL,[THISDRV]		; Tell which drive
 34973 0000613A E8ECFB                  	call	FATAL1
 34974 0000613D C42E[8A05]              	LES	BP,[THISDPB]
 34975 00006141 3C03                    	CMP	AL,3
 34976 00006143 7502                    	JNZ	short FAT_GOT_DPB	; User said retry
 34977 00006145 F9                      	STC				; User said FAIL
 34978 00006146 C3                      	retn
 34979                                  
 34980                                  FAT_GOT_DPB:
 34981                                  	;Context DS			;hkn; SS is DOSDATA
 34982 00006147 16                      	push	ss
 34983 00006148 1F                      	pop	ds
 34984                                  	;mov	al,0Fh
 34985 00006149 B00F                    	MOV	AL,DMEDHL
 34986                                  	;mov	ah,[es:bp+1]

 35323                                  ;SUBTTL SETVISIT,SKIPVISIT -- MANAGE BUFFER SCANS
 35324                                  ;
 35325                                  ;SETVISIT:
 35326                                  ;	; 31/07/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 35327                                  ;	; IBMDOS.COM (MSDOS 3.3, 1987) - Offset 5CAFh
 35328                                  ;; Inputs:
 35329                                  ;;      None
 35330                                  ;; Function:
 35331                                  ;;      Set up a scan of I/O buffers
 35332                                  ;; Outputs:
 35333                                  ;;      All visit flags = 0
 35334                                  ;;              NOTE: This pre-scan is needed because a hard disk error
 35335                                  ;;                    may cause a scan to stop in the middle leaving some
 35336                                  ;;                    visit flags set, and some not set.
 35337                                  ;;      DS:DI Points to [BUFFHEAD]
 35338                                  ;; No other registers altered
 35339                                  ;
 35340                                  ;       LDS     DI,[SS:BUFFHEAD] ; 15/03/2018
 35341                                  ;	PUSH    AX
 35342                                  ;       ;;XOR	AX,AX	  ;; MSDOS 2.11
 35343                                  ;	;mov	al,0DFh
 35344                                  ;	mov	al,~buf_visit
 35345                                  ;SETLOOP:
 35346                                  ;       ;;MOV	[DI+7],AL ;; MSDOS 2.11
 35347                                  ;	;and	[DI+5],al
 35348                                  ;	AND	[DI+BUFFINFO.buf_flags],AL
 35349                                  ;       LDS     DI,[DI]
 35350                                  ;       CMP     DI,-1
 35351                                  ;       JNZ     SHORT SETLOOP
 35352                                  ;       POP     AX ; 09/09/2018
 35353                                  ;	LDS     DI,[SS:BUFFHEAD] ; 15/03/2018
 35354                                  ;SVISIT_RETN:
 35355                                  ;       RETN
 35356                                  ;
 35357                                  ;SKIPVISIT:
 35358                                  ;	; 31/07/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 35359                                  ;	; IBMDOS.COM (MSDOS 3.3, 1987) - Offset 5CC8h
 35360                                  ;
 35361                                  ;; Inputs:
 35362                                  ;;      DS:DI Points to a buffer
 35363                                  ;; Function:
 35364                                  ;;      Skip visited buffers
 35365                                  ;; Outputs:
 35366                                  ;;      DS:DI Points to next unvisited buffer
 35367                                  ;;      Zero is set if skip to LAST buffer
 35368                                  ;; No other registers altered
 35369                                  ;
 35370                                  ;       CMP     DI,-1
 35371                                  ;       ;retz
 35372                                  ;       JZ	SHORT SVISIT_RETN
 35373                                  ;
 35374                                  ;	;;CMP	BYTE [DI+7],1 ;; MSDOS 2.11
 35375                                  ;       ;;;retnz
 35376                                  ;       ;;JNZ	SHORT SVISIT_RETN
 35377                                  ;
 35378                                  ;	;test	byte [di+5],20h
 35379                                  ;	TEST	byte [DI+BUFFINFO.buf_flags],buf_visit	
 35380                                  ;	JNZ	short SKIPLOOP
 35381                                  ;	
 35382                                  ;	push	ax
 35383                                  ;	or	al,1
 35384                                  ;	pop	ax
 35385                                  ;	retn	
 35386                                  ;
 35387                                  ;SKIPLOOP:
 35388                                  ;	LDS     DI,[DI]
 35389                                  ;       JMP     SHORT SKIPVISIT
