 35399                                  
 35400                                  ;**	BUF.ASM - Low level routines for buffer cache management
 35401                                  ;
 35402                                  ;	GETCURHEAD
 35403                                  ;	ScanPlace
 35404                                  ;	PLACEBUF
 35405                                  ;	PLACEHEAD
 35406                                  ;	PointComp
 35407                                  ;	GETBUFFR

 35413                                  ;	Revision history:
 35414                                  ;
 35415                                  ;		AN000  version 4.00  Jan. 1988
 35416                                  ;		A004   PTM 3765 -- Disk reset failed
 35417                                  ;		M039 DB 10/17/90 - Disk write optimization
 35418                                  ;		I001   5.0 PTR 722211 - Preserve CY when in buffer in HMA
 35419                                  
 35420                                  ;Break	<GETCURHEAD -- Get current buffer header>
 35421                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 35422                                  ; Procedure Name : GetCurHead
 35423                                  ; Inputs:
 35424                                  ;	 No Inputs
 35425                                  ; Function:
 35426                                  ;	Returns the pointer to the first buffer in Queue
 35427                                  ;	and updates FIRST_BUFF_ADDR
 35428                                  ;       and invalidates LASTBUFFER (recency pointer)
 35429                                  ; Outputs:
 35430                                  ;	DS:DI = pointer to the first buffer in Queue
 35431                                  ;	FIRST_BUFF_ADDR = offset ( DI ) of First buffer in Queue
 35432                                  ;       LASTBUFFER = -1
 35433                                  ; No other registers altered
 35434                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 35435                                  
 35436                                  ; 04/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 35437                                  ; DOSCODE:98D2h (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
 35438                                  ; 27/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 35439                                  ; DOSCODE:9876h (MSDOS 5.0, MSDOS.SYS)
 35440                                  
 35441                                  GETCURHEAD:

 35675                                  ;
 35676                                  ; Procedure Name : PointComp
 35677                                  ; Inputs:
 35678                                  ;         DS:SI & ES:DI
 35679                                  ; Function:
 35680                                  ;          Checks for ((SI==DI) && (ES==DS))
 35681                                  ;	   Assumes that pointers are normalized for the
 35682                                  ;	   same segment
 35683                                  ;
 35684                                  ; Compare DS:SI to ES:DI (or DS:DI to ES:SI) for equality
 35685                                  ; DO NOT USE FOR < or >
 35686                                  ; No Registers altered

 35688                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 35689                                  
 35690                                  POINTCOMP:
 35691                                  	; 31/07/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 35692                                  	; IBMDOS.COM (MSDOS 3.3, 1987) - Offset 5D84h

 35709                                  ;Break	<GETBUFFR, GETBUFFRB -- GET A SECTOR INTO A BUFFER>
 35710                                  
 35711                                  ;**	GetBuffr - Get a non-FAT Sector into a Buffer
 35712                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 35713                                  ;	GetBuffr does normal ( non-FAT ) sector buffering
 35714                                  ;	It gets the specified local sector into one of the I/O buffers
 35715                                  ;	and shuffles the queue
 35716                                  ; 
 35717                                  ;	ENTRY	(AL) = 0 means sector must be pre-read
 35718                                  ;		       ELSE no pre-read
 35719                                  ;		(DX) = Desired physical sector number	      (LOW)
 35720                                  ;		HIGH_SECTOR = Desired physical sector number (HIGH)
 35721                                  ;		(ES:BP) = Pointer to drive parameters
 35722                                  ;		ALLOWED set in case of INT 24
 35723                                  ;	EXIT	'C' set if error (user FAIL response to INT24)
 35724                                  ;		'C' clear if OK
 35725                                  ;		CURBUF Points to the Buffer for the sector
 35726                                  ;		    the buffer type bits OF buf_flags = 0, caller must set it
 35727                                  ;	USES	AX, BX, CX, SI, DI, Flags
 35728                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 35729                                  
 35730                                  ;**	GetBuffrb - Get a FAT Sector into a Buffer
 35731                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 35732                                  ;	GetBuffrb reads a sector from the FAT file system's FAT table.
 35733                                  ;	It gets the specified sector into one of the I/O buffers
 35734                                  ;	and shuffles the queue. We need a special entry point so that
 35735                                  ;	we can read the alternate FAT sector if the first read fails, also
 35736                                  ;	so we can mark the buffer as a FAT sector.
 35737                                  ; 
 35738                                  ;	ENTRY	(AL) = 0 means sector must be pre-read
 35739                                  ;		       ELSE no pre-read
 35740                                  ;		(DX) = Desired physical sector number	     (LOW)
 35741                                  ;		(SI) != 0
 35742                                  ;		HIGH_SECTOR = Desired physical sector number (HIGH)
 35743                                  ;		(ES:BP) = Pointer to drive parameters
 35744                                  ;		ALLOWED set in case of INT 24
 35745                                  ;	EXIT	'C' set if error (user FAIL response to INT24)
 35746                                  ;		'C' clear if OK
 35747                                  ;		CUR ddBUF Points to the Buffer for the sector
 35748                                  ;		    the buffer type bits OF buf_flags = 0, caller must set it
 35749                                  ;	USES	AX, BX, CX, SI, DI, Flags
 35750                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 35751                                  
 35752                                  	; 22/09/2023 - RetroDOS v4.2 MSDOS.SYS (optimization)

 35858                                  ;	The requested sector is not available in the buffers. DS:DI now points
 35859                                  ;	to the first buffer in the Queue. Flush the first buffer & read in the
 35860                                  ;	new sector into it.
 35861                                  ;

 35869                                  ;	(si) = 0 iff non fat sector, != 0 if FAT sector read

 36198                                  ;	   DS:DI - pointer to buffer

 36207                                  	; MSDOS 6.0

 36218                                  DOBUFFER:

 36220 0000649E F6450540                	TEST	byte [DI+BUFFINFO.buf_flags],buf_dirty
 36221 000064A2 74E8                    	jz	short flushbuf_retn	; Buffer not dirty, carry clear by TEST
 36222 000064A4 50                      	PUSH	AX
 36223                                  	;push	word [di+4]

 36225 000064A8 E80B00                  	CALL	BUFWRITE
 36226 000064AB 58                      	POP	AX

 36228                                  	;and	ah,0BFh
 36229 000064AE 80E4BF                  	AND	AH,~buf_dirty		; Buffer is clean, clears carry
 36230                                  	;mov	[di+4],ax
 36231 000064B1 894504                  	MOV	[DI+BUFFINFO.buf_ID],AX
 36232                                  LEAVE_BUF:
 36233 000064B4 58                      	POP	AX			; Search info
 36234                                  checkflush_retn:

 36237                                  ;Break	<BUFWRITE -- WRITE OUT A BUFFER IF DIRTY>

 36239                                  ;
 36240                                  ;	BufWrite writes a buffer to the disk, if it's dirty.
 36241                                  ;
 36242                                  ;	ENTRY	DS:DI Points to the buffer
 36243                                  ;

 36245                                  ;		Carry set if error (currently user FAILed to I 24)

 36371 00006537 E2C9                    	LOOP	WRTAGAIN
 36372 00006539 5B                      	pop	bx ; **
 36373 0000653A 1F                      	pop	ds ; *
 36374                                  	;OR	DI,DI		; Clears carry
 36375                                  	;JNZ	short BWROK	; At least one write worked
 36376                                  	;STC			; DI never got INCed, all writes failed.
 36377                                  	; 22/09/2023
 36378 0000653B 83FF01                  	cmp	di,1
 36379                                  BWROK:	
 36380 0000653E 5F                      	POP	DI
 36381 0000653F C3                      	retn

 36383                                  ;**	Set_RQ_SC_Parms - Set Secondary Cache Parameters
 36384                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 36385                                  ;	Set_RQ_SC_Parms sets the sector size and drive number value
 36386                                  ;	for the secondary cache. This updates SC_SECTOR_SIZE &
 36387                                  ;	SC_DRIVE even if SC is disabled to save the testing
 36388                                  ;	code and time
 36389                                  ;
 36390                                  ;	ENTRY	ES:BP = drive parameter block
 36391                                  ;
 36392                                  ;	EXIT	[SC_SECTOR_SIZE]= drive sector size
 36393                                  ;		[SC_DRIVE]= drive #
 36394                                  ;
 36395                                  ;	USES	Flags
 36396                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 36397                                  
 36398                                  ; 27/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 36399                                  ; 04/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 36400                                  
 36401                                  SET_RQ_SC_PARMS:

 36406 00006545 36A3[FE0D]              	MOV	[ss:SC_SECTOR_SIZE],ax
 36407                                  	;;mov	al,[es:bp+0]
 36408                                  	; 27/11/2022 MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS compatibility)
 36409                                  	;MOV	al,[ES:BP+DPB.DRIVE]		; save drive #
 36410                                  	; 15/12/2022
 36411 00006549 268A4600                	mov	al,[ES:BP]
 36412 0000654D 36A2[000E]              	MOV	[ss:SC_DRIVE],al
 36413 00006551 58                      	pop	ax
 36414                                  srspx:	
 36415 00006552 C3                      	retn					;LB. return

 36473                                  ; MSPROC.ASM, MSDOS 6.0, 1992
 36474                                  ;============================================================================
 36475                                  ; 02/08/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 36476                                  ; 29/04/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 36477                                  
 36478                                  ; (15/04/2018 - RetrO DOS v2.0, MSDOS 2.11 - PROC.ASM - 1983)
 36479                                  
 36480                                  ; Pseudo EXEC system call for DOS
 36481                                  
 36482                                  ;	TITLE	MSPROC - process maintenance
 36483                                  ;	NAME	MSPROC
 36484                                  
 36485                                  ; =========================================================================
 36486                                  ;**	Process related system calls and low level routines for DOS 2.X.
 36487                                  ;	I/O specs are defined in DISPATCH.
 36488                                  ;
 36489                                  ;	$WAIT
 36490                                  ;	$EXEC
 36491                                  ;	$Keep_process
 36492                                  ;	Stay_resident
 36493                                  ;	$EXIT
 36494                                  ;	$ABORT
 36495                                  ;	abort_inner
 36496                                  ;
 36497                                  ;	Modification history:
 36498                                  ;
 36499                                  ;		Created: ARR 30 March 1983
 36500                                  ;		AN000	version 4.0 jan. 1988
 36501                                  ;		A007	PTM 3957 - fake vesrion for IBMCACHE.COM
 36502                                  ;		A008	PTM 4070 - fake version for MS WINDOWS
 36503                                  ;
 36504                                  ;		M000	added support for loading programs into UMBs 7/9/90
 36505                                  ;
 36506                                  ;		M004 - MS PASCAL 3.2 support. Please see under tag M003 in 
 36507                                  ;		       dossym.inc. 7/30/90
 36508                                  ;		M005 - Support for EXE programs with out STACK segment and 
 36509                                  ;		       with resident size < 64K - 256 bytes. A 256 byte 
 36510                                  ;		       stack is provided at the end of the program. Note that
 36511                                  ;		       only SP is changed.
 36512                                  ;		M020 - Fix for Rational bug for details see exepatch.asm
 36513                                  ;
 36514                                  ;		M028 - 4b04 implementation
 36515                                  ;
 36516                                  ;		M029 - Support for EXEs without stack rewritten. If EXE is
 36517                                  ;			in memory block >= 64K, sp = 0. If memory block
 36518                                  ;			obtained is <64K, point sp at the end of the memory
 36519                                  ;			block. For EXEs smaller than 64K, 256 bytes are still
 36520                                  ;			added for a stack segment which may be needed if it
 36521                                  ;			is loaded in low memory situations.
 36522                                  ;
 36523                                  ;		M030 - Fixing bug in EXEPACPATCH & changing 4b04 to 4b05
 36524                                  ;
 36525                                  ;		M040 - Bug #3052. The environment sizing code would flag a
 36526                                  ;			a bad environment if it reached 32767 bytes. Changed
 36527                                  ;			to allow 32768 bytes of environment.
 36528                                  ;
 36529                                  ;		M047 - Release the allocated UMB when we failed to load a 
 36530                                  ;		       COM file high. Also ensure that if the biggest block
 36531                                  ;		       into which we load the com file is less than 64K then
 36532                                  ;		       we provide atleast 256 bytes of stack to the user.
 36533                                  ;
 36534                                  ;		M050 - Made Lie table search CASE insensitive
 36535                                  ;
 36536                                  ;		M060 - Removed special version table from the kernal and
 36537                                  ;                      put it in a device drive which puts the address
 36538                                  ;                      in the DOS DATA area location UU_IFS_DOS_CALL
 36539                                  ;		       as a DWORD.
 36540                                  ;
 36541                                  ;		M063 - Modified UMB support. If the HIGH_ONLY bit is set on
 36542                                  ;		       entry do not try to load low if there is no space in
 36543                                  ;		       UMBs.
 36544                                  ;
 36545                                  ;		M068 - Support for copy protect apps. Call ChkCopyProt to 
 36546                                  ;		       set a20off_count. Set bit EXECA20BIT in DOS_FLAG. Also
 36547                                  ;		       change return address to LeaveDos if AL=5.
 36548                                  ;
 36549                                  ;               20-Jul-1992 bens  Added ifdef RESTRICTED_BUILD code that
 36550                                  ;                      controls building a version of MSDOS.SYS that only
 36551                                  ;                      runs programs from a fixed list (defined in the
 36552                                  ;                      file RESTRICT.INC).  Search for "RESTRICTED_BUILD"
 36553                                  ;                      for details.  This feature is used to build a
 36554                                  ;                      "special" version of DOS that can be handed out to
 36555                                  ;                      OEM/ISV customers as part of a "service" disk.
 36556                                  ;
 36557                                  ; =========================================================================
 36558                                  
 36559                                  ;SAVEXIT  EQU  10
 36560                                  
 36561                                  ;BREAK	<$WAIT - return previous process error code>
 36562                                  ; =========================================================================
 36563                                  ;	$WAIT - Return previous process error code.
 36564                                  ;
 36565                                  ;	Assembler usage:
 36566                                  ;
 36567                                  ;	    MOV     AH, WaitProcess
 36568                                  ;	    INT     int_command
 36569                                  ;
 36570                                  ;	ENTRY	none
 36571                                  ;	EXIT	(ax) = exit code
 36572                                  ;	USES	all
 36573                                  ; =========================================================================
 36574

 36577

 36579                                  	; DOSCODE:9A5Ah (MSDOS 5.0, MSDOS.SYS)	
 36580                                  _$WAIT:
 36581                                  	; 02/08/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 36582                                  	; IBMDOS.COM (MSDOS 3.3, 1987) - Offset 5E1h
 36583                                  
 36584 00006573 31C0                    	xor	AX,AX

 36588                                  ; =========================================================================
 36589                                  ;BREAK <$exec - load/go a program>
 36590                                  ;	EXEC.ASM - EXEC System Call
 36591                                  ;
 36592                                  ;
 36593                                  ; Assembler usage:
 36594                                  ;	    lds     DX, Name
 36595                                  ;	    les     BX, Blk
 36596                                  ;	    mov     AH, Exec
 36597                                  ;	    mov     AL, FUNC
 36598                                  ;	    int     INT_COMMAND
 36599                                  ;
 36600                                  ;	AL  Function
 36601                                  ;	--  --------
 36602                                  ;	 0  Load and execute the program.
 36603                                  ;	 1  Load, create the program header but do not
 36604                                  ;	    begin execution.
 36605                                  ;	 3  Load overlay. No header created.
 36606                                  ;
 36607                                  ;	    AL = 0 -> load/execute program
 36608                                  ;
 36609                                  ;	    +---------------------------+
 36610                                  ;	    | WORD segment address of	|
 36611                                  ;	    | environment.		|
 36612                                  ;	    +---------------------------+
 36613                                  ;	    | DWORD pointer to ASCIZ	|
 36614                                  ;	    | command line at 80h	|
 36615                                  ;	    +---------------------------+
 36616                                  ;	    | DWORD pointer to default	|
 36617                                  ;	    | FCB to be passed at 5Ch	|
 36618                                  ;	    +---------------------------+
 36619                                  ;	    | DWORD pointer to default	|
 36620                                  ;	    | FCB to be passed at 6Ch	|
 36621                                  ;	    +---------------------------+
 36622                                  ;
 36623                                  ;	    AL = 1 -> load program
 36624                                  ;
 36625                                  ;	    +---------------------------+
 36626                                  ;	    | WORD segment address of	|
 36627                                  ;	    | environment.		|
 36628                                  ;	    +---------------------------+
 36629                                  ;	    | DWORD pointer to ASCIZ	|
 36630                                  ;	    | command line at 80h	|
 36631                                  ;	    +---------------------------+
 36632                                  ;	    | DWORD pointer to default	|
 36633                                  ;	    | FCB to be passed at 5Ch	|
 36634                                  ;	    +---------------------------+
 36635                                  ;	    | DWORD pointer to default	|
 36636                                  ;	    | FCB to be passed at 6Ch	|
 36637                                  ;	    +---------------------------+
 36638                                  ;	    | DWORD returned value of	|
 36639                                  ;	    | CS:IP			|
 36640                                  ;	    +---------------------------+
 36641                                  ;	    | DWORD returned value of	|
 36642                                  ;	    | SS:IP			|
 36643                                  ;	    +---------------------------+
 36644                                  ;
 36645                                  ;	    AL = 3 -> load overlay
 36646                                  ;
 36647                                  ;	    +---------------------------+
 36648                                  ;	    | WORD segment address where|
 36649                                  ;	    | file will be loaded.	|
 36650                                  ;	    +---------------------------+
 36651                                  ;	    | WORD relocation factor to |
 36652                                  ;	    | be applied to the image.	|
 36653                                  ;	    +---------------------------+
 36654                                  ;
 36655                                  ; Returns:
 36656                                  ;	    AX = error_invalid_function
 36657                                  ;	       = error_bad_format
 36658                                  ;	       = error_bad_environment
 36659                                  ;	       = error_not_enough_memory
 36660                                  ;	       = error_file_not_found
 36661                                  ; =========================================================================
 36662                                  ;
 36663                                  ;   Revision history:
 36664                                  ;
 36665                                  ;	 A000	version 4.00  Jan. 1988
 36666                                  ;
 36667                                  ; =========================================================================
 36668                                  
 36669                                  Exec_Internal_Buffer		EQU	OPENBUF
 36670                                  Exec_Internal_Buffer_Size	EQU	(128+128+53+curdirLen)
 36671

 36675                                  ;%out	Please make sure that the following are contiguous and of the
 36676                                  ;%out	following sizes:
 36677                                  ;%out
 36678                                  ;%out	OpenBuf     128
 36679                                  ;%out	RenBuf	    128
 36680                                  ;%out	SearchBuf    53

 36696                                  _$EXEC:
 36697                                  	; 02/08/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0

 36699                                  
 36700                                  EXEC001S:
 36701                                  	;LocalVar    Exec_Blk		,DWORD
 36702                                  	;LocalVar    Exec_Func		,BYTE
 36703                                  	;LocalVar    Exec_Load_High	,BYTE
 36704                                  	;LocalVar    Exec_FH		,WORD
 36705                                  	;LocalVar    Exec_Rel_Fac	,WORD

 36713                                  	;
 36714                                  	;LocalVar    Exec_DMA_Save	,WORD

 36716                                  
 36717                                  	; MSDOS 3.3 (& MSDOS 6.0)
 36718                                  	;%define	Exec_Blk	dword [bp-4]
 36719                                  	%define		Exec_Blk	[bp-4] ; 09/08/2018
 36720                                  	%define		Exec_BlkL	word [bp-4]	
 36721                                  	%define		Exec_BlkH	word [bp-2]
 36722                                  	%define		Exec_Func	byte [bp-5]
 36723                                  	%define		Exec_Load_High	byte [bp-6]

 36726                                  	%define		Exec_Res_Len_Para word [bp-12]
 36727                                  	%define		Exec_Environ	word [bp-14]
 36728                                  	%define		Exec_Size	word [bp-16]
 36729                                  	%define		Exec_Load_Block	word [bp-18]
 36730                                  	%define		Exec_DMA	word [bp-20]
 36731                                  	%define		ExecNameLen	word [bp-22]
 36732                                  	;%define	ExecName	dword [bp-26]
 36733                                  	%define		ExecName	[bp-26] ; 09/08/2018
 36734                                  	%define		ExecNameL	word [bp-26]	
 36735                                  	%define		ExecNameH	word [bp-24]

 36740                                  	; ==================================================================
 36741                                  	; validate function
 36742                                  	; ==================================================================
 36743                                  		      	
 36744                                  	; M068 - Start
 36745                                  	;
 36746                                  	; Reset the A20OFF_COUNT to 0. This is done as there is a 
 36747                                  	; possibility that the count may not be decremented all the way to
 36748                                  	; 0. A typical case is if the program for which we intended to keep 
 36749                                  	; the A20  off for a sufficiently long time (A20OFF_COUNT int 21 
 36750                                  	; calls), exits pre-maturely due to error conditions.
 36751                                  
 36752                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 36753 0000657D 36C606[8500]00          	mov	byte [SS:A20OFF_COUNT], 0
 36754                                  
 36755                                  	; If al=5 (ExecReady) we'll change the return address on the stack	
 36756                                  	; to be LeaveDos in msdisp.asm. This ensures that the EXECA20OFF
 36757                                  	; bit set in DOS_FLAG by ExceReady is not cleared in msdisp.asm
 36758                                  
 36759 00006583 3C05                    	cmp	al,5			; Q: is this ExecReady call
 36760                                  	;jne	short @f
 36761 00006585 7505                    	jne	short Exec_@f		; N: continue
 36762                                  					; Y: change ret addr. to LeaveDos.
 36763 00006587 59                      	pop	cx			; Note CX is not input to ExecReady
 36764 00006588 B9[F603]                	mov	cx,LeaveDOS
 36765 0000658B 51                      	push	cx
 36766                                  ;@@:
 36767                                  Exec_@f:
 36768                                  	; M068 - End
 36769                                  	
 36770                                  	;Enter
 36771                                  
 36772 0000658C 55                      	push	bp
 36773 0000658D 89E5                    	mov	bp,sp
 36774                                  	;;sub	sp,26	; MSDOS 3.3
 36775                                  	; 30/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0, MSDOS.SYS compatibility)	
 36776                                  	;sub	sp,29	; MSDOS 6.0 (& MSDOS 6.21)
 36777                                  	; 17/12/2022
 36778                                  	; 20/05/2019
 36779 0000658F 83EC1E                  	sub	sp,30	; Retro DOS v4.0	
 36780                                  
 36781                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 36782 00006592 3C05                    	cmp	AL,5			; only 0, 1, 3 or 5 are allowed ;M028
 36783                                  					; M030
 36784 00006594 7614                    	jna	short Exec_Check_2
 36785                                  
 36786                                  	; MSDOS 3.3
 36787                                  	;cmp	AL,3
 36788                                  	;jna	short Exec_Check_2
 36789                                  
 36790                                  Exec_Bad_Fun:
 36791 00006596 36C606[2303]01          	mov	byte [ss:EXTERR_LOCUS],errLOC_Unk ; 1
 36792                                  					; Extended Error Locus	;smr;SS Override
 36793                                  	;mov	al,1
 36794 0000659C B001                    	mov	al,error_invalid_function
 36795                                  
 36796                                  Exec_Ret_Err:
 36797                                  	;Leave
 36798 0000659E 89EC                    	mov	sp,bp
 36799 000065A0 5D                      	pop	bp
 36800                                  	;transfer SYS_RET_ERR
 36801 000065A1 E9D6A0                  	jmp	SYS_RET_ERR
 36802                                  
 36803                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 36804                                  ExecReadyJ:
 36805 000065A4 E8FD17                  	call	ExecReady		; M028
 36806 000065A7 E90504                  	jmp	norm_ovl		; do a Leave & xfer sysret_OK ; M028
 36807

 36809 000065AA 3C02                    	cmp	AL,2			
 36810 000065AC 74E8                    	je	short Exec_Bad_Fun
 36811

 36814 000065B0 74E4                    	je	short Exec_Bad_Fun
 36815                                  	
 36816 000065B2 3C05                    	cmp	al,5			; M028 ; M030
 36817 000065B4 74EE                    	je	short ExecReadyJ	; M028
 36818                                  
 36819                                  	;mov	[bp-4],bx
 36820 000065B6 895EFC                  	mov	Exec_BlkL,BX		; stash args
 36821                                  	;mov	[bp-2],es
 36822 000065B9 8C46FE                  	mov	Exec_BlkH,ES
 36823                                  	;mov	[bp-5],al
 36824 000065BC 8846FB                  	mov	Exec_Func,AL
 36825                                  	;mov	byte [bp-6],0
 36826 000065BF C646FA00                	mov	Exec_Load_High,0
 36827                                  
 36828                                  	;mov	[bp-26],dx
 36829 000065C3 8956E6                  	mov	ExecNameL,DX		; set up length of exec name

 36831 000065C6 8C5EE8                  	mov	ExecNameH,DS

 36837                                  
 36838                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 36839 000065D1 36A0[0203]              	mov	al,[ss:AllocMethod]	; M063: save alloc method in 
 36840 000065D5 36A2[8400]              	mov	[ss:ALLOCMSAVE],al	; M063: AllocMsave
 36841

 36844                                  
 36845                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 36846                                  	;or	byte [ss:DOS_FLAG],1
 36847 000065DC 36800E[8600]01          	or	byte [ss:DOS_FLAG],EXECOPEN ; this flag is set to indicate to

 36882

 37615                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 37616                                          ; 17/12/2022

 37618 000068F9 76A3                    	jbe	short Exec_Chk_Com_Mem	; M000: jump if not
 37619                                  	;;jbe	short Exec_No_Memj	; M000: jump if not

 37623

 37702                                  	; MSDOS 3.3 (& MSDOS 6.0)

 37711                                  	;test	byte [bp-5],2
 37712 00006975 F646FB02                	test	Exec_Func,exec_func_overlay

 37714                                  
 37715                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 37716 0000697B E8C201                  	call	Scan_Execname
 37717 0000697E E8D601                  	call	Scan_Special_Entries
 37718                                  ;SR;
 37719                                  ;The current lie strategy uses the PSP to store the lie version. However,
 37720                                  ;device drivers are loaded as overlays and have no PSP. To handle them, we
 37721                                  ;use the Sysinit flag provided by the BIOS as part of a structure pointed at
 37722                                  ;by BiosDataPtr. If this flag is set, the overlay call has been issued from
 37723                                  ;Sysinit and therefore must be a device driver load. We then get the lie 
 37724                                  ;version for this driver and put it into the Sysinit PSP. When the driver
 37725                                  ;issues the version check, it gets the lie version until the next overlay
 37726                                  ;call is issued.
 37727                                  
 37728 00006981 36803E[A210]00          	cmp	byte [ss:DriverLoad],0	;was Sysinit processing done?
 37729 00006987 7426                    	je	short norm_ovl		;yes, no special handling
 37730 00006989 56                      	push	si
 37731 0000698A 06                      	push	es
 37732 0000698B 36C436[A310]            	les	si,[ss:BiosDataPtr]	;get ptr to BIOS data block
 37733                                  	 
 37734                                  	; (es:si points to 'SysinitPresent' address/flag in retrodos4.s) 
 37735 00006990 26803C00                	cmp	byte [es:si],0		;in Sysinit?
 37736 00006994 7411                    	je	short sysinit_done	;no, Sysinit is finished
 37737                                  	
 37738 00006996 368E06[3003]            	mov	es,[ss:CurrentPDB]	;es = current PSP (Sysinit PSP)
 37739 0000699B 36FF36[020F]            	push	word [ss:SPECIAL_VERSION]
 37740 000069A0 268F064000              	pop	word [es:PDB.Version]	;store lie version in Sysinit PSP
 37741                                  		;;; PDB.VERSION
 37742 000069A5 EB06                    	jmp	short setver_done
 37743                                  sysinit_done:
 37744 000069A7 36C606[A210]00          	mov	byte [ss:DriverLoad],0	;Sysinit done,special handling off
 37745                                  setver_done:
 37746 000069AD 07                      	pop	es
 37747 000069AE 5E                      	pop	si
 37748                                  norm_ovl:
 37749                                  	;leave
 37750 000069AF 89EC                    	mov	sp,bp		
 37751 000069B1 5D                      	pop	bp
 37752                                  
 37753                                  	;transfer SYS_RET_OK		; overlay load -> done
 37754 000069B2 E9BB9C                  	jmp	SYS_RET_OK
 37755                                  
 37756                                  Exec_Build_Header:
 37757                                  	;mov	dx,[bp-18]

 37759                                  					; assign the space to the process

 37777

 37791

 38245                                  ; 04/08/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 38246                                  ; IBMDOS.COm (MSDOS 3.3, 1987) - Offset 633Dh
 38247                                  
 38248                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 38249                                  ;SUBTTL Terminate and stay resident handler
 38250                                  ;
 38251                                  ; Input:    DX is  an  offset  from  CurrentPDB  at which to
 38252                                  ;	    truncate the current block.
 38253                                  ;
 38254                                  ; output:   The current block is truncated (expanded) to be [DX+15]/16
 38255                                  ;	    paragraphs long.  An exit is simulated via resetting CurrentPDB
 38256                                  ;	    and restoring the vectors.
 38257                                  ;
 38258                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 38259                                  
 38260                                  	; 20/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 38261                                  	; DOSCODE:A19Bh (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
 38262                                  
 38263                                  	; 01/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 38264                                  	; DOSCODE:A13Bh (MSDOS 5.0, MSDOS.SYS)
 38265                                  
 38266                                  _$KEEP_PROCESS:
 38267 00006BA3 50                      	push	AX			; keep exit code around
 38268                                  	;mov	byte [SS:EXIT_TYPE],3
 38269 00006BA4 36C606[7C05]03          	mov	BYTE [SS:EXIT_TYPE],EXIT_KEEP_PROCESS
 38270 00006BAA 368E06[3003]            	mov	ES,[SS:CurrentPDB]
 38271 00006BAF 83FA06                  	cmp	DX,6h			; keep enough space around for system
 38272 00006BB2 7303                    	jae	short Keep_Shrink	; info
 38273                                  
 38274 00006BB4 BA0600                  	mov	DX,6h

 38488                                  ; arena data

 38491                                  ;       i_need  CurrentPDB,WORD         ; current process data block addr
 38492                                  ;       i_need  FirstArena,WORD         ; first free block found
 38493                                  ;       i_need  BestArena,WORD          ; best free block found

 38497                                  ;**	Arena_Free_Process
 38498                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 38499                                  ;	Free all arena blocks allocated to a prOcess
 38500                                  ;
 38501                                  ;	ENTRY	(bx) = PID of process
 38502                                  ;	EXIT	none
 38503                                  ;	USES	????? BUGBUG
 38504                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 38505                                  
 38506                                  	; 01/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 38507                                  	; DOSCODE:A1C2h (MSDOS 5.0, MSDOS.SYS)
 38508                                  
 38509                                  arena_free_process:
 38510                                  	; 14/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 38511                                  	; 04/08/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 38512 00006C2A 36A1[2400]                      MOV	AX,[SS:arena_head]
 38513                                  arena_free_process_start:
 38514 00006C2E BF0000                  	MOV     DI,ARENA.SIGNATURE ; 0
 38515                                  	;MOV	AX,[SS:arena_head] ; 15/04/2018  
 38516 00006C31 E83000                          CALL	check_signature         ; ES <- AX, check for valid block
 38517                                  
 38518                                  arena_free_process_loop:
 38519                                          ;retc
 38520 00006C34 723D                            JC	SHORT AFP_RETN	; Retro DOS v2.0 - 05/03/2018
 38521 00006C36 06                      	PUSH    ES
 38522 00006C37 1F                              POP     DS
 38523                                  	;cmp	[1],bx 
 38524 00006C38 391E0100                        CMP     [ARENA.OWNER],BX	; is block owned by pid?
 38525 00006C3C 7504                            JNZ     SHORT arena_free_next	; no, skip to next
 38526                                  	;mov	[1],di
 38527 00006C3E 893E0100                        MOV     [ARENA.OWNER],DI	; yes... free him
 38528                                  
 38529                                  arena_free_next:
 38530                                  	;cmp	byte [di],5Ah ;'Z'
 38531 00006C42 803D5A                          CMP     BYTE [DI],arena_signature_end
 38532                                                                          ; end of road, Jack?
 38533                                          ;retz				; never come back no more
 38534                                  	;JZ	SHORT AFP_RETN  ; MSDOS 3.3 (& MSDOS 2.11)
 38535                                  	; 14/05/2019
 38536                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 38537 00006C45 7405                    	jz	short arena_chk_umbs
 38538                                          
 38539 00006C47 E81300                  	CALL    arena_next              ; next item in ES/AX carry set if trash
 38540 00006C4A EBE8                            JMP     SHORT arena_free_process_loop
 38541                                  
 38542                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 38543                                  arena_chk_umbs:				; M010 - Start
 38544                                  	; 20/05/2019
 38545 00006C4C 36A1[8C00]              	mov	ax,[ss:UMB_HEAD]	; ax = umb_head
 38546 00006C50 83F8FF                  	cmp	ax,0FFFFh		; Q: is umb_head initialized
 38547 00006C53 741E                    	je	short ret_label		; N: we're done
 38548                                  	
 38549 00006C55 8CDF                    	mov	di,ds			; di = last arena
 38550 00006C57 39C7                    	cmp	di,ax			; Q: is last arena above umb_head
 38551 00006C59 7318                    	jae	short ret_label		; Y: we've scanned umbs also. done.
 38552 00006C5B EBD1                    	jmp	short arena_free_process_start
 38553                                  					; M010 - End
 38554                                  ;AFP_RETN:
 38555                                  ;	RETN
 38556                                  
 38557                                  ;	BREAK	<Arena Helper Routines>
 38558                                  
 38559                                  ;**	Arena_Next - Find Next item in Arena
 38560                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 38561                                  ;	ENTRY	DS - pointer to block head
 38562                                  ;		(di) = 0
 38563                                  ;	EXIT	AX,ES - pointers to next head
 38564                                  ;		'C' set iff arena damaged
 38565                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 38566                                  
 38567                                  arena_next:
 38568 00006C5D 8CD8                            MOV     AX,DS                   ; AX <- current block
 38569 00006C5F 03060300                        ADD     AX,[ARENA.SIZE]		; AX <- AX + current block length
 38570 00006C63 40                              INC     AX                      ; remember that header!
 38571                                  
 38572                                  ;       fall into check_signature and return
 38573                                  ;
 38574                                  ;       CALL    check_signature         ; ES <- AX, carry set if error
 38575                                  ;       RETN
 38576                                  
 38577                                  ;**	Check_Signature - Check Memory Block Signature
 38578                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 38579                                  ;	ENTRY	(AX) = address of block header
 38580                                  ;		(di) = 0
 38581                                  ;	EXIT	 ES = AX
 38582                                  ;		'C' clear if signature good
 38583                                  ;		'C' set if signature bad
 38584                                  ;	USES	ES, Flags
 38585                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 38586                                  
 38587                                  check_signature:        
 38588                                  
 38589 00006C64 8EC0                    	MOV     ES,AX                   ; ES <- AX
 38590                                  	;cmp	byte [es:di],4Dh ; 'M'
 38591 00006C66 26803D4D                        CMP     BYTE [ES:DI],arena_signature_normal
 38592                                                                          ; IF next signature = not_end THEN
 38593 00006C6A 7407                            JZ      SHORT check_signature_ok ;   GOTO ok
 38594                                  	;cmp 	byte [es:di],5Ah ; 'Z'
 38595 00006C6C 26803D5A                        CMP     BYTE [ES:DI],arena_signature_end
 38596                                                                          ; IF next signature = end then
 38597 00006C70 7401                            JZ      SHORT check_signature_ok ;   GOTO ok
 38598 00006C72 F9                              STC                             ; set error
 38599                                  ret_label: ; MSDOS 6.0
 38600                                  AFP_RETN:
 38601                                   	; Retro DOS v2.0 - 05/03/2018
 38602                                  check_signature_ok:
 38603                                  COALESCE_RETN:
 38604 00006C73 C3                      	RETN
 38605                                  
 38606                                  ;**	Coalesce - Combine free blocks ahead with current block
 38607                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 38608                                  ;	Coalesce adds the block following the argument to the argument block,
 38609                                  ;	iff it's free.  Coalesce is usually used to join free blocks, but
 38610                                  ;	some callers (such as $setblock) use it to join a free block to it's
 38611                                  ;	preceeding allocated block.
 38612                                  ;
 38613                                  ;	ENTRY	(ds) = pointer to the head of a free block
 38614                                  ;		(di) = 0
 38615                                  ;	EXIT	'C' clear if OK
 38616                                  ;		  (ds) unchanged, this block updated
 38617                                  ;		  (ax) = address of next block, IFF not at end
 38618                                  ;		'C' set if arena trashed
 38619                                  ;	USES	(cx)
 38620                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 38621                                          
 38622                                  Coalesce:
 38623                                  	;cmp	byte [di],5Ah ; 'Z'
 38624 00006C74 803D5A                  	CMP     BYTE [DI],arena_signature_end
 38625                                                                          ; IF current signature = END THEN
 38626                                          ;retz				;   GOTO ok
 38627 00006C77 74FA                            jz	short COALESCE_RETN
 38628 00006C79 E8E1FF                  	CALL    arena_next              ; ES, AX <- next block, Carry set if error
 38629                                          ;retc				; IF no error THEN GOTO check
 38630 00006C7C 72F5                    	jc	short COALESCE_RETN
 38631                                  
 38632                                  coalesce_check:
 38633                                  	;cmp	[es:1],di
 38634 00006C7E 26393E0100                      CMP     [ES:ARENA.OWNER],DI
 38635                                          ;retnz				; IF next block isnt free THEN return
 38636 00006C83 75EE                            JNZ	SHORT COALESCE_RETN
 38637                                  	;mov	cx,[ES:3]
 38638 00006C85 268B0E0300              	MOV     CX,[ES:ARENA.SIZE]	; CX <- next block size
 38639 00006C8A 41                              INC     CX                      ; CX <- CX + 1 (for header size)
 38640                                          ;ADD	[3],CX
 38641 00006C8B 010E0300                	ADD     [ARENA.SIZE],CX		; current size <- current size + CX
 38642 00006C8F 268A0D                          MOV     CL,[ES:DI]              ; move up signature
 38643 00006C92 880D                            MOV     [DI],CL
 38644 00006C94 EBDE                            JMP     SHORT Coalesce		; try again
 38645                                  
 38646                                  ; 04/08/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 38647                                  ; IBMDOS.COM (MSDOS 3.3, 1987) - Offset 641Fh
 38648                                  
 38649                                  ;	BREAK  <$Alloc - allocate space in memory>
 38650                                  
 38651                                  ; MSDOS 6.0
 38652                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 38653                                  ;**	$Alloc - Allocate Memory Space
 38654                                  ;
 38655                                  ;	$Alloc services the INT21 that allocates memory space to a program.
 38656                                  ;	Alloc returns a pointer to a free block of memory that
 38657                                  ;	has the requested size in paragraphs.
 38658                                  ;
 38659                                  ;	If the allocation strategy is HIGH_FIRST or HIGH_ONLY memory is 
 38660                                  ;	scanned from umb_head if not from arena_head. If the strategy is
 38661                                  ; 	HIGH_FIRST the scan is continued from arena_head if a block of 
 38662                                  ;	appropriate size is not found in the UMBs. If the strategy is 
 38663                                  ;	HIGH_FIRST+HIGH_ONLY only the UMBs are scanned for memory.
 38664                                  ;
 38665                                  ;	In either case if bit 0 of UmbFlag is not initialized then the scan
 38666                                  ;	starts from arena_head.
 38667                                  ;
 38668                                  ;	Assembler usage:
 38669                                  ;           MOV     BX,size
 38670                                  ;           MOV     AH,Alloc
 38671                                  ;           INT     21h
 38672                                  ;
 38673                                  ;	BUGBUG - a lot can be done to improve performance. We can set marks
 38674                                  ;	so that we start searching the arena at it's first non-trivial free
 38675                                  ;	block, we can peephole the code, etc. (We can move some subr calls
 38676                                  ;	inline, etc.) I assume that this is called rarely and that the arena
 38677                                  ;	doesn't have too many memory objects in it beyond the first free one.
 38678                                  ;	verify that this is true; if so, this can stay as is
 38679                                  ;
 38680                                  ;	ENTRY	(bx) = requested size, in bytes
 38681                                  ;		(DS) = (ES) = DOSGROUP
 38682                                  ;	EXIT	'C' clear if memory allocated
 38683                                  ;		  (ax:0) = address of requested memory
 38684                                  ;		'C' set if request failed
 38685                                  ;		  (AX) = error_not_enough_memory
 38686                                  ;		    (bx) = max size we could have allocated
 38687                                  ;		  (ax) = error_arena_trashed
 38688                                  ;	USES	All
 38689                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 38690                                  
 38691                                  ; MSDOS 2.11 (& MSDOS 3.3)
 38692                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 38693                                  ;SUBTTL $Alloc - allocate space in memory
 38694                                  ;
 38695                                  ;   Assembler usage:
 38696                                  ;           MOV     BX,size
 38697                                  ;           MOV     AH,Alloc
 38698                                  ;           INT     21h
 38699                                  ;         AX:0 is pointer to allocated memory
 38700                                  ;         BX is max size if not enough memory
 38701                                  ;
 38702                                  ;   Description:
 38703                                  ;           Alloc returns  a  pointer  to  a  free  block of
 38704                                  ;       memory that has the requested  size  in  paragraphs.
 38705                                  ;
 38706                                  ;   Error return:
 38707                                  ;           AX = error_not_enough_memory
 38708                                  ;              = error_arena_trashed
 38709                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 38710                                  
 38711                                  ; DOSCODE:A28Eh (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
 38712                                  
 38713                                  ; 01/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 38714                                  ; DOSCODE:A22Eh (MSDOS 5.0, MSDOS.SYS)
 38715                                  
 38716                                  _$ALLOC:
 38717                                  	; 25/05/2019 (Procedure has been checked and confirmed)
 38718                                  	; 14/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 38719                                  	; 04/08/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 38720                                  	;EnterCrit critMem
 38721 00006C96 E850AC                  	call	ECritMEM ; MSDOS 3.3 & MSDOS 6.0
 38722                                  
 38723                                  ; 17/12/2022
 38724                                  ; 01/12/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS compatibility)
 38725                                  ;%if 0
 38726                                  	; 14/05/2019
 38727 00006C99 16                      	push	ss
 38728 00006C9A 1F                      	pop	ds
 38729                                  
 38730                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 38731                                  	;mov	ax,[ss:arena_head]
 38732                                  	;mov	[ss:START_ARENA],ax	; assume LOW_FIRST
 38733                                  
 38734 00006C9B A1[2400]                	mov	ax,[arena_head]
 38735 00006C9E A3[8E00]                	mov	[START_ARENA],ax			
 38736                                  	
 38737                                  	;test	byte [ss:AllocMethod],HIGH_FIRST+HIGH_ONLY
 38738 00006CA1 F606[0203]C0            	test	byte [AllocMethod],HIGH_FIRST+HIGH_ONLY
 38739                                  					; Q: should we start scanning from 
 38740                                  					;    UMB's
 38741 00006CA6 740D                    	jz	short norm_alloc	; N: scan from arena_head
 38742                                  		
 38743                                  	;;cmp	word [ss:UMB_HEAD],-1	; Q: Has umb_head been initialized
 38744                                  	;cmp	word [UMB_HEAD],-1
 38745                                  	;je	short norm_alloc	; N: scan from arena_head
 38746                                  
 38747                                  	;test	byte [ss:UMBFLAG],LINKSTATE ; Q: are umb's linked
 38748 00006CA8 F606[8900]01            	test	byte [UMBFLAG],LINKSTATE ; 1
 38749 00006CAD 7406                    	jz	short norm_alloc	; N: scan from arena_head
 38750                                  	
 38751                                  	;mov	ax,[ss:UMB_HEAD]
 38752                                  	;mov	[ss:START_ARENA],ax	; start_arena = umb_head
 38753 00006CAF A1[8C00]                	mov	ax,[UMB_HEAD]
 38754 00006CB2 A3[8E00]                	mov	[START_ARENA],ax
 38755                                  					; M000 - end
 38756                                  norm_alloc:
 38757 00006CB5 31C0                            XOR     AX,AX
 38758 00006CB7 89C7                            MOV     DI,AX
 38759                                  	; 15/03/2018
 38760                                          ;MOV	[SS:FirstArena],AX	; init the options
 38761                                          ;MOV	[SS:BestArena],AX
 38762                                          ;MOV	[SS:LastArena],AX

 39027                                  ;	BREAK $SETBLOCK - change size of an allocated block (if possible)
 39028                                  
 39029                                  ; MSDOS 6.0
 39030                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 39031                                  ;**	$SETBLOCK - Change size of an Allocated Block
 39032                                  ;
 39033                                  ;	Setblock changes the size of an allocated block. First, we coalesce
 39034                                  ;	any following free space onto this block; then we try to trim the
 39035                                  ;	block down to the size requested.
 39036                                  ;
 39037                                  ;	Note that if the guy wants to grow the block but that growth fails,
 39038                                  ;	we still go ahead and coalesce any trailing free blocks onto it.
 39039                                  ;	Thus the maximum-size-possible value that we return has already
 39040                                  ;	been allocated! This is a bug, dare we fix it? BUGBUG
 39041                                  ;
 39042                                  ;	NOTE - $SETBLOCK is in bed with $ALLOC and jumps into $ALLOC to
 39043                                  ;		finish it's work. For this reason we build the allocsf
 39044                                  ;		structure on the frame, to make us compatible with $ALLOCs
 39045                                  ;		code.
 39046                                  ;
 39047                                  ;	ENTRY	(es) = segment of old block
 39048                                  ;		(bx) = newsize
 39049                                  ;		(ah) = SETBLOCK
 39050                                  ;
 39051                                  ;	EXIT	'C' clear if OK
 39052                                  ;		'C' set if error
 39053                                  ;		  (ax) = error_invalid_block
 39054                                  ;		       = error_arena_trashed
 39055                                  ;		       = error_not_enough_memory
 39056                                  ;		       = error_invalid_function
 39057                                  ;		  (bx) = maximum size possible, iff (ax) = error_not_enough_memory
 39058                                  ;	USES	???? BUGBUG
 39059                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 39060                                  
 39061                                  ; MSDOS 2.11 (& MSDOS 3.3)
 39062                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 39063                                  ;SUBTTL $SETBLOCK - change size of an allocated block (if possible)
 39064                                  ;
 39065                                  ;   Assembler usage:
 39066                                  ;           MOV     ES,block
 39067                                  ;           MOV     BX,newsize
 39068                                  ;           MOV     AH,setblock
 39069                                  ;           INT     21h
 39070                                  ;         if setblock fails for growing, BX will have the maximum
 39071                                  ;         size possible
 39072                                  ;   Error return:
 39073                                  ;           AX = error_invalid_block
 39074                                  ;              = error_arena_trashed
 39075                                  ;              = error_not_enough_memory
 39076                                  ;              = error_invalid_function
 39077                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 39078                                  
 39079                                  _$SETBLOCK:        
 39080                                  	; 04/08/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 39081                                  	;EnterCrit   critMem
 39082 00006DEC E8FAAA                  	call	ECritMEM ; MSDOS 3.3 & MSDOS 6.0
 39083                                  
 39084 00006DEF BF0000                  	MOV     DI,ARENA.SIGNATURE

 39086 00006DF4 48                              DEC     AX

 39173                                  ;	BREAK $AllocOper - get/set allocation mechanism
 39174                                  
 39175                                  ; MSDOS 6.0
 39176                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 39177                                  ;**	$AllocOper - Get/Set Allocation Mechanism
 39178                                  ;
 39179                                  ;	Assembler usage:
 39180                                  ;           MOV     AH,AllocOper
 39181                                  ;           MOV     BX,method
 39182                                  ;           MOV     AL,func
 39183                                  ;           INT     21h
 39184                                  ;
 39185                                  ;	ENTRY	
 39186                                  ;		(al) = 0
 39187                                  ;		  Get allocation Strategy in (ax)
 39188                                  ;
 39189                                  ;		(al) = 1, (bx) = method = zw0000xy
 39190                                  ;		  Set allocation strategy.
 39191                                  ;		   w  = 1  => HIGH_ONLY
 39192                                  ;		   z  = 1  => HIGH_FIRST
 39193                                  ;		   xy = 00 => FIRST_FIT
 39194                                  ;		      = 01 => BEST_FIT
 39195                                  ;		      = 10 => LAST_FIT
 39196                                  ;
 39197                                  ;		(al) = 2
 39198                                  ;		  Get UMB link state in (al)
 39199                                  ;
 39200                                  ;		(al) = 3
 39201                                  ;		  Set UMB link state
 39202                                  ;		   (bx) = 0 => Unlink UMBs
 39203                                  ;		   (bx) = 1 => Link UMBs
 39204                                  ;
 39205                                  ;
 39206                                  ;	EXIT	'C' clear if OK
 39207                                  ;
 39208                                  ;		 if (al) = 0
 39209                                  ;		  (ax) = existing method
 39210                                  ;		 if (al) = 1
 39211                                  ;		  Sets allocation strategy
 39212                                  ;		 if (al) = 2
 39213                                  ;		  (al) = 0 => UMBs not linked
 39214                                  ;		  (al) = 1 => UMBs linked in
 39215                                  ;		 if (al) = 3
 39216                                  ;		  Links/Unlinks the UMBs into DOS chain
 39217                                  ;
 39218                                  ;		'C' set if error
 39219                                  ;		  AX = error_invalid_function
 39220                                  ;
 39221                                  ;	Rev. M000 - added support for HIGH_FIRST in (al) = 1. 7/9/90
 39222                                  ; 	Rev. M003 - added functions (al) = 2 and (al) = 3. 7/18/90
 39223                                  ;	Rev. M009 - (al) = 3 will return 'invalid function' in ax if
 39224                                  ;		    umbhead has'nt been initialized by sysinit and 'trashed
 39225                                  ;		    arena' if an arena sig is damaged.
 39226                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 39227                                  
 39228                                  ; MSDOS 2.11 (& MSDOS 3.3)
 39229                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 39230                                  ;SUBTTL $AllocOper - get/set allocation mechanism

 39406                                  ; MSDOS 6.0
 39407                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 39408                                  ; Procedure Name : GetLastArena		-  M003
 39409                                  ;
 39410                                  ; Inputs	 : cx = umb_head
 39411                                  ;
 39412                                  ;
 39413                                  ; Outputs	 : If UMBs are linked
 39414                                  ;			ES = umb_head
 39415                                  ;			DS = arena before umb_head
 39416                                  ;		   else
 39417                                  ;			DS = last arena
 39418                                  ;			ES = next arena. will be umb_head if NC.
 39419                                  ;
 39420                                  ;		   CY if error
 39421                                  ;
 39422                                  ; Uses		 : DS, ES, DI, BX
 39423                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 39424                                  
 39425                                  ; 14/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 39426                                  ; DOSCODE:A4D6h (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
 39427                                  
 39428                                  ; 01/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 39429                                  ; DOSCODE:A476h (MSDOS 5.0, MSDOS.SYS)
 39430                                  	
 39431                                  GetLastArena:
 39432 00006ED0 50                      	push	ax			; save ax
 39433                                  
 39434 00006ED1 36A1[2400]              	mov	ax,[ss:arena_head]
 39435 00006ED5 8EC0                    	mov	es,ax			; es = arena_head
 39436 00006ED7 31FF                    	xor	di,di
 39437                                  
 39438 00006ED9 26803D5A                	cmp     byte [es:di],arena_signature_end
 39439                                  					; Q: is this the last arena
 39440 00006EDD 7419                    	je	short GLA_done		; Y: return last arena in ES		
 39441                                  					
 39442                                  GLA_next:
 39443 00006EDF 8ED8                    	mov	ds,ax
 39444 00006EE1 E879FD                  	call	arena_next		; ax, es -> next arena
 39445                                  	; 01/12/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS compatibility)
 39446                                  	;jc	short GLA_err
 39447                                  	; 17/12/2022
 39448 00006EE4 7228                    	jc	short GLA_err2
 39449                                  
 39450 00006EE6 36F606[8900]01          	test	byte [ss:UMBFLAG],LINKSTATE ; Q: are UMBs linked
 39451 00006EEC 7506                    	jnz	short GLA_chkumb	; Y: terminating condition is 
 39452                                  					;    umb_head
 39453                                  					; N: terminating condition is 05Ah
 39454                                  
 39455 00006EEE 26803D5A                	cmp     byte [es:di],arena_signature_end
 39456                                  					; Q: is this the last arena
 39457 00006EF2 EB02                    	jmp	short GLA_@f
 39458                                  GLA_chkumb:
 39459 00006EF4 39C8                    	cmp	ax,cx			; Q: is this umb_head
 39460                                  GLA_@f:
 39461 00006EF6 75E7                    	jne	short GLA_next		; N: get next arena
 39462                                  
 39463                                  GLA_done:
 39464                                  					; M061 - Start
 39465 00006EF8 36F606[8900]01          	test	byte [ss:UMBFLAG],LINKSTATE ; Q: are UMBs linked
 39466 00006EFE 750B                    	jnz	short GLA_ret		; Y: we're done
 39467                                  					; N: let us confirm that the next 
 39468                                  					;    arena is umb_head
 39469 00006F00 8ED8                    	mov	ds,ax
 39470 00006F02 E858FD                  	call	arena_next		; ax, es -> next arena
 39471                                  	;jc	short GLA_err
 39472 00006F05 7207                    	jc	short GLA_err2
 39473 00006F07 39C8                    	cmp	ax,cx			; Q: is this umb_head
 39474 00006F09 7502                    	jne	short GLA_err		; N: error
 39475                                  					; M061 - End
 39476                                  GLA_ret:
 39477                                  	; 17/12/2022				
 39478                                  	;clc
 39479                                  	; 01/12/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS compatibility)
 39480                                  	;clc
 39481 00006F0B 58                      	pop	ax			; M061
 39482 00006F0C C3                      	retn				; M061
 39483                                  
 39484                                  GLA_err:
 39485 00006F0D F9                      	stc				; M061
 39486                                  GLA_err2:
 39487 00006F0E 58                      	pop	ax
 39488 00006F0F C3                      	retn

 39516                                  
 39517                                  ;BREAK <ServerCall -- Server DOS call>
 39518                                  
 39519                                  ; DOSCODE:A517h (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
 39520                                  ; DOSCODE:A4B7h (MSDOS 5.0, MSDOS.SYS)
 39521

 39523                                  ;Public SRVC001S,SRVC001E
 39524                                  ;SRVC001S label byte

 39526                                  SRVC001S:
 39527                                  
 39528 00006F10 [146F]                  SERVERTAB:	dw	SERVER_DISP
 39529 00006F12 [666F]                  SERVERLEAVE:	dw	SERVERRETURN
 39530 00006F14 0B                      SERVER_DISP:	db	(SERVER_DISP_END-SERVER_DISP-1)/2 ; = 11
 39531 00006F15 [CE6F]                  		dw	SRV_CALL	; 0
 39532 00006F17 [676F]                  		dw	COMMIT_ALL	; 1
 39533 00006F19 [9D6F]                  		dw	CLOSE_NAME	; 2
 39534 00006F1B [A86F]                  		dw	CLOSE_UID	; 3
 39535 00006F1D [AF6F]                  		dw	CLOSE_UID_PID	; 4
 39536 00006F1F [B66F]                  		dw	GET_LIST	; 5

 39547                                  SRVC001E:

 39549                                  ;hkn; TABLE	ENDS
 39550                                  
 39551                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 39552                                  ;
 39553                                  ; Procedure Name : $ServerCall
 39554                                  ;
 39555                                  ; Inputs:
 39556                                  ;	DS:DX -> DPL  (except calls 7,8,9)
 39557                                  ; Function:
 39558                                  ;	AL=0	Server DOS call
 39559                                  ;	AL=1	Commit All files
 39560                                  ;	AL=2	Close file by name (SHARING LOADED ONLY) DS:DX in DPL -> name
 39561                                  ;	AL=3	Close all files for DPL_UID
 39562                                  ;	AL=4	Close all files for DPL_UID/PID_PID
 39563                                  ;	AL=5	Get open file list entry
 39564                                  ;		    IN: BX File Index
 39565                                  ;			CX User Index
 39566                                  ;		    OUT:ES:DI -> Name
 39567                                  ;			BX = UID
 39568                                  ;		    CX = # locked blocks held by this UID
 39569                                  ;	AL=6	Get DOS data area
 39570                                  ;		    OUT: DS:SI -> Start
 39571                                  ;			CX size in bytes of swap if indos
 39572                                  ;			DX size in bytes of swap always
 39573                                  ;	AL=7	Get truncate flag
 39574                                  ;	AL=8	Set truncate flag
 39575                                  ;	AL=9	Close all spool files
 39576                                  ;	AL=10	SetExtendedError
 39577                                  ;
 39578                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 39579                                  
 39580                                  _$ServerCall:
 39581                                  	; 13/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 39582                                  	; DOSCODE:A4D2h (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)		
 39583                                  	; 10/06/2019
 39584                                  	; 29/04/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 39585                                  	; DOSCODE:A532h (MSDOS 6.21 MSDOS.SYS)
 39586                                  
 39587                                  	; 05/08/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 39588                                  	; IBMDOS.COM (MSDOS 3.3, 1987) - Offset 657Bh
 39589 00006F2B 3C07                    	CMP	AL,7
 39590 00006F2D 7204                    	JB	short SET_STUFF
 39591 00006F2F 3C09                    	CMP	AL,9
 39592 00006F31 761A                    	JBE	short NO_SET_ID		; No DPL on calls 7,8,9
 39593                                  SET_STUFF:
 39594 00006F33 89D6                    	MOV	SI,DX			; Point to DPL with DS:SI
 39595                                  	;mov	bx,[si+12h]
 39596 00006F35 8B5C12                  	MOV	BX,[SI+DPL.UID]
 39597                                  
 39598                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 39599                                  ;SR;
 39600                                  ; WIN386 updates the USER_ID itself. If WIN386 is present we skip the updating
 39601                                  ; of USER_ID
 39602                                  
 39603 00006F38 36F606[A110]01          	test	byte [SS:IsWin386],1

 39609

 39613                                  NO_SET_ID:
