 39615 00006F4D 2EFF36[126F]            	PUSH	word [cs:SERVERLEAVE]	; push return address
 39616 00006F52 2EFF36[106F]            	PUSH	word [cS:SERVERTAB]	; push table address
 39617 00006F57 50                      	PUSH	AX

 39619                                  
 39620                                  ;hkn; SS override
 39621                                  	;mov 	byte [SS:EXETERR_LOCUS],1

 39623                                  	;error	error_invalid_function
 39624                                  	;mov	al,1
 39625 00006F61 B001                    	MOV	AL,error_invalid_function
 39626                                  servercall_error:
 39627 00006F63 E91497                  	JMP	SYS_RET_ERR
 39628                                  
 39629                                  SERVERRETURN:
 39630 00006F66 C3                      	retn
 39631                                  
 39632                                  ; Commit - iterate through the open file list and make sure that the
 39633                                  ; directory entries are correctly updated.
 39634                                  
 39635                                  	; 01/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 39636                                  COMMIT_ALL:
 39637 00006F67 31DB                    	XOR	BX,BX			;   for (i=0; ThisSFT=getSFT(i); i++)

 39639 00006F6A 1F                      	pop	ds
 39640 00006F6B E87BA9                  	call	ECritSFT		; Gonna scan SFT cache, lock it down
 39641                                  CommitLoop:

 39644 00006F72 7222                    	JC	short CommitDone

 39646                                  	;CMP	word [ES:DI+SF_ENTRY.sf_Ref_Count],0
 39647                                  					; if (ThisSFT->refcount != 0)
 39648 00006F78 7418                    	JZ	short CommitNext
 39649                                  	;cmp	word [es:di],0FFFFh ; -1
 39650 00006F7A 26833DFF                	cmp	word [ES:DI],sf_busy
 39651                                  	;CMP	word [ES:DI+SF_ENTRY.sf_Ref_Count],sf_busy  
 39652                                  					; BUSY SFTs have god knows what
 39653 00006F7E 7412                    	JZ	short CommitNext	;   in them.
 39654                                  	; 17/12/2022
 39655 00006F80 26F6450680              	test	byte [ES:DI+SF_ENTRY.sf_flags+1],(sf_isnet>>8) ; 80h
 39656                                  	;TEST	word [ES:DI+SF_ENTRY.sf_flags],sf_isnet ; 8000h
 39657 00006F85 750B                    	JNZ	short CommitNext	;  Skip Network SFTs so the SERVER
 39658                                  					;	doesn't deadlock

 39660 00006F8B 8C06[A005]              	MOV	[THISSFT+2],ES

 39666                                  CommitDone:

 39892                                  ;	BREAK	<pJFNFromHandle - return pointer to JFN table entry>
 39893                                  
 39894                                  ;**	pJFNFromHandle - Translate Handle to Pointer to JFN
 39895                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 39896                                  ;	pJFNFromHandle takes a file handle and turns that into a pointer to
 39897                                  ;	the JFN entry (i.e., to a byte holding the internal file handle #)
 39898                                  ;
 39899                                  ;	NOTE:
 39900                                  ;	  This routine is called from $CREATE_PROCESS_DATA_BLOCK which is called
 39901                                  ;	  at DOSINIT time with SS NOT DOSGROUP
 39902                                  ;
 39903                                  ;	ENTRY	(bx) = handle
 39904                                  ;	EXIT	'C' clear if ok
 39905                                  ;		  (es:di) = address of JFN value
 39906                                  ;		'C' set if error
 39907                                  ;		  (ax) = error code
 39908                                  ;	USES	AX, DI, ES, Flags
 39909                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 39910                                  
 39911                                  	; 02/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 39912                                  
 39913                                  pJFNFromHandle:
 39914                                  	; 05/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 39915                                  	;getdseg <es>			; es -> dosdata
 39916 00007063 2E8E06[0700]            	mov	es,[cs:DosDSeg]
 39917                                  	
 39918                                  	;MOV	ES,[cs:CurrentPDB]	; get user process data block
 39919 00007068 268E06[3003]            	mov	es,[es:CurrentPDB]
 39920                                  
 39921                                  	;cmp	bx,[ES:32h]
 39922 0000706D 263B1E3200              	CMP	BX,[ES:PDB.JFN_Length]	; is handle greater than allocated
 39923 00007072 7204                    	JB	short pjfn10		; no, get offset
 39924                                  ReturnCarry_inv_hndl: ; 05/08/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 39925                                  	;mov	al,6
 39926 00007074 B006                    	MOV     AL,error_invalid_handle ; appropriate error
 39927                                  ReturnCarry:
 39928 00007076 F9                      	STC                             ; signal error
 39929 00007077 C3                      	retn				; go back
 39930                                  pjfn10: 
 39931                                  	;les	di,[es:34h]
 39932 00007078 26C43E3400              	LES	DI,[ES:PDB.JFN_Pointer]	; get pointer to beginning of table
 39933 0000707D 01DF                    	ADD	DI,BX			; add in offset, clear 'C'
 39934                                  	;clc
 39935                                  pJFNFromHandle_error:
 39936 0000707F C3                      	retn

 39938                                  ;BREAK <SFFromHandle - return pointer (or error) to SF entry from handle>
 39939                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 39940                                  ;
 39941                                  ; Procedure Name : SFFromHandle
 39942                                  ;
 39943                                  ; SFFromHandle - Given a handle, get JFN and then index into SF table
 39944                                  ;
 39945                                  ;   Input:      BX has handle
 39946                                  ;   Output:     Carry Set
 39947                                  ;                   AX has error code
 39948                                  ;               Carry Reset
 39949                                  ;                   ES:DI has pointer to SF entry
 39950                                  ;   Registers modified: If error, AX,ES, else ES:DI
 39951                                  ; NOTE:
 39952                                  ;   This routine is called from $CREATE_PROCESS_DATA_BLOCK which is called
 39953                                  ;       at DOSINIT time with SS NOT DOSGROUP
 39954                                  ;
 39955                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 39956                                  
 39957                                  	; 02/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 39958                                  
 39959                                  SFFromHandle:
 39960 00007080 E8E0FF                  	CALL	pJFNFromHandle		; get jfn pointer
 39961                                  	;retc				; return if error
 39962 00007083 72FA                    	jc	short pJFNFromHandle_error
 39963 00007085 26803DFF                	CMP     BYTE [ES:DI],-1		; unused handle
 39964                                  	;JNZ	short GetSF		; nope, suck out SF
 39965                                  	;;mov	al,6
 39966                                  	;MOV	AL,error_invalid_handle ; appropriate error
 39967                                  	;jmp	short ReturnCarry	; signal it
 39968                                  	; 17/12/2022
 39969                                  	; 02/12/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS compatibility)
 39970 00007089 74E9                    	jz	short ReturnCarry_inv_hndl ; Retro DOS v3.0 modification
 39971                                  	;JNZ	short GetSF		; nope, suck out SF
 39972                                  	;;mov	al,6
 39973                                  	;MOV	AL,error_invalid_handle ; appropriate error
 39974                                  	;jmp	short ReturnCarry	; signal it
 39975                                  GetSF:
 39976 0000708B 53                      	push	bx			; save handle
 39977 0000708C 268A1D                  	MOV     BL,[ES:DI]		; get SFN
 39978 0000708F 30FF                    	XOR     BH,BH                   ; ignore upper half
 39979 00007091 E80200                  	CALL    SFFromSFN               ; get real sf spot
 39980 00007094 5B                      	pop	bx			; restore
 39981 00007095 C3                      	retn                        	; say goodbye
 39982                                  
 39983                                  ;BREAK <SFFromSFN - index into SF table for SFN>
 39984                                  
 39985                                  ;**	SFFromSFN - Get an SF Table entry from an SFN
 39986                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 39987                                  ;	SFFromSfn uses an SFN to index an entry into the SF table. This
 39988                                  ;	is more than just a simple index instruction because the SF table
 39989                                  ;	can be made up of multiple pieces chained together. We follow the
 39990                                  ;	chain to the right piece and then do the index operation.
 39991                                  ;
 39992                                  ;   NOTE:
 39993                                  ;	This routine is called from SFFromHandle which is called
 39994                                  ;       at DOSINIT time with SS NOT DOSGROUP
 39995                                  ;
 39996                                  ;	ENTRY	BX has SF index
 39997                                  ;	EXIT	'C' clear if OK
 39998                                  ;		  ES:DI points to SF entry
 39999                                  ;		'C' set if index too large
 40000                                  ;	USES	BX, DI, ES
 40001                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 40002                                  
 40003                                  	; 02/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 40004                                  
 40005                                  SFFromSFN:
 40006                                  	; 05/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 40007                                  	;getdseg <es>			; es -> dosdata
 40008 00007096 2E8E06[0700]            	mov	es,[cs:DosDSeg]
 40009                                  
 40010                                  	;LES	DI,[CS:SFT_ADDR]	; (es:di) = start of SFT table
 40011 0000709B 26C43E[2A00]            	les	di,[es:SFT_ADDR]
 40012                                  sfsfn5:	
 40013                                  	;cmp	bx,[es:di+4]
 40014 000070A0 263B5D04                	CMP	BX,[ES:DI+SFT.SFCount]	; is handle in this table?
 40015 000070A4 720E                    	JB	short sfsfn7		; yes, go grab it
 40016                                  	;sub	bx,[es:di+4]
 40017 000070A6 262B5D04                	SUB     BX,[ES:DI+SFT.SFCount]
 40018 000070AA 26C43D                  	les	di,[es:di] ; 14/08/2018
 40019                                  	;LES	DI,[ES:DI+SFT.SFLink]	; get next table segment
 40020 000070AD 83FFFF                  	CMP     DI,-1                   ; end of tables?
 40021 000070B0 75EE                    	JNZ	short sfsfn5		; no, try again
 40022 000070B2 F9                      	STC
 40023 000070B3 C3                      	retn				; return with error, not found
 40024                                  sfsfn7:
 40025 000070B4 50                      	push	ax
 40026                                  	;mov	ax,53 ; MSDOS 3.3
 40027                                  	;mov	ax,59 ; MSDOS 6.0
 40028                                  	;MOV	AX,SF_ENTRY.size	; put it in a nice place
 40029                                  	
 40030                                  	; 17/12/2022
 40031 000070B5 B03B                    	mov	al,SF_ENTRY.size ; 28/05/2019
 40032                                  	; 07/12/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS compatibility)
 40033                                  	;mov	ax,SF_ENTRY.size ; 59
 40034                                  	
 40035 000070B7 F6E3                    	MUL	BL			; (ax) = offset into this SF block
 40036 000070B9 01C7                    	ADD	DI,AX			; add base of SF block
 40037 000070BB 58                      	pop	ax
 40038                                  	;add	di,6
 40039 000070BC 83C706                  	ADD	DI,SFT.SFTable		; offset into structure, 'C' cleared
 40040 000070BF C3                      	retn				; return with 'C' clear
 40041                                  
 40042                                  ;	BREAK <JFNFree - return a jfn pointer if one is free>
 40043                                  
 40044                                  ;**	JFNFree - Find a Free JFN Slot
 40045                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 40046                                  ;	JFNFree scansthrough the JFN table and returnsa pointer to a free slot
 40047                                  ;
 40048                                  ;	ENTRY	(ss) = DOSDATA
 40049                                  ;	EXIT	'C' clear if OK
 40050                                  ;		  (bx) = new handle
 40051                                  ;		  (es:di) = pointer to JFN slot
 40052                                  ;		'C' set if error
 40053                                  ;		  (al) = error code
 40054                                  ;	USES	bx, di, es, flags
 40055                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 40056                                  
 40057                                  JFNFree:
 40058 000070C0 31DB                    	XOR	BX,BX			; (bx) = initial JFN to try
 40059                                  jfnf1:	
 40060 000070C2 E89EFF                  	CALL	pJFNFromHandle		; get the appropriate handle
 40061 000070C5 7209                    	JC	short jfnf5		; no more handles
 40062 000070C7 26803DFF                	CMP     BYTE [ES:DI],-1		; free?
 40063 000070CB 7405                    	je	short jfnfx		; yes, carry is clear
 40064 000070CD 43                      	INC     BX                      ; no, next handle
 40065 000070CE EBF2                    	JMP	short jfnf1		; and try again
 40066                                  
 40067                                  	; Error. 'C' set
 40068                                  jfnf5:	
 40069                                  	;mov	al,4
 40070 000070D0 B004                    	MOV	AL,error_too_many_open_files
 40071                                  jfnfx:	
 40072 000070D2 C3                      	retn				; bye
 40073                                  
 40074                                  ;	BREAK <SFNFree - Allocate a free SFN>
 40075                                  
 40076                                  ;**	SFNFree - Allocate a Free SFN/SFT
 40077                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 40078                                  ;	SFNFree scans through the sf table looking for a free entry
 40079                                  ;	If it finds one it partially allocates it by setting SFT_REF_COUNT = -1
 40080                                  ;
 40081                                  ;	The problem is that we want to mark the SFT busy so that other threads
 40082                                  ;	can't allocate the SFT before we're finished marking it up.  However,
 40083                                  ;	we can't just mark it busy because we may get blown out of our open
 40084                                  ;	by INT24 and leave the thing orphaned.	To solve this we mark it
 40085                                  ;	"allocation in progress" by setting SFT_REF_COUNT = -1.  If we see
 40086                                  ;	an SFT with this value we look to see if it belongs to this user
 40087                                  ;	and process.  If it does belong to us then it must be an orphan
 40088                                  ;	and we reclaim it.
 40089                                  ;
 40090                                  ;	BUGBUG - improve the performance. I guess it's smaller to call SFFromSFN
 40091                                  ;		over and over, but we could at least set a high water mark...
 40092                                  ;		cause an N^2 loop calling slow SFFromSFN is real slow, too slow
 40093                                  ;		even though this is not a frequently called routine - jgl
 40094                                  ;
 40095                                  ;	ENTRY	(ss) = DOSDATA
 40096                                  ;	EXIT	'C' clear if no error
 40097                                  ;		  (bx) = SFN
 40098                                  ;		  (es:di) = pointer to SFT
 40099                                  ;		  es:[di].SFT_REF_COUNT = -1
 40100                                  ;		'C' set if error
 40101                                  ;		  (al) = error code
 40102                                  ;	USES	bx, di, es, Flags
 40103                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 40104                                  
 40105                                  	; 02/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 40106                                  	; DOSCODE:A682h (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 40107                                  
 40108                                  SFNFree:
 40109                                  	; 12/08/2018
 40110                                  	; 05/08/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 40111                                  	;
 40112                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 40113 000070D3 50                      	push	ax
 40114 000070D4 31DB                    	xor	bx,bx			; (bx) = SFN to consider
 40115                                  sfnf5:	
 40116 000070D6 53                      	push	bx
 40117 000070D7 E8BCFF                  	call	SFFromSFN		; get the potential handle
 40118 000070DA 5B                      	pop	bx
 40119 000070DB 723A                    	jc	short sfnf95		; no more free SFNs
 40120 000070DD 26833D00                	cmp	word [ES:DI],0
 40121                                  	;cmp	word [ES:DI+SF_ENTRY.sf_Ref_Count],0 ; free?
 40122 000070E1 741D                    	je	short sfnf20			; yep, got one
 40123                                  	
 40124                                  	;cmp	word [es:di],0FFFFh ; -1
 40125 000070E3 26833DFF                	cmp	word [ES:DI],sf_busy
 40126                                  	;cmp	word [ES:DI+SF_ENTRY.sf_ref_count],sf_busy
 40127 000070E7 7403                    	je	short sfnf10		; special busy mark
 40128                                  sfnf7:	
 40129 000070E9 43                      	inc	bx			; try the next one
 40130 000070EA EBEA                    	jmp	short sfnf5
 40131                                  
 40132                                  ;	The SFT has the special "busy" mark; if it belongs to us then
 40133                                  ;	it was abandoned during a earlier call and we can use it.
 40134                                  ;
 40135                                  ;	(bx)	= SFN
 40136                                  ;	(es:di) = pointer to SFT
 40137                                  ;	(TOS)	= caller's (ax)
 40138                                  
 40139                                  sfnf10:	
 40140 000070EC 36A1[3E03]              	mov	ax,[SS:USER_ID]
 40141                                  	;cmp	[es:di+2Fh],ax
 40142 000070F0 2639452F                	cmp	[ES:DI+SF_ENTRY.sf_UID],ax
 40143 000070F4 75F3                    	jnz	short sfnf7		; not ours
 40144 000070F6 36A1[3C03]              	mov	ax,[SS:PROC_ID]
 40145                                  	;cmp	[es:di+31h],ax
 40146 000070FA 26394531                	cmp	[ES:DI+SF_ENTRY.sf_PID],ax
 40147 000070FE 75E9                    	jnz	short sfnf7		; can't use this one, try the next
 40148                                  
 40149                                  ;	We have an SFT to allocate
 40150                                  ;
 40151                                  ;	(bx)	= SFN
 40152                                  ;	(es:di) = pointer to SFT
 40153                                  ;	(TOS)	= caller's (ax)
 40154                                  
 40155                                  sfnf20:
 40156                                  	; cf = 0 ;; Retro DOS v3.0
 40157                                  
 40158                                  	;mov	word [es:di],0FFFFh
 40159 00007100 26C705FFFF              	mov	word [ES:DI],sf_busy
 40160                                  					; make sure that this is allocated
 40161                                  	;mov	word [ES:DI+SF_ENTRY.sf_ref_count],sf_busy
 40162                                  
 40163 00007105 36A1[3E03]              	mov	ax,[SS:USER_ID]
 40164                                  	;mov	[es:di+2Fh],ax
 40165 00007109 2689452F                	mov	[ES:DI+SF_ENTRY.sf_UID],ax
 40166 0000710D 36A1[3C03]              	mov	ax,[SS:PROC_ID]
 40167                                  	;mov	[es:di+31h],ax
 40168 00007111 26894531                	mov	[ES:DI+SF_ENTRY.sf_PID],ax
 40169                                  sfnf21: ;; Retro DOS v3.0
 40170                                  	; 02/12/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS compatibility)
 40171                                  	;pop	ax
 40172                                  	;;clc
 40173                                  	;retn				; return with no error
 40174                                  	; 17/12/2022
 40175 00007115 58                      	pop	ax

 40229

 40231                                  ; ES:DI point to SFT
 40232                                  ;
 40233                                  ; We now examine the user's JFN entry; If the file was a 70-mode file (network
 40234                                  ; FCB, we examine the ref count on the SFT;  if it was 1, we free the JFN.

 40617                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 40618                                  
 40619                                  ;   Input: DS:DX points to user's buffer addr
 40620                                  ;   Function: rearrange segment and offset for READ/WRITE buffer
 40621                                  ;   Output: [DMAADD] set
 40622                                  
 40623                                  ; 20/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 40624                                  ; 26/07/2019
 40625                                  ;	; MSDOS 6.0
 40626                                  ;Align_Buffer:
 40627                                  ;	MOV	BX,DX			; copy offset
 40628                                  ;	push	cx			; don't stomp on count
 40629                                  ;	MOV	CL,4			; bits to shift bytes->para
 40630                                  ;	SHR	BX,CL			; get number of paragraphs
 40631                                  ;	pop	cx			; get count back
 40632                                  ;	MOV	AX,DS			; get original segment
 40633                                  ;	ADD	AX,BX			; get new segment
 40634                                  ;	MOV	DS,AX			; in seg register
 40635                                  ;	AND	DX,0Fh			; normalize offset
 40636                                  ;	MOV	[ss:DMAADD],DX		; use user DX as offset	;smr;SS Override
 40637                                  ;	MOV	[ss:DMAADD+2],DS 	; use user DS as segment for DMA
 40638                                  ;						;smr;SS Override
 40639                                  ;	retn
 40640                                  
 40641                                  ; 02/12/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS compatibility)
 40642                                  Align_Buffer:
 40643 00007276 89D3                    	MOV	BX,DX			; copy offset

 40835                                  ;	AL=03		 get EA name list

 40837                                  ;	   CX=size of buffer (0, return max size )

 40839                                  ;
 40840                                  ;	AL=04		 set extended attributes
 40841                                  ;	   BX=handle
 40842                                  ;	   ES:DI buffer of EA list

 40844                                  ;
 40845                                  ;   Error returns:
 40846                                  ;	    AX = error_invalid_function
 40847                                  ;	       = error_invalid_handle

 40953                                  ;   Assembler usage:
 40954                                  ;	    MOV     BX, fh
 40955                                  ;	    MOV     AH, Dup

 40959                                  ;	    AX = dup_invalid_handle

 40967                                  DupErrorCheck:

 40969 00007353 06                      	push	es
 40970 00007354 57                      	push	di			; save away SFT
 40971 00007355 5E                      	pop	si			; into convenient place DS:SI
 40972 00007356 1F                      	pop	ds
 40973 00007357 93                      	XCHG	AX,BX			; get back old handle
 40974 00007358 E81D00                  	call	CheckOwner		; get sft in ES:DI
 40975 0000735B 729E                    	JC	short DupErr		; errors go home
 40976 0000735D E869BD                  	call	DOS_Dup_Direct
 40977 00007360 E800FD                  	call	pJFNFromHandle		; get pointer
 40978 00007363 268A1D                  	MOV	BL,[ES:DI]		; get SFT number
 40979 00007366 881C                    	MOV	[SI],BL			; stuff in new SFT

 40981                                  	;jmp	SYS_RET_OK		; and go home

 40983

 40990                                  ;BREAK <$DUP2 - force a dup on a particular jfn>
 40991                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 40992                                  ;
 40993                                  ;   Assembler usage:
 40994                                  ;	    MOV     BX, fh
 40995                                  ;	    MOV     CX, newfh
 40996                                  ;	    MOV     AH, Dup2
 40997                                  ;	    INT     int_command
 40998                                  ;   Error returns:
 40999                                  ;	    AX = error_invalid_handle
 41000                                  ;
 41001                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 41002                                  
 41003                                  _$DUP2:
 41004 0000736A 53                      	push	bx
 41005 0000736B 51                      	push	cx			; save source
 41006 0000736C 89CB                    	MOV	BX,CX			; get one to close
 41007 0000736E E8AAFD                  	call	_$CLOSE			; close destination handle
 41008 00007371 5B                      	pop	bx
 41009 00007372 58                      	pop	ax			; old in AX, new in BX
 41010 00007373 E8EDFC                  	call	pJFNFromHandle		; get pointer
 41011 00007376 EBD9                    	JMP	short DupErrorCheck	; check error and do dup
 41012                                  
 41013                                  ;Break	<CheckOwner - verify ownership of handles from server>
 41014                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 41015                                  ;   CheckOwner - Due to the ability of the server to close file handles for a
 41016                                  ;   process without the process knowing it (delete/rename of open files, for
 41017                                  ;   example), it is possible for the redirector to issue a call to a handle
 41018                                  ;   that it soes not rightfully own. We check here to make sure that the
 41019                                  ;   issuing process is the owner of the SFT. At the same time, we do a
 41020                                  ;   SFFromHandle to really make sure that the SFT is good.
 41021                                  ;
 41022                                  ;	ENTRY	BX has the handle
 41023                                  ;		User_ID is the current user
 41024                                  ;	EXIT	Carry Clear => ES:DI points to SFT
 41025                                  ;		Carry Set => AX has error code
 41026                                  ;	USES	none
 41027                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 41028                                  
 41029                                  	; 02/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 41030                                  	; 21/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 41031                                  CheckOwner:
 41032                                  	; 13/07/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 41033                                  
 41034 00007378 E805FD                  	call	SFFromHandle
 41035 0000737B 721B                    	jc	short co_ret_label	; retc
 41036                                  
 41037 0000737D 50                      	push	ax
 41038                                  
 41039                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 41040                                  
 41041                                  ;SR; WIN386 patch - Do not check for USER_ID for using handles since these 
 41042                                  ;SR; are shared across multiple VMs in win386.
 41043                                  
 41044 0000737E 36F606[A110]01          	test	byte [ss:IsWin386],1 ; 02/06/2019
 41045 00007384 7404                    	jz	short no_win386		;win386 is not present
 41046 00007386 31C0                    	xor	ax,ax			;set the zero flag
 41047 00007388 EB08                    	jmp	short _skip_win386	
 41048                                  
 41049                                  no_win386:
 41050 0000738A 36A1[3E03]              	mov	ax,[SS:USER_ID]		;smr;SS Override
 41051                                  	;cmp	ax,[es:di+47]
 41052 0000738E 263B452F                	cmp	ax,[es:di+SF_ENTRY.sf_UID]
 41053                                  
 41054                                  _skip_win386:
 41055 00007392 58                      	pop	ax
 41056                                  	
 41057                                  	; 17/12/2022
 41058 00007393 7403                    	jz	short co_ret_label
 41059                                  	; 02/12/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS compatibility)
 41060                                  	;jnz	short CheckOwner_err
 41061                                  	;retn
 41062                                  	
 41063                                  CheckOwner_err:
 41064                                  	;mov	al,6
 41065 00007395 B006                    	mov	al,error_invalid_handle
 41066 00007397 F9                      	stc
 41067                                  
 41068                                  co_ret_label:
 41069 00007398 C3                      	retn

 41075                                  ; 21/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 41076                                  
 41077                                  ;	TITLE	MACRO - Pathname and macro related internal routines
 41078                                  ;	NAME	MACRO
 41079                                  
 41080                                  ;	Microsoft Confidential
 41081                                  ;	Copyright (C) Microsoft Corporation 1991
 41082                                  ;	All Rights Reserved.
 41083                                  
 41084                                  ;**	MACRO.ASM
 41085                                  ;
 41086                                  ;	$AssignOper
 41087                                  ;	FIND_DPB
 41088                                  ;	InitCDS
 41089                                  ;	$UserOper
 41090                                  ;	GetVisDrv
 41091                                  ;	GetThisDrv
 41092                                  ;	GetCDSFromDrv
 41093                                  ;
 41094                                  ;   Revision history:
 41095                                  ;
 41096                                  ;	Created: MZ 4 April 1983
 41097                                  ;		 MZ 18 April 1983   Make TransFCB handle extended FCBs
 41098                                  ;		 AR 2 June 1983     Define/Delete macro for NET redir.
 41099                                  ;		 MZ 3 Nov 83	    Fix InitCDS to reset length to 2
 41100                                  ;		 MZ 4 Nov 83	    Fix NetAssign to use STRLEN only
 41101                                  ;		 MZ 18 Nov 83	    Rewrite string processing for subtree
 41102                                  ;				    aliasing.
 41103                                  ;
 41104                                  ;   MSDOS performs several types of name translation. First, we maintain for
 41105                                  ;   each valid drive letter the text of the current directory on that drive.
 41106                                  ;   For invalid drive letters, there is no current directory so we pretend to
 41107                                  ;   be at the root. A current directory is either the raw local directory
 41108                                  ;   (consisting of drive:\path) or a local network directory (consisting of
 41109                                  ;   \\machine\path. There is a limit on the point to which a .. is allowed.
 41110                                  ;
 41111                                  ;   Given a path, MSDOS will transform this into a real from-the-root path
 41112                                  ;   without . or .. entries. Any component that is > 8.3 is truncated to
 41113                                  ;   this and all * are expanded into ?'s.
 41114                                  ;
 41115                                  ;   The second part of name translation involves subtree aliasing. A list of
 41116                                  ;   subtree pairs is maintained by the external utility SUBST. The results of
 41117                                  ;   the previous 'canonicalization' are then examined to see if any of the
 41118                                  ;   subtree pairs is a prefix of the user path. If so, then this prefix is
 41119                                  ;   replaced with the other subtree in the pair.
 41120                                  ;
 41121                                  ;   A third part involves mapping this "real" path into a "physical" path.  A
 41122                                  ;   list of drive/subtree pairs are maintained by the external utility JOIN.
 41123                                  ;   The output of the previous translation is examined to see if any of the
 41124                                  ;   subtrees in this list are a prefix of the string. If so, then the prefix
 41125                                  ;   is replaced by the appropriate drive letter. In this manner, we can
 41126                                  ;   'mount' one device under another.
 41127                                  ;
 41128                                  ;   The final form of name translation involves the mapping of a user's
 41129                                  ;   logical drive number into the internal physical drive. This is
 41130                                  ;   accomplished by converting the drive number into letter:CON, performing
 41131                                  ;   the above translation and then converting the character back into a drive
 41132                                  ;   number.
 41133                                  ;
 41134                                  ;   There are two main entry points: TransPath and TransFCB. TransPath will
 41135                                  ;   take a path and form the real text of the pathname with all . and ..
 41136                                  ;   removed. TransFCB will translate an FCB into a path and then invoke
 41137                                  ;   TransPath.
 41138                                  ;
 41139                                  ;	A000	version 4.00  Jan. 1988
 41140                                  
 41141                                  ;Installed = TRUE
 41142                                  
 41143                                  ;	I_need	ThisCDS,DWORD		; pointer to CDS used
 41144                                  ;	I_need	CDSAddr,DWORD		; pointer to CDS table
 41145                                  ;	I_need	CDSCount,BYTE		; number of CDS entries
 41146                                  ;	I_need	CurDrv,BYTE		; current macro assignment (old
 41147                                  ;					; current drive)
 41148                                  ;	I_need	NUMIO,BYTE		; Number of physical drives
 41149                                  ;	I_need	fSharing,BYTE		; TRUE => no redirection allowed
 41150                                  ;	I_need	DummyCDS,80h		; buffer for dummy cds
 41151                                  ;	I_need	DIFFNAM,BYTE		; flag for MyName being set
 41152                                  ;	I_need	MYNAME,16		; machine name
 41153                                  ;	I_need	MYNUM,WORD		; machine number
 41154                                  ;	I_need	DPBHEAD,DWORD		; beginning of DPB chain
 41155                                  ;	I_need	EXTERR_LOCUS,BYTE	; Extended Error Locus
 41156                                  ;	I_need	DrvErr,BYTE		; drive error
 41157                                  
 41158                                  ;BREAK <$AssignOper -- Set up a Macro>
 41159                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 41160                                  ; Inputs:
 41161                                  ;	AL = 00 get assign mode 		    (ReturnMode)
 41162                                  ;	AL = 01 set assign mode 		    (SetMode)
 41163                                  ;	AL = 02 get attach list entry		    (GetAsgList)
 41164                                  ;	AL = 03 Define Macro (attch start)
 41165                                  ;	    BL = Macro type
 41166                                  ;	       = 0 alias
 41167                                  ;	       = 1 file/device
 41168                                  ;	       = 2 drive
 41169                                  ;	       = 3 Char device -> network
 41170                                  ;	       = 4 File device -> network
 41171                                  ;	    DS:SI -> ASCIZ source name
 41172                                  ;	    ES:DI -> ASCIZ destination name
 41173                                  ;	AL = 04 Cancel Macro
 41174                                  ;	    DS:SI -> ASCIZ source name
 41175                                  ;	AL = 05 Modified get attach list entry
 41176                                  ;	AL = 06 Get ifsfunc item
 41177                                  ;	AL = 07 set in_use of a drive's CDS
 41178                                  ;	     DL = drive number, 0=default  0=A,,
 41179                                  ;	AL = 08 reset in_use of a drive's CDS
 41180                                  ;	     DL = drive number, 0=A, 1=B,,,
 41181                                  ; Function:
 41182                                  ;	Do macro stuff
 41183                                  ; Returns:
 41184                                  ;	Std Xenix style error return

 41354                                  ;Break <$UserOper - get/set current user ID (for net)>
 41355                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 41356                                  ;   $UserOper - retrieve or initiate a user id string.	MSDOS will only
 41357                                  ;	maintain this string and do no verifications.
 41358                                  ;
 41359                                  ;   Inputs:	AL has function type (0-get 1-set 2-printer-set 3-printer-get
 41360                                  ;				      4-printer-set-flags,5-printer-get-flags)
 41361                                  ;		DS:DX is user string pointer (calls 1,2)
 41362                                  ;		ES:DI is user buffer (call 3)
 41363                                  ;		BX is assign index (calls 2,3,4,5)
 41364                                  ;		CX is user number (call 1)
 41365                                  ;		DX is flag word (call 4)
 41366                                  ;   Outputs:	If AL = 0 then the current user string is written to DS:DX
 41367                                  ;			and user CX is set to the user number
 41368                                  ;		If AL = 3 then CX bytes have been put at input ES:DI
 41369                                  ;		If AL = 5 then DX is flag word

 41578                                  ;Break <GetCDSFromDrv - convert a drive number to a CDS pointer>
 41579                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 41580                                  ;   GetCDSFromDrv - given a physical drive number, convert it to a CDS
 41581                                  ;	pointer, returning an error if the drive number is greater than the
 41582                                  ;	number of CDS's
 41583                                  ;
 41584                                  ;   Inputs:	AL is physical unit # A=0...
 41585                                  ;   Outputs:	Carry Set if Bad Drive
 41586                                  ;		Carry Clear
 41587                                  ;		    DS:SI -> CDS
 41588                                  ;		    [THISCDS] = DS:SI
 41589                                  ;   Registers modified: DS,SI

 41596                                  	;STC				; signal error

 41630                                  ;BREAK <TransFCB - convert an FCB into a path, doing substitution>
 41631                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 41632                                  ;   TransFCB - Copy an FCB from DS:DX into a reserved area doing all of the
 41633                                  ;       gritty substitution.
 41634                                  ;
 41635                                  ;   Inputs:     DS:DX - pointer to FCB
 41636                                  ;               ES:DI - point to destination
 41637                                  ;   Outputs:    Carry Set - invalid path in final map
 41638                                  ;               Carry Clear - FCB has been mapped into ES:DI
 41639                                  ;                   Sattrib is set from possibly extended FCB
 41640                                  ;                   ExtFCB set if extended FCB found
 41641                                  ;   Registers modified: most
 41642                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 41643                                  
 41644                                  	; 04/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 41645                                  TransFCB:
 41646                                  	; 22/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 41647                                  	; 12/07/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 41648                                  	;LocalVar FCBTmp,16
 41649                                  	;ENTER
 41650 00007519 55                      	push	bp
 41651 0000751A 89E5                    	mov	bp,sp
 41652                                  	;sub	sp,15	; MSDOS 3.3
 41653 0000751C 83EC10                  	sub	sp,16	; MSDOS 6.0
 41654 0000751F 16                      	push	ss
 41655 00007520 07                      	pop	es
 41656 00007521 06                      	push	es
 41657 00007522 57                      	push	di
 41658                                  	;lea	di,[bp-15] ; MSDOS 3.3
 41659                                  	;LEA	DI,FCBTmp 
 41660 00007523 8D7EF0                  	lea	di,[bp-16]		; point to FCB temp area
 41661 00007526 36C606[6C05]00          	mov	byte [SS:EXTFCB],0	; no extended FCB found ;smr;SS Override
 41662 0000752C 36C606[6D05]00          	mov	byte [SS:SATTRIB],0	; default search attributes;smr;SS Override
 41663 00007532 E826AD                  	call	GetExtended             ; get FCB, extended or not
 41664                                  	; 06/12/2022
 41665 00007535 740D                    	jz	short GetDrive		; not an extended FCB, get drive
 41666 00007537 8A44FF                  	mov	AL,[SI-1]               ; get attributes
 41667 0000753A 36A2[6D05]              	mov	[SS:SATTRIB],AL		; store search attributes;smr;SS Override
 41668 0000753E 36C606[6C05]FF          	mov	byte [SS:EXTFCB],-1	; signal extended FCB  ;smr;SS Override
 41669                                  GetDrive:
 41670 00007544 AC                      	lodsb				; get drive byte
 41671 00007545 E85CFF                  	call	GETTHISDRV
 41672 00007548 722A                    	jc	short BadPack
 41673 0000754A E87303                  	call	TextFromDrive           ; convert 0-based drive to text
 41674                                  
 41675                                  ; Scan the source to see if there are any illegal chars
 41676                                  
 41677                                  	;mov	bx,CharType		; load lookup table
 41678 0000754D B90B00                  	mov	cx,11
 41679 00007550 56                      	push	si			; back over name, ext
 41680                                  FCBScan:
 41681 00007551 AC                      	lodsb				; get a byte
 41682                                  	
 41683                                  	; 09/08/2018
 41684                                  	;;xlat	byte [es:bx]
 41685                                  	;es	xlat
 41686

 41689                                  
 41690                                  	;test	al,8	
 41691 00007555 A808                    	test	al,FFCB
 41692 00007557 741B                    	jz	short BadPack
 41693                                  NextCh:

 41695 0000755B 5E                      	pop	si
 41696 0000755C 89FB                    	mov	bx,di
 41697 0000755E E858B1                  	call	PackName                ; crunch the path
 41698 00007561 5F                      	pop	di			; get original destination
 41699 00007562 07                      	pop	es
 41700 00007563 16                      	push	ss			; get DS addressability
 41701 00007564 1F                      	pop	ds
 41702                                  	;lea	si,[bp-15] ; MSDOS 3.3
 41703                                  	;LEA	SI,FCBTmp		; point at new pathname
 41704 00007565 8D76F0                  	lea	si,[bp-16]
 41705 00007568 803F00                  	cmp	byte [bx],0
 41706 0000756B 7407                    	jz	short BadPack
 41707 0000756D 55                      	push	bp
 41708 0000756E E80E00                  	call	TransPathSet            ; convert the path
 41709 00007571 5D                      	pop	bp
 41710 00007572 7303                    	jnc	short FCBRet		; bye with transPath error code
 41711                                  BadPack:

 41714 00007575 B003                    	MOV     AL,error_path_not_found

 41718 00007579 5D                      	pop	bp

 41724                                  ;BREAK <TransPath - copy a path, do string sub and put in current dir>
 41725                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 41726                                  ;
 41727                                  ;   TransPath - copy a path from DS:SI to ES:DI, performing component string
 41728                                  ;       substitution, insertion of current directory and fixing . and ..
 41729                                  ;       entries. Perform splicing. Allow input string to match splice
 41730                                  ;       exactly.
 41731                                  ;
 41732                                  ;   TransPathSet - Same as above except No splicing is performed if input path
 41733                                  ;       matches splice.
 41734                                  ;
 41735                                  ;   TransPathNoSet - No splicing/local using is performed at all.
 41736                                  ;
 41737                                  ;   The following anomalous behaviour is required:
 41738                                  ;
 41739                                  ;       Drive letters on devices are ignored. (set up DummyCDS)
 41740                                  ;       Paths on devices are ignored. (truncate to 0-length)
 41741                                  ;       Raw net I/O sets ThisCDS => NULL.
 41742                                  ;       fSharing => dummyCDS and no subst/splice. Only canonicalize.
 41743                                  ;
 41744                                  ;   Other behaviour:
 41745                                  ;
 41746                                  ;       ThisCDS set up.
 41747                                  ;       FatRead done on local CDS.
 41748                                  ;       ValidateCDS done on local CDS.
 41749                                  ;
 41750                                  ;   Brief flowchart:
 41751                                  ;
 41752                                  ;       if fSharing then
 41753                                  ;           set up DummyCDS (ThisCDS)
 41754                                  ;           canonicalize (sets cMeta)
 41755                                  ;           splice
 41756                                  ;           fatRead
 41757                                  ;           return
 41758                                  ;       if \\ or d:\\ lead then
 41759                                  ;           set up null CDS (ThisCDS)
 41760                                  ;           canonicalize (sets cMeta)
 41761                                  ;           return
 41762                                  ;       if device then
 41763                                  ;           set up dummyCDS (ThisCDS)
 41764                                  ;           canonicalize (sets cMeta)
 41765                                  ;           return
 41766                                  ;       if file then
 41767                                  ;           getCDS (sets (ThisCDS) from name)
 41768                                  ;           validateCDS (may reset current dir)
 41769                                  ;           Copy current dir
 41770                                  ;           canonicalize (set cMeta)
 41771                                  ;           splice
 41772                                  ;           generate correct CDS (ThisCDS)
 41773                                  ;           if local then
 41774                                  ;               fatread
 41775                                  ;           return
 41776                                  ;
 41777                                  ;   Inputs:     DS:SI - point to ASCIZ string path
 41778                                  ;               DI - point to buffer in DOSDATA
 41779                                  ;   Outputs:    Carry Set - invalid path specification: too many .., bad
 41780                                  ;                   syntax, etc. or user FAILed to I 24.
 41781                                  ;               WFP_Start - points to beginning of buffer
 41782                                  ;               Curr_Dir_End - points to end of current dir in path
 41783                                  ;               DS - DOSDATA
 41784                                  ;   Registers modified: most
 41785                                  ;
 41786                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 41787                                  
 41788                                  ; 22/05/2019
 41789                                  ; 13/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 41790                                  ; DOSCODE:AB99h (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
 41791                                  
 41792                                  ; 04/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 41793                                  ; DOSCODE:AB39h (MSDOS 5.0, MSDOS.SYS)
 41794                                  
 41795                                  TransPath:
 41796 0000757B 30C0                    	XOR     AL,AL
 41797 0000757D EB02                    	JMP     SHORT SetSplice
 41798                                  TransPathSet:
 41799 0000757F B0FF                    	MOV     AL,-1
 41800                                  SetSplice:
 41801 00007581 36A2[4C03]              	MOV	[SS:NoSetDir],AL	;   NoSetDir = !fExact; ;smr;SS Override
 41802 00007585 B0FF                    	MOV     AL,-1
 41803                                  TransPathNoSet:

 41805 0000758B 36C606[7A05]FF          	MOV	byte [ss:CMETA],-1      			;smr;SS Override
 41806 00007591 36893E[B205]            	MOV     [SS:WFP_START],DI 				;smr;SS Override
 41807 00007596 36C706[B605]FFFF        	MOV	word [SS:CURR_DIR_END],-1 ; crack from start	;smr;SS Override
 41808 0000759D 16                      	push	ss
 41809 0000759E 07                      	pop	es

 41812                                  ;
 41813                                  ; if this is through the server dos call, fsharing is set. We set up a
 41814                                  ; dummy cds and let the operation go.
 41815                                  ;
 41816 000075A3 36F606[7205]FF          	TEST	byte [SS:FSHARING],-1	; if no sharing		;smr;SS Override
 41817 000075A9 7435                    	JZ	short CheckUNC		; skip to UNC check
 41818                                  ;
 41819                                  ; ES:DI point to buffer
 41820                                  ;
 41821 000075AB E8FC02                  	CALL	DriveFromText           ; get drive and advance DS:SI
 41822 000075AE E8F3FE                  	call	GETTHISDRV              ; Set ThisCDS and convert to 0-based
 41823 000075B1 722A                    	jc	short NoPath

 41825 000075B6 8D5D01                  	LEA	BX,[DI+1]               ; backup limit

 41827 000075BC 72BC                    	jc	short TransPath_retn	; errors
 41828                                  ;

 41830                                  ;

 41837                                  NoServerSplice:

 41848                                  
 41849                                  ; Let the network decide if the name is for a spooled device. It will map
 41850                                  ; the name if so.
 41851                                  
 41852                                  CheckUNC:
 41853 000075E0 36C706[A205]FFFF        	MOV     WORD [SS:THISCDS],-1	; NULL thisCDS		;smr;SS Override

 41855 000075E7 B82311                  	mov	ax,1123h
 41856 000075EA CD2F                    	int	2Fh	; Multiplex - NETWORK REDIRECTOR - QUALIFY REMOTE FILENAME
 41857                                  			; DS:SI -> ASCIZ filename to canonicalize

 41863                                  ; \\s) or is a local file/device. Remember that if a net-spooled device was
 41864                                  ; input, then the name has been changed to the remote spooler by the above net
 41865                                  ; call. Also, there may be a drive in front of the \\.
 41866                                  
 41867                                  NO_CHECK:

 41901                                  CheckDevice:

 41903                                  ; Check DS:SI for device. First eat any path stuff
 41904

 41912                                  CheckPath:

 41914 00007628 55                      	push	bp			; save drive number
 41915                                  
 41916                                  
 41917                                  ; 04/12/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS compatibility)
 41918                                  %if 0
 41919                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 41920                                  ;;;BUGBUG BUG 10-26-1992 scottq
 41921                                  ;;;This is a hack for the CDROM extensions (2.1) who scan looking
 41922                                  ;;;for the following POP BP == 5Dh (restore <bp,ax>).
 41923                                  ;;;The problem is that a direct call to CheckThisDevice can (and did)
 41924                                  ;;;end up having a 5D in the opcode's displacement field. The
 41925                                  ;;;scanning code would choke on this thinking it was a POP BP instruction.
 41926                                  ;;;
 41927                                  ;;;What we do here is do a call to a function that is less than 5Dh
 41928                                  ;;;bytes away (and assert its not exactly 5D away) that jmps (transfers)
 41929                                  ;;;to the correct function. This cannot accidently insert a 5Dh.
 41930                                  ;;;
 41931                                  ;;;More info:
 41932                                  ;;;  This particular scan is begun at the UNCdone label for 32 bytes
 41933                                  ;;;looking for pop BP, so you cannot put a 5D between here and there.
 41934                                  ;;;
 41935                                  	call	no5Dshere
 41936                                  start5Dhack:
 41937                                  ;following is replaced with 5Dhack code--Invoke CheckThisDevice
 41938                                  backfrom5Dhack:
 41939                                  
 41940                                  %endif
 41941                                  	; 04/12/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS compatibility)
 41942                                  	; Note: 'call no5Dshere' is not required for MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS
 41943 00007629 E8B6D6                  	call    CheckThisDevice	; E8h,6Fh,0D6h
 41944                                  
 41945 0000762C 5D                      	pop	bp
 41946 0000762D 58                      	pop	ax			; get drive letter back
 41947 0000762E 731C                    	JNC	short DoFile		; yes we have a file.
 41948                                  
 41949                                  ; We have a device. AX has drive letter. At this point we may fake a CDS ala
 41950                                  ; sharing DOS call. We know by getting here that we are NOT in a sharing DOS
 41951                                  ; call.
 41952                                  
 41953 00007630 36C606[7205]FF          	MOV	byte [SS:FSHARING],-1	; simulate sharing dos call;smr;SS Override
 41954 00007636 E86BFE                  	call	GETTHISDRV              ; set ThisCDS and init DUMMYCDS
 41955 00007639 36C606[7205]00          	MOV     byte [SS:FSHARING],0	;                       ;smr;SS Override
 41956                                  
 41957                                  ; Now that we have noted that we have a device, we put it into a form that
 41958                                  ; getpath can understand. Normally getpath requires d:\ to begin the input
 41959                                  ; string. We relax this to state that if the d:\ is present then the path
 41960                                  ; may be a file. If D:/ (note the forward slash) is present then we have
 41961                                  ; a device.
 41962                                  
 41963 0000763F E87E02                  	CALL    TextFromDrive
 41964 00007642 B02F                    	MOV     AL,'/'                  ; path sep.
 41965 00007644 AA                      	STOSB
 41966 00007645 E867A1                  	call	StrCpy			; move remainder of string
 41967                                  
 41968 00007648 F8                      	CLC                             ; everything OK.
 41969 00007649 16                      	push	ss
 41970 0000764A 1F                      	pop	ds                      ; remainder of OK stuff
 41971                                  DoFile_retn:
 41972 0000764B C3                      	retn
 41973                                  
 41974                                  ; 04/12/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS compatibility)
 41975                                  %if 0
 41976                                  
 41977                                  no5Dshere:
 41978                                  	; 10/08/2018
 41979                                  	jmp	CheckThisDevice		; snoop for device
 41980                                  %endif
 41981                                  
 41982                                  ;.erre (no5Dshere - start5Dhack - 5D)
 41983                                  
 41984                                  ; We have a file. Get the raw CDS.
 41985                                  
 41986                                  DoFile:
 41987                                  	; MSDOS 3.3 (& MSDOS 6.0)
 41988                                  
 41989 0000764C E839FE                  	call	GetVisDrv               ; get proper CDS
 41990                                  	;mov	al,3 
 41991 0000764F B003                    	MOV     AL,error_path_not_found ; Set up for possible bad file error
 41992 00007651 72F8                    	jc	short DoFile_retn  ; CARRY set -> bogus drive/spliced
 41993                                  
 41994                                  ; ThisCDS has correct CDS. DS:SI advanced to point to beginning of path/file.
 41995                                  ; Make sure that CDS has valid directory; ValidateCDS requires a temp buffer
 41996                                  ; Use the one that we are going to use (ES:DI).
 41997                                  
 41998                                  	;SAVE    <DS,SI,ES,DI>		; save all string pointers.
 41999 00007653 1E                      	push	ds
 42000 00007654 56                      	push	si

 42002 00007656 57                      	push	di

 42138                                  ;BREAK <Canonicalize - copy a path and remove . and .. entries>
 42139                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 42140                                  ;   Canonicalize - copy path removing . and .. entries.
 42141                                  ;
 42142                                  ;   Inputs:     DS:SI - point to ASCIZ string path
 42143                                  ;               ES:DI - point to buffer
 42144                                  ;               BX - backup limit (offset from ES) points to slash
 42145                                  ;               BP - end of buffer
 42146                                  ;   Outputs:    Carry Set - invalid path specification: too many .., bad
 42147                                  ;                   syntax, etc.
 42148                                  ;               Carry Clear -
 42149                                  ;                   DS:DI - advanced to end of string
 42150                                  ;                   ES:DI - advanced to end of canonicalized form after nul
 42151                                  ;   Registers modified: AX CX DX (in addition to those above)
 42152                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 42153                                  
 42154                                  	; 04/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 42155                                  
 42156                                  Canonicalize:
 42157                                  
 42158                                  ; We copy all leading path separators.
 42159                                  
 42160 000076F0 AC                      	LODSB                           ;   while (PathChr (*s))

 42164 000076F8 7319                    	JAE	short CanonBad		;           goto error;

 42167                                  CanonDec:

 42169                                  
 42170                                  ; Main canonicalization loop. We come here with DS:SI pointing to a textual
 42171                                  ; component (no leading path separators) and ES:DI being the destination
 42172                                  ; buffer.
 42173

 42425                                  ;   Splice - take a string and substitute a prefix if one exists. Change

 42514                                  ;Break <$NameTrans - partially process a name>
 42515                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 42516                                  ;   $NameTrans - allow users to see what names get mapped to. This call
 42517                                  ;   performs only string substitution and canonicalization, not splicing.  Due
 42518                                  ;   to Transpath playing games with devices, we need to insure that the output
 42519                                  ;   has drive letter and : in it.
 42520                                  ;
 42521                                  ;   Inputs:     DS:SI - source string for translation
 42522                                  ;               ES:DI - pointer to buffer
 42523                                  ;   Outputs:
 42524                                  ;       Carry Clear
 42525                                  ;               Buffer at ES:DI is filled in with data
 42526                                  ;               ES:DI point byte after nul byte at end of dest string in buffer
 42527                                  ;       Carry Set
 42528                                  ;               AX = error_path_not_found
 42529                                  ;   Registers modified: all

 42543                                  ; a previous DOS call is used for attrib and DevName thinks it is not a 
 42544                                  ; device if the old call set the volume attribute bit. Note that devname in
 42545                                  ; dir2.asm gets ultimately called by Transpath. See also M026. Also save
 42546                                  ; and restore CX.

 42548                                  	;mov	ch,16h

 42604                                  ;   trailing :. TextFromDrive1 takes a 1-based number.

 42621                                  ;Break   <PathPref - see if one path is a prefix of another>
 42622                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 42623                                  ;   PathPref - compare DS:SI with ES:DI to see if one is the prefix of the
 42624                                  ;   other.  Remember that only at a pathchar break are we allowed to have a
 42625                                  ;   prefix: A:\ and A:\FOO
 42626                                  ;
 42627                                  ;   Inputs:     DS:SI potential prefix
 42628                                  ;               ES:DI string
 42629                                  ;   Outputs:    Zero set => prefix found
 42630                                  ;                   DI/SI advanced past matching part
 42631                                  ;               Zero reset => no prefix, DS/SI garbage
 42632                                  ;   Registers modified: CX
 42633                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 42634                                  
 42635                                  PathPref:

 42637 000078CB 49                      	DEC     CX                      ; do not include nul byte
 42638 000078CC F3A6                    	REPZ    CMPSB                   ; compare
 42639 000078CE 75F7                    	jnz	short PathPref_retn	; if NZ then return NZ
 42640 000078D0 50                      	push	ax			; save char register
 42641 000078D1 8A44FF                  	MOV     AL,[SI-1]               ; get last byte to match
 42642 000078D4 E897E1                  	call    PATHCHRCMP              ; is it a path char (Root!)
 42643 000078D7 7406                    	JZ	short Prefix		; yes, match root (I hope)
 42644                                  NotSep:                                 ; 2/13/KK
 42645 000078D9 268A05                  	MOV     AL,[ES:DI]		; get next char to match
 42646 000078DC E878FE                  	CALL    PathSepGotCh            ; was it a pathchar?
 42647                                  Prefix:
 42648 000078DF 58                      	pop	ax			; get back original
 42649 000078E0 C3                      	retn

 42683                                  ;BREAK <$Open - open a file handle>
 42684                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 42685                                  ;   Assembler usage:
 42686                                  ;           LDS     DX, Name
 42687                                  ;           MOV     AH, Open
 42688                                  ;           MOV     AL, access
 42689                                  ;           INT     int_command
 42690                                  ;
 42691                                  ;       ACCESS          Function
 42692                                  ;       ------          --------
 42693                                  ;       open_for_read   file is opened for reading
 42694                                  ;       open_for_write  file is opened for writing
 42695                                  ;       open_for_both   file is opened for both reading and writing.
 42696                                  ;
 42697                                  ;   Error returns:
 42698                                  ;           AX = error_invalid_access
 42699                                  ;              = error_file_not_found
 42700                                  ;              = error_access_denied
 42701                                  ;              = error_too_many_open_files

 42703                                  
 42704                                  ; MSDOS 6.0
 42705                                  ;	BREAK <$Open - open a file from a path string>
 42706                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 42707                                  ;
 42708                                  ;**	$OPen - Open a File
 42709                                  ;
 42710                                  ;	given a path name in DS:DX and an open mode in AL, $Open opens the
 42711                                  ;	file and and returns a handle
 42712                                  ;
 42713                                  ;	ENTRY	(DS:DX) = pointer to asciz name
 42714                                  ;		(AL) = open mode
 42715                                  ;	EXIT	'C' clear if OK
 42716                                  ;		  (ax) = file handle
 42717                                  ;		'C' set if error
 42718                                  ;		  (ax) = error code
 42719                                  ;	USES	all
 42720                                  ;
 42721                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 42722                                  
 42723                                  ; 13/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 42724                                  ; 04/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)

 42726                                  _$OPEN:       
 42727 000078EA 30E4                    	xor	ah,ah  ; MSDOS 6.0	
 42728                                  _$Open2:

 42730 000078EC B516                    	mov	ch,attr_hidden+attr_system+attr_directory
 42731 000078EE E85702                  	call	SetAttrib

 42736 000078F4 50                      	push	ax

 42738                                  ;*	General file open/create code. The $CREATE call and the various
 42739                                  ;	$OPEN calls all come here.
 42740                                  ;
 42741                                  ;	We'll share a lot of the standard stuff of allocating SFTs, cracking
 42742                                  ;	path names, etc., and then dispatch to our individual handlers.
 42743                                  ;	WARNING - this info and list is just a guess, not definitive - jgl
 42744                                  ;
 42745                                  ;	(TOS) = create mode
 42746                                  ;	(CX) = address of routine to call to do actual function
 42747                                  ;	(DS:DX) = ASCIZ name
 42748                                  ;	SAttrib = Attribute mask
 42749                                  
 42750                                  ;	Get a free SFT and mark it "being allocated"
 42751                                  
 42752                                  AccessFile:
 42753 000078F5 E8F19F                  	call	ECritSFT
 42754 000078F8 E8D8F7                  	call	SFNFree			; get a free sfn
 42755 000078FB E818A0                  	call	LCritSFT
 42756 000078FE 7214                    	jc	short OpenFailJ		; oops, no free sft's
 42757 00007900 36891E[AA05]            	MOV	[SS:SFN],BX		; save the SFN for later;smr;SS Override
 42758 00007905 36893E[9E05]            	MOV	[SS:THISSFT],DI		; save the SF offset	;smr;SS Override
 42759 0000790A 368C06[A005]            	MOV	[SS:THISSFT+2],ES	; save the SF segment	;smr;SS Override
 42760                                  
 42761                                  ;	Find a free area in the user's JFN table.
 42762                                  
 42763 0000790F E8AEF7                  	call	JFNFree			; get a free jfn
 42764 00007912 7303                    	jnc	short SaveJFN
 42765                                  OpenFailJ:
 42766 00007914 E99300                  	JMP	OpenFail		; there were free JFNs... try SFN
 42767                                  
 42768                                  SaveJFN:
 42769 00007917 36893E[AE05]            	mov	[ss:PJFN],DI		; save the jfn offset	;smr;SS Override
 42770 0000791C 368C06[B005]            	MOV	[ss:PJFN+2],ES		; save the jfn segment	;smr;SS Override
 42771 00007921 36891E[AC05]            	MOV	[ss:JFN],BX		; save the jfn itself	;smr;SS Override
 42772                                  
 42773                                  ;	We have been given an JFN. We lock it down to prevent other tasks from
 42774                                  ;	reusing the same JFN.
 42775                                  
 42776 00007926 368B1E[AA05]            	MOV	BX,[ss:SFN]					;smr;SS Override
 42777 0000792B 26881D                  	MOV	[ES:DI],BL		; assign the JFN
 42778 0000792E 89D6                    	MOV	SI,DX			; get name in appropriate place
 42779 00007930 BF[BE03]                	MOV	DI,OPENBUF		; appropriate buffer
 42780 00007933 51                      	push	cx			; save routine to call
 42781 00007934 E844FC                  	call	TransPath		; convert the path
 42782 00007937 5B                      	pop	bx			; (bx) = routine to call
 42783

 42822                                  ;	modes in sf_mode. Call Set_EXT_mode to do all this. See
 42823                                  ;	Set_EXT_mode in creat.asm

 42858                                  ; contents. If we find one, then we can 'collapse' thissft onto the already
 42859                                  ; opened one. Otherwise we use this new one. We compare uid/pid/mode/mft
 42860                                  ;

 42862                                  ; sharer.

 42864 00007981 36A1[AC05]              	MOV	AX,[ss:JFN]				;smr;SS Override

 42909                                  ; MSDOS 2.11
 42910                                  ;BREAK <$CREAT - creat a new file and open him for input>
 42911                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 42912                                  ;   Assembler usage:
 42913                                  ;           LDS     DX, name
 42914                                  ;           MOV     AH, Creat
