 45709                                  
 45710                                  ; M020 : BEGIN
 45711                                  ;
 45712                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 45713                                  ;
 45714                                  ; procedure : RationalPatch
 45715                                  ;
 45716                                  ; A routine (in Ration DOS extender) which is invoked at hardware interrupts
 45717                                  ; clobbers CX register on 286 machines. (123 release 3 uses Rational DOS
 45718                                  ; extender). This routine identifies Buggy Rational EXEs and fixes the bug.
 45719                                  ;
 45720                                  ; THE BUG is in the following code sequence:
 45721                                  ;
 45722                                  ;8b 0e 10 00	mov	cx, ds:[10h]		; delay count
 45723                                  ;90		even				; word align
 45724                                  ;e2 fe		loop	$			; wait		CLOBBERS CX
 45725                                  ;e8 xx xx	call	set_A20			; enable A20
 45726                                  ;
 45727                                  ; This patch routine replaces the mov & the loop with a far call into a
 45728                                  ; routine in DOS data segment which is in low memory (because A20 line
 45729                                  ; is off). The routine (RatBugCode) in DOS data saves & restores CX around
 45730                                  ; a mov & loop.
 45731                                  ;
 45732                                  ; Identification of Buggy Rational EXE
 45733                                  ; ====================================
 45734                                  ;
 45735                                  ; (ALL OFFSETS ARE IN THE PROGRAM SECTION - EXCLUDING THE EXE HEADER)
 45736                                  ;
 45737                                  ; OFFSET				Contains
 45738                                  ; ------				--------
 45739                                  ; 0000h			100 times Version number in binary
 45740                                  ;			bug exists in version 3.48 thru 3.83 (both inclusive)
 45741                                  ;
 45742                                  ; 000ah			the WORDS : 0000h, 0020h, 0000h, 0040h, 0001h
 45743                                  ;
 45744                                  ; 002ah			offset where version number is stored in ASCII
 45745                                  ;				e.g. '3.48A'
 45746                                  ;
 45747                                  ; 0030h			offset of copyright string. Copyright strings either
 45748                                  ;			start with "DOS/16M Copyright...." or
 45749                                  ;			"Copyright.....". The string contains
 45750                                  ;			"Rational Systems, Inc."
 45751                                  ;
 45752                                  ; 0020h			word : Paragraph offset of the buggy code segment
 45753                                  ;				from the program image
 45754                                  ; 0016h			word : size of buggy code segment
 45755                                  ;
 45756                                  ;	Buggy code is definite to start after offset 200h in its segment
 45757                                  ;
 45758                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 45759                                  
 45760                                  ; 23/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 45761                                  ; DOSCODE:B976h (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
 45762                                  
 45763                                  ; 04/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 45764                                  ; DOSCODE:B654h (MSDOS 5.0, MSDOS.SYS)
 45765                                  
 45766                                  RScanPattern1:
 45767                                  	db	0, 0, 20h, 0, 0, 0, 40h, 0, 1, 0
 45768                                  
 45769                                  RLen1 equ $ - RScanPattern1
 45770                                  
 45771                                  RScanPattern2:
 45772                                  	db	8Bh, 0Eh, 10h, 00h, 90h, 0E2h, 0FEh, 0E8h
 45773                                  
 45774                                  RLen2 equ $ - RScanPattern2
 45775                                  
 45776                                  RScanPattern3:
 45777                                  	db	8Bh, 0Eh, 10h, 00h, 0E2h, 0FEh, 0E8h
 45778                                  
 45779                                  RLen3 equ $ - RScanPattern2
 45780                                  
 45781                                  ; DOSCODE:B98Fh (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
 45782                                  ; DOSCODE:B66Dh (MSDOS 5.0, MSDOS.SYS)
 45783                                  
 45784                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 45785                                  ;
 45786                                  ; INPUT : ES = segment where program got loaded
 45787                                  ;
 45788                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 45789                                  
 45790                                  RationalPatch:
 45791                                  	cld
 45792                                  	push	ax
 45793                                  	push	bx
 45794                                  	push	cx
 45795                                  	push	dx
 45796                                  	push	si
 45797                                  	push	di
 45798                                  	push	es
 45799                                  	push	ds			; we use all of them
 45800                                  	mov	di,0Ah			; look for pat1 at offset 0Ah
 45801                                  	push	cs
 45802                                  	pop	ds
 45803                                  	
 45804                                  	mov	si,RScanPattern1
 45805                                  	;mov	cx,10
 45806                                  	mov	cx,RLen1
 45807                                  	rep	cmpsb			; do we have the pattern ?
 45808                                  	jne	short rpexit
 45809                                  	mov	ax,[es:0]
 45810                                  	cmp	ax,348			; is it a buggy version ?
 45811                                  	jb	short rpexit
 45812                                  	cmp	ax,383			; is it a buggy version
 45813                                  	ja	short rpexit
 45814                                  
 45815                                  	call	VerifyVersion
 45816                                  	jne	short rpexit
 45817                                  
 45818                                  	mov	cx,[es:16h]		; Length of buggy code seg
 45819                                  	sub	cx,200h			; Length we search (we start
 45820                                  					;  at offset 200h)
 45821                                  	mov	es,[es:20h]		; es=buggy code segment
 45822                                  	mov	si,RScanPattern2
 45823                                  	;mov	dx,8	
 45824                                  	mov	dx,RLen2
 45825                                  	call	ScanCodeSeq		; look for code seq with nop
 45826                                  	jz	short rpfound
 45827                                  
 45828                                  	mov	si,RScanPattern3
 45829                                  	;mov	dx,15
 45830                                  	mov	dx,RLen3
 45831                                  	call	ScanCodeSeq		; look for code seq w/o nop
 45832                                  	jnz	short rpexit
 45833                                  
 45834                                  rpfound:
 45835                                  	
 45836                                  ;	we set up a far call into DOS data
 45837                                  ;	dx has the length of the code seq we were searching for
 45838                                  
 45839                                  	mov	al,9Ah			; far call opcode
 45840                                  	stosb
 45841                                  	mov	ax,RatBugCode
 45842                                  	stosw
 45843                                  	mov	ax,ss
 45844                                  	stosw
 45845                                  	mov	cx,dx
 45846                                  	sub	cx,6			; filler (with NOPs)
 45847                                  	mov	al,90h
 45848                                  	rep	stosb
 45849                                  rpexit:
 45850                                  	pop	ds
 45851                                  	pop	es
 45852                                  	pop	di
 45853                                  	pop	si
 45854                                  	pop	dx
 45855                                  	pop	cx
 45856                                  	pop	bx
 45857                                  	pop	ax
 45858                                  	retn
 45859                                  
 45860                                  ; M020 END
 45861                                  
 45862                                  ; 04/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 45863                                  ; (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS compatibility)
 45864                                  
 45865                                  ; DOSCODE:B6D8h (MSDOS 5.0, MSDOS.SYS)
 45866                                  
 45867                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 45868                                  ;
 45869                                  ; ScanCodeSeq
 45870                                  ;
 45871                                  ; Looks for a pattern pointed to by DS:SI & len DX in ES:200 to ES:200+CX-1
 45872                                  ;
 45873                                  ; returns in ES:DI the start of the pattern if Zero flag is set
 45874                                  ;
 45875                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 45876                                  
 45877                                  ScanCodeSeq:
 45878                                  	; 17/12/2022
 45879                                  	mov	di,200h
 45880                                  ;ScanCodeSeq_di:
 45881                                  	push	cx
 45882                                  	sub	cx,dx
 45883                                  	inc	cx
 45884                                  	; 17/12/2022
 45885                                  	; 04/12/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS compatibility)
 45886                                  	;mov	di,200h
 45887                                  scsagain:
 45888                                  	push	si
 45889                                  	push	di
 45890                                  	push	cx
 45891                                  	mov	cx,dx
 45892                                  	rep	cmpsb
 45893                                  	pop	cx
 45894                                  	pop	di
 45895                                  	pop	si
 45896                                  	je	short scsfound
 45897                                  	inc	di
 45898                                  	loop	scsagain
 45899                                  scsfound:
 45900                                  	pop	cx
 45901                                  vvexit:		; 18/12/2022
 45902                                  	retn
 45903                                  
 45904                                  
 45905                                  ; 04/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 45906                                  ; (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS compatibility)
 45907                                  
 45908                                  ; DOSCODE:B6F0h (MSDOS 5.0, MSDOS.SYS)
 45909                                  
 45910                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 45911                                  ;
 45912                                  ; VerifyVersion
 45913                                  ;
 45914                                  ; Checks whether the binary version from ES:0 matches the ASCII version
 45915                                  ; from ES:2A.
 45916                                  ;
 45917                                  ;       Entry: AX = binary version number 
 45918                                  ;       Exit : Z flag set if version numbers match
 45919                                  ;
 45920                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 45921                                  
 45922                                  VerifyVersion:
 45923                                  	mov	si,[es:2Ah]		; offset of version number
 45924                                  					;  in ascii
 45925                                  	mov	bl,10
 45926                                  	add	si,3			; point to last digit
 45927                                  
 45928                                  	call	VVDigit
 45929                                  	jne	short vvexit
 45930                                  	call	VVDigit
 45931                                  	jne	short vvexit
 45932                                  	cmp	byte [es:si],'.' ; 2Eh
 45933                                  	jne	short vvexit
 45934                                  	dec	si
 45935                                  	;call	VVDigit
 45936                                  	; 18/12/2022
 45937                                  	;jmp	short VVDigit
 45938                                  ;vvexit:
 45939                                  	;retn
 45940                                  VVDigit:
 45941                                  	div	bl
 45942                                  	add	ah,'0' ; 30h
 45943                                  	dec	si
 45944                                  	cmp	[es:si+1],ah
 45945                                  	mov	ah,0			; do not xor or sub we need Z
 45946                                  	retn
 45947                                  
 45948                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------- 
 45949                                  %endif	; 28/12/2022
 45950                                  
 45951                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 45952                                  ;
 45953                                  ;	M068
 45954                                  ;
 45955                                  ; 	Procedure Name	: IsCopyProt
 45956                                  ;
 45957                                  ;	Inputs		: DS:100 -> start of com file just read in
 45958                                  ;
 45959                                  ;	Outputs		: sets the A20OFF_COUNT variable to 10 if 
 45960                                  ;			  the program loaded in DS:100 uses a MICROSOFT
 45961                                  ;			  copy protect scheme that relies on the A20 line
 45962                                  ;			  being turned off for it's scheme to work.
 45963                                  ;
 45964                                  ;			  Note: The int 21 function dispatcher will turn 
 45965                                  ;				a20 off, if the A20OFF_COUNT is non-zero 
 45966                                  ;				and dec the A20OFF_COUNT before	iretting 
 45967                                  ;				to the user. 
 45968                                  ;
 45969                                  ;	Uses		: ES, DI, SI, CX
 45970                                  ;
 45971                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 45972                                  
 45973                                  ; 23/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 45974                                  
 45975                                  CPStartOffset	EQU	0175h
 45976                                  CPID1Offset	EQU	011Bh
 45977                                  CPID2Offset	EQU	0173h
 45978                                  CPID3Offset	EQU	0146h
 45979                                  CPID4Offset	EQU	0124h
 45980                                  ID1		EQU	05343h
 45981                                  ID2		EQU	05044h
 45982                                  ID3		EQU	0F413h
 45983                                  ID4		EQU	08000h
 45984                                  
 45985                                  ; DOSCODE:B9FAh (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
 45986                                  
 45987                                  ; 04/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 45988                                  ; DOSCODE:B71Ch (MSDOS 5.0, MSDOS.SYS)
 45989                                  
 45990                                  CPScanPattern:
 45991 00008070 89264801                	db	89h,26h,48h,01h		 ; mov [148],sp
 45992 00008074 8C0E4C01                	db	8Ch,0Eh,4Ch,01h		 ; mov [14C],cs
 45993 00008078 C7064A010001            	db	0C7h,06h,4Ah,01h,00h,01h ; mov [14A],100h 
 45994 0000807E 8C0E1301                	db 	8Ch,0Eh,13h,01h		 ; mov [113],cs
 45995 00008082 B82001                  	db	0B8h,20h,01h		 ; mov ax,120h
 45996 00008085 BE0001                  	db	0BEh,00h,01h		 ; mov si,100h
 45997                                  
 45998                                  CPSPlen	EQU $ - CPScanPattern
 45999                                  
 46000                                  ; DOSCODE:BA12h (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
 46001                                  ; DOSCODE:B734h (MSDOS 5.0, MSDOS.SYS)
 46002                                  
 46003                                  IsCopyProt:
 46004 00008088 813E1B014353            	cmp	word [CPID1Offset],ID1
 46005 0000808E 752D                    	jne	short CP_done
 46006                                  
 46007 00008090 813E73014450            	cmp	word [CPID2Offset],ID2
 46008 00008096 7525                    	jne	short CP_done
 46009                                  
 46010 00008098 813E460113F4            	cmp	word [CPID3Offset],ID3
 46011 0000809E 751D                    	jne	short CP_done
 46012                                  
 46013 000080A0 813E24010080            	cmp	word [CPID4Offset],ID4
 46014 000080A6 7515                    	jne	short CP_done
 46015                                  
 46016 000080A8 0E                      	push	cs
 46017 000080A9 07                      	pop	es
 46018 000080AA BF[7080]                	mov	di,CPScanPattern	; es:di -> Pattern to find
 46019                                  
 46020 000080AD BE7501                  	mov	si,CPStartOffset	; ds:si -> possible location 
 46021                                  					; of pattern
 46022                                  
 46023 000080B0 B91800                  	mov	cx,CPSPlen ; 24		; cx = length of pattern
 46024 000080B3 F3A6                    	repe	cmpsb
 46025 000080B5 7506                    	jnz	short CP_done
 46026                                  
 46027 000080B7 36C606[8500]0A          	mov	byte [ss:A20OFF_COUNT],0Ah ; M071
 46028                                  CP_done:
 46029 000080BD C3                      	retn
 46030                                  	
 46031                                  ;DOSCODE ENDS
 46032                                  
 46033                                  	;END
 46034

 46041                                  align 2

 46043                                  ; 06/08/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 46044                                  ;============================================================================
 46045                                  ; MSINIT.ASM
 46046                                  ;============================================================================
 46047                                  ; 22/04/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0 (MSINIT.ASM, MSDOS 6.0, 1991)
 46048                                  ;
 46049                                  ; MAIN ENTRY FOR DOS INITIALIZATION
 46050                                  ;
 46051                                  	; 15/07/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 46052                                  	; (MSDOS 3.3, IBMDOS.COM, 1987)
 46053                                  
 46054                                  ; temp iret instruction
 46055                                  
 46056                                  
 46057                                  ; 05/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 46058                                  ; DOSCODE:B76Ah (MSDOS 5.0, MSDOS.SYS)
 46059                                  
 46060                                  initiret: ; MSDOS 6.0
 46061                                  SYSBUF:
 46062                                  ;IRETT: ; 06/05/2019
 46063 000080BE CF                      	iret
 46064                                  
 46065                                  ; 22/04/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 46066                                  
 46067                                  ; pointer to the BIOS data segment that will be available just to the
 46068                                  ; initialization code
 46069                                  
 46070 000080BF 7000                    InitBioDataSeg:	dw 70h ; KERNEL_SEGMENT = 0070h
 46071                                  
 46072                                  ; 05/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 46073                                  ; DOSCODE:B76Dh (MSDOS 5.0, MSDOS.SYS)
 46074                                  
 46075                                  ; Convert AX from a number of bytes to a number of paragraphs (round up).
 46076                                  
 46077                                  ParaRound:
 46078 000080C1 83C00F                  	add	ax, 15
 46079 000080C4 D1D8                    	rcr	ax, 1
 46080 000080C6 D1E8                    	shr	ax, 1
 46081 000080C8 D1E8                    	shr	ax, 1
 46082 000080CA D1E8                    	shr	ax, 1
 46083 000080CC C3                      	retn
 46084                                  
 46085                                  ; MAIN ENTRY FOR DOS INITIALIZATION
 46086                                  
 46087                                  	; 05/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 46088                                  	; DOSCODE:B779h (MSDOS 5.0, MSDOS.SYS)
 46089                                  	
 46090                                  	; 30/05/2019
 46091                                  	; 22/04/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 46092                                  	; 07/07/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 46093                                  	; Retro DOS v2.0 - 03/03/2018
 46094                                  	; 03/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 46095                                  	; MSDOS 5.0 - MSDOS.SYS, offset 79A9h
 46096                                  DOSINIT:
 46097                                  	; MSDOS 6.21 - MSDOS.SYS, offset 7C77h
 46098                                  	;
 46099                                  	; Far call from SYSINIT
 46100                                  	; DX = Memory size in paragraphs
 46101                                  	; DS:SI = [DEVICE_LIST] (SYSINIT.S) 
 46102                                  	;	  (Retro DOS v2.0, 16/03/2018)
 46103                                  	;
 46104                                  	; ES:DI = ptr to BIOS communication block (sysinit3.s)
 46105                                  	;	  (Retro DOS v4.0, 20/04/2019)
 46106                                  
 46107 000080CD FA                              CLI
 46108 000080CE FC                              CLD
 46109                                  
 46110                                  	; 03/11/2022
 46111                                  	;push	dx ; 30/05/2019		; save parameters from BIOS
 46112                                  	
 46113                                  	; 17/12/2022
 46114                                  	; 05/12/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS compatibility)
 46115                                  	;push	dx ; =*=		; save parameters from BIOS
 46116                                  	
 46117 000080CF 56                      	push	si
 46118 000080D0 1E                      	push	ds
 46119 000080D1 57                      	push	di			;save di (ptr to BiosComBlock)
 46120                                  
 46121 000080D2 8CC3                    	mov	bx,es			;bx:di = ptr to BiosComBlock
 46122                                  
 46123                                  ; First, move the DOS data segment to its final location in low memory
 46124                                  
 46125                                  	;;mov	ax,0BF69h ; MSDOS 6.21 MSDOS.SYS, file offset 7C7Fh
 46126                                  	;mov	ax,0BC77h ; MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS, file offset 79B1h	
 46127 000080D4 B8[4E85]                	mov	ax,MEMSTRT		; get offset of end of init code
 46128                                  
 46129                                  	;add	ax,15	; 0Fh		; round to nearest paragraph
 46130                                  	;and	ax,~15	; 0FFF0h	; boundary
 46131                                  
 46132                                  	;mov	si,ax			; si = offset of DOSDATA in current 
 46133                                  					; code segment
 46134                                  
 46135                                  	; 05/12/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS compatibility)
 46136 000080D7 83C00F                  	add	ax,15			; round to nearest paragraph
 46137 000080DA 83E0F0                  	and	ax,~15			; boundary
 46138                                  
 46139 000080DD 89C6                    	mov	si,ax			; si = offset of DOSDATA in current 
 46140                                  					; code segment
 46141                                  	; 05/12/2022
 46142                                  	; 30/04/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 46143                                  	;xor	si,si
 46144                                  	
 46145 000080DF 8CC8                    	mov	ax,cs
 46146 000080E1 8ED8                    	mov	ds,ax			; ds = current code segment
 46147                                  					; DS:SI now points to dosdata
 46148                                  
 46149                                  	;mov	es,[cs:0BA49h] ; MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS, offset 7C8Eh 
 46150                                  	;mov	es,[cs:InitBioDataSeg]	; First access to DosDataSg in
 46151                                  					;  BData segment. Cannot use
 46152                                  					;  getdseg macro here!!!
 46153                                  	; 17/12/2022
 46154 000080E3 8E06[BF80]              	mov	es,[InitBioDataSeg]
 46155                                  	; 07/12/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS compatibility)
 46156                                  	;mov	es,[cs:InitBioDataSeg]  ; ds = cs !
 46157                                  
 46158                                  	;mov	es,[es:3]
 46159 000080E7 268E060300              	mov	es,[es:DosDataSg]	; Get free location in low memory
 46160                                  
 46161 000080EC 31FF                    	xor	di,di			; ES:DI now points to RAM data
 46162                                  
 46163                                  	;mov	cx,4970  ; Offset 0BA78h in MSDOS 6.21 MSDOS.SYS)
 46164                                  	;mov	cx,4976  ; 25/05/2019
 46165                                  	; 05/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 46166                                  	;mov	cx,4962
 46167                                  	;mov	cx,MSDAT001E		; get end of dosdata = size of dosdata
 46168 000080EE B96D14                  	mov	cx,DOSDATASIZE ; = 4962 for MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS
 46169 000080F1 F3A4                    	rep	movsb			; move data to final location
 46170                                  	
 46171 000080F3 5F                      	pop	di			; restore ptr to BiosComBlock
 46172 000080F4 1F                      	pop	ds			; restore parms from BIOS
 46173 000080F5 5E                      	pop	si
 46174                                  	; 17/12/2022
 46175                                  	;pop	dx ; 30/05/2019	
 46176                                  	; 05/12/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS compatibility)
 46177                                  	;pop	dx ; =*=		
 46178                                  
 46179 000080F6 06                      	push	es
 46180 000080F7 1E                      	push	ds
 46181 000080F8 07                      	pop	es			; es:si -> device chain
 46182 000080F9 1F                      	pop	ds			; ds points to dosdata
 46183                                  
 46184                                  ;SR;
 46185                                  ;We get a ptr to the BIOS exchange data block. This has been setup right 
 46186                                  ;now so that the EXEC call knows when SysInit is present to do the special
 46187                                  ;lie table handling for device drivers. This can be expanded later on to
 46188                                  ;establish a communication block from the BIOS to the DOS.
 46189                                  
 46190                                  	;mov	[1040h],di	; Offset 0BA87h in MSDOS 6.21 MSDOS.SYS)
 46191                                  	;mov	[1042h],bx
 46192 000080FA 893E[A310]              	mov	[BiosDataPtr],di
 46193 000080FE 891E[A510]              	mov	[BiosDataPtr+2],bx	; save ptr to BiosComBlock
 46194                                  
 46195 00008102 2E8C1E[0700]            	mov	[cs:DosDSeg],ds		; set pointer to dosdata in code seg
 46196                                  
 46197                                  	; Set the segment of Lowint23/24/28Addr in msctrlc.asm to dosdata
 46198                                  
 46199 00008107 2E8C1E[7D5A]            	mov	[cs:LowInt23Addr+2],ds	; set pointers in code seg
 46200 0000810C 2E8C1E[815A]            	mov	[cs:LowInt24Addr+2],ds
 46201 00008111 2E8C1E[855A]            	mov	[cs:LowInt28Addr+2],ds
 46202                                  
 46203                                  	;mov	[346h],dx	; MSDOS 6.21 DOSDATA addresses
 46204                                  	;mov	[584h],sp
 46205                                  	;mov	[586h],ss
 46206 00008116 8916[4603]                  	mov	[ENDMEM],dx	; =*=

 46208 0000811E 8C16[8605]              	mov	[USER_SS],ss
 46209

 46211 00008124 8ED0                    	mov	ss,ax

 46215 00008126 BC[2009]                	mov	sp,DSKSTACK

 46940                                  ;
 46941                                  ;	check_XMM: routine to check presence of XMM driver
 46942                                  ;
 46943                                  ;	Exit:   Sets up the XMM entry point in XMMcontrol in DOSDATA
 46944                                  ;
 46945                                  ;	USED:	none
 46946                                  ;
 46947                                  ;-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 46948                                  
 46949                                  check_XMM: ; proc near
 46950                                  ;
 46951                                  ; determine whether or not an XMM driver is installed
 46952                                  ;
 46953 000083B8 50                      	push	ax
 46954                                  	;mov	ax,(XMM_MULTIPLEX<<8)+XMM_INSTALL_CHECK
 46955 000083B9 B80043                  	mov	ax,4300h
 46956 000083BC CD2F                    	int	2Fh
 46957                                  		; - Multiplex - XMS - INSTALLATION CHECK
 46958                                  		; Return: AL = 80h XMS driver installed
 46959                                  		; AL <> 80h no driver
 46960 000083BE 3C80                    	cmp	al,80h			; Q: installed
 46961 000083C0 751D                    	jne	short cXMM_no_driver	; N: set error, quit
 46962                                  ;
 46963                                  ; get the XMM control functions entry point, save it, we
 46964                                  ; need to call it later.
 46965                                  ;

 46967 000083C3 52                      	push	dx
 46968 000083C4 1E                      	push	ds
 46969 000083C5 06                      	push	es
 46970                                  	;mov	ax,(XMM_MULTIPLEX<<8)+XMM_FUNCTION_ADDR
 46971 000083C6 B81043                  	mov	ax,4310h
 46972 000083C9 CD2F                    	int	2Fh
 46973                                  		; - Multiplex - XMS - GET DRIVER ADDRESS
 46974                                  		; Return: ES:BX -> driver entry point
 46975                                  
 46976 000083CB 2E8E1E[0700]            	mov	ds,[cs:DosDSeg]
 46977                                  
 46978 000083D0 891E[AD11]              	mov	[XMMcontrol],bx
 46979 000083D4 8C06[AF11]              	mov	[XMMcontrol+2],es
 46980                                  cXMMexit:

 46997                                  ;
 46998                                  ; Procedure Name : seg_reinit
 46999                                  ;
 47000                                  ; Inputs	 : ES has final dos code location
 47001                                  ;		   AX = 0 / 1
 47002                                  ;
 47003                                  ; Outputs	 : Patch in the sharer and other tables with seg in ES
 47004                                  ;		   if AX =0
 47005                                  ;		      if first entry
 47006                                  ;			 patch segment & offset of vectors with stub
 47007                                  ;			 and stub with segment in ES
 47008                                  ;		      else
 47009                                  ;			 patch stub with segment in ES
 47010                                  ;
 47011                                  ;		   else if AX = 1
 47012                                  ;			patch segment of vectors with segment in ES
 47013                                  ;
 47014                                  ; NOTE		 : This routine can be called at most twice!
 47015                                  ;
 47016                                  ; Regs Mod.	 : es, ax, di, cx, bx
 47017                                  ;-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 47018                                  
 47019 000083E2 00                      num_entry: db	0		; keeps track of the # of times this routine
 47020                                  				; has been called. (0 or 1)
 47021                                  
 47022                                  	; 04/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (ref: MSDOS 5.0)
 47023                                  	; MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS - DOSCODE:0BAB7h
 47024                                  	; 25/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0 (ref: MSDOS 6.21)
 47025                                  	; MSDOS 6.21 MSDOS.SYS - DOSCODE:0BDA5h
 47026                                  
 47027                                  seg_reinit:	; proc	far
 47028 000083E3 1E                      	push	ds
 47029                                  
 47030 000083E4 2E8E1E[0700]            	mov	ds,[cs:DosDSeg]
 47031                                  
 47032 000083E9 E88600                  	call	patch_misc_segments	; patch in segments for sharer and 
 47033                                  					; other tables with seg in ES.
 47034                                  	; 17/12/2022
 47035                                  	; cx = 0
 47036 000083EC 39C8                    	cmp	ax,cx ; 0
 47037                                  	;cmp	ax,0
 47038 000083EE 753D                    	jne	short patch_vec_seg	; patch vectors with segment in es
 47039                                  
 47040                                  	; 17/12/2022
 47041 000083F0 2E380E[E283]            	cmp	[cs:num_entry],cl ; 0
 47042                                  	;cmp	byte [cs:num_entry],0	; Q: is it the first call to this
 47043 000083F5 7508                    	jne	short second_entry	; N: just patch the stub with 
 47044                                  					;    segment in ES
 47045                                  					; Y: patch the vectors with stub
 47046 000083F7 8CD8                    	mov	ax,ds
 47047 000083F9 E83E00                  	call	patch_vec_segments	; patch the segment of vectors
 47048 000083FC E8BD00                  	call	patch_offset		; patch the offsets of vectors 
 47049                                  					; with those in the stub.
 47050                                  	; 17/12/2022
 47051                                  	; cx = 0
 47052                                  second_entry:
 47053 000083FF 8CC0                    	mov	ax,es			; patch the stub with segment in es
 47054                                  
 47055                                  	;mov	di,OFFSET DOSDATA:DOSINTTABLE
 47056                                  	;mov	di,1062h	; (same table addr for MSDOS 5.0 and MSDOS 6.21)
 47057 00008401 BF[AC10]                	mov	di,DOSINTTABLE
 47058                                  	; 17/12/2022
 47059                                  	; cx = 0
 47060                                  	;mov	cx,9
 47061 00008404 B109                    	mov	cl,9
 47062 00008406 1E                      	push	ds			
 47063 00008407 07                      	pop	es			; es:di -> DOSINTTABLE
 47064

 47071 0000840B E2FB                    	loop	dosinttabloop

 47136                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 47137                                  ;
 47138                                  ; Procedure Name : WhatCPUType
 47139                                  ;
 47140                                  ; Inputs	 : none
 47141                                  ;
 47142                                  ; Outputs	 : AL = 0 if CPU <  286
 47143                                  ;		      = 1 if CPU == 286
 47144                                  ;		      = 2 if CPU >= 386
 47145                                  ;
 47146                                  ; Regs. Mod.	 : AX
 47147                                  ;
 47148                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 47149                                  
 47150                                  WhatCPUType:
 47151                                  	; 25/04/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 47152                                  	;get_cpu_type	; done with a MACRO which can't be generated > once
 47153                                  
 47154                                  	;CPUTYPE.INC (MSDOS 6.0, 1991)
 47155                                  
 47156                                  ; Note: this must be a macro, and not a subroutine in the BIOS since
 47157                                  ; 	it is called from both CODE and SYSINITSEG.
 47158                                  ;
 47159                                  ;------GET_CPU_TYPE-----------------------------------May, 88 by M.Williamson
 47160                                  ;  Returns: AX = 0 if 8086 or 8088
 47161                                  ;              = 1 if 80286
 47162                                  ;              = 2 if 80386
 47163                                  
 47164                                  	; 04/11/2022
 47165                                  	; MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS - DOSCODE:0BB03h
 47166                                  
 47167                                  Get_CPU_Type:	;macro
 47168                                  	pushf
 47169                                  	push	bx			; preserve bx
 47170                                  	xor	bx,bx			; init bx to zero
 47171                                  
 47172                                  	xor	ax,ax			; 0000 into AX
 47173                                  	push	ax			; put it on the stack...
 47174                                  	popf				; ...then shove it into the flags
 47175                                  	pushf				; get it back out of the flags...
 47176                                  	pop	ax			; ...and into ax
 47177                                  	and	ax,0F000h		; mask off high four bits
 47178                                  	cmp	ax,0F000h		; was it all 1's?
 47179                                  	je	short cpu_8086		; aye; it's an 8086 or 8088
 47180                                  
 47181                                  	mov	ax,0F000h		; now try to set the high four bits..
 47182                                  	push	ax
 47183                                  	popf
 47184                                  	pushf
 47185                                  	pop	ax			; ...and see what happens
 47186                                  	and	ax,0F000h		; any high bits set ?
 47187                                  	jz	short cpu_286		; nay; it's an 80286
 47188                                  
 47189                                  cpu_386:				; bx starts as zero
 47190                                  	inc	bx			; inc twice if 386
 47191                                  cpu_286:				; just inc once if 286
 47192                                  	inc	bx
 47193                                  cpu_8086:				; don't inc at all if 086
 47194                                  	mov	ax,bx			; put CPU type value in ax
 47195                                  	pop	bx			; restore original bx
 47196                                  	popf
 47197                                  	
 47198                                  	;endm
 47199                                  
 47200                                  	; 04/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 47201                                  	retn	; 19/09/2023
 47202

 47576                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 47577                                  ;
 47578                                  ; 	Procedure Name	:	patch_in_nops
 47579                                  ;
 47580                                  ; 	Entry		: 	ES -> DOSDATA
 47581                                  ;
 47582                                  ;	Regs Mod	: 	cx, di
 47583                                  ;
 47584                                  ;	Description:
 47585                                  ;		This routine patches in 2 nops at the offsets specified in 
 47586                                  ;	patch_table. This basically enables the low mem stub to start 
 47587                                  ;	making XMS calls.
 47588                                  ;
 47589                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 47590                                  
 47591                                  	; 04/11/2022
 47592                                  	; (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 47593                                  	; DOSCODE:0BC50h
 47594                                  
 47595                                  patch_table:	; label	byte
 47596                                  	;dw	offset dosdata:i0patch
 47597                                  	;dw	offset dosdata:i20patch
 47598                                  	;dw	offset dosdata:i21patch
 47599                                  	;dw	offset dosdata:i25patch
 47600                                  	;dw	offset dosdata:i26patch
 47601                                  	;dw	offset dosdata:i27patch
 47602                                  	;dw	offset dosdata:i2fpatch
 47603                                  	;dw	offset dosdata:cpmpatch
 47604 00008527 [D410]                  	dw	i0patch
 47605 00008529 [DE10]                  	dw	i20patch
 47606 0000852B [E810]                  	dw	i21patch
 47607 0000852D [F210]                  	dw	i25patch
 47608 0000852F [FC10]                  	dw	i26patch
 47609 00008531 [0611]                  	dw	i27patch
 47610 00008533 [1011]                  	dw	i2fpatch
 47611 00008535 [1A11]                  	dw	cpmpatch
 47612                                  
 47613                                  patch_table_size equ ($-patch_table)/2
 47614                                  
 47615                                  patch_in_nops:
 47616 00008537 50                      	push	ax
 47617 00008538 56                      	push	si
 47618 00008539 BE[2785]                	mov	si,patch_table
 47619 0000853C B89090                  	mov	ax,9090h ; nop, nop
 47620                                  	; 17/12/2022
 47621                                  	; cx = 0
 47622                                  	;mov	cx,8
 47623                                  	;mov	cx,patch_table_size ; 8
 47624 0000853F B108                    	mov	cl,patch_table_size ; 8
 47625                                  pin_loop:
 47626 00008541 2E8B3C                  	mov	di,[cs:si]
 47627 00008544 AB                      	stosw
 47628                                  	;add	si,2
 47629                                  	; 17/12/2022
 47630 00008545 46                      	inc	si
 47631 00008546 46                      	inc	si
 47632 00008547 E2F8                    	loop	pin_loop
 47633 00008549 5E                      	pop	si
 47634 0000854A 58                      	pop	ax
 47635 0000854B C3                      	retn

 47718                                  ; and those that are relevant to the system as a whole. Under 3.0, the system

 47720                                  ; be available for swapping and under 3.0 it will be allocated per-process.

 47723                                  ; describing that data item.

 47820                                  ;;***************************************************************************
 47821                                  ;; NOTE: INT 21H AH=52H !  (http://stanislavs.org/helppc/int_21-52.html)
 47822                                  ;;***************************************************************************
 47823                                  ;; INT 21,52 - Get Pointer to DOS "INVARS" (Undocumented)
 47824                                  ;;
 47825                                  ;;	AH = 52h
 47826                                  ;;
 47827                                  ;;	on return:
 47828                                  ;;	ES:BX = pointer to DOS "invars", a table of pointers used by DOS.
 47829                                  ;;		Known "invars" fields follow (varies with DOS version):
 47830                                  ;;
 47831                                  ;;	Offset Size		 Description
 47832                                  ;;
 47833                                  ;;	 -12   word   sharing retry count (DOS 3.1-3.3)
 47834                                  ;;	 -10   word   sharing retry delay  (DOS 3.1-3.3)
 47835                                  ;;	  -8   dword  pointer to current disk buffer (DOS 3.x)
 47836                                  ;;	  -4   word   pointer in DOS code segment of unread CON input;
 47837                                  ;;		      0 indicates no unread input (DOS 3.x)
 47838                                  ;;	  -2   word   segment of first Memory Control Block (MCB)
 47839                                  ;;	  00   dword  pointer to first DRIVE PARAMETER TABLE (A:) in chain
 47840                                  ;;	  04   dword  pointer to DOS System File Table (SFT)
 47841                                  ;;	  08   dword  pointer to $CLOCK device driver
 47842                                  ;;	  0C   dword  pointer to CON device driver
 47843                                  ;;	  10   byte   number of logical drives in system
 47844                                  ;;	  11   word   maximum bytes/block of any block device
 47845                                  ;;	  13   dword  pointer to DOS cache buffer header
 47846                                  ;;	  17 18bytes  NUL device header, first 4 bytes of device header
 47847                                  ;;		      point to the next device in device chain
 47848                                  ;;
 47849                                  ;;***************************************************************************
 47850

 48057                                  ;============================================================================
 48058                                  ; CONST2.ASM (MSDOS 6.0, 1991)
 48059                                  ;============================================================================
 48060                                  ; 25/04/2019 - Retro DOS 4.0 
 48061                                  ; 16/07/2018 - Retro DOS 3.0	
 48062                                  
 48063                                  ;Break <Initialized data and data used at DOS initialization>
 48064                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 48065                                  
 48066                                  ; We need to identify the parts of the data area that are relevant to tasks
 48067                                  ; and those that are relevant to the system as a whole.  Under 3.0, the system
 48068                                  ; data will be gathered with the system code.  The process data under 2.x will
 48069                                  ; be available for swapping and under 3.0 it will be allocated per-process.
 48070                                  ;
 48071                                  ; The data that is system data will be identified by [SYSTEM] in the comments
 48072                                  ; describing that data item.
 48073                                  
 48074                                  ;DOSDATA SEGMENT WORD PUBLIC 'DATA'
 48075                                  
 48076                                  ;
 48077                                  ; Table of routines for assignable devices
 48078                                  ;
 48079                                  ; MSDOS allows assignment if the following standard devices:
 48080                                  ;   stdin  (usually CON input)
 48081                                  ;   stdout (usually CON output)
 48082                                  ;   auxin  (usually AUX input)
 48083                                  ;   auxout (usually AUX output)
 48084                                  ;   stdlpt (usually PRN output)
 48085                                  ;
 48086                                  ; SPECIAL NOTE:
 48087                                  ;   Status of a file is a strange idea. We choose to handle it in this manner:
 48088                                  ;   If we're not at end-of-file, then we always say that we have a character.
 48089                                  ;   Otherwise, we return ^Z as the character and set the ZERO flag. In this
 48090                                  ;   manner we can support program written under the old DOS (they use ^Z as EOF
 48091                                  ;   on devices) and programs written under the new DOS (they use the ZERO flag
 48092                                  ;   as EOF).
 48093                                  
 48094                                  ; Default SFTs for boot up
 48095                                  
 48096                                  		;PUBLIC	SFTABL
 48097                                  
 48098                                  SFTABL:	   ; LABEL   DWORD		; [SYSTEM] file table
 48099 000000CC FFFF                    		DW -1			; [SYSTEM] link to next table
 48100 000000CE FFFF                    		DW -1			; [SYSTEM] link seg to next table
 48101 000000D0 0500                    		DW sf_default_number	; [SYSTEM] Number of entries in table
 48102                                  		;times 295 db 0 ; MSDOS 6.0
 48103 000000D2 00<rep 127h>            		times (sf_default_number*sf_entry_size) db 0
 48104                                  
 48105                                  ; the next two variables relate to the position of the logical stdout/stdin
 48106                                  ; cursor. They are only meaningful when stdin/stdout are assigned to the
 48107                                  ; console.
 48108                                  		; DOSDATA:01F9h (MSDOS 6.21)
 48109 000001F9 00                      CARPOS:		db 0			; [SYSTEM] cursor position in stdin
 48110 000001FA 00                      STARTPOS:	db 0			; [SYSTEM] position of cursor at beginning
 48111                                  					;	   of buffered input call
 48112 000001FB 00<rep 80h>             INBUF:		times 128 db 0		; [SYSTEM] general device input buffer
 48113 0000027B 00<rep 83h>             CONBUF:		times 131 db 0		; [SYSTEM] The rest of INBUF and console buffer
 48114                                  		; DOSDATA:02FEh (MSDOS 6.21)
 48115 000002FE 00                      PFLAG:		db 0			; [SYSTEM] printer echoing flag
 48116 000002FF 00                      VERFLG:		db 0			; [SYSTEM] Initialize with verify off
 48117 00000300 03                      CHARCO:		db 00000011b		; [SYSTEM] Allows statchks every 4 chars...
 48118                                  switch_character:
 48119 00000301 2F                      chSwitch:	db '/'			; UNUSED - obsolete datum, can be reused
 48120 00000302 00                      AllocMethod:	db 0			; [SYSTEM] how to alloc first(best)last
 48121 00000303 00                      fShare:		db 0			; [SYSTEM] TRUE => sharing installed
 48122 00000304 01                      DIFFNAM:	db 1			; [SYSTEM] Indicates when MYNAME has changed
 48123 00000305 20<rep 10h>             MYNAME:		times 16 db 20h		; [SYSTEM] My network name
 48124                                  
 48125                                  ; The following table is a list of addresses that the sharer patches to be
 48126                                  ; PUSH AX to enable the critical sections
 48127                                  
 48128                                  		; DOSDATA:0315h (MSDOS 6.21)
 48129                                  
 48130                                  ;PUBLIC	CritPatch
 48131                                  
 48132                                  CritPatch:	; LABEL WORD
 48133                                  
 48134                                  ;IRP sect,<critDisk,critDevice>
 48135                                  
 48136                                  ;IF (NOT REDIRECTOR) AND (NOT SHAREF)
 48137                                  ;
 48138                                  ;SR; Change code patch address to a variable in data segment
 48139                                  ;
 48140                                  ;       dw OFFSET DOSDATA: redir_patch
 48141                                  ;       dw OFFSET DOSDATA: redir_patch
 48142                                  ;
 48143                                  ;;hkn	Short_Addr  E&sect
 48144                                  ;;hkn	Short_Addr  L&sect
 48145                                  ;
 48146                                  ;ELSE
 48147                                  ;	DW	0
 48148                                  ;	DW	0
 48149                                  ;ENDIF
 48150                                  ;ENDM
 48151                                  ;	DW	0
 48152                                  
 48153                                  	; 25/07/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0 (MSDOS 6.21)
 48154

 48156 00000317 [860D]                  	dw 	redir_patch

 48158 0000031B [860D]                  	dw 	redir_patch
 48159                                  
 48160 0000031D 0000                    	dw	0
 48161                                  
 48162                                  ; WARNING!!! PRINT and PSPRINT *REQUIRE* ErrorMode to precede INDOS.
 48163                                  ; Also, IBM server 1.0 requires this also.
 48164                                  
 48165                                  	;EVEN			; Force swap area to start on word boundry
 48166 0000031F 90                      align 2
 48167                                  	;PUBLIC	SWAP_START
 48168                                  SWAP_START:	; LABEL BYTE
 48169 00000320 00                      ERRORMODE:	db 0		; Flag for INT 24 processing
 48170 00000321 00                      INDOS:		db 0		; DOS status for interrupt processing
 48171 00000322 FF                      WPERR:		db -1		; Write protect error flag
 48172 00000323 00                      EXTERR_LOCUS:	db 0		; Extended Error Locus
 48173 00000324 0000                    EXTERR:		dw 0		; Extended Error code
 48174                                  
 48175                                  ;WARNING Following two bytes Accessed as word in $GetExtendedError
 48176 00000326 00                      EXTERR_ACTION:	db 0		; Extended Error Action
 48177 00000327 00                      EXTERR_CLASS:	db 0		; Extended Error Class
 48178                                  ; end warning
 48179                                   
 48180 00000328 00000000                EXTERRPT:	dd 0		; Extended Error pointer
 48181                                  
 48182 0000032C 80000000                DMAADD:		dd 80h		; User's disk transfer address (disp/seg)
 48183 00000330 0000                    CurrentPDB:	dw 0		; Current process identifier

 48327                                  ; 25/04/2019 - Retro DOS 4.0
 48328                                  
 48329                                  ; Retro DOS v4.0 NOTE: (by Erdogan Tan, 25/04/2019)
 48330                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------
 48331                                  ; This data section which was named as uninitialized data
 48332                                  ; (as overlayed by initialization code) but follows 
 48333                                  ; initialized data section from DOSDATA:03B6h address
 48334                                  ; (in otherwords, the method is different than MSDOS 3.3,
 48335                                  ; and there is not overlaying..)
 48336                                  ; **********************************************************
 48337                                  ; Reference: MSDOS 6.21 kernel DOSDATA section (4970 bytes)
 48338                                  ; follows DOSCODE section in the kernel file (MSDOS.SYS) 
 48339                                  ; (it is located at offset 0BF70h, file offset 0BF70h-3DE0h) 
 48340                                  ; but starts from offset 0 (ORG 0) and ends at offset 1370h.
 48341                                  ; TIMEBUF is at offset 03B6h.
 48342                                  ; **********************************************************	
 48343                                  
 48344                                  ;Break <Uninitialized data overlayed by initialization code>
 48345                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 48346                                  ;DOSDATA    SEGMENT WORD PUBLIC 'DATA'
 48347                                  ; Init code overlaps with data area below
 48348                                  
 48349                                  ; 	ORG     0
 48350                                  
 48351                                  MSDAT001S:	; label byte
 48352                                  
 48353                                  ; DOSDATA:03B6h	; MSDOS 6.21 (MSDOS.SYS, file offset 0BF70h-3DE0h+3B6h)
 48354                                  TIMEBUF: ;	times 6 db 0
 48355 000003B6 0000<rep 3h>            	times 3 dw	0		; Time read from clock device
 48356 000003BC 0000                    DEVIOBUF:	dw	0		; Buffer for I/O under file assignment
 48357                                  
 48358                                  ; The following areas are used as temp buffer in EXEC system call
 48359                                  
 48360                                  ; DOSDATA:03BEh
 48361                                  OPENBUF: ;times 64  dw	0
 48362 000003BE 00<rep 80h>             	times	128 db	0		; buffer for name operations
 48363                                  RENBUF:	
 48364 0000043E 00<rep 80h>             	times	128 db	0		; buffer for rename destination
 48365                                  
 48366                                  ; Buffer for search calls
 48367                                  SEARCHBUF:	
 48368 000004BE 00<rep 35h>             	times	53  db	0		; internal search buffer
 48369                                  DUMMYCDS:  ;times 88 db 0
 48370 000004F3 00<rep 58h>             	times	curdirLen db 0
 48371                                  
 48372                                  ; End of contiguous buffer
 48373                                   
 48374                                  ; Temporary directory entry for use by many routines. Device directory
 48375                                  ; entries (bogus) are built here.
 48376                                  
 48377                                  ; DOSDATA:054Bh
 48378

 48380                                  
 48381                                  ; WARNING..  do not alter position of NAME1 relative to DEVFCB
 48382                                  ; without first examining BUILD_DEVICE_ENT. Look carefully at DOS_RENAME
 48383                                  ; as well as it is the only guy who uses NAME2 and DESTSTART.
 48384                                  
 48385                                  NAME1:	
 48386 0000054B 00<rep Ch>                      times 	12 db	0		; File name buffer
 48387                                  NAME2:
 48388 00000557 00<rep Dh>              	times	13 db	0 		;
 48389                                  DESTSTART:

 48392                                  	;times	5  db	0

 48394                                  
 48395                                  ; End Temporary directory entry.
 48396

 48846                                  ; ------------------------------------------------<MSKK01>----------------------
 48847                                  
 48848                                  ; DOSDATA:0CF5h
 48849                                  
 48850                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 48851                                  ;
 48852                                  ;CASE MAPPER ROUTINE FOR 80H-FFH character range, DOS 3.3
 48853                                  ;     ENTRY: AL = Character to map
 48854                                  ;     EXIT:  AL = The converted character
 48855                                  ; Alters no registers except AL and flags.
 48856                                  ; The routine should do nothing to chars below 80H.
 48857                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 48858                                  ; Example:
 48859                                  
 48860                                  MAP_CASE:
 48861                                  ;Procedure MAP_CASE,FAR
 48862                                  
 48863 00000D49 3C80                    	CMP	AL,80h
 48864 00000D4B 7301                    	JAE	short Map1	;Map no chars below 80H ever
 48865 00000D4D CB                      	RETF
 48866                                  Map1:
 48867 00000D4E 2C80                    	SUB	AL,80h		;Turn into index value
 48868 00000D50 1E                      	PUSH	DS
 48869 00000D51 53                      	PUSH	BX
 48870 00000D52 BB[030B]                	MOV	BX,UCASE_TAB+2
 48871                                  FINISH:
 48872 00000D55 0E                      	PUSH	CS		;Move to DS
 48873 00000D56 1F                      	POP	DS
 48874 00000D57 D7                      	XLAT			;Get upper case character
 48875 00000D58 5B                      	POP	BX
 48876 00000D59 1F                      	POP	DS
 48877                                  L_RET:	
 48878 00000D5A CB                      	RETF
 48879                                  
 48880                                  ;EndProc MAP_CASE
 48881                                  
 48882                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 48883                                  
 48884                                  ; The variables for ECS version are moved here for the same data alignments
 48885                                  ; as IBM-DOS and MS-DOS.
 48886                                  
 48887                                  InterChar:
 48888 00000D5B 00                      	db	0	; Interim character flag ( 1= interim)  ;AN000;
 48889                                  ;------- NOTE: NEXT TWO BYTES SOMETIMES USED AS A WORD !! -------------------
 48890                                  DUMMY:	; LABEL   WORD
 48891                                  InterCon:  
 48892 00000D5C 00                      	db	0	; Console in Interim mode ( 1= interim) ;AN000;
 48893                                  SaveCurFlg:
 48894 00000D5D 00                      	db	0	; Print, do not advance cursor flag     ;AN000;

 49169                                  ;############################################################################
 49170                                  ;
 49171                                  ; ** HACK FOR DOS 4.0 REDIR **
 49172                                  ; 
 49173                                  ; The redir requires the following:
 49174                                  ;
 49175                                  ;	ERR_TABLE_21	offset DDBH
 49176                                  ;	ERR_TABLE_24	offset E5BH
 49177                                  ; 	ErrMap24	offset EABH
 49178                                  ;
 49179                                  ; WARNING! WARNING!
 49180                                  ;
 49181                                  ; MARK2 SHOULD NOT BE >= 0DDBH. IF SOME VARIABLE IS TO BE ADDED ABOVE DO SO
 49182                                  ; WITHOUT VIOLATING THIS AND UPDATE THE FOLL. LINE
 49183                                  ;
 49184                                  ; CURRENTLY MARK2 = 0DD0H
 49185                                  ;
 49186                                  ;############################################################################
 49187                                  
 49188                                  	;ORG	0DDBh
 49189                                  
 49190                                  ; DOSDATA:0DDBh (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
 49191                                  
 49192                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 49193                                  ;
 49194                                  ; The following table defines CLASS ACTION and LOCUS info for the INT 21H
 49195                                  ; errors. Each entry is 4 bytes long:
 49196                                  ;
 49197                                  ;       Err#,Class,Action,Locus
 49198                                  ;
 49199                                  ; A value of 0FFh indicates a call specific value (ie. should already
 49200                                  ; be set). AN ERROR CODE NOT IN THE TABLE FALLS THROUGH TO THE CATCH ALL AT
 49201                                  ; THE END, IT IS ASSUMES THAT CLASS, ACTION, LOCUS IS ALREADY SET.
 49202                                  ;
 49203                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 49204                                  
 49205                                  ;ErrTab  Macro   err,class,action,locus
 49206                                  ;ifidn <locus>,<0FFh>
 49207                                  ;    DB  error_&err,errCLASS_&class,errACT_&action,0FFh
 49208                                  ;ELSE
 49209                                  ;    DB  error_&err,errCLASS_&class,errACT_&action,errLOC_&locus
 49210                                  ;ENDIF
 49211                                  ;ENDM

 49533                                  
 49534                                  ; 27/04/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 49535                                  ; 04/11/2022
 49536                                  ; DOSDATA:1044h (MSDOS 6.21 & MSDOS 5.0, MSDOS.SYS)
 49537                                  
 49538                                  ;------------------------------------------------------------------------
 49539                                  ; Patch for Sidekick
 49540                                  ;
 49541                                  ; A documented method for finding the offset of the Errormode flag in the
 49542                                  ; dos swappable data area if for the app to scan in the dos segment (data)
 49543                                  ; for the following sequence of instructions.
 49544                                  ;
 49545                                  ; Ref: Part C, Article 11, pg 356 of MSDOS Encyclopedia
 49546                                  ;
 49547                                  ; The Offset of Errormode flag is 0320h
 49548                                  ;
 49549                                  ;------------------------------------------------------------------------
 49550                                  
 49551                                  	db	036h, 0F6h, 06h, 020h, 03h, 0FFh ; test ss:[errormode], -1
 49552                                  	db	075h, 0Ch			 ; jnz  NearLabel
 49553                                  	db	036h, 0FFh, 036h, 058h, 03h	 ; push ss:[NearWord]
 49554                                  	db	0CDh, 028h			 ; int  28h
 49555                                  
 49556                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 49557                                  ; Patch for PortOfEntry - M036
 49558                                  ;
 49559                                  ; PortOfEntry by Sector Technology uses an un documented way of determining
 49560                                  ; the offset of Errormode flag. The following patch is to support them in
 49561                                  ; DOS 5.0. The corresponding code is actually in msdisp.asm
 49562                                  ;
 49563                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 49564                                  
 49565                                  	db 	080h, 03Eh, 020h, 03h, 00h 	 ; cmp 	[errormode], 0
 49566                                  	db	075h, 037h			 ; jnz	NearLabel
 49567                                  	db 	0BCh, 0A0h, 0Ah		  	 ; mov	sp, dosdata:iostack
 49568                                  
 49569                                  %endif ; 29/12/2022

 49615 000010B4 [F102]0000              	dw	COMMAND		, 0  ; DOSINTTABLE+8
