 49626                                  ;-------------------------------------------------------------------------
 49627                                  ;
 49628                                  ; LOW MEM STUB:
 49629                                  ;
 49630                                  ; The low mem stub contains the entry points into DOS for all interrupts
 49631                                  ; handled by DOS. This stub is installed if the user specifies that the
 49632                                  ; DOS load in HIMEM. Each entry point does this.
 49633                                  ;
 49634                                  ; 	1. if jmp to 8 has been patched out
 49635                                  ;	   2. if A20 OFF
 49636                                  ;	      3. Enable A20
 49637                                  ;	   4. else 
 49638                                  ;	      5. just go to dos entry
 49639                                  ;	   6. endif
 49640                                  ;	7. else
 49641                                  ;	   8. just go to dos entry
 49642                                  ;	9. endif
 49643                                  ;
 49644                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 49645                                  
 49646                                  ; 27/04/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 49647                                  
 49648                                  ; DOSDATA:108Ah (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
 49649                                  
 49650                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 49651                                  ;
 49652                                  ; DIVIDE BY 0 handler
 49653                                  ;
 49654                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 49655                                  
 49656                                  ldivov:
 49657                                  	; The following jump, skipping the XMS calls will be patched to 
 49658                                  	; NOPS by SEG_REINIT if DOS successfully loads high. This jump is
 49659                                  	; needed because the stub is installed even before the XMS driver
 49660                                  	; is loaded if the user specifies dos=high in the config.sys
 49661                                  i0patch:
 49662 000010D4 EB03                    	jmp	short divov_cont
 49663                                  
 49664 000010D6 E8D800                  	call	EnsureA20ON		; we must turn on A20 if OFF
 49665                                  divov_cont:
 49666 000010D9 2EFF2E[AC10]            	jmp	far [cs:DOSINTTABLE]	; jmp to DOS
 49667                                  
 49668                                  ;------------------------------------------------------------------------
 49669                                  ;
 49670                                  ; INT 20 Handler
 49671                                  ;
 49672                                  ; Here we do not have to set up the stack to return here as the abort call
 49673                                  ; will return to the address after the int 21 ah=4b call. This would be the
 49674                                  ; common exit point if A20 had been OFF (for TOGGLE DOS) and the A20 line
 49675                                  ; will be restored then.
 49676                                  ;
 49677                                  ;-------------------------------------------------------------------------
 49678                                  
 49679                                  lquit:
 49680                                  	; The following jump, skipping the XMS calls will be patched to 
 49681                                  	; NOPS by SEG_REINIT if DOS successfully loads high. This jump is
 49682                                  	; needed because the stub is installed even before the XMS driver
 49683                                  	; is loaded if the user specifies dos=high in the config.sys
 49684                                  i20patch:
 49685 000010DE EB03                    	jmp	short quit_cont
 49686                                  
 49687 000010E0 E8CE00                  	call	EnsureA20ON		; we must turn on A20 if OFF
 49688                                  quit_cont:
 49689 000010E3 2EFF2E[B010]            	jmp	far [cs:DOSINTTABLE+4]	; jump to DOS
 49690                                  
 49691                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 49692                                  ;
 49693                                  ; INT 21 Handler
 49694                                  ;
 49695                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 49696                                  
 49697                                  lcommand:
 49698                                  	; The following jump, skipping the XMS calls will be patched to 
 49699                                  	; NOPS by SEG_REINIT if DOS successfully loads high. This jump is
 49700                                  	; needed because the stub is installed even before the XMS driver
 49701                                  	; is loaded if the user specifies dos=high in the config.sys
 49702                                  i21patch:
 49703 000010E8 EB03                    	jmp	short command_cont
 49704                                  
 49705 000010EA E8C400                  	call	EnsureA20ON		; we must turn on A20 if OFF
 49706                                  command_cont:
 49707 000010ED 2EFF2E[B410]            	jmp	far [cs:DOSINTTABLE+8]	; jmp to DOS
 49708                                  
 49709                                  ;------------------------------------------------------------------------
 49710                                  ;
 49711                                  ; INT 25 
 49712                                  ;
 49713                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 49714                                  
 49715                                  labsdrd:
 49716                                  	; The following jump, skipping the XMS calls will be patched to 
 49717                                  	; NOPS by SEG_REINIT if DOS successfully loads high. This jump is
 49718                                  	; needed because the stub is installed even before the XMS driver
 49719                                  	; is loaded if the user specifies dos=high in the config.sys
 49720                                  i25patch:
 49721 000010F2 EB03                    	jmp	short absdrd_cont
 49722                                  
 49723 000010F4 E8BA00                  	call	EnsureA20ON		; we must turn on A20 if OFF
 49724                                  absdrd_cont:
 49725 000010F7 2EFF2E[B810]            	jmp	far [cs:DOSINTTABLE+12]	; jmp to DOS
 49726                                  
 49727                                  ;-------------------------------------------------------------------------
 49728                                  ;
 49729                                  ; INT 26
 49730                                  ;
 49731                                  ;-----------------------------------------------------------------------
 49732                                  
 49733                                  labsdwrt:
 49734                                  	; The following jump, skipping the XMS calls will be patched to 
 49735                                  	; NOPS by SEG_REINIT if DOS successfully loads high. This jump is
 49736                                  	; needed because the stub is installed even before the XMS driver
 49737                                  	; is loaded if the user specifies dos=high in the config.sys
 49738                                  i26patch:
 49739 000010FC EB03                    	jmp	short absdwrt_cont
 49740                                  
 49741 000010FE E8B000                  	call	EnsureA20ON		; we must turn on A20 if OFF
 49742                                  absdwrt_cont:
 49743 00001101 2EFF2E[BC10]            	jmp	far [cs:DOSINTTABLE+16]	; jmp to DOS
 49744                                  
 49745                                  ;------------------------------------------------------------------------
 49746                                  ;
 49747                                  ; INT 27
 49748                                  ;
 49749                                  ;-----------------------------------------------------------------------
 49750                                  
 49751                                  lstay_resident:
 49752                                  	; The following jump, skipping the XMS calls will be patched to
 49753                                  	; NOPS by SEG_REINIT if DOS successfully loads high. This jump is
 49754                                  	; needed because the stub is installed even before the XMS driver
 49755                                  	; is loaded if the user specifies dos=high in the config.sys
 49756                                  i27patch:
 49757 00001106 EB03                    	jmp	short sr_cont
 49758                                  
 49759 00001108 E8A600                  	call	EnsureA20ON		; we must turn on A20 if OFF
 49760                                  sr_cont:
 49761 0000110B 2EFF2E[C010]            	jmp	far [cs:DOSINTTABLE+20]	; jmp to DOS
 49762

 49764                                  ;
 49765                                  ; INT 2f
 49766                                  ;
 49767                                  ;-------------------------------------------------------------------------
 49768                                  
 49769                                  lint2f:
 49770                                  	; The following jump, skipping the XMS calls will be patched to 
 49771                                  	; NOPS by SEG_REINIT if DOS successfully loads high. This jump is 
 49772                                  	; needed because the stub is installed even before the XMS driver
 49773                                  	; is loaded if the user specifies dos=high in the config.sys
 49774                                  i2fpatch:
 49775 00001110 EB03                    	jmp	short int2f_cont
 49776

 49778                                  int2f_cont:

 49780

 49782                                  ;
 49783                                  ; CPM entry
 49784                                  ;
 49785                                  ;------------------------------------------------------------------------
 49786                                  
 49787                                  lcall_entry:
 49788                                  	; The following jump, skipping the XMS calls will be patched to 
 49789                                  	; NOPS by SEG_REINIT if DOS successfully loads high. This jump is
 49790                                  	; needed because the stub is installed even before the XMS driver
 49791                                  	; is loaded if the user specifies dos=high in the config.sys
 49792                                  cpmpatch:
 49793 0000111A EB03                    	jmp	short callentry_cont
 49794                                  
 49795 0000111C E89200                  	call	EnsureA20ON		; we must turn on A20 if OFF
 49796                                  callentry_cont:
 49797 0000111F 2EFF2E[C810]            	jmp	far [cs:DOSINTTABLE+28]	; jmp to DOS
 49798                                  
 49799                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 49800                                  
 49801                                  lirett:
 49802 00001124 CF                      	iret
 49803                                  
 49804                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 49805                                  ;
 49806                                  ; LowIntXX:
 49807                                  ;
 49808                                  ; Interrupts from DOS that pass control to a user program must be done from
 49809                                  ; low memory, as the user program may change the state of the A20 line or
 49810                                  ; they may require that the A20 line be OFF. The following piece of code is
 49811                                  ; far call'd from the following places in DOS:
 49812                                  ;
 49813                                  ;	1. msctrlc.asm where dos issues an int 23h (ctrlc)
 49814                                  ;	2. msctrlc.asm where dos issues an int 24h (critical error)
 49815                                  ;	3. msctrlc.asm where dos issues an int 28h (idle int)
 49816                                  ;
 49817                                  ; The int 23 and int 24 handlers may decide to do a far return instead of an
 49818                                  ; IRET ane leave the flags on the stack. Therefore we save the return address
 49819                                  ; before doing the ints and then do a far junp back into DOS.
 49820                                  ;
 49821                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 49822                                  
 49823 00001125 00000000                DosRetAddr23:	dd	0
 49824 00001129 00000000                DosRetAddr24:	dd	0
 49825 0000112D 00000000                DosRetAddr28:	dd	0
 49826                                  
 49827                                  	; Execute int 23h from low memory
 49828                                  LowInt23:
 49829                                  					; save the return address that is on
 49830                                  					; the stack
 49831 00001131 2E8F06[2511]            	pop	word [cs:DosRetAddr23]
 49832 00001136 2E8F06[2711]            	pop	word [cs:DosRetAddr23+2]
 49833                                  
 49834 0000113B CD23                    	int	23h			; ctrl C
 49835                                  					; turn on A20 it has been turned OFF
 49836                                  					; by int 28/23/24 handler.
 49837                                  
 49838 0000113D E87100                  	call	EnsureA20ON		; M011: we must turn on A20 if OFF 
 49839                                  
 49840 00001140 2EFF2E[2511]            	jmp	far [cs:DosRetAddr23]	; jump back to DOS
 49841                                  
 49842                                  
 49843                                  	; Execute int 24h from low memory
 49844                                  LowInt24:
 49845                                  					; save the return address that is on
 49846                                  					; the stack
 49847 00001145 2E8F06[2911]            	pop	word [cs:DosRetAddr24]
 49848 0000114A 2E8F06[2B11]            	pop	word [cs:DosRetAddr24+2]
 49849                                  
 49850 0000114F CD24                    	int	24h			; crit error
 49851                                  					; turn on A20 it has been turned OFF
 49852                                  					; by int 28/23/24 handler.
 49853                                  
 49854 00001151 E85D00                  	call	EnsureA20ON		; M011: we must turn on A20 if OFF
 49855                                  
 49856 00001154 2EFF2E[2911]            	jmp	far [cs:DosRetAddr24]	; jump back to DOS
 49857                                  
 49858                                  
 49859                                   
 49860                                  	; Execute int 28h from low memory
 49861                                  LowInt28:
 49862 00001159 CD28                    	int	28h			; idle int
 49863                                  					; turn on A20 it has been turned OFF
 49864                                  					; by int 28/23/24 handler.
 49865                                  
 49866 0000115B E85300                  	call	EnsureA20ON		; M011: we must turn on A20 if OFF
 49867                                  
 49868 0000115E CB                      	retf
 49869                                  
 49870                                  ; DOSDATA:1115h (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
 49871                                  
 49872                                  ;-------------------------------------------------------------------------
 49873                                  ;
 49874                                  ; int 21 ah=4b (exec) call will jump to the following label before xferring
 49875                                  ; control to the exec'd program. We turn off A20 inorder to allow programs
 49876                                  ; that have been packed by the faulty exepack utility to unpack correctly.
 49877                                  ; This is so because exepac'd programs rely on address wrap.
 49878                                  ;
 49879                                  ;------------------------------------------------------------------------- 
 49880                                  
 49881                                  disa20_xfer:
 49882 0000115F E83F00                  	call	XMMDisableA20		; disable A20
 49883                                  
 49884                                  	; Look at msproc.asm at label exec_go for understanding the following:
 49885                                  
 49886                                  	; DS:SI points to entry point
 49887                                  	; AX:DI points to initial stack
 49888                                  	; DX has PDB pointer
 49889                                  	; BX has initial AX value
 49890                                  
 49891 00001162 FA                      	cli
 49892 00001163 2EC606[2103]00          	mov	byte [cs:INDOS],0	; SS Override
 49893                                  
 49894 00001169 8ED0                    	mov	SS,AX			; set up user's stack
 49895 0000116B 89FC                    	mov	SP,DI			; and SP
 49896 0000116D FB                      	sti
 49897                                  
 49898 0000116E 1E                      	push	DS			; fake long call to entry
 49899 0000116F 56                      	push	SI
 49900 00001170 8EC2                    	mov	ES,DX			; set up proper seg registers
 49901 00001172 8EDA                    	mov	DS,DX
 49902 00001174 89D8                    	mov	AX,BX			; set up proper AX
 49903 00001176 CB                      	retf
 49904                                  
 49905                                  ;-------------------------------------------------------------------------
 49906                                  ;
 49907                                  ; M003:
 49908                                  ;
 49909                                  ; If an int 21 ah=25 call is made immediately after an exec call, DOS will
 49910                                  ; come here, turn A20 OFF restore user stack and registers before returning
 49911                                  ; to user. This is done in dos\msdisp.asm. This has been done to support 
 49912                                  ; programs compiled with MS PASCAL 3.2. See under TAG M003 in DOSSYM.INC for
 49913                                  ; more info.	
 49914                                  ;
 49915                                  ; Also at this point DS is DOSDATA. So we can assume DS DOSDATA. Note that
 49916                                  ; SS is also DOS stack. It is important that we do the XMS call on DOS's
 49917                                  ; stack to avoid additional stack overhead for the user.
 49918                                  ;
 49919                                  ; -------------------------------------------------------------------------
 49920                                  
 49921                                  disa20_iret:
 49922 00001177 E82700                  	call	XMMDisableA20
 49923 0000117A FE0E[2103]              	dec	byte [INDOS]
 49924 0000117E 8E16[8605]              	mov	SS,[USER_SS]		; restore user stack
 49925 00001182 8B26[8405]              	mov	SP,[USER_SP]
 49926 00001186 89E5                    	mov	BP,SP
 49927                                  	;mov	[BP+user_env.user_AX],AL
 49928 00001188 884600                  	mov	[bp],al
 49929 0000118B A1[F205]                	mov	AX,[NSP]
 49930 0000118E A3[8405]                	mov	[USER_SP],AX
 49931 00001191 A1[F005]                	mov	AX,[NSS]
 49932 00001194 A3[8605]                	mov	[USER_SS],AX
 49933                                  
 49934 00001197 58                      	pop	AX			; restore user regs
 49935 00001198 5B                      	pop	BX
 49936 00001199 59                      	pop	CX
 49937 0000119A 5A                      	pop	DX
 49938 0000119B 5E                      	pop	SI
 49939 0000119C 5F                      	pop	DI
 49940 0000119D 5D                      	pop	BP
 49941 0000119E 1F                      	pop	DS
 49942 0000119F 07                      	pop	ES
 49943 000011A0 CF                      	iret
 49944                                  
 49945                                  ;**************************************************************************
 49946                                  ;***	XMMDisableA20 - switch 20th address line
 49947                                  ;
 49948                                  ;	This routine is used to disable the 20th address line in
 49949                                  ;	the system using XMM calls.
 49950                                  ;
 49951                                  ;	ENTRY	none		;ds = _DATA
 49952                                  ;	EXIT	A20 line disabled
 49953                                  ;	USES	NOTHING
 49954                                  ;
 49955                                  ;**************************************************************************
 49956                                  
 49957                                  XMMDisableA20:
 49958 000011A1 53                      	push	bx
 49959 000011A2 50                      	push	ax
 49960                                  	;mov	ah,XMM_LOCAL_DISABLE_A20
 49961 000011A3 B406                    	mov	ah,6
 49962 000011A5 2EFF1E[AD11]            	call	far [cs:XMMcontrol]
 49963 000011AA 58                      	pop	ax
 49964 000011AB 5B                      	pop	bx
 49965 000011AC C3                      	retn
 49966                                  
 49967                                  ; The entry point in the BIOS XMS driver is defined here.
 49968                                  
 49969                                  XMMcontrol:
 49970 000011AD 00000000                	dd	0
 49971                                  
 49972                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 49973                                  ;
 49974                                  ;***	EnsureA20ON - Ensures that A20 is ON
 49975                                  ;
 49976                                  ;	This routine is used to query the A20 state in
 49977                                  ;	the system using XMM calls.
 49978                                  ;
 49979                                  ;	ENTRY: none
 49980                                  ;
 49981                                  ;	EXIT : A20 will be ON
 49982                                  ;		
 49983                                  ; 	USES : NONE
 49984                                  ;
 49985                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 49986                                  
 49987                                  ; 19/09/2023
 49988                                  ;LowMemory:	; label dword		; Set equal to 0000:0080
 49989                                  ;	dw	00080h
 49990                                  ;	dw	00000h
 49991                                  ;
 49992                                  ;HighMemory:	; label dword
 49993                                  ;	dw	00090h			; Set equal to FFFF:0090
 49994                                  ;	dw	0FFFFh
 49995                                  
 49996                                  EnsureA20ON:
 49997 000011B1 9C                      	pushf
 49998 000011B2 1E                      	push    ds
 49999 000011B3 06                      	push	es
 50000 000011B4 51                      	push	cx
 50001 000011B5 56                      	push	si
 50002 000011B6 57                      	push	di
 50003                                  
 50004                                  	; 19/09/2023
 50005                                  	;lds	si,[cs:LowMemory]	; Compare the 4 words at 0000:0080
 50006                                  	;les	di,[cs:HighMemory]	; with the 4 at FFFF:0090
 50007                                  
 50008 000011B7 31FF                    	xor	di,di
 50009 000011B9 8EC7                    	mov	es,di
 50010 000011BB 4F                      	dec	di
 50011 000011BC BE9000                  	mov	si,90h	; 0FFFFh:0090h	; HighMemory
 50012 000011BF 8EDF                    	mov	ds,di
 50013 000011C1 BF8000                  	mov	di,80h ; 0000h:0080h	; LowMemory
 50014                                  	
 50015 000011C4 B90400                  	mov	cx,4
 50016 000011C7 FC                      	cld
 50017 000011C8 F3A7                    	repe    cmpsw
 50018                                  
 50019 000011CA 7407                    	jz	short EA20_OFF
 50020                                  EA20_RET:
 50021 000011CC 5F                      	pop	di
 50022 000011CD 5E                      	pop	si
 50023 000011CE 59                      	pop	cx
 50024 000011CF 07                      	pop	es
 50025 000011D0 1F                      	pop	ds
 50026 000011D1 9D                      	popf
 50027 000011D2 C3                      	retn
 50028                                  
 50029                                  EA20_OFF:
 50030                                  	; We are going to do the XMS call on the DOS's AuxStack.
 50031                                  	; NOTE: ints are disabled at this point.
 50032                                  
 50033 000011D3 53                      	push	bx
 50034 000011D4 50                      	push	ax
 50035                                  
 50036 000011D5 8CD0                    	mov	ax,ss			; save user's stack pointer
 50037 000011D7 2EA3[D010]              	mov	[cs:SS_Save],ax
 50038 000011DB 2E8926[D210]            	mov	[cs:SP_Save],sp
 50039 000011E0 8CC8                    	mov	ax,cs
 50040 000011E2 8ED0                    	mov	ss,ax
 50041 000011E4 BC[A007]                	mov	sp,AUXSTACK
 50042                                  					; ss:sp -> DOSDATA:AuxStack
 50043                                  	;mov	ah,XMM_LOCAL_ENABLE_A20
 50044 000011E7 B405                    	mov	ah,5
 50045 000011E9 2EFF1E[AD11]            	call	far [cs:XMMcontrol]
 50046 000011EE 09C0                    	or	ax,ax
 50047 000011F0 740F                    	jz	short XMMerror		; AX = 0 fatal error
 50048                                  
 50049 000011F2 2EA1[D010]              	mov	ax,[cs:SS_Save]		; restore user stack
 50050 000011F6 8ED0                    	mov	ss,ax
 50051 000011F8 2E8B26[D210]            	mov	sp,[cs:SP_Save]
 50052

 50054 000011FE 5B                      	pop	bx
 50055                                  
 50056 000011FF EBCB                    	jmp	short EA20_RET
 50057                                  
 50058                                  XMMerror:				; M006 - Start
 50059 00001201 B40F                    	mov	ah,0Fh			; get video mode
 50060 00001203 CD10                    	int	10h
 50061 00001205 3C07                    	cmp	al,7			; Q: are we an MDA
 50062 00001207 7406                    	je	short XMMcont			; Y: do not change mode
 50063 00001209 30E4                    	xor	ah,ah ; 0			; set video mode
 50064 0000120B B002                    	mov	al,02h			; 80 X 25 text
 50065 0000120D CD10                    	int	10h
 50066                                  XMMcont:
 50067 0000120F B405                    	mov	ah,05h			; set display page
 50068 00001211 30C0                    	xor	al,al			; page 0
 50069 00001213 CD10                    	int	10h
 50070                                  	
 50071 00001215 BE[3A13]                	mov	si,XMMERRMSG
 50072 00001218 0E                      	push	cs
 50073 00001219 1F                      	pop	ds
 50074 0000121A FC                      	cld				; clear direction flag
 50075                                  XMMprnt:
 50076 0000121B AC                      	lodsb
 50077 0000121C 3C24                    	cmp	al,'$'			; indicates end of XMMERRMSG
 50078 0000121E 7409                    	jz	short XMMStall		; function 0Eh

 50080 00001222 BB0700                  	mov	bx,7
 50081 00001225 CD10                    	int	10h

 50490                                  ; ** HACK FOR DOS 4.0 REDIR **
 50491                                  ;
 50492                                  ; The dos 4.X redir requires that country_cdpg is at offset 0122ah. Any new
 50493                                  ; data variable that is to be added to DOSDATA must go in between Mark3
 50494                                  ; COUNTRY_CDPG if it can. 
 50495                                  ;
 50496                                  ; MARK3 SHOULD NOT BE > 122AH

 50502                                  	;ORG	0122Ah
 50503                                  
 50504                                  ; DOSDATA:122Ah (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
 50505                                  
 50506                                  ; 09/01/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0
 50507                                  ; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM - DOSDATA:122Ah
 50508                                  
 50509                                  ; 17/01/2024
 50510                                  ; MSDOS 5.0  MSDOS.SYS - DOSDATA:122Ah
 50511                                  ; MSDOS 6.22 MSDOS.SYS - DOSDATA:122Ah
 50512                                  
 50513                                  ; The following table is used for DOS 3.3
 50514                                  ;DOS country and code page information is defined here for DOS 3.3.
 50515                                  ;The initial value for ccDosCountry is 1 (USA).
 50516                                  ;The initial value for ccDosCodepage is 850.
 50517                                  
 50518                                  ; country and code page information
 50519                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 50520                                  COUNTRY_CDPG:	; label  byte
 50521 00001351 0000000000000000        	db   0,0,0,0,0,0,0,0		; reserved words
 50522 00001359 5C434F554E5452592E-     	db   '\COUNTRY.SYS',0		; path name of country.sys
 50522 00001362 53595300           
 50523                                  	;db   51 dup (?)
 50524 00001366 00<rep 33h>             	times 51 db 0
 50525                                  ; ------------------------------------------------<MSKK01>-------------------
 50526                                  ;ifdef	DBCS
 50527                                  ;  ifdef JAPAN
 50528                                  ;	dw   932			; system code page id (JAPAN)
 50529                                  ;  endif
 50530                                  ;  ifdef TAIWAN

 50759                                  
 50760                                  ; Seventh DOS patch - System call entry, patch USER_ID with VMid for share
 50761                                  ;
 50762                                  ; Code in disp.asm, 1 location
 50763                                  ;
 50764                                  ;
 50765                                  ;	mov [SaveDS],ds
 50766                                  ;	mov [SaveBX],bx
 50767                                  ;	mov bx,cs

 50772

 50774                                  DOSP7_SAVEDS:	db	07Eh,05h		; mov [SaveDS],ds
 50775                                  		db	02Eh,089h,01Eh
 50776                                  DOSP7_SAVEBX:	db	07Ch,05h		; mov [SaveBX],bx
 50777                                  		db	08Ch,0CBh		; mov bx,cs

 50779                                  		db	0FEh,006h

 50781                                  		db	033h,0C0h		; xor ax,ax
 50782                                  DOSP7_ID_LEN	equ	$-DOSP7_ID

 50802                                  DOSP8_ID_LEN	equ	$-DOSP8_ID
 50803                                  		db	02Fh,058h		; pop  ax
 50804                                  
 50805                                  ; DOSDATA:1314h
 50806                                  
 50807                                  ; 10th, 11th, 12th DOS patch - System call 3Fh (Read) in raw mode
 50808                                  ;
 50809                                  ;   Take RAW read to STDIN SFT and turn it into a polling loop doing
 50810                                  ;   a yeild when a character is not ready to be read.
 50811                                  ;
 50812                                  ; Code in disk.asm, 3 locations
 50813                                  ;
 50814                                  ;   DVRDRAW:
 50815                                  ;	    PUSH    ES
 50816                                  ;	    POP     DS
 50817                                  ;   ReadRawRetry:				<- Patch 10
 50818                                  ;	    MOV     BX,DI
 50819                                  ;	    XOR     AX,AX			<- Reenter #2
 50820                                  ;	    MOV     DX,AX
 50821                                  ;	    call    SETREAD
 50822                                  ;	    PUSH    DS				<- Reenter #1
 50823                                  ;	    LDS     SI,[THISSFT]
 50824                                  ;	    call    DEVIOCALL
 50825                                  ;	    MOV     DX,DI
 50826                                  ;	    MOV     AH,86H
 50827                                  ;	    MOV     DI,[DEVCALL.REQSTAT]
 50828                                  ;	    TEST    DI,STERR
 50829                                  ;	    JZ	    CRDROK
 50830                                  ;	    call    CHARHARD
 50831                                  ;	    MOV     DI,DX
 50832                                  ;	    OR	    AL,AL
 50833                                  ;	    JZ	    CRDROK
 50834                                  ;	    CMP     AL,3
 50835                                  ;	    JZ	    CRDFERR
 50836                                  ;	    POP     DS
 50837                                  ;	    JMP     ReadRawRetry
 50838                                  ;
 50839                                  ;   CRDFERR:
 50840                                  ;	    POP     DI				<- Patch 11
 50841                                  ;   DEVIOFERR:
 50842                                  ;	    LES     DI,[THISSFT]
 50843                                  ;	    jmp     SET_ACC_ERR_DS
 50844                                  ;
 50845                                  ;   CRDROK:
 50846                                  ;	    POP     DI				<- Patch 12
 50847                                  ;	    MOV     DI,DX
 50848                                  ;	    ADD     DI,[CALLSCNT]
 50849                                  ;	    JMP     SHORT ENDRDDEVJ3
 50850                                  
 50851                                  DOSP10_ID:		db	006H,01FH
 50852                                  DOSP10_LOC_OFFSET	equ	$-DOSP10_ID
 50853                                  DOSP10_LOC:		db	08BH,0DFH
 50854                                  DOSP10_REENT2_OFFSET	equ	$-DOSP10_LOC
 50855                                  			db	033H,0C0H,08BH,0D0H,0E8H
 50856                                  DOSP10_ID_LEN		equ	$-DOSP10_ID

 50860                                  			db	08BH,0D7H,0B4H,086H,036H,08BH,03EH
 50861                                  DOSP10_PACKVAL_OFFSET	equ	$-DOSP10_ID
 50862                                  			db	009H,003H
 50863                                  			db	0F7H,0C7H,000H,080H,074H,019H,0E8H,047H,017H
 50864                                  			db	08BH,0FAH,00AH,0C0H,074H,010H,03CH,003H,074H,003H
 50865                                  			db	01FH,0EBH,0CFH
 50866                                  DOSP11_LOC_OFFSET	equ	$-DOSP10_ID
 50867                                  			db	05FH

 50869                                  			db	036H,0C4H,03EH,036H,005H,0E9H,0A1H,004H

 50872                                  			db	05FH,08BH,0FAH

 50874                                  
 50875                                  ; 13th DOS patch - Actually a SYSINIT patch. Patches the stack fault code
 50876                                  ;		which prints the fatal stack fault error on DOS >= 3.20.
 50877                                  ;
 50878                                  ;	    Sets focus to current VM so user can see fatal message.
 50879                                  ;
 50880                                  ;
 50881                                  ;	l0: lodsb		<- Setfocus here
 50882                                  ;	    cmp al, '$'
 50883                                  ;	    je l1
 50884                                  ;	    mov bl, 7
 50885                                  ;	    mov ah, 0Eh
 50886                                  ;	    int 10h
 50887                                  ;	    jmp l0
 50888                                  ;	l1: jmp $
 50889                                  
 50890                                  DOSP13_ID:	db	0ACh			; l0: lodsb
 50891                                  		db	03Ch,024h		;     cmp al, '$'
 50892                                  		db	074h,008h		;     je l1
 50893                                  		db	0B3h,007h		;     mov bl, 7
 50894                                  		db	0B4h,00Eh		;     mov ah, 0Eh
 50895                                  		db	0CDh,010h		;     int 10h
 50896                                  		db	0EBh,0F3h		;     jmp l0
 50897                                  		db	0EBh,0FEh		; l1: jmp $
 50898                                  DOSP13_ID_LEN	equ	$-DOSP13_ID

 50911                                  ;============================================================================
 50912                                  ; MPATCH.ASM (MSDOS 6.0, 1993)
 50913                                  ;============================================================================
 50914                                  ; 27/04/2019 - Retro DOS 4.0
 50915                                  
 50916                                  ;mpatch.asm -- holds data patch location for callouts 
 50917                                  ; -- allocate cluster in rom.asm
 50918                                  ;
 50919                                  ; This area is pointed to by OffsetMagicPatch[609h] in fixed DOS data.
 50920                                  ; Currently, this location is used only by magicdrv.sys's patch to
 50921                                  ; cluster allocation, however it can be expanded to be used by other
 50922                                  ; patches. This is important since we have an easy-access pointer to
 50923                                  ; this location in OffsetMagicPatch. Magicdrv.sys is guaranteed to
 50924                                  ; only patch out a far call/retf, so any space after that could be
 50925                                  ; used as a patch by using OffsetMagicPatch+6. See rom.asm on how
 50926                                  ; to call out here.
 50927                                  ;
 50928                                  ; Currently, we allocate only the minimum space required for the 6
 50929                                  ; byte magicdrv patch, so if you change the dos data, you may want
 50930                                  ; to reserve space here if your new data will be position dependent
 50931                                  ; and would prohibit growing of this table.
 50932                                  ;       
 50933                                  ;history	-	created 8-7-92 by scottq
 50934                                  ;		-	added Rational386PatchPtr 2-1-93 by jimmat
 50935                                  ;
 50936                                  ;Exported Functions
 50937                                  ;==================
 50938                                  ;MagicPatch     -       callout patched by magidrv.sys for cluster allocations
 50939                                  
 50940                                  ; DosData Segment
 50941                                  
 50942                                  ; DOSDATA:1362h (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
 50943                                  
 50944                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 50945                                  
 50946                                  ; Rational386PatchPtr points to either a RET instruction (80286 or less) or
 50947                                  ; a routine to fix buggy versions of the Rational DOS Extender (80386 or
 50948                                  ; greater). Added to this file because it needed to be somewhere and is
 50949                                  ; 'patch' related.
 50950                                  
 50951                                  Rational386PatchPtr:
 50952 00001465 0000                    	dw	0	; points to patch routine or RET instr.
 50953                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 50954                                  
 50955                                  MagicPatch:
 50956                                  ;MagicPatch proc far
 50957 00001467 CB                              retf            ;default is to just return to allocate
 50958 00001468 90                              nop             ;however, this code will be patched
 50959 00001469 90                              nop             ;by magicdrv.sys to
 50960 0000146A 90                              nop             ; call far ?:?     
 50961 0000146B 90                              nop             ; retf or perhaps just jmp far
 50962 0000146C 90                              nop             ;retf/nop take one byte, so we need six instructions
 50963                                                          ;for 6 byte patch
 50964                                  ;MagicPatch endp
 50965                                  
 50966                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 50967                                  
 50968                                  ;DosData Ends
 50969                                  
 50970                                  ; DOSDATA:136Ah
 50971                                  
 50972                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 50973                                  
 50974                                  ;DOSDATALAST SEGMENT
 50975                                  
 50976                                  ; 29/04/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 50977                                  
 50978                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 50979                                  ; 25/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0 Modification (paragraph alignment)
 50980                                  
 50981                                  ;db 0,1,12,64,19,0 ; ! Magic numbers !
 50982                                  
 50983                                  ;align 16
 50984                                  
 50985                                  ; !!! DOSDATA:1370h ; Retro DOS v4.0 only!
 50986                                  
 50987                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 50988                                  
 50989                                  ; 05/01/2024
 50990                                  ;%endif	; 05/11/2022
 50991                                  
 50992                                  ; 05/12/2022
 50993                                  ;MSDAT001E:	; label byte
 50994                                  
 50995                                  ; 05/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 50996                                  DOSDATAEND equ $
 50997                                  DOSDATASIZE equ DOSDATAEND - DOSDATASTART ; = 4962 for MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS
 50998                                  MSDAT001E equ DOSDATAEND - DOSDATASTART
